product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: customer
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. i hear stranger(s) talking through mic since last Monday. i contacted wyze, sent the log file and video. we were told to change the password.  so we did.  on saturday after password is changed i was testing the mic and heard a chinese? lady and early sunday morning, there was alert with some strangers conversation recorded.  i can only upload 1 video so i’m posting one from yesterday.  i cannot tell what language is this.... and nobody was near also no one around here can speak this language. this is what wyze customer support reply from the first incident from last week.: First, if you are concerned about security the first thing you should do is change your account password to make sure you are the only one with access to the camera. If the camera is shared with any accounts I would suggest the shared account holder also resets their passwords. Next, to talk a little about our security. Our cameras utilize a point to point encrypted connection, this means that when you attempt to connect to a camera (specifically connection step 2/3) the camera and the app will perform a handshake with our servers, confirming that both have the correct encryption key that is unique to the device. This means that currently, the only options for getting access to your live feed is to have the log in information of an account with control over the camera (either the account it is setup to, or a shared account) or an Alexa device that you have allowed access to your live feeds (again, this requires the log in information for the account). anyway we changed the password and this just happened yesterday. i hope they can explain this....
title: security issue

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Nicholas Parker
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. This little camera is VERY impressive. I currently own a Nest IQ indoor camera and have owned a couple Foscam indoor cameras in the past. This Wyze camera produces excellent picture quality and has a very easy to use app. The fact that you get 14 days of clips storage for free just blows the Nest cam out of the water. This camera does so much that the 10x more expensive Nest Cam IQ at a fraction of the price. So how does this stack up against the much more expensive Nest Cam IQ indoor camera? * You don't get continuous recording stored online, you only get clips stored online. However, you can pop a $10 32GB microSD card into this Wyze camera and get continuous local recording (meaning it's being recorded on the card in the device). You can view your recordings in the app. At HD quality, you get a couple days storage on a 32GB card, more if you go SD quality. *You don't get the ability to turn the camera on/off based on whether or not you are home. Personally, I really like this feature so it isn't recording us when we're home. Just feels weird. Wyze support says they may add this via IFTTT in the future. You can control whether or not motion recording is on when you are home using IFTTT. However, I"ve found it a little buggy. *You don't get the Nest IQ facial recognition which is very high tech. I'm not sure how important this is for an indoor camera. It's amazing for the Nest Hello doorbell. *You don't get a monthly fee with the Wyze cam. You pay a fee for the Nest Cam IQ. I can't believe this thing is so cheap and works so well. It has so many features like the big guys. Even the two-way audio is decent. If I had one complaint, it's that the motor that rotates the camera is a little loud. I'm still giving this 5 stars. I guess its sensitivity to sound is a little high too. It seems like it's too good to be true. If you are looking for an indoor security camera, you found it. TIP: I am using this SD card in the camera and it's working fine. Inexpensive and does the job if you want local recording - . Silicon Power-32GB High Speed MicroSD Card with Adapter - New Edition NOTE: In the video, I have the camera attached to a mini-tripod. The camera has a standard screw mount for a tripod. You can get a little tripod for around $10. I like it because it raises the camera a bit and provides some extra stability, decreasing the chance it can be knocked over. ----- 07/2019 HERE ARE SOME ANSWERS TO COMMENTS PEOPLE HAVE LEFT BELOW ---- - Yes, it will continue to do its cloud recording when you have an SD card installed. There is an "events" tab on the main page of the app for the clips. You can also open a specific camera and tap "view playback" to see the continuous recording. When viewing on the SD card, there is a delay as it loads up the video. For example, you scroll the time line back 8 hours then there is a 3-4 second delay as it loads the chunk of video around that time. Once it loads, you can move back and forth in it instantly. - I am going to say my 32GB card is getting a little over 3 days recording in a room with only light activity. I can't speak to how that time grows as you increase the size of the card. I'm not sure if 64GB would get you 6 days. Seems like it would though. - To the person that thinks the app is useless, I'm sorry to hear you are having such troubles. I think the app works well on my Android phone (I don't know about iOS). However, I do believe that those kinds of things can happen. It's not a perfect app and they are adding features which can introduce bugs. Considering the cost of this camera, the app is phenomenal but some people are going to have problems. Hard to predict. - The other app question about it being efficient - yes, it works much better than those other cheap camera app. There is about a 2-3 second delay before it brings up live video. I'm not experiencing freezing. However, that is heavily dependent on the network in your home and the network you are using on your phone when you access it (e.g. mobile, slow WiFi, etc.). - I'm not sure about the comment about not auto-rebooting when you lose WiFi? I'll say that the cameras survive power failures perfectly. We just had a three hour one last night. Booted right back up. I have reset my network periodically which causes my WiFi to go down for about a minute and the cameras come right back online. I'm still using this one and the regular Wyze cam. I still think these are SHOCKINGLY good values. I feel like I wasted so much money on my Nest cam. I should sell it and buy 5-6 Wyze cams.
title: Amazing picture, features, ease of use at this low price! How does it stack up against Nest?

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: GD
content: Only good as a toy in close by properties If your internet goes down then back up as it always sometime does in New York City or State the camera will sometimes not reconnect to your WiFi network as it has happened with 3/4 cameras . Since the camera is not responding to either WiFi or LTE your only option is to manually unplug it then plug it in again This would solve the issue but what happens when you are a 1000 miles away ? Until Wyze ( like Nest does ) codes the software so that the camera reboots itself when attempting to re- connect these cameras are just a gimmick to watch your cat . I am not the only one having same issue as I got numerous emails from forum You can try to fix by having WiFi AC plugs turning on Pandora off but not reliable
title: Does not auto reboot when losing WiFi connection

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: MultiMatt
content: I'm a bit of a camera addict.  I have hardwired (fixed) cameras that are hooked up to a DVR, and I have 4 Nest cams as well. But we have a lot of pets, and I wanted to have some PTZ cams to be able to look around and check on them when we are away.  I heard several tech podcasts (TWiT, Stacey on IoT) ranting and raving over this Wyze cam, so I took the plunge on one. WOW, how amazing to get all this, for $30 (plus shipping)!  The image is super-clear, and I LOVE the ability to scan around a room via my phone.  I even installed the Wyze app onto my Pixelbook, and when I enlarge the image on my big screen, it looks incredible.  I have only had the camera hooked up for a day, and I am still learning the ropes, but I am SO pleased, I am going to order another two, if not three cameras right away! The motion detection feature is pretty slick.  I set up the camera in our spare bedroom, where some of our cats hang out, and when Barbie came in, the camera detected her and began following her movements.  She was intrigued at the noise (noticeable, but not loud, btw) of the camera whirring, turning.  I have attached a screenshot I grabbed via the app, where she is examining the Wyze cam!  Highly recommended.
title: SO much functionality for 30 bucks! WOW.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Benjamin Semola
content: I am a fan of wyzecam but this wyzecam Pan is disappointing. Both motion tagging and motion tracking doesn’t work even after firmware update.  The cam for no reason sometimes just freezes up. I have to power off and on by removing the micro usb cable in order to get it working again. I tried to return it but the return time was over. I am so disappointed and I will never advise others to buy this model base in my experience. How I wish it works as advertised. The bug or whatever it is should be fixed and if it is this unit that is defective I feel I deserve a replacement unit from Wyze. The other units (3) of wyzecam v2 i have is much better in performance.  They work great even in my echoshow. UPDATES! Wyze reached out to me and changed the unit. It was on the second attempt that I got a perfectly functioning wyze cam pan. Despite better functionalities than the wyze cam, I feel the wyze cam pan MUST be tested before shipping.  To avoid the pains I went through. If you get a fully functional wyze cam pan then you will love it. I have given a 4 star now.
title: Don’t buy Wyzecam Pan!-UPDATED REVIEW

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Terrence R.
content: I wanted to like this. I am in the security camera business and I was asked by some to evaluate this for them so I bought a couple. I am not trying to compare this to a tier one camera system. I was evaluating it based on its price point. It has some pretty good features. The interface is a little clunky but overall reasonable. Set up was easy and went smoothly. Day one was fine. After that the image was nearly unusable. There was a green pixelization on all shaded areas. I realize this is a budget camera but this issue was a bad component. I believe is is a bad CCD. The issue I had is I tried to contact their support group. The phone never gets answered. The support link in their web page never gets answered. Emails to support never get answered. Are they still a company open for business. My evaluation was to look elsewhere for a budget home camera.
title: Non existent customer service

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Stori
content: After going through multiple nursery cams, I am SUPER impressed with this camera (especially for the money)! No app issues, great video quality, simple easy setup. Hands down better than the other video monitors we’ve had.
title: You can view anywhere from your phone. No temperature detection

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Camp Runamok
content: My best friend bought the original version of this camera and was amazed at the easy of setup, ease of use, features - software and hardware, and quality of the video.  And now I can see why.  This really is a game changer in terms of security cameras.  The value is mind boggling, and I have to admit, was a source of concern before I bought these cameras.  I like to feel I understand the business model of a company from which I'm buying a product, especially one I hook into my personal network.  This feels like I'm buying an iPhone for $50.  In fact, I have to say that I felt like I had bought an apple product when I was unwrapping the cameras.  They come beautifully packaged, and the workmanship and operation is just apple gorgeous, and apple smooth. However, while I my first three set up flawlessly, the last three I just bought were problematic.  The setup was smooth, like before, but at the end it has you update to the latest and greatest firmware.  Last time that worked fine.  This time it did not.  The first camera gave me a failure message.  So deleted the camera from the app and ran it again.  It once again setup easily, but this time it had the latest firmware.  So apparently the update worked, but something went wrong with the reboot at the end.  All 3 did the same thing.  However,  that said, all 3 have been working well for 8 months now, with 2 or 3 firmware updates that have been flawless. The firmware and app have both added cool new features.
title: As someone already noted, these are a game changer, but I did have some setup issues with my last 3.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: EA
content: UPDATE: I tossed it into garbage. DO NOT BUY THIS! UPADATE: in less than two months, Wyze Cam Pan is dead. Disposable camera for 35 bucks, anyone?! I can't believe posts complaining about short life span, until mine died. What a waste! I got my one Wyze Pan three days ago. It was operational in minutes tracking movements and noise like a mad dog with amazingly sharp colors. I spent hours trying to find faults but I couldn't other than the loud hum of the motion tracking motor, the choppy sound and more integration with smart home products. The free cloud was not a myth either and it captured most of the significant motion. The micro sd card captured all movements without a miss with a comfortable before and after event buffer time. So I bought 6 more and bragged about it to friends and relatives. One Month Update: The cameras just shut down regularly and give error code 90 - requiring physical power cycle. They shutdown more often progressively and you have to inspect them regularly, reboot, power cycle and make sure they are connected. I am downgrading to one star. What if you are out-of-town? These are not install and forget devices - they add to things to worry about when you are traveling - pets, houseplants, lights and then, these cameras. I'd return them if I could.
title: Died - DO NOT BUY !!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Amazon Customer
content: I have tried many cameras the advantages are ease of use of use, setup,  and cost.  Possible disadvantages are that it works only with the Wyze app as of now.  The Wyze Pan and its fixed counterpart are game changers.  If you don't need a cloud Cam or an outside security cameras these cameras set the bar.  They aren't the best cameras but they are incredible values are as close to zero setup as possible.  Frankly floored by these things.  Buy one to try the worse case is you loose less than $50 and 10 minutes to setup.  If you already have another Wyze camera it will take longer to get out of the box than to get it working.  Great thing for many users. I'm not throwing my other cameras away,  but the other camera makers need to be paying attention.
title: Floored. These are game changers.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jordan
content: I was so excited to get this camera! Dave is from Utah, which is where I live and I was exited to try out this awesome looking product! Set up was EXTREMELY easy, and its picture quality is great! The motion tracking is really cool and night vision isreally clear! However, at the end of the day, none of this matters if you cannot connect to the camera. The camera CONSTANTLY loses connection to the internet (like every 3-5 minutes). The router and camera are in the same room, no less than 10ft apart. Even when I am home and ON the same Wifi, I get the connection issue. Tried all the steps, re-setting camera up, resetting my home Wifi, uninstalling and reinstalling the app, and still the same issue happens. After trying to connect a few times, the camera will prompt you to do a power cycle. And sometimes, the camera will just completely just shut off, and it wont turn back on until someone actually unplugs the power from the camera. What is the point of having a camera to use while your away if you have to be home to constantly reset it? So disappointing.. *Update! After using it for a couple weeks, we had moved the camera from our living room, into our spare bedroom. This bedroom is farther away from our internet router, so I was sure it wouldn't even connect. But to my surprise, it has connected and not ONCE has it lost connection.. Odd that I went farther away and it has a better connection. Updated my review to 4 stars, as it still does suck that the camera cannot go in the room I'd like it to go in.
title: Constant connection issues UPDATED*

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Leeana
content: When this camera actually works, it's great! The problem is 90% of the time it won't sync with the app. I constantly get an error code 90 saying that I need to re-cycle the camera to get it to work again. Or for no reason at all i will have to launch the app over 10 times to get it to work. It's very frustrating. I bought this to use as a baby monitor. We have an audio only monitor, and I was hoping to use this for the video. I was planning on buying more for the rest of the house if I liked it enough. Oh and forget using the pan/tilt! Every single time it freezes up, and takes 20 minutes to start working again. My husband is pretty good with electronics and he has checked our internet connection and made sure nothing is interfering with the camera, and we can't find any reason on our end why it works so poorly. I'm crossing my fingers for some sort of software update to fix these issues, because like I said the camera is really neat when it works. I'll give it another week, but unfortunately I'll probably be returning it.
title: I like it when it actually works...which is hardly ever.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: roberto
content: slick packaging, sleek form factor, but it stops there, at least that was my experience trying to get it to work halfway decently with my android device... i have to wonder if the camera works well with apple products, and that's who is giving it all of the positive reviews, ios owners? anyway, all of the positive amazon reviews don't seem to match all of the complaining that's going on at wyze's forum, complaints that mirror my experience... it's a a pain to set up, the "zoom" is a joke, and the pan/scan is so painfully slow that it's practically useless, in fact i couldn't even get my camera to pan left or right, only up and down, if you can even call it up and down given how minimal the range is.
title: Junk

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Greg J
content: Overall, well worth the purchase price.  Installation and connection took about 15 minutes for both the camera and the necessary app.  No problems were encountered except for input of the user name and password which took 3 attempts for both initial installation and sharing with my wife`s phone. it took about 10 minutes a day for 3 days to learn its capabilities and make adjustments that I wanted. THE GOOD Daytime video is very clear - Excellent Nighttime video is fairly clear for about 12-15 feet - Good Notifications are easy to set-up and quite accurate for both sound and motion . Sound especially is quite sensitive.  VG Fairly easy to set the  motor controls for pan fields and stops - pan speed Excellent Motion tagging and tracking works well but tracking lags a bit  VG 14 Day Rolling Cloud Storage is FREE  Excellent Ability to use a 32 GB Micro SD for  Local Storage  Excellent Has 2 Way Audio -  Works Well (Too well my wife likes yell at me in the evening while she is working to scare the crap out of me) THE BAD Nothing really bad IMPROVEMENTS or MINOR ISSUES Motor is a bit nosy in a quiet room Pan Cam will move around a bit on a slippery surface like glass - solved by putting a piece of cloth under it Works with ALEXA and IFTTT but would like to see more integration with Wink or Smartthings Really, for the price, its a great purchase and addition for your smart home or security needs  I will buy another one or maybe 2, this time adding a longer power cable and mounts for more installation flexability,
title: Great Little Camera with Many Pluses and No Real Negatives - Excellent Value for its Capabilities

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ANA
content: There is nothing wrong with the actual camera but the app that it runs off of is horrible. I was hoping to use it as a baby monitor but so far in the past month the sound on the app goes in and out or just completely goes silent. I have a sound machine on in my kids room so I can tell when the sound goes out. Also the app randomly shuts itself down. I thought it might have been my device (iPhones) so I tried 2 other devices with no luck. I am very sad since the idea is great. The camera is good. The alerts are on point. However the sound and image is off by a few seconds so I can actually here my kid crying in the hall before I hear it on the monitor.
title: NOT A BABY MONITOR

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Chad
content: Bought a Wyze pan cam on the advice of my neighbor. I have several brands of camera around my house inside and out now. But all fixed, none pan. Camera itself works great, as intended. Nice to pan around and check out the house if you're curious, picture quality is excellent. SD card storage has major issues. Wyze knows about it, but hasnt been able to fix it just yet. Your SD card will fill up, and when it does, the card becomes junk. Wyze forums have some tips some folks have had luck with, some say a GoPro camera recognizes the card, my GoPro does not. I purchased a Wyze branded 32GB card, and it's in the garbage now. So overall, I'd stay away. There are similar cameras that work just as well on Amazon, similar price, and dont cost you an SD card every few days. Wyze needs to figure this out, meanwhile, I'm so unimpressed with this one fault, I'll be returning it to Amazon. Checked out the neighbors camera too, he has the same issue. He is also returning his.
title: Buy A Different Brand

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Smartypants_Monica
content: Frustrated with other expensive Doorbell and security cam systems, I needed a cheaper,  temp solution quickly so I found Wyze on Amazon and bought a Wyze pan camera for 36ish bucks and a mini SD card based on reviews (and it's Alexa compatible) to TRY it and.... I LOVE it. Now it's NOT a doorbell but heck I don't answer my doorbell anyways (my giant mastiff alerts the entire neighborhood when some tries to get close to the front of the house and he looks mean) I just want to replay the coming and going activities as needed or watch live feed if I see fit so this Wyze device was perfect!!! It detects motion and/or sound and sends alerts, it motion tracks, motion tags, pan tracks, it offers continuous recording that can play back days of time in addition to sending you motion clips based on motion or person detection settings, you can watch the live feed with sound (what you hear is based on distance) AND it has two way selections to listen and talk through it decently, you can create shortcuts to do quick temp activities such as one click to pause notifications to override your schedule settings  (exp: I stayed home sick and have it set to normally send alerts during work hours so I press my pause shortcut so my hub's doesn't get alerts while I move around the house AND without having to mess with my weekday settings), you can add multiple cameras easily, play back entire periods YOU select in time lapse speed, you can take pics of what you are seeing, take videos from live view or from the playback (use to black mail your kids when you catch them singing or picking a nose), the app is easy to use, you can buy inexpensive accessories to mount it on an outlet or mount it to a wall, even hang it upside down bcz you can flip the view,  and the best.... NO PAID SUBSCRIPTION required.  (Like ahem RING or Nest) and VERY REASONABLY PRICED (so everyone has access to personal security I could probably gush more as I play with features, I know I'm forgetting something BUT I did buy a second camera and will probably keep adding to my system as needed. Hope this helped!
title: Best find on Amazon so far!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: mae
content: Good for watching pets while you're away, but I would not / do not trust this camera for security purposes. Playback videos skip 2 to 4 seconds at a time and the motion alerts aren't reliable to pick up motion. I know of several instances where it has missed movement. The point of a security cam is so that you don't miss anything. Customer service has not gotten back with me after contacting them twice. I would return it if I still had the box. Regardless, I'm on the market for something a bit more expensive, but more efficient. Edited to add: shortly after posting this review, it stopped working all together and customer support is unhelpful.
title: I wouldn't recommend as a security camera.(edit: I wouldn't recommend for anything)

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Thomas
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. This morning my one year-old was near the charge port for my Wyze cam pan. I’ve had this camera for about a month and has not sustain any damage of any type. We were in the same area playing with a ball and he was simply trying to stand up, he wasn’t “playing” with it or anything, he just kind of backed into it. To my surprise the charging brick came apart quite easily, and it was obvious upon inspection that this was poorly made. The worst part of this all is that once apart, it leaves two metal probes sticking out of your wall, Which could easily electrocute anyone.  We do not leave our children unattended, but this still frightens me to think that something could happen where negligence on the part of Wyzecam Due to saving money and cutting corners could lead to the death of one of my children Upon seeing this I called Wyze cam and was put on hold for it I was told to be two minutes, after waiting 20 minutes, I messaged them on Facebook with no response. I called back later on in the morning and after 15 minutes I spoke to representative who told me “I need to remind you to keep these out of the reach of small children“. I explained to him that these were built very cheaply and you can see very clearly that this is a friction fit peace, there are no screws, no solder joints, and it’s very obvious that they are of poor quality. After him telling me that the answer to my problem was to keep my 1 year old away from this, I told him I would record the conversation and that is when he hung up on me. I have attached pictures to show what happens when the front of the charge port comes off. This is a shame that the company would not stand behind they product, as they told me “oh I’m sorry that happened but just to let you know this ain’t common” but it is even sadder to see that their response to a poorly made product was to keep children away from it because it is obviously harmful. I know that, I’m sure who is reading knows that, it doesn’t make this problem any better. It is difficult in any house to keep kids away from plugs and in every open plug of my house I have protectors. I can’t use these plugs in good faith knowing that a company would be so unwilling to stand behind something they make, even when it is shown to them that it could kill people. The camera itself is good, and I am going to replace the plugs on my own with ones that won’t potentially Kill my children. I think that customer service is terrible and their response shows clearly they neither stand behind their product nor do they care about the families that use their products.
title: Do not buy! Especially if you have children!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Stan A to Z
content: There aren't many security cameras with all of the features that Wyze packs in - and NONE at this price-point. I got high capacity GB SD cards that literally save a month's worth of activity and is immediately accessible remotely. You don't really need them tho as you also get 14 days of Cloud storage free. Those photos/videos you save there can then be easily shared thru a variety of ways (text, email, print, etc). The complaints below are a combination of user errors (like not adjusting the pan/tilt speeds) and/or poor WiFi connectivity (or just a bum unit that should be replaced). My system connected flawlessly and I only have 100Mbps service in a rather large home. There is little, if any lag, and the high definition picture blows others away. While this is an indoor camera I shoot mine through internal windows for the same effect.  The image shown is thru my living room window to the front door. No more wondering when you get deliveries as WYZE notifies you immediately and saves the clip in a notification email to you. You simply can't buy peace of mind for under $40 - unless of course you get this camera.
title: Best Bang for the Buck

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: James Morales
content: As of 9/6/2018 Like many others won’t connect :(. Setup was a breeze connected fine during that process.  Kept device in same location as setup but just won’t ever connect.  Spend more time trying to connect than actual viewing of live feed.  Also I have WiFi devices working from every room of house, so seems specific to just this device.  Unfortunately in my case didn’t live up to the hype.  Will be retiurming this product.
title: Won’t connect

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ToddB
content: FANTASTIC!! little wifi security cam. Loaded with features. I have this perched on my mantle above fireplace. Crystal clear 1080p image. two way talking with my family on the way from work. Great to keep an eye on the dog. What a deal for around $30.00 and change. Don't waste your money on a Canary or any other expensive cam. This on is all you need.
title: FANTASTIC!! little wifi security cam

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Sepen
content: Took delivery of this and set it up. Have several of the Wyze V2 cameras already, and setup is so easy. Camera worked but the lens was stuck in the upright position. The controls via the phone would not correct it. I tried customer support before returning. Nope, nada, nothing. No response whatsoever. Disappointed to say the least. Just got a return label. When they work they are great. If they don't, and you need support, you may be SOL. YMMV.
title: Broken

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: UJ_188
content: You get what you pay for and this is still a $30 camera. The picture quality is good, in both day and night mode, but only when the camera is not panning or tilting. Motion causes the video to break up until the camera stops again. This happens even on the low resolution setting. The camera doesn't have enough  horsepower to do a quality job of motion detecting or motion tracking, and since both features seem to make the video less stable I've turned them off. Pan and tilt commands sent to the camera from the app seem to lag quite a bit. The general sound alarm is much too sensitive. Even with the sensitivity set to 1 / 100 it still false alarms with normal conversation or a phone ringing in the next room so I've turned that feature off. The "CO Alarm" alarm doesn't work at all when I trigger my CO sensor. However, it did think a violin playing on a TV show was a CO alarm and reported it. I haven't tried the "Smoke Alarm" alarm feature yet. The camera only supports 2.4G WiFi connections. The app is nice looking and laid out well. All the controls and features are easily accessible. Talking through the camera seems to work sometimes and not at other times. I haven't found any zoom controls yet and I thought it had 8x digital zoom. I can pinch zoom the live feed but that's not a digital zoom because the entire field of view is still visible. Having a bright source such as a window in the camera field of view makes the picture useless because the camera doesn't compensate for the increased brightness. The wide angle lens, 14 day rolling cloud storage, and microSD card support are all nice features. Mine came with a 6' power cord. Some of the reviews said the cord was only 2'.  In summary, for $30 you can do worse, but don't expect the quality, features, reliability, or functionality you'd find in a camera costing 2x or 3x the price.
title: Don't Expect Too Much - It's a $30 Camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Trowa Barton
content: This is a wonderful alternative to a Nest camera. It is cheap and works pretty well. My current setup is having this sit in a window sill looking out at my grill and my back yard. This is not the best setup but it works for what I require. I have it elevated sitting on top of a glass candle covered with a lid. I am able to easily control the camera position from the android app. The camera barely makes any noise when moving and it moves very fast. It stays put and won't fall over. A few issues about the motion detection... It comes installed with 50 out of 100 on the detection sensitivity. With my setup in daylight it was not able to track me if I walked in front of the camera. I had to look directly at it for it to track me. I am guessing the Artificial Intelligence understands what a human face looks like. If I was to hold something like my grill cover and move it around it will track me. Once it "locks on" it will follow me as I walk around my yard. After a few moments it will go back to the original position. There is an option to setup the camera's motion detection area. Also you can setup multiple points to go in order in a panning mode. It will look at point a for 10 seconds, move to point b, etc. I didn't use this option. I did change the tracking sensitivity higher around 70 and it was able to follow me without having my grill cover in hand. It is great at instantly sending a push notification with a short clip of what was detected. Only issue with this is sometimes it detects the trees blowing in the wind and will give you false alerts. The speaker option works okay. I had to be pretty loud on my phone for it to sound decent coming from the camera. But yes you could use this to talk to someone if they are in front of the camera. Your results may vary. At night this thing is decent. I have multiple outside lights so the area is bright enough at night to detect myself moving or anyone else. There is no issues with trees at night. And yes you can disable the night vision LEDs and the Blue "recording" LED. I did both of these options and it can probably show you details someone's face if they are a few feet from the window. You must remember there will be some glare in the video since it is recording through glass and  to keep the area it is watching bright with extra light. Also it helps to clean the inside and outside of your window! It has been running for 8 days on Standard Definition mode continuous record with no sound recording and it has filled up almost all of my 32GB SD card. Currently 0.56GB of free space available. So you should get at least 8 days of recording to your card before it starts to override the video with newer video. HD video mode I am not sure probably less than a week of recording. Overall for the price this is a great buy. It works very well and I might buy a 2nd one to monitor my front door.
title: Great deal on a camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mac
content: Push notifications do not work even though all the settings are correct. Have had it for three days and it has only caught and saved motion video four times, and has only sent a notification to my phone once, randomly. Works okay if you are using it as a monitor, but not good as a security/alert camera.
title: You Get What You Pay For

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: LadyMarlone
content: Sound quality is great, picture quality as well. Motion detection and sound detection are solid. If you want discreet, this is it. Infrared on the Wyze is not externally visible (my Arlo cameras turn on red lights). Obviously, panning the camera has motor noise, so you don't want to do that. But if you want to stealth in on how well your caregiver responds at night to your bedbound senior parent, it's really good. Want to monitor two locations but don't want to pan? They're cheap as dirt, get another one. The place where the Wyzecam is weak is the app.  Initial setup was pretty easy, but once you set the WiFi network name and password, there is no way to change it (i.e. there's no edit mode) except by going through setup again. (Fortunately, other settings are saved so you're not really starting from ground zero.) There are icons that you can toggle but it's unclear what they mean. There is a help section that seems to be drawing from the online forum, but it doesn't seem to be optimized for mobile -- there are illustrations to go with the text, but I can't see them.  There's a sense of disorganization/incompleteness to the app, e.g. there's a button to turn off push notifications for everything, and a button to turn off push for individual cameras, but these buttons are in completely different places and there's no link to take you to the other option. Scheduling recordings is pretty simple, it can be triggered by motion or sound, and you can set a time range for the triggers to be active. However, there is only one 24-hour schedule, so if you want to record let's say only on weekends, you're s out of luck. Recording to the cloud is in 12 second increments. You cannot configure this length. If you want longer segments you must install an SD card, and it will record in 1 minute increments. You cannot configure this length either. You cannot access the cloud recordings from a PC web browser and they DO NOT plan to make it accessible. You cannot bulk download cloud recordings, you can only save one at a time with the "share" button, which is far too tedious because there will be *a lot* of recordings. I put in an 8GB SD card which I was able to format, but have not yet been able to get it to work as the Wyzecam suddenly stopped recognizing it. Will update in a few days when I'm able to get back to the camera. So overall, the app will do the basics for you, but it is not so easy to do other things that are just a pinch beyond basic. In my ideal world they would put the app on GitHub so people can improve on it, because it needs a lot of that. This camera deserves a better app.
title: Camera quality great, software not so much

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Hotbod Handsomeface
content: Camera is fine for the price, features work, but don't EVER try to upgrade firmware unless you have an hour to attempt to re-setup the camera as new. Connecting issues, random error codes, re-setup failures... It is an absolute nightmare to get the camera working again every time the firmware wants to update itself. I guess you ultimately get what you pay for.
title: Nightmare to set up, initially and after firmware upgrades.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ERIC, WI
content: I really wanted to like this device. Coming in, I was really really pumped to get based off of all the noise and rave reviews. I waited for at least 4 months of use before coming here to give my candid opinion. HARDWARE: The built quality is really good. Does not feel like cheap plastic. The design is plain, no bells and whistles. SOFTWARE: This is the real reason why I bought it. Keeping real time video of my surroundings. And this is where it all nosedived. This is advertised as a 1080p HD camera. With options of 720p and lower. When the setting is at the highest resolution I experienced an irritating time lag of almost 15 seconds between the actual motion and when its captured on the cam. I said let me bring it down to 720p and there was a noticeable improvement. The lag was about 3 seconds. Now, just to give the device the full benefit of the doubt, I said maybe the problem is from my network. And so I tried a different security camera brand -- Tenvis. The Tenvis also is advertised as 1080p HD. On set up, there was almost no lag in the recording. So, it was obvious the culprit wasn't my network but rather the Wyze cam itself. Got in touch with their service team and we kept going back and forth on all the possible problems. In the end, they said I should keep it at 720p. Like really? To make matters worse, they announced a security breach that exposed peoples personal information. They claimed no threat was posed. Yeah, right. I have not logged in since the security problem. And I intend to junk this (and the other 3 I have )since they're not accepting returns. I cannot in good conscience recommend this security cam. Look elsewhere. Hope this review was helpful.
title: Not worth the hype

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Aloke C. Kumar
content: The Camera is real easy to setup and then app is really friendly and easy to use. Lot of features. Good build and equally good videos.  Even picked up by Smoke Alarm testing and pushed notification.  But alas! Like all good vacation the good time ended too early.  I had this bliss for a mere 40 days.  One fine day it just started panning randomly and incessantly.  I restarted several times.  Powered off for couple of days. Even deleted the item from the app and added back in - also several time.  But all it does pans randomly at random interval.  Amazon was kind enough to issue "out of return window" refund.  I have lost faith on this camera.  Cannot expect Amazon to bail me out all the time.
title: Good Camera but only for 40 days.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: valueexpected
content: Good little camera. 1. It will record 12 second videos when detecting motion and save to app. Free cloud service for 14 days. You can save these to your device. Don’t need a SD card for this feature. 2. You can view and record at anytime. 3. Can receive motion alert message without an SD card. 4. Motion and panning work ok. 5. Wide angle view 6. Good quality picture and videos 7. Can tilt, zoom in and rotate camera with app. 7. ONLY PROBLEM we had was the SD card would not format.  An Amazon customer advised putting SD card in card holder and formatting on PC. IT WORKED. After PC formatting,  unplug camera and insert SD card in camera. Plug in and proceed to advance settings, local storage and select format. Wait a bit to hear 2 chimes. The Wyze You tube video should disclose this information on all  their videos regarding installing SD card. 6. Hard to understand any sound in room.  Not a real problem for us since we’re not using it to listen in on someone’s conversation. The microphone does work well. Took off 1 star because of the aggravation of getting SD card to work.  Took 4 days to  solve this problem and we had to depend on an Amazon customer to solve that problem for us. Bottom line. Love the camera even tho it takes a bit of time to figure out all the features. Give yourself a bit of time to do this. Good camera for the money. Just ordered 2 of the Wyze non panning cameras. Hope they work as well.
title: Great camera- read review if having SD format problems.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Christopher R.
content: Had this set up in my office, but my IT department noticed suspicious activity with data packets constantly going to a server in China. A google search found a number of similar concerns on Reddit. Loved the camera, but the ongoing activity and the low price make me wonder.
title: Sends data to servers in China

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: RSinChandler
content: I bought 3 of the basic Wyze cameras and one Wyze Pan camera at the end of 2018 so I have been using them for several months now. I am extremely pleased with these cameras. Like all the reviews I've seen say, these cameras have the quality and features of the much more expensive cameras. I love the fact that I can have onboard 24/7 recording and I do not have to pay any subscription fees for cloud storage. They are constantly updating the app with more features and functionality and are coming out with new add-on products. So far these appear to be a great product from a great company! EXPERT TIP: I learned this through some testing and previous experience with reported maximum MicroSD card size in Tesla Model 3 cars. The 32GB size limitation appears to be incorrect and only specified due to the fact that Windows computers can only format USB drives and MicroSD cards using the FAT32 file system to a maximum size of 32GB via the GUI interface. It is entirely possible to format any of the external USB drives, SD cards, or MicroSD cards of a much larger size with the FAT32 file system. If you Google "windows format fat32 command line" you will find numerous articles showing you how to do it either via the built in command line tools or using third party utilities. Mac computers can also format these larger storage devices to FAT32 via the GUI or the command line. In the MacOS GUI the file system format is just called MS-DOS (FAT). I am successfully using Samsung 128GB MicroSD cards in all of my Wyze cameras. With the 128GB cards I am able to store approximately 21 days of rolling 24/7 camera footage. I have not tested, but suspect that 256GB MicroSD cards will also work (this is based on the fact that I am using 256GB USB stick to store music on and plug into my Tesla which says that the maximum size for the required FAT32 format is 32GB). App hint: if you are viewing the locally stored footage you can pinch the timeline to essentially zoom in and find what you are looking for much more quickly than if you search in the fully expanded timeline.
title: Wyze cameras - amazing products for amazing prices

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Paul S
content: Yes, for the price, these cameras are great...until they totally lock up when you do a firmware update! I had 2 of these and 2 of the regular cameras set up on my doors and garage.  They are super simple to set up.  One note on set up- you must use 2.4Ghz wifi so when it pulls up wifi, I just had to erase the 5G from the network setting.  They set up quickly and the app works fine.  I set them up for motion recording and HD- it's a bit too grainy to identify things in standard def.  I also installed 32GB SD cards so they would record on the device.  The app allows you to view and store motion and/or sound events. So for a fraction of the cost, I was able to set up my entire house with quality security cameras versus something like the Nest cams.  Genius right?  I thought so until I was getting ready to leave for a vacation and decided I should go ahead and update all of the firmware on my devices so I was up-to-date before I left. If you are using these, DO NOT DO THE FIRMWARE UPDATES!!!!!  When it was done, all of the cameras completely locked up.  It wouldn't connect to wifi rendering all of them completely useless.  I tried to do a factory reset and also even tried to use the SD card to install an old version of the firmware from the Wayze website.  Nothing worked.  I worked for hours trying to get them to work but nothing. I would have given these 5 stars for great value, simple app, decent build quality and good video.  HOWEVER, how in the world could a company release a firmware update that locks up a device?  I did some checking and it seems to be a common problem. 1 star because I am now unable to use them.  Thankfully, Amazon was gracious enough to work with me on a return.  Ugh...now I've got to look at the much more expensive options...I guess in this case, you truly get what you pay for.
title: DO NOT DO FIRMWARE UPDATES!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Steve Birchfield
content: I bought the panning Wyze camera for monitoring my kitchen with the intent of putting it above the cabinets.  It is taller than I expected and I was disappointed to find out that the IR lighting is mounted below the camera.  This meant that I had to prop it up higher above the cabinet to get it to work correctly in night mode.  The night mode is ok, but compared to the Blink night mode, it isn't as clear and sharp. The panning motor is loud and it is noticeable when it is moving.  I also found that it kept trying to point to the wall when on the motion activated setting.  I could have saved $10 by buying the stationary camera if I had known that.  I have motion turned off and it sits high above the cabinet because of these issues. However, I will give it credit that the HD quality is very clear.  I like that you can zoom in with the video feed and that it doesn't cut you off quickly when watching live video like my outdoor Blink cameras do.  The software is decent and I like that it has the ability to capture video during the day (I work from home and have kids that are home during the day, mostly wanted to capture things at night or early morning) and not notify me constantly.  I have it schedule to only notify me during certain hours but it is capturing all day long.  I didn't opt for the SD card yet.  The free cloud storage will probably be all I need.  I like that it can do time lapse and has a panning pattern that can be customized.  For now I will leave it at a stationary position but if I need to pan and see the other side of the room I can do that or have it motion activated. If you are looking for a stealth panning camera, this isn't for you.  Be sure you need panning or motion before getting this versus their cheaper version.  But if you need a camera to capture clear motion this is a great deal for the price.
title: A very inexpensive, clear, motion camera that is a little noisy

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: CHRA
content: It’s a very good camera. Packs tons of height and features, is very easy to set up, tracks motion sends alerts. Pretty much a full featured camera with lots of extras and it integrates brilliantly with Alexa so that I can see my cameras from the television downstairs if I chose. What makes this camera probably one of the most exceptional  it’s a very good camera. PAX tons of high end features, is very easy to set up, tracks motion sends alerts. Pretty much a full featured camera with lots of extras and it integrates brilliantly with Alexa so that I can see my cameras from the television downstairs if I chose. What makes this camera probably one of the most exceptional  is the cost. I have bought Ring cameras for almost $200 that have even less functionality then this one. So this camera is definitely a six star deal. If it continues to work and it lasts at least two years and I would be incredibly happy.  I’ve bought six of them so far. *  I think one of the most important things to note on this camera that I think is impressive, out of all of the devices I have set up lots of devices  and this is so easy. Anybody can put this device on the set up takes literally 15 seconds.
title: Brilliant

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Todd Lewison
content: loved this thing for a long time.  but last week or so, it constantly says to recycle the power.  won't stay on at all.  I have two of the pan cams and they both act this way suddenly.  I have 4 of the non-pan version and they all work just fine, so its not a network issue.  seems to be a firmware issue on the pan version. otherwise, when working...picture is good, sound is pretty lousy, app responsiveness is very good.  definitely good buy for the price and have recommended this thing to many people. update 2/14/19: after being unable to connect for about two weeks, both of my wyze cam pans suddenly started working a couple days ago.  Tech support during my troubles was pretty poor.  I had tried many, many things to get cameras to work.  I gave up and after a couple days of just sitting there with blinking blue lights, they suddenly were solid blue and working fine.
title: worked great for a long time, recently doesn't work at all

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: A. Jones
content: Let me 1st say, Wyze really needs to do a better job on customer care issues. 7 to 10 days for them to get back with me on a issue is their timeline. I'm still waiting to hear from them. Hire a couple of PT service reps to at least show that you have acknowledge your issue within the 1st 24 to 48 hours. An email telling you that someone will get back to you shortly, and a forum post on wyze's site by a company rep saying sorry we are experiencing heavy issues load, and expect a week for someone to get back with you is...., just shameful for a start up. Customer service,Customer service,Customer service! With that being said, the cam, when it did work, worked fairly well for it's price point. Good features, nice free 14 day cloud storage, and fairly straight forward to operate. People complain about the loud turning motor noise on the cam. It's not that noticeable from 10 to 15 feet out when it turns. The only time it seems to be noisy, is when you have the sound turned on the camera, and viewing it with your phone, and pan the room. But again, not that loud..., not unless you are using it for nefarious purposes (hidden cam) then it might give you away. Again, promising product, but needs some work, and for Gawds sake Wyze..., hire more customers service people to deal with questions and issues. Your forum on your site, is not very helpful.
title: Was great...., until it stopped working.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Bryce2113
content: I bought this camera to use to check in an make sure my dog is doing okay when I'm away.  I bought this camera because of the price and because it comes with free notifications when sound is detected.  I wanted to know when my dog was barking and so far this does that perfectly.  It will send me a notification when sound is detected and then I can play a 15 second clip of what it recorded through the app.  The picture quality is pretty good (as good or better than I expected). As for the bad, the two-way sound feature is pretty poor.  I have tested it inside and the output is not very loud at all.  There is a also a significant delay.  I wanted this feature to talk to my dog when she is barking.  So far this has not worked at all--either because she cannot hear me or is just immune to a talking voice coming from nowhere.  Lastly, I had some connectivity issues right after getting it that were a result from servers issues at Wyze.  Other than that one issue, it has worked flawlessly for connectivity. Overall, this was a great investment and I have been encouraging all of my friends to get one. Please be sure to let me know if you found this review helpful.
title: Picture Quality is Great / Stability and Two-Way Sound is Poor

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: William J Beard
content: I am writing this review after about a year of owning the WyzeCam Pan. I was initially very impressed by this product but I will now go into detail about all the things that they got wrong when designing this device 1. NO web interface of any kind is available, even though all the traffic for the camera's live view goes over LAN if you are on the same network, and not over the internet like Amazon's own Cloudcam does for example. This fact alone should make a web interface very easy to deploy. Per their forums they say that it is the number one feature request but that they have no plans to implement it. Seems like they really don't care about their customers that much. 2. If you email them for any type of support or question, you will get a canned response 100% of the time and trying to follow up to the generic email is impossible. So if customer service is important to you, get another camera from a reputable brand. 3. The hardware that this thing uses is not even capable of capturing, rendering, and streaming HD video. Just switching back and forth between SD and HD, one can clearly see that the image quality of the SD image is better and the frame rate is very stable in SD. But I did not buy an SD camera, I bought and HD 1080p camera and really wanted to use it as such, it's impossible though. Much more detail is captured in standard definition mode so that's what I'm stuck using. 4. The app randomly kick you out of the live feed and returns to the main menu with a white screen. This forces you to kill the app and relaunch every time that this happens. This cam become very tedious if you want to watch one of your cameras 24/7. I say one because you would need a separate device to view another camera. 5. The camera itself randomly crashes or freezes and the app tells you to go power cycle the thing, which is impossible if you're not home. (without specialized equipment). I find myself power cycling this and other Wyze cameras daily and if I can go 48 hours without resetting one, then that's a good run for this camera before it get's glitched out by poor firmware programming and the cheap SoC that they use. In conclusion, I would like to say that I really wish this camera worked properly because it is a really amazing price point. However, the old idioms stand "if it's too good to be true, it's probably not" and "You get what you pay for" come to mind. The less you pay for something, the lower quality it will inevitably be, especially when there are pricier options on the market. Well Wyze has to undercut everyone, including you yo have a prayer of making any profit (which they really don't). Which brings me to my final thought; this company cannot not last. It is an unsustainable business model. They will either go out of business completely and my cams will be worthless or they will end up forcing everyone to purchase a subscription plan. Either way, I have no confidence on this product or brand and it's future. ***As a point aside from the review: did you know that the Wyze team used to work at Amazon and developed the Cloudcam? It's true, then they just cut and run and probably either stole intellectual property from Amazon or changed it just enough not to get sued. I personally find people like this morally bankrupt and after finding this out I wish I had not supported them monetarily by purchasing this garbage from them.
title: Detailed Review From Owner of Many Cameras

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Stacey
content: 3 issues with the Wyze Pan Cam. Firstly, if you lose power or it accidentally gets unplugged, the camera resets and needs to be set up again. If you are away and trying to monitor your home this makes the cameras inoperable. If you are home and need to reset it's more of an annoyance. Secondly, when I bought the camera person detection was included. Now it's a "subscription" that you need to pay for. I purposely did not buy a camera that needed a subscription so it feels like I was duped. Presently my camera only detects motion and not people so it's nearly useless as a security  camera. I walked right by it today twice and the camera detected nothing. Thirdly, I forgot my password for my Wyze.com account and it has been very difficult to recover it. Tried chatting with customer service and it wasn't helpful. This is a company based in the U.S. (Seattle) so I really wanted to like this product because picture quality, motion and person detection is very good. Unfortunately I wish I could get my money back.
title: Wish I could return this

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Daniel Safa
content: This camera is fantastic quality for the price. The only thing that kills it is the software integration. If you want to review footage, you have to "scrub" through the footage, and it takes like 3 second per movement to show just a thumbnail of the footage. I held off on filing a review to see if they would release an update to allow 2x, 5x, 10x, or even 20x scrubbing to footage, but they have not. It is EXHAUSTING trying to find specific clips in this camera, since you have to watch in real time. Motion detection is good but it can only send you like a minute clip. If this camera had wonderful software, it would be 5/5 stars, but unfortunately it is dreadful software lacking even basic features such as fast forward.
title: Good quality, software is what kills it

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Nemo
content: Did I really pay less than $40 for this wonderful device?  Unbelievable deal.  So here are my experiences: I noticed how intelligently packaged the product was.  Great sign.  Only Apple products impress me more on packaging. Download the Wyze app to your phone. Plug the USB into the outlet adaptor, then plug it into the base unit. Make sure to REMOVE THE LENS COVER before attempting to connect your device to your WiFi. Scanning the QR code can be rather tricky.  It took me several attempts.  I watched their video and they noted that you should bring your phone about 5 inches in front of the camera lens.  Because my phone's screen is large, I had to bring it back to about 6 or 7 inches, and because there was glare, I had to tip the phone at a better angle so the camera could read the QR code.  This is the only frustrating part about the setup process as it took about ten tries. Once you connect, go to your settings (the sprocket) and build your Pan settings. After you do this, it's possible that you might end up just moving the entire device to a different part of your room. Here's something I thought would snag me.  If the WiFi router goes out, will the camera reconnect once router signaling is back?  Yes, it will.  I tested this by unplugging and replugging my WiFi router and it reconnected automagically.  (Side note:  I have a UPS on my cable modem and router for power failure purposes, so you may equally want to explore that option.) Anyway, it appears you can buy other devices to pair with this system so I'm looking forward to plunging into the IoT world, now! Thanks, Wyze!!
title: Absolute Wonderful Product

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: skidude
content: These little cameras work surprisingly good. I attached one picture from one of my cameras over our register. Most of the lights are off and there is enough sunlight coming in that night mode is currently disabled. What I like: * The microphone is fairly sensitive and you can hear the conversations if the background doesn't drown it out. * You can speak over the camera and the people can actually hear you! WAY better than the Amazon Cloud Cam. * Monitor the video feed from anywhere you have internet access. * Motion and/or sound events can be pushed as notifications. * Images are very clear. * Easy to setup * Low network usage * Cameras have stayed online across router reboots. (My Amazon Cloud Cams keep losing connection. Things I don't like: * Field of view is fairly wide angle. Not bad in itself but I wish they had another option that wasn't quite so wide view and worked better for distance. * Alert sensitivity... It would be nice to get alerts if there is movement detected during the night when our business is closed. And this camera COULD do it. The issue is that because of the wide field of view, I get a partial view of the street so passing cars set this off ALL NIGHT LONG. If they could mask off a part to ignore, it would be AWESOME. For the price point, this camera is awesome. You get constant recording onto the memory chip (IF you bought and installed it) or 12sec events uploaded to cloud. If you are being robbed and they steal the cameras or remove the memory chip you have lost most of your recordings. So businesses that are at high risk of robbery may want something else. For the rest of us normal people, this little thing packs a lot of value into a very affordable device. This is my own review. I did NOT get comped anything to write this.
title: Cheap and works great so far.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Dan Mitchell
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. It's a decent camera with most of things properly working, few down-time and good accessibility. Pros/Cons: Pros: - stable (Android) App - time-lapse is really nice, but unfortunately there's no re-scheduleing - free 14 day cloud recording - fast camera moves - conneciton from app to device easy with QR code - 3 ways of storage: SD, cloud, phone - works easily with 4G - App can be used on different phones (just login and you have the camera(s)) available - camera quite responsive (e.g. app startup/connect/move camera) - nice time-overview (but not with live viewer) - most of the functions available - easy sharing and uploading to google photos and others - IR LED's can be disabled - cams can be coupled (on host USB) - usually reconnects fast - nice touch control and zoom plus joystick - good quality voice, but not loud Cons: - set-up very difficult if device finds 5g first. No WIFI selection. Have to manually enter SSID and PW. - motion detection resets the camera position every 5 seconds (that's a bug and should be solved !!!) - relatively low dynamic range - footage overprocessed - uses way too much space on storage card for the limited quality - doesn't like backlight - no alert markers in timeline when recording 'continuios' recording - no live or real-time view when playing re-recorded sd card video - some functions difficult to find / different places for setting (why?) - hard to find good instructions (they are everywhere, but no REAL manual !!!!) - length of recording not adjustable - requires new Android version to install app (old devices won't work, you can use TinyCam but will have same issue with Wyze Cam :-() - once lost 2 way audio, but came back after reboot of device - uses lots of space (low compression) - for several functions (e.g. time-lapse) phone(app) needs to be connected to same wifi - no online viewer, but there are options to work around, but lots of work and may not work - no camera position presets - voice/micro very low volume - time-lapse difficult to set - zooming NOT on video !!! - no reocurring time-lapse scheduler (like every day) - tracking slow and probably won't work in real - no time-lapse based on recordings on SD card BTW - The footage is a 8 Hours Time-Lapse in 15 Seconds
title: Above average but still way from being perfect

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: C Eastman
content: Won't connect to wifi
title: Won't work

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Real Doc
content: This review is for the Wyze Cam 1080p HD and the Wyze Cam Pan 1080p HD. I have had 5 of these for 6 months. Pros: Cheap price and well made Excellent video quality when streaming and recorded videos. Easy set up Free 12 seconds max per notification recording in the cloud. (Only can see last 14 days and then they are deleted). Huge Cons: There is usually a delay of 2-5 minutes between motion in front of the camera and a notification on your phone. More than enough time for someone to get in your house in one room and get the drop on you in a different room before you get the notification of motion. This delay occurs even when I am home and even though I have high speed internet in my home. The notification recordings, which are stored in the cloud, are extremely short (Only 12 seconds in length) The camera will only give you a notification and cloud recording only once per five minutes. So if you trigger the camera when you leave your door and someone walk in your door 3 minutes later, there is no notification or cloud recording. There is a 5 min cool down period. So you get a maximum of 12 seconds per 5 minutes stored in the cloud. To get longer recordings requires inserting an SD card in the camera. This can give you continuous all day recording and playback. However that recording is not stored in the cloud and if someone takes the camera you will not be able to retrieve any recordings other than the very very short notification recordings, which will have 5 minute gaps between them. The SD card cost should be considered when buying this camera. You can only live stream one camera at a time. If someone is walking around your house, you cannot get a view from all cameras at once. You can only access live streaming and notification recordings through app on your phone and not through desktop/laptop or directly. Pan cam motion tracking does not return camera to original position after moving object goes out of frame. For example if the pan cam is aimed towards the right side of your room, and someone moves across the room and out a door on the left, the pan cam will stay positioned to the left and not automatically return to the original right sided position. Summary: Overall excellent quality for live streaming or playing back SD card to see what your kids, nanny, dog do during the day when you are not home. Terrible for security cameras. If they were any more expensive, I'd give them 2 stars.
title: Terrible for security cameras. OK for recording kids, dog, nanny.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Amazonian
content: I got as far as setting up the app and when I unplugged it to move it to its permenant location it never turned back on. So, I had it working for 30 minutes. The app was easy enough to set up but I never got a chance to check out the operation. I paid more for it on Amazon rather than buying it directly from their website in case I ran into problems as the reviews with this camera seemed mix. I know I can count on Amazon for easy returns and replacements without going through any hassle (read their return policy on their website) and it’s well worth the extra couple dollars, and it appears I made the right choice. I’m sending it back and reluctantly having a replacement shipped. I will post another review if I can get a functioning unit.
title: Died after 30 minutes!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Starlord
content: Bought two of these and after a week I unplugged them because of the uselessness of them.  Buyers should beware that only 12 seconds of motion detected will be recorded for play back... that is it! And then there is a 5 minute delay before the next motion is recorded for 12 seconds.  If you want to review the rest of what has been recorded they advise you to input a micro sd card to continuously record to which requires you to manually review all of the footage to review those times that movement was recorded.  I have now gone back to mounting my old iPhones with the Manything app and reviewing motion detection through them instead.
title: Beware only 12 seconds of motion recorded with a 5 minute cool down before the next recording!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Gonzalo
content: Have had it for about 5 days now. I was in love with the camera at first. Setting it up is very easy. Picture quality is amazing, but the camera loses signal daily. I’d walk by it and notice the blue light flashing and not stable which means it lost connection. It’s within 8ft of my modem/router. I have xfinity blast 150mbps download speed which is more than enough for practically anything. Everything always stays connected wirelessly except this darn camera. I’ve been at work, and wanted to check on my dogs and it never has signal. Pretty useless if it’s not holding connection in my opinion. If it happens once or twice again before my return period I will be returning. Update 03/07/2019 I have issued a refund. Camera loses signal every single day. Has moved down from 2 stars to 1.
title: Loses connection everyday for no reason.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: H Wilhite
content: 03/18/2019 update Just wanted to update and say that we’re still loving this camera. Almost a year later and no complaints! This product is fantastic! I set it up last night (super easy process - 5/10 min tops) and I’ve been thrilled so far. The motion and sound detections are quick and accurate. You can pan the camera, move it side to side, up and down, and zoom, all from your phone app. Notification come immediately and the live stream is INCREDIBLE. Beautiful picture and video quality. The two way audio works like a charm (although it does slightly distort your voice) and the sound quality was completely unexpected. I am also loving the night vision. Without it, the room was pitch black last night, I flipped it on and I could clearly see every single nook and cranny. This is an amazing product, and it’s a steal at this price. I have no complaints, but if anything changes, I’ll update my review.
title: Amazing Product

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Alexander
content: The camera, in terms of hardware, is okay - there is nothing fancy, video quality is nowhere near Sony RX100, of course, but decent for a $30 web-cam. Audio could be louder both ways - when you speak and when you listen. My major issue is the Android app. For whatever reason it downloaded 85 MB while in foreground (me watching live stream, I believe) and whopping 350 MB in the background in half a day on cellular network! I have quality set to SD and watched it for like 3 minutes overall, so this data consumption is just crazy. Even 85 MB on foreground doesn't sound right to me, given the streaming time I had.
