I don't know what it was downloading in the background, but as soon as I discovered that it's eating through my limited mobile data like it's nobody's business - I restricted background data for the app. At this point I'm not sure, if it has any pros over any other cheap camera that can do live stream and recording - if I understand correctly, with background data disabled I won't get any notifications for fire/CO2 alarm, which was supposed to be a neat feature. The problem is made worse by the fact that this app is the only way to access the camera - there is no website where you can go and watch the stream, while you are stationary on ethernet.
title: Okay camera, bad software

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kilroy
content: As a former security expert (who was worked with/installed/maintained security cams old and new) i can say this camera, if used for ANY security, would be unsatisfactory. At the BEST conditions, there was a 15-25 second delay in the so-called "live" feed. This is enough time for anyone to walk in, grab something, and walk out of an establishment. By the time you see what's going on, it's done and over. There is a lag in communication time between Echo show and the cameras before you get a "lagged" live feed. So, communicating with someone is aggravating and could cause real confusion. Understand, i tested this (within 10 feet) of a 2.5ghz router so i was getting "full" strength signal. I wished to be fair about this so i moved this camera around to multiple location....it got worse from there. I am forced to agree with other negative reviews....this camera is no better than an augmented "toy". Also i bought the outdoor protection for this camera....it's a silicon joke. I could spit on the camera and short it out, it wouldn't survive any amount of rain (even with the protection jacket that can be bought (extra). This camera only works (nominally) under near-perfect conditions and with the signal lag, it's just a joke. The night vision camera did not impress me (unless i look at this camera as a "toy", it would be an impressive toy). With there being no, true, control command system (other than the cell phone) it's just a toy and shouldn't be taken seriously for ANY situation where security is involved. I am also a tech repair individual and i had it's signal feed under near-perfect conditions. I would not take this camera too seriously.
title: Many issues with this camera. I ran it through thorough tests.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Consumer727
content: I have 3 Wyzecams and 1 Wyzecam Pan.  I am a "beta tester," which is to say I am among a large group of Wyzecam consumers that get firmware updates before the other buyers do.  I expect their to be bugs.  That being said, at this point I found the motion tracking to be imperfect.  There are times when the camera catches the initial movement but doesn't stay with it, as in the case with my dogs.  Or the Wyzecam Pan will stay with the moving subject, but jump to another position then back to the subject repeatedly.  Lastly, while you can adjust sensitivity, things like moving tree branches and flying insects will be recorded so you get dozens of alerts of movement, most of which are just a waste of time to review. Pros:  1) Relatively inexpensive 2) You get a 12 second preview and then can download the longer video from their cloud 3) No monthly charges 4) Using your wi-fi system you can view what your cameras see via their cell phone app from anywhere you can access the internet.  5) If you install Bluestacks on your computer, you can monitor all of your cameras on your computer.  6) You can take still photos or make videos of the live stream to save or share on your cell phone.  7) You can set up the Wyzecam and/or Wyzecam Pan in your bedroom to see if aliens are abducting you while you sleep. Cons: 1) Customer service may take several days to a week to get back to you  2) Device is imperfect  3) You never know with each update if some of the functioning will work and sometimes you have to go back to a previous version in order to have a system you can rely on.  4) With their latest update there is no longer an easy return to a previous software version - you have to follow a multiple step process that ends in flashing the firmware to return to the previous version 5) They're currently trying to perfect their AI for discerning if there's a person in the video or not 6) Most people install this product and the Wyzecam V1 and V2 outside.  That invalidates the warranty and you get no customer support if you do, even if like me, you install the Wyzecam Pan under a roof eave, and put the Wyzecam in housing designed to protect it outside. 7) The Wyzecam Pan, like the Wyzecam, has a built in speaker that transmits and picks up audio, but it's not very loud.  8) This device is known to corrupt SD memory cards.  I've had better luck with the stationary Wyzecams.  I'm on my 3rd card with this one. Wyzecam is working on an "outdoor" model.  Right now, their products are buggy so you have to decide, is it worth saving money for a "work in progress."  I'm trying a high usage memory card this time in the hopes that it will last longer than a few months.  I hope at some point Wyzecam can work out all of the bugs because I think if they do they will have a great product at a great price.
title: Still a work in progress

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: BostonC75
content: I have been using Nest cams for a long time (most of mine are dropcams) and i write this so you know what I'm use to. I bought two of the pan/tilt cameras and one V2 after seeing a review on YouTube by LifeHackster.  I needed to set up some cameras fast and cheap at a new vacation home I bought that's in a rural area of New Hampshire. In a word, all three work very well.  They connected to WIFI without any problems, the APP works well, and the motion detection/motion tracking is pretty good...not great, but good. I used a 32 gb card in two of them (the pan tilt and v2 stationary) and I'm getting about 4 days of constant HD recording.  I am currently trying a 64 gb card (even though it says you can't) and it's getting around 6-7 days. I these up and running around the house and tested my Nest protect smoke/co detector..and all the WYZE cameras picked up on the test and sent an alert that my smoke detector was going off.  Pretty cool. If you want to start out with a wifi security camera that's cheap, easy to use, I would strongly suggest buying one of these.  You can always upgrade, but these will work pretty well.  The cloud service is free (although only 15 seconds of motion sent to the cloud) and with a 32 gb card you can easily check out the whole event. Only downside I see is the motion detection is a little spotty, and the audio doesn't sink up with the video, there is a one second delay.  Not the of the world, but what do you want for $20 and $37?
title: Great, cheap camera that works pretty well

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: LoveThatRonWhite
content: Setup was a little hiccup-y.  There was a little more to it than just plug 'n play but, in the end, this is worth it.  There's definitely a place for these cameras, and they're probably destined to be sitting in every garage, coffee shop, living room, and pool room in America.  At this price, why stop at one, and why not gift one to everyone in the family on every occasion?  Pictures are clear, alerts are ok once they're up and running, and the camera's habit of obviously following people around may be a little unnerving, but is probably a great theft deterrent.
title: Cheap Way To Keep An Eye On Things

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: SARAHHHHHH
content: After a week of use, encountered connection error code 0 each time I tried to use my purchased Wyze Cam Pan or the replacement Wyze Cam Pan (provided by Amazon Tech Support). Worked with Wyze Tech Support team to review my camera's connectivity to my router using the "RouteThis Helps" application scan.  Per their review, my signal looks incredibly clear and they could not determine why either camera was having trouble on my network. Returned products. On the other hand, my other two Wyze Cam (v2) continue to work great.
title: Unrealiable Wyze Cam Pan; buy the Wyze Cam instead.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jose
content: Bueno la estetica de la camara es muy agradable y se mezcla facilmente en interiores, el sensor de movimiento funsiona bien al igual que la vision nocturna, los contra que podria sacarle son: el audio es pobre! Hay que gritar para que se escuche claro, si bien esta diseñada para detectar fuertes sonidos ya sea por un vidrio roto, un bebe llorando etc... al momento de hablar con alguien, que es una de sus funsiones, es super incomodo, tienen que repetir demasiadas veces para escuchar bien o tienen que gritar; ellos anuncian que la vision nocturna tiene un alcanze de 10 metros, bueno mi sala no tiene ni 5 metros y ya la luz se va perdiendo a los 4 metros de distancia; el modo de seguimiento, funsiona pero ya que el sensor de movimiento de esta camara funsiona por medio del cambio de pixeles en el video, al momento de ella detectar movimiento, lo sigue pero al ver otro movimiento ya sea una cortina, una puerta, el reflejo en el espejo, la luz del foco, etc... se pierde en seguida y se queda enfocando todo menos a la persona. Estos son algunos factores que hay que tomar en cuenta, pero para su precio y su finos acabados y plasticos de buena calidad, es una camara increible, solo que con problemas por solucionar, espero haya sido de ayuda.
title: PROS Y CONTRAS

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: T-Rex "Gas"osaurus
content: It works, but bigger than expected (yes, price is v.reasonable) and the device makes a plastic-scraping noise as it moves around. Not too bad of a product, for sampling, at this under$40  price. But the noise is too noticable for ordinary use in a home.
title: Just 1/2 ok

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jen
content: Upon opening up the product I was impressed with the look and feel of the item and the packaging. I had high expectations for this product. I downloaded the app, connected the camera and updated the firmware as it stated it needed to be updated. Everything looked great until I tried to use the SD card that I purchased (SanDisk). I started researching why the device would not recognize the SD card and found out that their new firmware update has caused SD cards that are NOT Wyze brand to not work. So basically if you want to use the SD card feature you have to get their brand SD card. I do not like to support a company that forces you to use only their brand. SD cards are not expensive and SanDisk is a very well known brand of SD cards. There is no reason why a consumer has to go out of their way to purchase a specific SD card to satisfy one product.
title: SD card does not work

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kirstie Corbett
content: I’ve been looking into the Wyze cam for about a year now. We finally decided to purchase to keep an eye on our most recent addition to the family (very old, sick dog). We are OBSESSED with these cams!! They are extremely affordable and have AMAZING clarity during night and day. Not to mention, they are real time! I love being able to speak and move the cam around to search for my fur-kids. Also, we really like that the cam pans with motion. I literally keep my phone open to the “Furby Cam” to keep an eye on our dog and cats during the day while I am away. I’m so glad that we didn’t waste our money on a RING. We love these cams so much and plan to purchase some more for outside of our house.
title: Fantastic price and excellent clarity!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Steven R. Bukosky
content: I have a LOT of internet cameras around my house. I am a rep for a company that has a home automation and monitoring system. I tried the Wyze to see how they were and now have four around the home. They beat the ones that my company sells on two things. #1, they can be rotated 360 degrees and look up and down. #2, the time to access them on the cell phone app is much faster than mine. I'll add a #3. They are inexpensive. The motion detecting is pretty good, but it searches back and forth too much. It should follow the motion smoother than it does, but you can easily report a motion alert to them for helping them improve the software. All in all, I highly recommend them.
title: A no brainer. Buy it.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: David A. Hill
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Update review:_____________________ Still getting great images. I don't record anything directly to the SD card and don't use the built-in motion detection etc. I use rtsp: to connect to my NAS and other security monitoring software on my PC, and use their settings. One very disturbing issue just 20 minutes ago: I use the YouTube app on my smart TV, and after watching an episode of Antiques Roadshow, instead of going to the next video, I had 5 minutes of what I assume is some Chinese woman and her cam feeds. Reference the video. Not a joke. This didn't come thru the app, but across my network to my TV. My TV isn't connected to my phone, so I can't see where changing the password would or could have any effect. It appears that they (whom ever "they" are) have access to my internal network. Not impressed at all. I'm going to change the sub net on the wireless router I use for these cams, change the password and see if it happens again. If it does, in the trash they go! Original review: ____________________ These cams are a snap to setup. Install the app and follow really simple instructions. At one point it will have you will need to have the camera read a QR code on your phone. Don't forget to remove the protective plastic film that's over the lens. I have (2) Pan cams mounted outside with black silicone covers, and (3) V2 cams inside the house. All have been updated to "demo" firmware, that allows them to be accessed from my PC desktop, laptop, NAS etc. using rtsp:// protocol. Search "Wyze WiFi cam desktop viewing" to locate the "demo" firmware. There's a version for both V2 and Pan cams. Both work great. I don't use SD cards in any of them (except to upgrade the firmware). I use free software to connect to the cameras and record with no time limit. The motion detection is cool. If you enable it, it will follow a car going by, as the car moves, so the camera rotates to keep it in frame. The color reproduction in good light is excellent. To get the best resolution from your cam, after initial setup, go to the live stream view. You'll see an "SD" in a light blue outlined box just to the left of the words, "Live Stream". Select this, and you'll get a drop down list with: SD, 360P, and HD. SD is the default. Keep in mind that higher resolution will require more bandwidth on your WiFi, and affect how responsive the cam is from the app when viewing the live stream. I'v read many questions on here about whether or not the Wyze cameras are wireless. Some have answered erroneously that they aren't, that they need to be connected to power. Huh? They are wireless indeed. Wireless is how they communicate, but are powered by a USB cable connected to a power supply that plugs into the wall (both supplied). Think about what happens when your phone's battery runs out. You plug it into a charging cable. It still communicates wirelessly, but is plugged into the wall for power. It doesn't stop being wireless when you plug it in. Overall for the money, you really can't go wrong. My only uncertainty is how these "indoor" cams will work outside in weather. It can get to -20 here in the winter. Only the Pan cams are outside under the eaves. out of the lion's share of the weather. I wouldn't have tried putting them outside had I not read about others doing it with good results. Search YouTube as well. As I learn more, I'll update this review. Hope it's helped someone. :)
title: At this price point, how can you possibly go wrong. I couldn't be happier :) : Update

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Sabrina L.
content: I purchased these because I was having dog walkers come into my home while I was at work. Setting up alerts was super easy and worked great. I did purchase two Micro-SD chips so I could record to that, instead of the cloud because accessing video from the cloud seemed a little too complicated for someone not-tech smart like myself. That being said, having no skills in tech whatsoever, these were SO EASY to install and setup. I did make the mistake of connecting to the wrong internet (need 2.5 instead of 5 ghz) but once I realized that, it was smooth sailing! I bought one for multiple rooms in my house and even purchased one as a gift because I thought they were SO cool! The gift purchase went to a family member and I helped them with the setup, as well as helped them program the app onto two user's phones, so they can both access the camera/settings. I love these so much! The only downside (if this is important to you, it's not to me), is they don't really blend into your settings (meaning they stand out quite a bit). They also have to be plugged in 24/7 to stay on but they do come with a chord, they don't however come with a block to plug the USB into the wall so you may need to purchase that. All-in-all, I LOVE these cameras and think the picture quality is great, and the alert notifications are very reliable.
title: Best In-Class for Home Video Monitoring

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Omar K
content: I bought two of these units after reading the reviews. They arrived and I followed the steps for installation which are simple and it didn’t work. I emailed customer service and 4days later they still haven’t contacted me back. Now I know why they are so cheap, it’s a volume product but not quality oriented. If you are one of the lucky that buys this product and it works then great. But if it doesn’t work or breaks somehow, good luck with getting support to fix the issue. Just glad mine didn’t work out of the box rather than dealing with no customer support in the future. I’d rather pay more and have a quality product!
title: Two cameras didn’t work at all

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J L
content: update (work in progress): starting off by saying support has been excellent once i got on touch. i also have a cam v2 which is fine. my issues are for this particular product. the replacement has the same issues as the first one. i spent hours trying anything directly conceivable. tried upgrading from the existing old firmware to the .40 firmware. issue still exists. then tried upgrading to the latest firmware. issue persists. tried re-applying the current firmware again via wifi and twice more via sd card. no change. so up next, i will either replace it again through Amazon or try the warranty option with Wyze. busy with real life but this product needs to get its act together. i don't plan on keeping a half-functional product taking up space. Seriously, this should work right out of the box! Motion tracking and all functions should work as advertised but does not. old review: tried firmware 4.10.3.108 (latest) 4.10.3.60 4.10.3.50 4.10.3.40 re-installed the app and the device in the app several times. Does not work: all automated stuff: event recording auto-tracking motion detection (no green boxes, unresponsive, sensitivity set to 5, 7 & 10 max) motion tagging motion detection zone on or off notifications - enabled in ios - bell icon not crossed out in app - all wyze app notification settings enabled under every section i could find enabled "free" person detection & disabled it. still not working. Worked: manual intervention stuff like: pressing record to actually record panning / tilting around night vision connectivity firmware updates either via sd card or via wifi sd card slot In case it was a defective unit, I may update this with my experience on a replacement unit to confirm the issues. The Wyze forums show these issues existed as far back as last year up to present day. I'm skeptical the replacement will be better but taking a chance due to the price & awesomeness if it would actually work right out of the box. This product is not frustration-free.
title: The automated features, especially motion tracking, do not work!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jb h
content: GOOD: *cheap, but GREAT picture day & night. *i can get it to work through a window, and it sometimes records motion. *you can install SD card for continuous recording, but then finding the piece of footage you want can be an issue.  (although i hear they now have a tag button for that?) *i hear they may also have $1.49 per camera fee for recording to cloud as long as the motion occurs, this is fairly cheap compared to other cameras.  I returned mine b/c this wasn't out.  I may repurchase it now b/c of this. BAD: *only 12 sec, never enough to see all the details.  5 min cool downs makes you loose or not record valuable footage, plus then if it does, it's only 12 sec. *i had issues with the SD card overheating *not for outdoors. *casing is cheap, DO NOT DROP IT. *sometimes it freezes and you would have to be home to reboot it.  So not good for vacation home where you aren't there. OVERALL:  good if you're home alot, and can reboot it.
title: good and bad

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Cory
content: Having owned two Wyze Cam v2 models prior to purchasing the Wyze Cam Pan, I had a pretty average review on Wyze. Great feature-packed security cameras that are inexpensive. After receiving the Pan, however, things changed. Setup was just as easy as the v2, and the only extra setup step (at least that I recommend) is setting your waypoints, so the camera knows where to track. I didn't, and its default position was facing the wall. The camera quality appears to have a slight improvement over the v2, and the audio isn't muffled, you can make out a whole lot more than before. With any Wyze Cam, I highly advise purchasing a MicroSD card for internal recording. This allows for constant recording with smart events and motion being stored in the cloud for a limited time. Still great in the event a camera gets destroyed or breaks. Wyze has stepped it up with the Wyze Cam Pan, and they have now a phenominal product with a great platform to access it from.
title: Big improvement over Wyze Cam v2

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: scott
content: Everything normal hooks up to my Xfinity router.  Not this, first one didn't, ordered 2nd, nope.  Emailed company, nope. Spent hours of my life researching to make it work, nope.  Two of them going back, yep.  Good theory, really wanted it to work. Bad business model, chinese hardware stolen from legit company  with poorly managed app= no worky
title: 0 support

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: RUSSELL
content: So far so good.  And you can't beat the price. The picture quality is excellent.  I also have an Arlo Cam Q, and the picture quality is inferior on the Arlo.  My only complaint is the app is a bit confusing to operate, as the different options for the camera are not clearly explained. I also love that you can put your own micro SD card in it, and do continuous or motion/sound activated recording locally.  Very few cameras have that, as they want you to pay for their cloud service.
title: Good Price, Great Camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jerbear
content: Wyze cam pro is priced very reasonable but you get what you pay for. Installed it and had it running.  The cam then recommended to install a firm ware upgrade.  The new firm ware fried the cam.  When to the forum and there were many people having the same issue.  The instructions to correct it didn't work.  Two days later, I figured out on my own how to revert to the original firm ware. Put in a support ticket and it took weeks to get an answer but by then I had already it sort of working.  Wyze has the attitude that you need to fix problems by visiting their forum.  The forum is difficult to navigate.  Customers shouldn't have to spent time fixing a brand new product. The motion tracking on this camera does not work.  It over shoots what it is tracking.  Eventually it picks a bright or dark spot and locks on it.  The whole point of this camera is the ability to pan and track motion.  It doesn't work very well at all. Due to the price point Wyze is growing very rapidly but they are putting out product that is not fully tested and they push out firm ware fixes that are not stable. Pay a little more and get a quality product that works.
title: Not worth it

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: sfchris
content: It was effortless to set up this camera and the app works wonderfully. Night vision is excellent indoors (others have said it doesn't work well outdoors or through glass). The camera does not topple over even if not anchored, although to be sure, I slid some masking tape between the base and the rotating top to tape it down in case of earthquake. If you want to mount it you will need to buy a mount kit or a tripod. What I did not like about this camera is that there is no way to physically switch off the microphone or the speaker. This means you cannot use this camera in locations where you security is important... if a hacker should access your camera, they would be able to listen in. Furthermore, there have been reports of hackers breaking into all kinds of IP cameras and playing music or making noise. As my apartment has think walls, I cannot risk that someone would break into the camera and play obnoxious noises like airhorns or sirens, disturbing my neighbors. I taped up the back of the camera to try to block the speaker, but it only reduced the sound by about half. Since the speaker can be pretty loud, that is not good enough. A physical kill switch on for the mic and the speaker on the camera itself would solve that problem.
title: Great camera for the price. Wish it had a physical kill switch for mic and speaker on camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: M. Chick
content: I have used Wyze Cams in the past and they have been excellent. I just received the Wyze Cam Pan and it will not notify on movement or do anything it is supposed to do except notify on sound. I noticed that on the Wyze forum there are hundreds of people with the same issue. I jumped through all the hoops with tech support and nothing. I returned the camera but will get a replacement and hopefully I wont be disappointed. with that decision. I will update after I receive the replacement.  UPDATE: Received second camera. Although the picture is great I can not get it to  record motion or send notifications. A total failure with Amazon tech support also. Support person had to read about the camera to see what it is supposed to do. I could get nowhere. second camera is going back. The Wyze camera is OK but not the Cam Pan version!
title: Seems to be a lot of defective units Updated review

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kevin P
content: The camera itself is excellent.  However, it isn't suitable for any locations where you want to safeguard the privacy of the people who walk by it, e.g. at a medical facility, educational institution, places with minors, or anywhere that people don't want their presence tracked. After corresponding with Wyze, I can confirm that the 12-second event clips are stored in Wyze's cloud, where they CAN BE VIEWED by Wyze's staff, and also possibly subjected to face-recognition algorithms.  Even though the event clips may be deleted after 14 days, that is plenty of time for much privacy violation to occur.  There is nothing that prevents Wyze from storing face-recognition images indefinitely, and sharing them with anybody.  Anyone who has been keeping up with the news of what the Chinese government is doing in Xinjiang should recognize the possibility of abuse. It turns out that you can disable the cloud storage by turning off Notifications.  Event recordings can then be stored on the local SD card.  But then you lose the ability to receive Event notifications!  This negates much of the benefit of this camera.  This is a design flaw, and can be fixed easily, but Wyze doesn't seem to consider this a priority. The local SD card recording is also buggy.  Sometimes, I can find video clips; sometimes, they haven't been created. As consumers, we need to take a stand to have these products clearly and honestly conform to what we expect for our privacy.
title: Not suitable for privacy-sensitive locations or persons

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jack Smith
content: UPDATE: total privacy invasion ! My phone just said that “WYZE is actively tracking your location for several days”!!! This product line is becoming a worst privacy invader!! They can see my videos, they now track where I go. And because of the technology they used, the cameras record 24x7 even if you turn them off. When detection is on they compare images and if they detect changes it means motion so they record that clip. So Wyze is “smart enough” to know how we look like, how our place looks like and that is not enough for them, now they want to know where we go and where we are at any time!!! -my recent review-: After being a loyal customer for years I am looking elsewhere. With the latest firmware updates, since April 2020, videos freeze, motion is not recorded, detection is not triggered and then it works. And then it does not record. And then it works. And then it does not. So frustrating!! And it is inconsistent every single day!! Tech support? Totally useless!! Most reviews appear to be fake. It was a good product. No more.
title: Wyze tracks my location for days. It messed up the cameras functions. Looking at other brands.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: T Griffis
content: First of all if you need a security system this isn't for you. I like it because I run an aquarium store and I can keep an eye on my store when I'm off or out of town. Too many times I've returned to a busted tank and a soaked floor or a return pump that ran dry and quit working. With this camera I have a decent idea of what's going on in my store when I'm not there. I like the pan and tilt feature thats really nice and the "zoom" is more or less viewing the picture larger or smaller but overall it does a fair job at getting close enough to what I need to see. The audio is a bit lacking it lags really badly even at high speed internet and there's an echo or digital scrambled noise sometimes. Also it's very soft you cannot hear a conversation more than a couple feet away nor can the other party hear you. I wish it was more of a dvr type setup and I'm sure it can be configured that way even if some extra apps or something were used but I haven't played with it much. Would be a decent nanny cam or to view your aquarium when away. Note that the size of the unity is rather large and it's kind of clunky. There are nano cams in the world this isn't one of them. It isn't for you if you need the camera hidden. Also the base is a little weird the plugin for the cord is in the base which seems small compared to the top heavy unit but I haven't had it tip over or anything (yet.) Note that this runs off a common mini usb charger cord and you'll need a brick for that unless you use it on the usb drive of a computer or something. I don't really care for the power cord I think it could have been handled differently. Overall for the price it's pretty neat and I'd buy it again for my purposes.
title: It's a really neat camera and for the price I'm impressed. Just know what you're buying.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: TooTechnical
content: I was looking for an inexpensive way to see the view from the west side of my house on my TV which is mounted on the west wall of my living room.  Unfortunately, the downstairs of my house only has windows facing the west inside the master bedroom (directly behind the living room wall). Living in the main house we only had a view from our kitchen and living room to the backyard.  The day we moved in I said I would find a way to get this problem resolved by using a WiFi cam that tied into the TV.  After arbitrarily researching over the past 1+ years, I came across this little Cam and figured, "why not give it a go...".  Reading some reviews, I kind of got the impression it would work with my Fire TV Stick.  But first I investigated what App came on the Fire TV Stick and I saw 3 apps available.  So I went ahead and purchased it hoping one of them might work. The day arrived, I got it - yea!!  Now on to hooking it up, which was ridiculously easy.  That is plugging it in anyway.  Of course I downloaded the Android APP and did everything needed and I was up and running in no time.  Now for the TV.  Of course none of the APPS on the FIRE TV Stick worked.  Well, that's not to say they won't but I wasn't ready to spend hours or days or weeks trying to figure out all the techno guru stuff required to make it work. After a couple of hours of researching I found someone indicate that it would work by going to and downloading the Wyze App at apkmirror.com.  After searching "Wyze" I found the suggested download of 2.0.26, downloaded it to my USB thumb drive, mounted the thumb drive and my wireless keyboard to the Fire TV Stick, opened ES Explorer and installed the APP.  Woohoo!  It worked - But NO IT DIDN'T!!  I mean it did work, but my picture was squeezed at the top of the screen - UGH!!!  The APP was thinking  Portrait mode, not landscape mode.  So off to do more research on how to turn the image 90 degrees.  After researching and researching, I came up with nothing.  But then I thought, "I cannot be the first one to have this issue...".  I went back to APKMirror.com and downloaded the latest APK 2.3.69 after reading through all the versions.  I can't recall which version fixed this but one of them I read a blurp indicating they gave it the ability to rotate the image.  So I went for it and downloaded the latest version hoping that the option flowed into the newer versions. SUCCESS!! After installing, I notice those 4 little "crop" marks in the upper right hand corner of my screen.  Clicked on it and WALLAH! My screen rotated and I got my landscaped Full Screen of my Window.  Now we can stair at the TV while cooking dinner and see the storms approaching from the west. Most people would have rated this between 1 and 4 stars.  However, I went into this expecting not to get what I wanted.  What I got however, was a great camera at a great cost.  I am fortunate that I had been in IT for the past 40+ years so troubleshooting isn't a stranger to me.  For those feint of heart, well - that's why you hire, Computer Techs,  CPI or other technology firms to do this for you. Oh - one last note.  For those who do not know how to work "inside" the operations of the Amazon Fire TV Stick, please take the time to research and understand how to use your TV stick "outside the box" so-to-speak... Good luck. Now on to getting more Wyze devices pointed all over the place. I found buying many of these devices on the Wyze website might turn out to be less costly.  However they do charge shipping so I need to do a bit more research for promo codes, etc...
title: Excellent Bang for the Buck!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: James Neiswonger
content: I do CCTV cameras for a living (18yrs) and have been looking for a cheap camera (for the house) that had continues onboard recording without having to sign up for a subscription service for saving video recordings. Lets start with the good then go to the deal breaker. 1. Price. 2. Has a lot of great features for the price. 3. Can pan/tilt. 4. some aftermarket support for accessories . 5. Fairly easy set up and the app is decent. OK now the not so good. 1. Only see's up to 32GB memory card. Way to small for any good amount of recording time. Should have been set for much more. Some people (on forums) are stating that they are using larger cards with no issue while others say anything over 32 doesn't work for them. 2. The Pan/Tilt is not very smooth (but this is nitpicking on a $37 camera) 3. Not for outdoor use (from Wyze) without 3rd party accessories and I'm still not sure how well it's going to handle the weather because the power port cannot be covered. 4. After 3 weeks of reading forums and testing, I cannot keep the camera from constantly resenting itself when the memory card is used. If I pull the card out it works fine. Yes I formatted the card correctly,  yes the card I used is rated correctly for the application (fast enough for video recording). Lots of people report having this same issue. This is the deal breaker for me. I want more than just short 12 sec video clips, I need continuous recording. I hope with some more time and maybe some software updates the memory card issue get resolved, but until then I will not purchase anymore of these cameras. I continuous recording is no big deal for you then give these a try, your not out too much money if you don't like it.
title: Good Camera BUT....

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Katrina Cabral
content: I wanted to like this soooooo bad. In fact, I was sharing my find with friends even before it arrived. Out of the box, I was impressed with how easy it was to set up. Just plug and play it seemed .... then I tried to actually use it.... and it’s pathetic.... for some reason it doesn’t record reliably. I have a SIM card installed but it doesn’t recognize it even though I bought them together as it was the recommended one. But I don’t even see cloud recordings a lot of the time. Some times I do and then other times - like when it matters - then there are no recordings. Seriously. Ugh! Once I finally sort of got it working and after I’m done troubleshooting it and I try to move it to a different outlet that’s only a few feet away - it stops working AGAIN... ugh...plug it back in to the original outlet and voila ... it doesn’t work there again either! And yes, like another person noted, the motion sensor doesn’t work long enough. It should keep working ‘as long as the subject is still present and as long as there is motion.’ Doesn’t help much to see the first few seconds of someone entering a room and then nothing. And when I complained that the SIM card wasn’t recognized they wanted me to troubleshoot that and make sure it wasn’t the SIM card. The only problem is that this is the only device I own that uses this type of card. I have WAY better things to do with my time. What a waste of money and a colossal waste of time. So so so frustrating.
title: Quintessentially the most frustrating product EVER

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Eric
content: Since an update around Dec. 2018, this camera overpans past whatever it detects. It then detects what it just panned right past on the opposite end of its visual range, and overpans back right past it. What results is an endless, over-rigorous bouncing back and forth which makes the video basically impossible to watch (see my uploaded video). This is not an isolated issue; dozens of people have reported it between their forums, Reddit, and here. What’s the point in having the ability to track someone if it is done in a way which makes identification and observation nearly impossible? The only solution is to flash the firmware with an old version from around November 2018. I have reached out to technical support at Wyze, they replaced the camera, but the same issue is present in every camera because it’s a software issue. Rather than providing an update to allow for reduced or variable motion detection pan speeds to resolve this obvious bug, they instructed me to submit a feature request. Suffice to say, this company is not particularly interested in excellence and fixing severe functionality destroying bugs. This camera is perfectly fine if you don’t use the motion detection panning, but then why buy it over a static model? I’ve also noticed that the night vision brightness appears to differ between the first one I have and the replacement they sent (which is much darker).
title: Motion Detection Does Not Function Properly

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: BobPT
content: I have one of these set up to overlook the kitchen, living room and entry door.  I have another out under the deck to observe the back yard and patio entry door.  The unit is powered by an included micro USB cord and the plug-in adapter.  The cord plugs into the base and this would be the rear of the camera. The cord is about 6 ft. long.  Any micro USB cord will work.  In daylight, the picture is very good as this is 1080p.  However, if this is looking towards a window or light source, the light will really obscure part of the view.  The night time vision is not great but you can still see reasonably well.  Needs more infrared lighting to see a bit better. This has both motion and sound detection tracking and the unit can rotate in almost a full 360 deg but it doesn't spin around and around, though. When you first set it up, have the base and cord at the back with lens facing forward.  That is your front and back reference.  Once powered up, the unit will take a minute to calibrate by turning 180 deg to the right and then all the way back to the left so it scans 350 deg.  Once that happens, it automatically turns to point forward. It does a good job in motion detection and motion tracking.  The unit can scan almost a 360 deg circle but I have each one set up to scan only 180 deg.  In the software, you can change the amount of time it takes for the camera to do a full pan of the room.  I have min set to the fastest time and I found that it will track motion pretty well. At a slower speed, it can't keep up with the moving object. My wife complains that when she is working in the kitchen she can hear the motor of the unit whirring when it is tracking her and it is annoying. Therefore, I shut off the motion detection when we are home.  I have a 32 Gb micro SD card in each one and the unit will record what it picks up each time.  If you don't want to use an SD card, the unit will record to the cloud for free for a few days.  The downside is that it only records each event for 12 seconds with no option to change time +/- and, it takes several minutes for a "cool down" (not sure what the correct term is) before it can record another episode.  I have turned off the sound detection part of this as it seems that even the slightest sound will start it tracking, including just footsteps. I found this out when I initially went to review the past few days of recordings and there were literally hundreds of sound detection recordings with nothing happening in the video.  This level of sensitivity may be a good thing, or a bad thing depending on your needs. This has 2-way voice communication but the speaker part is really weak and not really of practical, functional use.  The software is really pretty good.  I have 3 Wyze Cams set up.  The down side is that you can only view one camera at a time on your iOS or Android phone or tablet.  There is no software provision for a computer.  Overall, for the price, the picture quality, motion tracking, free cloud storage, and the software, I would recommend this for home use. UPDATE:  I take back what I said about how well this Cam Pan tracks.  It is terrible.  When set to motion tracking and it detects motion, it will constantly hunt back and forth to track the object moving across its path.  It will lock on for a moment and then scan back about 30 degrees, then forward to track, then back again.  Very hard to get a clear visual of the object when it jerks back and forth so much.  Many owners have complained about this issue on the forums for at least a year now and Wyze has yet to address this.  I am downgrading my review to 3 stars because when stationary, it takes pretty good video clips, even at night for up to around 15 feet distance.  IMO, right now, the only benefit of the Pan over the regular camera is that you can still manually pan the camera with the software program and set it to look in a different direction rather than having to physically go to the camera to change the view.  Save your money and buy just the Wyze Cam.
title: Good value - not anymore

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Josh C
content: I have been using this camera for a couple weeks pretty regularly.  I tried other cameras but this one had sound alerts which I thought would be perfect for seeing if my dogs are barking and hopefully talk to them to get them to stop. It works from the "letting me manually spy on them" but the alert system needs tweaks. The Good: - Setup was super easy - Panning works really well although the motor is pretty loud - Picture quality is nice and crisp - 2 way audio works (not very loud speaker however) The Bad: - The microphone is so sensitive it makes the "alert" system pretty useless. It goes off when the dogs walk around and when they drink water. Tried tape over the microphone and still picks up everything. - Call support is lacking. They have a number but after 30 minutes and no estimated wait time I gave up - Email support is laughable. I got a response to my ticket saying their US based support takes 5 - 7 days to respond. For the price it is a good product, it could be a great product if they can get that microphone to be less sensitive or answer their emails in a normal amount of time. Who knows in a week when I hear back from them they may have a solution to the microphone!
title: Works well for motion, not for sound alerts

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Heartland Indiana
content: EDIT: I downgraded my review because after many weeks of using the cameras they are just too undependable and dependability is what I want in a camera. Sorry to say you get a lot for the price they are still just TOYS. I could never set these to watch anything important to me. Original Review: Just purchased 3 of these (Pan Cams and 1 Wyze Non Pan cam) and while they seem to work great (picture wise and Panning) BUT they keep getting dropped from Alexa. When I call them trough Alexa some work fine and others say the camera is not responding. A few hours a different camera may lose contact and the bad one is now working With Alexa. I have the Wyze add on or "skill" for Alexa. The cameras work better with the Wyze phone APP but still have one that will not connect then later it does. Small house new Router High speed Internet all work fine. When the camera finally does decide to show on Echo Show or Echo Dot it only stay on for about 10 - 15 min and drops out never to return. I think this is a Wyze issue and not Amazon. I use them on 360p resolution to reduce lag. Not happy with the quirkiness but the cost was fine.
title: I'm disappointed, they keep getting disabled from Alexa and won't show longer than 10min.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Dave
content: We have 3 cameras for security in our house while we're building. Installed last August 2019. We live at another location several miles away and the cameras watch the 4 entries into the house. Camera 1 watches the basement entry and the pellet stove. Camera 2 watches the main entry Camera 3 watches the side door and deck door Because we have lousy internet where we're staying I had to set all 3 to 360P. This allows a more reliable connection. Both places use Wifi however communication is also good through phone data with 3 bars. The cameras need Wifi at their location. So far we have picked up noise from things falling especially one windy night when stuff hit the deck. I can pan a camera to check the inside thermometer and can pan to see the deck and check outside conditions especially rain and snow. We tested regular motion, person detection and voice and all work great. The voice is a little tinny but when I whispered "geeet ouuuut" to an unsuspecting person the result would have made funniest home videos if I would have recorded. The latest is that you can store events such as a break in on the Wyze server that will allow video evidence to be had if the camera is stolen or destroyed for a very reasonable small fee. These are the best you can buy for under $40 and I highly recommend
title: Best camera for security at affordable price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: glmccready
content: The price was right, and the resolution was similar to my Arlo setup.  I put it in a round plastic Dove chocolate container, open side down. No problems, even with a hurricane, 60 mph winds.  I did put the camera in a water resistant case, but it never got wet, or even damp, anyway.  In the plastic container the night vision doesn't work, of course, but I have a sensor light on that side of the house...so it does pickup "motion" at night, when thesensor light comes on. I like this much better than my Arlo "system". It uses wifi and it updates fast, but doesn't reach as far as the Arlo hub. My Arlo often takes 10-15 seconds to "alert", and this is nearly instantaneous. Only wish it was 2k, like my Eufy doorbell. Nutshell: Great Cam, at a great price. Held up very well outside, 10 months, in all seasons, encased in a used round Dove bar container.
title: Still going STRONG. Impressed...and outside!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rob Scarpa
content: Worked great using my old iPhone SE. However, bought a new iPhone 11 Pro and it works fine and sees all 7 pan cams and 6 plugs while I’m on same network at home but doesn’t pull up the cams when on LTE or another WiFi. It might pull up one or two cams but not the others on LTE. Then later might pull up one other cam but not the earlier one. Contacted Wyze and they sent me a link to a useless site on how to connect. I emailed them several times and no response. I paid over $300 for cameras and someone needs to fix this problem!!!! Useless cams/app unless I’m at home where I really don’t need them. Went to daughters house and checked how it connects while on her WiFi and got the same results. Interestingly enough at night I am able to pull up all cameras immediately whether on WiFi or LTE around midnight. However, soon as daylight comes I’m getting same problems. Contacted Apple and Verizon who both suspect it’s a app issue. App was updated about same time I received the new phones. Update. I got my old iPhone se which still has all my apps intact. Connected to my daughters WiFi and tried to pull up my cameras. It’s having same issues whereas weeks ago pulled up the cameras almost instantly. So, WYZE has obviously done something at their end!!!
title: WYZE pan cam app no longer pulls up cameras while on LTE

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Michael viox
content: After having this for 4 months now, I'm ready to give my full review. I read the reviews, I watched the videos, I was even referred to this by my best friend, but is still feel like I got scammed? Sure, it's a cheap camera! Got what I paid for, I guess? This just feels like a Chinese Amazon toy. Pros: Clear video: Even when streaming in HD still get a pretty decent video. Streaming away from home is still pretty decent. Night vision is good too; however, auto mode in low light could give you a seizure. Pan. Definitely a plus. Don't use with motion tracking if you've got a fan! Cons: Panned Predictive Motion Tracking: Simply put NO! The Wyze Pan Cam acts like it's doing the dance move "The Twist". It over shoots the Target by feet even when it's only 15 feet away. Even worse the further out. Slowed the motors down in the app with very little help to stability. Pray you don't use this with a ceiling fan in the room. Even with the detection zone setup, as soon as something moves into the "fan zone" you're done... It's like an ADD child. And you can't use Detection zones in Pan mode! Noisy: Motors are LOUD! You definitely know this thing is in the room. One could almost use this as an alarm system. When capturing video, the motors are extremely distracting. 2 way Comms: Even at home, the lag to the speakers could be measured in seconds. Away from home... NO! Even with a gigabyte network, the audio is unrecognizable from the built in Wyze Cam speakers. Alexa: unless you have an Amazon Fire device or Echo Show, Alexa is useless. Lack of API or Web interface: I've been in the forums and the only answer I could get was, "We don't have one". Bulky: Didn't realize how big this thing is. Undecided: Noise detection: It works... Don't use if you've got dogs in a kennel. It's not directional. It just starts recording where ever it's currently pointed. (Turned it off). Conclusion: I guess I got caught up in the hype. Watched so many reviews and felt really confident on the purchase that real life left me disappointed. Before I actually took this for a "spin", I referred it to a fortune 500 Executive. Not my greatest achievement... I said it once, I'll say it again, I got what I paid for. A one night stand, and herpes.
title: Don't believe the hype

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Heather
content: I wish I had a night vision pic and a pic from the old camera we had so you could see the difference in quality. But at least you can get an idea :) We had a diff. cam & it just stopped working, it had most of the features this cam does but the night vision def. sucked on the other cam we had, & it didn't rotate or do motion detection. But anyway, this cam is really nice, I love that it has 2 way audio (because when I'm watching my fur babies on it & if one of them gets into something they shouldn't I can yell at them). The pic and video quality is great, & I love how it automatically adjusts for the lighting, & the night vision you can actually see but its kinda creepy also lol. The ONLY thing I would say kinda stinks (but its NOT the end of the world) is the sound quality. For example when I'm listening in on my dogs we have a radio going & the sound quality goes in and out and I can't even hear the music. Same as when you talk into it its clear, but it does go in an out so that's kinda disappointing (& I know for the price of this cam its not that big of a deal but you would think it would be a little better). Other than that, my fiance & I love this cam & I would def. recommend to a friend (because my coworker has the same one & she recommended to me). Oh, and its really handy that you can turn the cam off and on using the phone app, & you can rotate the cam w/the phone app using the button/wheel thing or you can do it w/your hand and just drag up or down, left or right on your phone screen. You can also add people so they can have access to the cam if you wanted. We don't turn the motion detection or pan scan on because we just have it in the one room and the dogs stay in view most of the time. And I just found it annoying when its scanning because its constantly moving & scanning & it makes a little noise & we don't really need the whole room to be scanned. I don't really know what the face recognition does, so I can't say anything about that. But for the price of the cam & all the features it has and all it can do, its def. worth paying for!
title: LOVE THIS CAM!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: EK
content: I had a Nest camera for a year, then my new kitten grabbed the cord and ripped it off a shelf. Needless to say, RIP Nest Cam. I needed a new one to keep an eye on my furry friends (dog + kitten), so I was going to replace it. As a grad student with essentially no money, paying almost $200 for a new Nest cam was not ideal. I decided to take a chance on this camera, and I'm definitely NOT disappointed with my decision. So why did I give it 4 stars instead of 5? Details below. Pros: -Wyze cam swivels around. You can move it! It's a slightly narrower field of view than the Nest cam in a stable position, but because this one moves in all 4 directions, you can see pretty much anything. Greater field of view than Nest, for sure. -You can throw in your own memory card! This is dope and means you don't have to pay for a monthly membership to record like you do with nest. -COST! SO MUCH CHEAPER!! -Has a special function to detect the sounds of fire and CO alarms, then notify you. -Can easily take photos and video recordings from the camera using your phone app. On Nest, you're stuck with screenshots. Same as Nest: -Can speak and listen through the camera. -Similar image quality, but Wyze may actually be slightly better. Honestly, neither one is amazing. It does the job but certainly isn't fancy high quality. -Night vision, similar quality to Nest. Cons: -Activating the home/away feature for motion detection is harder on Wyze. It's a simple click on the Nest app, but you need to go through the menus to get to it with this Wyze cam. Not a huge deal, but worth noting. -Unlike Nest, Wyze doesn't have other products to use a massive home control app. With Nest, you can use thermostats, tons of different cameras, security devices, safety alarms like fire, etc. With Wyze, it's just the cameras.
title: Thinking about Nest? You should definitely consider getting this instead. SAVE MONEY!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tuffie
content: I recently became a Dog Dad and now that I have walkers and dog sitters in my home when I'm not there I thought it's time to get some indoor security cameras. There are so many options today from super cheap to super expensive, and I was almost going to bite the bullet and get the Nest indoor cams (I already use their smoke detectors and I'm a Google Android user so figured keeping it 'in the family' would be best) but then found these and figured why not since the reviews were very good. SO HAPPY I DID! The camera itself is very well designed and super minimal which I love. The size is ideal, not too big/not too small, and the spin feature is awesome! I've placed one on top of my coffee grinder in my kitchen and the other on a bookshelf that looks down my hallway to my main door. Setup was super easy since it's literally just the camera, AC plug, and Micro-USB cable. It doesn't come with a MicroSD card, so I bought two 128GB cards for both cameras thinking that would be enough space. From the time I unboxed to downloading the app and setting up my account both cameras were working in under 10-15 minutes! I did hit a sang when updating the firmware, the app gave me the option to update mulitple devices at the same time but that didn't work, but worked perfectly when I did one at a time. The app interface is super easy to use and works great on my Samsung Galaxy s10 phone. Again simple/not cluttered design making it super easy and intuitive to do and get to exactly what you want. I love that I can easily schedule when in the day they need to be on, such as the hours I'm not there and at work, and that they turn off around the time before I return home. Accessing and using remotely via cell, not Wifi, also works great. Tested this morning while walking to a nearby breakfast spot and leaving Espen (my baby girl) out so I could see what she does when I'm gone. Both cameras pulled up in seconds and I was immediately able to see Espen sitting by my front door waiting for me to return, then walking around a bit. These cameras literally provide everything I wanted in an indoor security camera. Great video quality, easy to use, can access anytime from my mobile, and do much more all for ridiculously less than 'major brands' who are charging almost x5's the amount per unit. The only negative thing, and it's not really a negative as I haven't spent time to figure it out, is how the storage of video footage works or how to quickly see how much space remains on the 128GB MicroSD cards I added to both cameras. If you're in the market for indoor security cameras and don't want to spend a fortune on equipment and hosting services I can't recommend Wyze enough.
title: Literally THE BEST!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: readanlearn
content: Wyze makes mention over and over, do not use this for security.  But, thats what I wanted to keep eye on for the sump pump.  However, its always iffy.  More for keeping eyes on pets, etc.  I wouldnt trust it watching my house.  We have a big brand for that anyway, but thought these would be good for other minor things and thats what we will use these for.  The company is very good though.  I give customer service 5 stars.  There are many blogs on their site for questions, utube, etc.  They clearly state to not use for household protection, so no fault of theirs.
title: Jury is still out on this.  It is just a gadget do not mistake for security.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: H. Rast
content: Unfortunately I bought a few of these because I needed to keep track of my cat. Looking back I could have come up with something with a raspberry pi that would meet my needs (im an engineer, but i was very busy at the time). These are the problems with this camera: 1- No desktop app 2- video/audio sync problems 3- video recording is patchy and sometimes chunks of video are missing 4- it takes a bit of time to see the stream and sometimes the app has to attempt a few times before it gets the stream 5- the app is fairly limited in my opinion. I like to have the option to stream all the cameras in the same window rather than having to click them one by one. I know you can do this if you create a group but what if the cameras are not in a group? 6- the alerts are pretty unreliable. Often it misses my cat jumping but catches the changing of light coming through my window or something that is noise. A computer science student with a few internship could implement a better motion detection algorithm than these guys. 7- the sharing option is poorly done. I want to have finder control on what i share with someone. You get what you pay for! and sometimes much less.
title: amateur hour

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Hawkstv
content: When they say you get what you pay for, then that’s correct. I raved how great this camera was being inexpensive and working well. After two weeks, the camera fell and split apart and broke off the mini USB in the port on the camera. While I tweeted Wyze directly, I was advised to email support and a week later no response and one and the few cameras I purchased is down. When the camera pans instead of the eye of the camera panning, the entire camera pans so the camera is constantly moving when it pans. The camera wiggles itself enough to fall off of a 5” flat stand. The camera was located inside the home to detect who comes in the front yard and around the vehicles. Needless to say, I was out of town and couldn’t understand why my camera was offline until I returned home. If you decide to purchase this, then buy the warranty as customer support won’t respond back. For such an inexpensive camera, I wasn’t expecting it to need to be replaced two weeks later. Pros: cheap, can use SD card, no fee for cloud service Cons: entire camera pans and constantly moves when it pans, easy to fall from where it’s placed unless you mount it via screws directly to the wall, customer service takes a long time to respond to emails
title: Look elsewhere

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mark
content: Purchased 2 cameras on June 21, 2019. On July 24 one camera stopped working properly. Image is distorted also image is green and purple. Tried unplugging and plugging back in that did nothing Amazon states return window closed July 21, 2019. Now stuck with a $30 camera that doesn’t work. Have to try and contact Wyze hopefully they can help. 2nd review DO NOT BUY worst cameras ever. Contacted Wyze regarding my issue they sent me a replacement. A few weeks after receiving the new camera it stopped working properly. Image constantly freezes and audio goes out for long periods of time Im selling my home had potential buyers with their agent walking through it one day. I was watching them from work when I observed them on 2nd floor in my kitchen. I watched them walk out on to the deck. After 5 mins I’m like they re on the deck for a while now. It wasn’t that they were on the porch this whole time. The camera froze these people walked through the 2nd floor up to the 3rd floor. They then walked back to the 2nd flr that’s when the camera began to work again. This isn’t the firs time these cameras froze for a long period time while I had people in the house. I contacted Wyze through email advising them of all the problems I was having. Their response was return them to amazon. I told them the return window was closed their response sorry nothing we can do. They said they don’t do returns when their products are purchased through a 3rd party.
title: DO NOT BUY! Theses cameras don’t work.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ManFam
content: First of all, they claim to have telephone support but each time I called the recording said no one is available and hung up on me. I bought the camera AND the SD card. I think the software needs work. It would tell me there was no SD card when there was, One time the image was upside down even though the "invert image 180 degrees" was set to "OFF" and NEVER turned to "ON". I had to turn it on and off a few times to make the picture the right way. At first, I could not get the SD card to stay in. Of course, there were no manuals nor diagrams that I could find to look at so I used online chat. The Wyze guy shocked me by telling me to use a key or a pen to shove the card in but, nevertheless, I did. There was no "click" nor was there a bell sound that the agent said I would hear. Nevertheless, it was in and I was able to record to it. So now I decide to format. Each time I tried, I got "format failed". So I removed the card and put it back in using my pencil like the Wyze agent told me to. This time, whenever I tried to record it said "no SD card". I wanted to remove the card and put it back in but when I tried to remove the card it would not come out! At that point I got totally disgusted. Clearly there is something wrong with this camera and I will return it. My suggestion is that the software still needs to be debugged and manuals ought to be available (at least one that talks about inserting the SD card).
title: My set up experience was full of problems and now I am returning it. Was it defective?

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Roger
content: Yep, absolutely incredible for the investment. Simple setup (ANYONE can do it!) and the cameras are working right out of the box. Picture resolution is astounding and rivals still cameras. I bought the mounts to go with these cameras and I have actually mounted them outside, under the eaves and well-protected from any weather. I covered the openings on the back of the cameras with clear packing tape to keep any small bugs or moisture out, and they work GREAT, since they're well protected. Even if one is damaged somehow, the replacement cost is low. Excellent value! Quality is great and I totally admire the dedication of the new company that's making these cameras. The only thing to deal with is their sensitivity, which simply takes time on your part. They pick up motion very, very well - like shadows from clouds moving, a flapping flag in the distance, etc. You can set the detection area and that helps somewhat. Notification of camera activation on your cell phone works well also, although I turn that off at night, as the cameras record moths, bees, bugs, spiders, whatever, moving around at night! Highly recommended!
title: Absolutely Incredible

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J Tyler
content: Not sure what exactly happened, but I saw the camera had turned facing the wall and I checked the app which said it was offline. The light on the front was solid yellow but otherwise, it was dead. Tried power cycle, factory reset, different power adapter and different cable. Nothing changed. Nonresponsive, just that yellow, non-blinking cyclops staring back at me mockingly.  Browsed the website for troubleshooting steps to no avail. Much of the support information is for the app or other products. It was a decent product while it worked, but I expected more than ten days. I didn't even get a chance to put it in its final location after a getting acquainted period.
title: A white plastic brick after 10 days

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: TinaKay
content: This is the most amazing little camera! I am so happy with this purchase. I was planning to buy the DLink 720p so that I could monitor smoke detector/CO detector/intruder alarms while away from home. I wanted wireless, battery operation. After reading reviews on this site, I was skeptical and began looking for an alternative. I stumbled on the Wyze Pan - an inexpensive, well featured camera, and bought 2. I figured that if it didn’t work I’d return it. Not gonna happen though. Setup was super easy. I placed it in my living room and then figured out the panning and noise monitoring features. I talked to my cat thru it while I was at work and it freaked him out so bad he ran out of the room. I have 3 active cats. So far it hasn’t been bothered. The night vision is fantastic. The smoke detector sensor works as promised. I burnt a pizza and when the alarms went off, the camera immediately sent me a text about it. Negatives: - It’s corded for power but connects to WiFi wirelessly. I’d prefer battery but it’s ok for $35. - The noise alert settings are not customizable. I set a start and end time that works well Monday-Friday, but it notifies me of noise when I’m home during those times on weekends. I’d prefer a weekend setting option. - One is black and white. The 2nd is color. Cannot figure out how to make the B/W do color... I’ve already recommended it to several friends and coworkers. I plan to buy 2 more in the near future for the garage and front porch.
title: Love this little camera!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Steve H.
content: This camera was in my mother's home. She's not there right now but all of her belongings are. In early July, while I was on vacation over 1000 miles from Mom's home, I got a notification from the Wyze cam that it had detected sound and motion. I checked the video from the camera with my phone and saw a burglar in the house. I was able to call the Sheriff in that area and report a burglary in progress. Deputies arrived quickly and using copies of the video that I emailed and texted to the deputies on scene, 2 suspects were caught and identified immediately. All property was recovered. The Wyze Cam Pan did exactly what it was purchased to do and I am extremely happy with the product. I now have one in my home and had to buy another for Mom because the burglars realized what it was and stole it, so now it's locked up as evidence against them. What they didn't realize was that it was too late. The video showing them was sent to the cloud immediately after they were detected in the home. Five stars for Wyze Cam Pan!!!
title: Awesome Security Camera and it's very inexpensive too!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Brenda
content: *2nd Update* Sound doesn't work at all during live view even though it is still recording sound. I noticed occasionally there is an alert that was recording during the time I was live viewing. Those recordings have sound during playback but live viewing has no sound. 2 way audio still doesn't work though. The really terrible software junks this camera. *Update* If you're having issues connecting to your Wifi, open your router settings. Go into where you would edit your password and wifi name. If you see a space AFTER the username or password, DELETE IT. Not ignoring a space after your login info seems to be a flaw unique to the Wyze Cam. Unfortunately, even AFTER connecting, we realized the two way audio is completely unusable. I bought this for my daughter's homebased classroom. She attends Highschool online and we needed a cam so we could communicate if she needed help and I could still do check-ins and see what she's working on while away. If you had high hopes for the 2 way audio, motion tracking or the smoke/co2 alarm detection, look elsewhere. It doesn't function as described. The first thing the app does is run updates after the initial connection. So its unlikely that all the bad reviews are discrepancies in software. Its just poorly made. ===Old Review=== This is the ONLY device I've bought that will not connect to my router. My ring and older FujiKam had no problems.
title: Audio doesnt work. Bad software.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Marcus Aurelius
content: Pros: -Price -Free cloud storage -Product support/Customer Service replies within a business day -Tripod Mount -Picture/Video quality is decent -Phone app is useful and easy to use -Easy setup -2 way audio -Good amount of options to customize -Motion detect is pretty good -Record video and take pics using the app and save directly to phone Cons: -Only records 12 seconds video after detecting motion and/or sound then a 5 min “cool down” period of no motion/sound detection recording. Would be better if it continues to record as long as motion is detected for cloud upload. -Does not reset position if no motion is detected. My cam is mounted behind a window. It regularly tracks motion until it faces “nothing” (wall or blinds) then stays there for hours at a time. I have to manually change the position using the app. Very annoying.
