Wyze need to add an option to reset the position if no motion is detected after a configurable amount of time. -Sound quality is not the best. It sounds muffled. Ugly: -Current issue with microSD formatting. Formatting your card in the camera will corrupt it. Wyze acknoledged this is a known issue.  They recommend to use a PC to format the card to FAT32 but that solution did not work for me. I had to use my Roav Dash cam to format the SD card for the Wyze Pan. -5 minute cool down sucks. Cool down time should be configurable. Lowers the usablity of the camera. You have to rely on falling back on reviewing footage from microSD (If the card is not corrupted). -Camera stops detecting and recording motion. The user will have to reboot the camera to function normally again. -Certain settings are reset to default sometimes. An obvious bug with the firmware/software Wyze has to fix with the other defects.
title: Has potential - Works as deterrent

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Love2bAlive
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. We have 3 outdoor and 4 indoor nest cams.  We also pay for the annual subscription to all.  As you can you can imagine a lot of expense has gone into the security.  Greater than 1k and climbing every year. My daughter in New York who has fios purchased 1.  $36 and that is it.  She has shared the viewing with me.  Works like a charm. I had to set up my own wyze account.  The camera faces her chinchilla which is a nocturnal creature.  The night vision is incredible.  I can zoom in without it disrupting her view mode.  I can pan and tilt remotely.  I like it so much I bought us one.  At $35 compared to what I have put into nest, it could be disposable. My first camera came in.  Our router is dual 5/2.4.  All items are connected to 5 and the router distributes accordingly.  Nest can use 5.  Wyze is 2.4.  We had to connect to 2.4 manually.  Inputting the network name had to be precise  to include case sensitive.  We were accustomed to using our phones to scan Q codes.  A blonde moment  - the cam scans the Q code.  That took us an extra 5 minutes for set up.  All in all it took at the most 10 minutes to set up. Our internet gets 100 down and if we're lucky 5 up.  So far it was  able to handle the load of all nest, 3 echo shows and one wyze.  So I decided to push it to the limit and bought 2 more wyze. After going the first set up, the 2nd took less than 3 minutes.  However it did put a strain on our upload speed.  I decided not to hook up the 3rd until I test all of their functionality. I set up tinycam pro on my firesticks, show and fire 10 tablet.  (Pro was free) I am in awe. the set up was very easy.  Just remember you MUST assign different channels for each camera in the advanced area of the program to get them to work.  Amazon sells a 24 inch insignia fireTV for $99.  I purchased that for viewing in tile mode. You can put in a SD card which loops.  No need to delete old video.  No need for nest subscription.  That is a $450 a year savings.  RV camping  - no need for internet for security.  All can be recorded to the SD card for viewing later, but you do need electricity. Nest offers one feature that really outshines wyze and that is zoned for motion detection.  Wyze is all or nothing,  nest I can create zones for motion and notification.  Nest also has color coding for these zones.  Nest does not have pan/tilt, wyze does.  Nest has outdoor cameras,  wyze does not.  There are 3rd party vendors who have protective covers.  Nest viewing area is almost twice the size of wyze.  Nest cameras $149 - $199,  wyze $25 - $35.  Nest 10 day subscription annual cost $100 for 1st camera $50 for each additional camera,  wyze $0 with a 14 day a few seconds motion detection alerts.  A memory card for continuous recording.  Wyze & Alexa,  Nest & Google. For me, I'm going to keep both nest and wyze.  I'll take down 2 nest and put up 2 wyze.
title: Nest vs Wyze - Amazing what you get at this price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Zachare S.
content: Quick: Following the WyzeCam v2, this movable WyzeCam Pan seems like a giant step backwards. Pros: + Its got a nice 1080p 30fps(ish) camera with a 110 Lens + It moves + The system recognizes the difference between a person and a squirrel, so you're not getting notified when say, a spider crawls across the lens. + This one actually has a mount screwhole, unlike the WyzeCam v2. Cons: - You'll end up throwing away everything else in the box besides the charger (you'll need a longer cord) - You'll also want to buy a 128gb SD Card (per cam) for continuous record. If you don't pony up for an SD Card, you'll miss anything that happens. The 12s record function does not work under any situation. - Sometimes the cameras just don't sync to the servers. They still record continuously, but you'll need to reboot them manually. It doesn't usually happen often, and you usually can access the camera by still tapping on it (for some reason), but the system doesn't notify you of issues, and those 12s clips don't get recorded. - The motor control lags out when you're moving it. - When you have it set for Following motion detection, the camera keeps on moving back and forth very rapidly, because it doesn't give itself a moment to reset motion detection after moving. - The Wyze Sense Bridge can't be plugged into this, even despite it having a slot for the bridge. I saw this camera on sale during the Christmas sales, and went for it. I bought two, one for my garage, one for my main room. Both areas of which can't be covered completely by one single stationary camera. However, I found that the WyzeCam Pan has some serious issues, all of which could be addressed by a future patch. I'm not going to go over the WyzeCam issues in general, I covered that in my other review, but a short summary is: You'll need to buy a cable because the one in the box is super short, the 12s record functionality isn't enough [option A: Buy the $2/mo/cam service, option B: Get a 128gb SD Card to record everything], and the app has some flaws that need to be addressed. As for the Pan, the fact you can turn it is nice, except for the fact that when you just tap the "turn" button for even a split second, it can send it to the absolute opposite side of the spectrum on that axis. It makes calibrating its normal position incredibly difficult. There is a setting for Rotate Speed in the app, but it is does absolutely nothing. If you set to "Follow" the motion, it will shake back and forth, and if the entire room lights up (because a light turned on), it will get confused and almost rotate 180 degrees in random directions, missing everything. The WyzeCam Pan also can't deal with Fans. It gets mezmerized by them and never wants to let go. It has a "Pan Mode", but its a mode where it goes between 2-4 points that you create for 10 seconds at a time. So, rather than allowing you to, I don't know, create a slow scan from one side of the room to the other, it has this rigid, hard-to-configure pan mode which makes you never use the mode ever. What's worse is that it treats the panning as motion itself, so if you have it elected to record on motion plus pan scan, get prepared for constant events. Lastly, there's the Sense bridge. I bought two WyzeCam Pans. Both suck at maintaining connectivity with the Bridge. It has a slot for the bridge, but it definitely does not work with the bridge. If you end up getting the Sense package, make sure you buy a stationary WyzeCam to house the bridge. I think this Camera can be great, it just needs some serious patches in order to fix itself. Perhaps future firmware updates and app updates?
title: It moves...too fast.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tyler
content: Absolute garbage. Video feed constantly an issue record feature randomly drops and  has huge gaps in the recordings (you would think this would be a top priority to make sure it functioned 100%...it is a camera..) Random messages about not having an sd card.....which is wrong of course. Camera motion is choppy when moving via the app. Both cameras (bought 2 because of the reviews) have these issue. Units worked fine for first few months (convenient) now have become completely unreliable. Not built for longevity apparently. Very disappointing pwrformance based in the reviews.
title: Dont buy them of you want dependability

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: johnb
content: Overall I think this is a solid camera, especially given how inexpensive it is and the fact it includes free 14-day cloud storage. Setup was very straightforward. The camera was working within 10 minutes of taking it out of the box. I find the video quality to be very good without any zoom but not go great zooming. But that's probably true of most cameras. Note that I have been using it exclusively to view through a window, so some reduction in picture quality is expected. The camera does an excellent job of detecting motion, and I like the beta version of person detection, which I think works pretty well. The video playback is also very reliable. The one flaw and complaint I have about this camera is that it only comes in white. I point the camera through a window, and the problem with a white camera is that it always shows a reflection in the window. I solved this problem by taking a permanent marker and changing the color to black, which solved the problem.
title: Good inexpensive pan camera with only one flaw

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Justin
content: The camera looks nice. But I need something that works, not something that looks nice. This is by far the worst camera ever. We bought two - one for our sons nursery and another for our other kids room. The quality of the video is horrible, it’s blurry. The camera is constantly dropping off internet connection. I’m having to reconnect both camera’s multiple times through out the day. I know it’s not our internet because my husband works from home and has zero issues with our internet all day long. We have ring camera’s outside of our home and they work just fine. But I can not get these cameras to stay connected. I am constantly being kicked out of the app as well, it will freeze and then shoot me back to my home page. And when the camera does finally work it is so far behind I can walk across my whole house before it even shows I left the room. I do NOT recommend buying this camera. I had many friends recommend it because they’re so cheap. But unfortunately it is a huge waste of time and money. I will be returning both camera’s. Don’t waste your time. Go buy something that actually works.
title: Dont waste your time

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mixed Desmid
content: I have many different camera systems in my home(s) as I travel a lot and have teenage kids.  The Wyze cameras are my favorite, and the software to set up monitoring / controlling them keeps getting better by adding needed functionality (like a global monitoring off / on key).  The only clearly superior software is in my high end wired  POE camera system with a central NVR - but the pictures are not better with these cameras (but the POE cameras are weather proof). Third parties are also coming out with some great (and some not so great) mounts and accessories for the Wyze cameras.  The non-panning Wyze camera can be mounted to it's plug in power supply and effectively be attached to an outlet (you can home brew this or buy a third party mount).  This pan and scan camera is also easily mounted in various ways (but too big to attach to its plug in power supply).  They can be used outside in a protected environment (under an awning) - but they are not water proof, and the third party cases I have found to date are not up to the quality of a real all weather camera. You might be able to save some money by purchasing multiple cameras directly from Wyze, and can also save money by purchasing 3rd party memory cards from Amazon such as the 32GB Samsung (versus the Wyze brand). I am really impressed by Wyze, their commitment to design, simplicity and value.  The cameras are a great value and I recommend them to anyone who asks me about a camera solution in their home, be it for indoor security, baby monitoring, pet monitoring, kid monitoring, and alike.  I have a conditional recommendation for use outdoors - and the few Wyze cameras I have place outdoors are well protected and I still would not be surprised if they fail eventually from exposure to the elements. P.s. - I did get one malfunctioning camera from Wyze - it was clearly banged up in shipping, and they sent a replacement.
title: One of the best deals in home cameras

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: john winchester
content: Initially seemed great then it was flaking out and for some reason while I was at work it fell over. I put back in place worked fine for a few days.  Loved being able to view live at any time. Not sure why but it never sends nor ever did send any notification for anything. I disregarded this assuming it was my settings.  I just recently was given the option to update so I did.  Well thats where it went wrong. Afterwards I had to reconnect my phone to the camera. After that was done I had to rename it again.  When I was configuring my settings I went to prompt it to do continuous recording (my original settings) to my 128 gb memory card,  it said no sd card. I reinstalled several times still nothing. Tried on second camera same thing. Doesn't seem coincidental.  I don't expect much from any cheap electronic device but basic function would be nice. I'm going back in to Canary. Reliable and actually notifies me of any movement or sound.
title: You get what you pay for

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Iman M.
content: I did everything right following  the manual and yes I am aware that this only works on 2.4g Wifi but as soon as I left the house and tried to log in and watch livestream it only showed a few seconds and then dropped the video altogether and I tried with different wifis to make sure it's not just my wifi. long story short, it never worked. I have other security cameras and never had any issues with them, just this one. Also I have already returned the camera and dropped it off at the UPS store and I usually get refunded as soon as I drop off items at UPS being a very long time Amazon customer but this one for some reason is not even refunding my money and on amazon it says the return started which is not the case cause the return is in transit not just started. I hope it's just some kinda mistake on amazon's part cause this is the very first time I"m returning something within the time limit and don't get refunded for it right away or maybe people who sell these cameras are really tight when it comes down to refunding unhappy customer's money.
title: Didn't work... Not even for once

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: MidWest Shopper
content: Overall, this is a good camera for the price.  I own 3 (monitoring basement, garage, and living room) and have ordered 2 more.  Certainly not the same as a Ring (I have the Ring Spot, Floodlight (x 2), Doorbell and yes, a doorbell in the mail box so I can tell when the mail is there), but the Ring doesn't have Pan or Tilt. Pan / Tilt works well, perhaps a little slow to respond ( 1- 2 secs) so it is a little jerky, but remember it isnt' a $200 camera either. Zoom is probably no different than the Ring.  It is a digital zoom, so depending upon how far you are away, the zoom quality is not necessarily clear.  But then, that is no different than the $200 Ring digital zoom. I ordered the 32 GB ScanDisk Micro SD card, so I have done both continuous and event only recording.  Continuing works good and allows you to go back in time to look at the continuous recording.  Albiet, again, not perfect somewhat clunky, but it works.  Event recording works good too and so I have opted to just do event recording rather than continuous. Easy to setup and takes no technical expertise to connect to the network. Downside is that there is no web app and the vendor has said they are not interested in developing one.  So you can only monitor the cameras off your phone or rather off any Android device.  I tried using the app on a Samsung Galaxy Tab S4 but the app is not configured for a tablet but it will work. I  wish like the Ring, it had a light, even a small 500 lumen would be perfect.  Although the image is clear and sharp in the darkness, would be nice just to turn a light on to see additional details.  I've compensated for this by installing WEMO light switches so I can turn on the lights if I need to. Of course the Ring has a siren, the Wyze does not. The speaker that Wzye has is probably not a whole lot better than what you'd find on the Ring but you can talk and listen.  However, if the individual is not within I'd say 8 feet of the Wyze camera, you won't hear them and they won't hear you.  But then, that is no different than what I have experienced with the Ring. In summary, but $37.98 + $9 for the SD card, a lot cheaper than Ring, Nest or others.  I will use Ring for the outside, but for the inside, I'm ok with this camera.  You can't beat the price for the functionality that you get.
title: Review of the Wyze camera (own 5) compared to Ring (own 5)

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Sawdust
content: Yes, this is a inexpensive camera that produces a good quality image.  The app works fine but for the price I didn't expect too much since I've work with commercial grade security devices at my job and know what professional systems cost.  My concern is with the security of the system.  I don't record video to a SD card or to the cloud, I just use it for realtime viewing.  This morning the camera started moving by itself.  My wife and I are the only users with the app and neither or us had the app running.  The camera was following us backing & forth accross the room,  stopped and started again.  I unplugged the camera thinking it may need a reboot and after a short time it started moving again.  I could chalk it off to a hardware issue but after reading the security concerns and see first hand this device follow me across a room I've disconnected the device.
title: Beware

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: j.h.
content: I've had a pretty good experience with Wyze Cam.  I wanted the Wyze Cam Pan specifically to keep an eye on my vehicle & parking spot, through my 3rd FL window & half of a block away, but tech support informs me that the Zoom function is only usable manually: Strike One.  Also, it seems that the Panning function is ALWAYS on;  I might like to use it in the future, but not at present, it's unneeded & unwanted.  Stop moving!...: Strike Two.  & lastly the controls are just wonky & needs a reorganization - one iPod-style rotary dial for panning & tilting, both??  Strike Three.  It's feature-packed, just not with the features I need & simple control modifications that seem like 'no brainers' (& plenty of folks have commented & complained about them before me) - hopefully a firmware & app update can solve most or all.  I'll keep it in the box, on a shelf for the moment.
title: disappointed.  needs improvement.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Nicholas B
content: So I got this totally excited to use. The price seemed to make it one of the best values. But things aren't really as they seem, at least on my end. I noticed there was no information in the box or manual related to the free 14-day recording. So I went on their website where I encountered how to sign up for their PAID services. The ONLY option is to sign up and pay for the $1.99 a month or the annual subscription. The product page says this is a free service with "no subscription plan or monthly fees required." Now, on their website, you definitely have to do EXACTLY that. So that clearly irritated me. I bought this camera exactly because I did NOT want to have to pay a monthly subscription. Thats cool though, I thought. I will just set it up to record locally on my network-attached storage server at home. Yeah... thats not even a potential option. There is no way to record locally on my server. There was absolutely no information available on their website about this, nor is their information on the app. I tried the general/standard ports based on the camera IP. Nothing worked. So basically, I have a live camera. I could do this with my eyeballs. I needed a camera that has a recording function. Otherwise, its literally useless. So I feel like I'm being held hostage to pay for their subscription service or not use the camera. I left the best for last. There is a function on the camera for motion tracking. It is supposed to follow movement, paring with the object being tracked. Afterwards, it is supposed to return to the original position from where it started tracking. Sounds perfect. As expected, it was FULL of false positives, following every single car that drives in front of my drive way -- day or night. Thats fine though. Except... the camera doesn't go back to where you left it. Every time I check the camera, it is pointed in a different direction. Not ok AT ALL! This camera has an extremely wide range of motion, which is why I decided to purchase it. I just checked it 10 minutes before writing this review, and it was pointed up towards the roof of my house - not down the driveway like it is supposed to. An issue related to this but not exactly the same is related to the location of the camera whenever it turns on or restarts. It returns to the same location every time, which is the "start point" if you will. It would be great if that was somewhere helpful. Its not. It is located the opposite side of the camera lens. If you want the camera facing away from the wall, you need to have the USB right behind it. Thats a problem because is it an extremely tight fit with a wall mount. Furthermore, because of the wide range of motion in the pan function, it will pull the usb cable around and over the wall mount. When it needs to return, it can get stick on the usb cable, which will either prevent the camera from moving or unplug the camera every once in a while. A security camera needs to have an incredibly high level of reliability. Unplugging even once or pointing the wrong direction a single time is unacceptable. So if you don't want this to happen, you need to point the camera's default restart position towards the wall so the usb cable never crosses the wall mount and has full range of motion on the front side of the camera when panning. So a power outage, any updates, or anything that would resulting the camera turning off or restarting will result in the camera pointing directly at the wall. Guess what it doesn't do - go back to the location you intentionally angled the camera. And honestly, even if this function was available, my experience suggests it could end up almost anywhere - roof, grass, front door, across the street, wall, or wherever. Just dot even waste your time and energy on dealing with this product. Just keep looking for similar products. Almost any will be better.
title: NO FREE RECORDING. Horrible reliability. Honestly, just a horrible product with false advertising.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Gary T
content: I loved this camera when I first got it - as other positive reviews note, there is a ton of functionality packed in!  I set it up, installed the app, and thought about buying another 5-6 for the rest of the home based on the first day's performance.  Glad I waited until the first time I tried to use it while out of town (the primary reason for having it).  "Please try to power cycle the camera" it tells me - which I can't do when I'm not there.  I tried to self-serve on support, and read that some folks found moving this closer to their router addressed the issue.  Not ideal by any stretch (and certainly limited the applicability for me), but I gave that a shot.  Again, upon initial relocation, worked like a champ!  Next day I checked on the app - same error. This is the major flaw for me, and is insurmountable.  I have other wireless cameras (like Arlo) that have lower resolution and less functionality (and are more expensive), but they work - reliably.  From the best I can tell, this issue crops up if the camera loses internet connectivity - which happens from time to time.  And that makes this nothing more than a novelty camera at this point. Other issues I've had (such as it not accepting an SD card that I've used in other cameras, formatted prior to inserting, etc) are irritants, but non-issues when the camera can't be reliable.  I'm glad it seems to be working for many folks, but I would beware and test scenarios like your internet dropping before leaving town and relying on it to be yours eyes & ears.
title: Unfortunately unreliable

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jadela
content: I love the camera I bought one initial now I have 4.. Pros: Anywhere anytime you can view and you get nothing even if a leaf moves. You can control the sensitivity of your camera. Love that you can talk to someone without opening your door and best of an you see them before they see you. Lol. You can record from your phone or tablet and take photos of what you see. Cons: I wish it did automatic photo capture like every 5 seconds after registering a movement. But you can't beat the features for this price camera.. I love that it goes back to the present location/view after detecting movement.. Ok my biggest Con with this is the ability to have like a split screen view for all cameras at the same time. I want to be able to have all four displayed on my tablet at the same time.. Hopefully that's too be considered in future software development. But get it your love it all. I feel safe in my own home now that I can see everything around at a glance.. Night vision is awesome. Just get it ok👌🏽👌🏽 I'll be setting up one camera in my backyard let's see how that goes for us supposed to be indoors only..
title: View everything around you...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: R. J. Scott
content: Absolutely unbelievable image quality! Super easy to set up. Newly available cloud storage for continuous recording is a stellar value at $1.49 per month (already saved me several hundred dollars after capturing a truck destroying our front gate as he was leaving our home with a dumpster full of renovation waste). Both cams are mounted outside; one under cover and the gate cam in full exposure to the elements. Both are housed in inexpensive covers bought here on Amazon. Two not so great things- the motion detection is based on pixel change and as such will trigger for absolutely any apparent movement from car headlights driving buy to the shadows of trees blowing in the breeze. There are sensitivity settings in the wyze app but they don't seem to work well at all. I will definitely be buying the Wyze motion detectors for each camera soon. The second issue is the software itself. It's functional but not necessarily intuitive and it's a somewhat annoying process to delete groups of captures. On my Note 10+ oftentimes the feed will not display across the entire space in both portrait and full landscape view. Sometimes a force quit will resolve the issue and sometimes it resolves on its own. Are any of the issues mentioned enough to not recommend these cams? Absolutely not! Wyze seems to be a fantastic company that is customer focused and striving to deliver very high quality hardware at incredible prices.
title: Absolutely Great!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Anastasiya shulishova
content: I went with this one because of all the reviews and The fact that it was a little cheaper than competitive cameras on the market .. ended up Having to to return it and purchased the ring indoor camera. this ended up being more expensive in the end , after camera ,SD and wall mount it was 5$ more for a product that works half the time . After install (finally ) I tried to move the camera around and it kept getting stuck and wouldn’t move back . I spend 2 hours talking to support (May was the representative) they were extremely helpful but the message app was not . Every time I had to go change a setting or leave the chat it would close out the chat which was so frustrating because I had to start another chat hoping to get the same rep. We ended up tweaking the setting but it was only temporary and would go back to not moving after a few uses . I would rate this a 2 , because the quality of camera was there but with the glitches and Product taking over an hour to connect to my WiFi its just not worth it . Buy your self a name brand and go along your day , it will end up being less expensive too!
title: Not worth the hassle

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: all320
content: I bought three of these cameras a year ago and they've been plagued with issue after issue since getting them. First it was certain settings randomly resetting themselves. I set the night vision to auto and it would randomly reset to off. I'd only find out after I tried to view recorded footage, only to see nothing but black, because the night vision had turned off again. Then it was the resetting of the position I set them to. I turned off the pan feature, because I could set it to view the area I want recorded without needing it to pan. Randomly the cameras would start spinning around and go back to their default position. I can't tell you how many times they did this in the overnight hours and I went back to view footage, only to find I recorded nothing but a wall, because it had changed position while we slept. I finally contacted Wyze support and was told that they believed the cameras were defective, all of them. They said they'd NEVER heard of their cameras doing any of the things I was describing. To their credit they replaced the cameras. Too bad the new ones did the EXACT same thing. Finally one day I caught one the buggers spinning and it gave me a clue as to the issue. I thought the cameras were dropping their internet connections and that's why they were going back to their default position. Less than 30 seconds of Googling confirmed I was right. Another 30 seconds and I found that this was actually a fairly common occurrence. I don't know if Wyze was being dishonest, or honestly wasn't aware, though I have difficulty believing they didn't know. I should mention that I have two different internet connections coming into my home and I've tried both and the problem exists on both. These are also the ONLY TWO DEVICES out of MANY that have this type of issue. Our phones are on wifi at all times when we're home and have never once dropped their connection. Our laptops, tablets, AppleTVs, smart TVs, game systems and printer have NEVER ONCE dropped their connection to the internet. ONLY THE CAMERAS. I decided living with the issue was easier than trying to contact support again. We'd recently rescued a stray cat, who was FIV+, and I NEEDED to be able to check in on him and our other cat when I wasn't home. We had to make sure there was no fighting that we'd need to address to make sure our other cat wasn't infected. Then about five months ago I started finding my spice jars on the floor in the morning. I was pretty sure I knew who the culprit was, but didn't want to discipline a cat without knowing for sure. No corporal punishment here folks, only withholding treats. I changed the position of the camera and started recording, or so I thought. I woke up one morning to see the nutmeg on the floor and thought, "Ah ha! NOW I have proof." Except I didn't. All I had was a message that said, "No video at the selected time." I looked and looked and there was no video at ANY time. Further investigation showed that the camera was saying there was no SD card installed. Except there was, and it was the same one that had been in there. I checked the other cameras and one other one was like that too. We tried everything and nothing we did fixed the issue. We reformatted the card using both the Wyze app and Sandisk's formatting utility. Nothing. We tried putting the card from the still working camera in one of the non working ones to see if the card went bad somehow. Nothing. We bought NEW SD cards. Still nothing. Finally as a last ditch effort I deleted the whole camera and reinstalled. BINGO! We were up and running, for a week or so, and then ALL the cameras stopped recording. Did the same thing and it fixed it again, until it stopped, again and again and again. Over and over we fixed it only to have the same thing happen. A quick Google search again found that I'm not alone in this issue either. I can't take it anymore! I was a real fan of these cameras and recommended them to a lot of people. Now I wish I hadn't. I don't know what my next camera will be, but it won't ever be another Wyze cam of any kind. These things are buggy beyond belief. There's really no hope for them. Six cameras all with the same issue of randomly disconnecting from the internet is not a coincidence. Three cameras all continually claiming there is no SD in them is not a coincidence. What is it they say about getting what you paid for? Well in this case I didn't get what I paid for, I got A WHOLE LOT LESS.
title: Save your money!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: CanAmSteve
content: I've a few of these cameras and they are IMO the best bang for the buck. They work as a basic IP camera with an OK image quality. The motion detection features are as useless as most IP cameras  - constantly fooled by a twig or dappled sunlight or wind. "Person detection" (offered at extra cost) is maybe 10% accurate, so not worth a penny. The PanCams have a design flaw - when you use the motion detection, they swivel around all the time with false alerts and can literally "walk" off a windowsill if trained outdoors. They don't deal well with falls. So beware - either turn off motion detection (doesn't work very well anyway) or screw the camera down (which is tricky, because it has about 1/8" of thread in the base). As with most of these cameras, if you put them on a windowsill looking out, the IR night vision is useless as it just shows glare off the window. The "Outdoor" models work better just because of the no-glass location, but the IR is good for about five feet. And if you activate motion detection on them the battery life will be measured in days. For the most part, Wyze products work as described but they have essentially zero customer support (you end up in a mindless AI chatbot loop) so you should consider them disposable. Remember you can return stuff that doesn''t work properly directly to Amazon
title: Good camera. Good value. Zero support

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: veggiefleur
content: The audio on this camera is terrible.  The picture quality is fantastic and the app is easy to use and straightforward.  I want to love this camera, but the sound is useless - any words are incomprehensible.  I initially contacted Wyze and they sent me a replacement camera, but the sound was equally bad.  The sound is loud and garbled, like it is coming through a speaker at a stadium, it gets randomly louder and quieter, and occasionally echoes.  I am returning the camera.
title: Audio is very bad

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: kissnrain
content: Loved this camera and have been a loyal fan of all things Wyze until the company proved to be a double crossing greed machine.  Really, we should have all seen it coming since the founders are offspring of corporate digital America.  They changed the functionality of the camera so it TURNS OFF all recordings and TURNS OFF all notifications for 5 full minutes after you receive a notification.  What does that mean?  Effectively, it means that your camera which once gave you around the clock notifications of movement and/or sound now secures your property a maximum of only 9 seconds every 5 minutes or 3% of the time it used to secure it for.  Not only did they take from us 97% of its usage, but it is given on a schedule of 5 minutes after the previous notification so you have zero control of when it is working. I don't care about the cloud storage because I use the sd card, but I do care about notifications which I don't get anymore.  They are no linked to event records so I can get a notification only every 5 minutes.  In other words, it is useless unless you subscribe to their new pay per camera cloud storage which gives you back what you once had for free.  It doesn't give you anytime more.  It doesn't keep the events in the cloud a year or even a month.  They save it 2 weeks, just like they did yesterday for free before they hijacked the system.  My hands aren't tied.  I already ordered a different brand and these cameras are going in the garbage.
title: From hero to big fat ZERO!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Carl Bronx
content: TL;DR; Works "Alright" as a kitty camera while on vacation, but would not trust to have it on while we're home. The Android Software is extremely buggy, very slow and constantly crashes on my low end Motorola e5 Cruise. When it works its great; but its very hit and miss. Lots of crashes before you can get a "usable" instance. Wyze the company has also shown really poor data security/data management. Their unprotected Elasticsearch instance leaked several pieces of customer information (Emails / WiFi SSID's / Alexa Tokens) during December 2019. Why was customer production data ported into a test environment? Their excuse was they were attempting to "improve the product", but why would you need anything other than anonymized customer data? Completely inexcusable in 2019, insecure Elasticsearch instances have been known since at least 2017, this was reckless. My recommendation is if you pick up one of these use as much burner information as possible. We personally only have it plugged in while we are away and NEVER while we're home. This company has shown they cannot be trusted to maintain OpSec.
title: Software Very Buggy / Poor Security of Wyze

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: beezageeza
content: I am going to see if I can buy shares in this company because I believe they are going to grab a significant chunk of the smart home market with this camera and their other products like bulbs and motion sensors.  I don't normally have much brand loyalty but I'm a Wyze convert and will be looking for this brand when buying smart home products.  Here is why: Unfortunately, I have a bit more experience trying (and failing) to install budget security cameras than I would like.  The Wyze pan cam is the 5th camera I have purchased.  There are already plenty of gushing reviews you can read so I won't bother with expressing my absolute delight and surprise to find such a great little camera with a user interface that is actually useful and with the easiest installation I've encountered for a long time.  Install the app on your smart phone and turn it on.  Everything is so easy and the instructions are in english that I can understand. Last week I spent a full day trying to install a more expensive security camera and never did get it to work or be recognized Alexa or anything else.  I bought four of these Wyze ones and had them up and running in an hour, with another hour to fine-tune the many useful settings available.  The pan and tilt feature is great and the camera can be set to follow movement and/or pan across a pre-set range, pausing longer at critical points that  you can set to suit your situation. Video can be uploaded to a free cloud server or recorded on an SD card which is not included but can be bought for $5-10.  I mounted them using the very useful and inexpensive ($20-ish) mounts also on Amazon (search for "2 Pack 16.4FT Power Extension Charging Cable with Wall Mount for Wyze Cam Pan Camera".  They are worth the money just for the long USB cables which you are going to need.  The mounts let you install these pretty much anywhere you damn well please.
title: These are a delight to install!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: AlaskaKayakMama
content: Update as of 12/10/20 I posted this initially on their own site, but they “moderated,” it, which is a euphemism for “deleted,” it, so I’m going to post here where they can’t. These are facts as far as my experience, not a raving opinion. I bought four of these cameras, having two Arlo cameras to begin with. I bought them earlier this summer and up until about two weeks ago everything worked fine, and they all detected a person. I paid for the subscription on one camera; the one in my elderly mothers house, in order to have longer than 12 second recordings. All the sudden, the other 3 cameras stop detecting humans, after they updated their software. After going back-and-forth, back-and-forth, back-and-forth with their “tech“ support they finally just now told me that I don’t pay for a subscription so they’re not gonna detect humans anymore. What the H3L! is the purpose of having a security camera that can’t detect a person? Complete bait and switch. I’ve had the cameras long enough that now I can’t return them so the best I can do is warn other people: yes everything is fine and dandy, they’re easy to use, easy to install but they won’t work worth a d4mn for any applicable security purpose. Footnote: since the time that I posted this on their site and they “moderated,“ it, now NONE of my cameras detect ANYTHING; including the one that I pay for. They detect nothing. Not sound, not motion, not anything. Tell me that there is not some person in their “Tech Support,“ who is messing with the cameras because of my post or because they can’t seem to make them work. Update as of 072020: Got the 4th camera I ordered; amazon apparently has a limit of 3, which is stupid imo, so I ordered the 4th from another seller, “ Petiteadeline.” Avoid this person if you can. I haven’t even gotten to unpacking the camera yet but I almost afraid to. Packed in the cheapest, crappiest flimsy box, crushed all to heck, and taped so little that I presume the roll of tape they have must need to last the rest of their life. And that was after I finally got it. It sat for SIX DAYS before I wondered why it was taking so long to put it in the box, and I emailed them through the amazon app. No reply, but suddenly my camera finally shipped. To be clear, all the ones that came from AMAZON got here promptly and well packaged. I don’t know what was going on with this seller but I won’t order from them again. ********** Preliminary as of set up on 071320 Good stuff: loads quickly, EXTREMELY simple to set up (especially if you have the app installed, account made, and alexa skill enabled before you start), great resolution. Added 4 days after setup: the app features motion tagging, motion follow, pan scan, time lapse (requires SD card for storage) and some other handy features. The motion follow takes more getting used to than I am willing to give it currently. Our security cams have been stationary, so having something that “turns its head” to look at you feels a little too SkyNet. The impossible to believe something so high/simple tech overlooked: clunky. Why in the WORLD would you include an AC/USB adapter that sticks SO FAR out from the wall? Seriously. You couldn’t put it behind a piece of furniture if you had to. #2: WHY would you put the power input on the base, right up against the wall? The base obviously makes sense since the unit pans, but it would have been simple enough to offset the default stop/front position so the input is off to the side so you could get the unit closer to the wall. It does its pan/exorcist dance at power up so it isn’t prudent to put it any closer to an object in its current configuration. I’m pretty mind blown at the power adapter. There is nothing low profile or sleek about it. Yes, one could seek out another that doesn’t fry the unit, but the point and principle is: you should’t have to. Also, a little noisy when it movies. Not “loud,” but definitely noticeable in a quite room with all the clicks and whirring, and the sound is noticeable in the app. Overall, having been through 5 various camera manufacturers in the past few years and the latest and longest surviving being Arlo, I am pretty impressed with the compactness of the units and their simplicity, but with quite the powerhouse of resolution, night vision, and pan range. Very little lag time between event and showing on the app. As opposed to Arlo, who I still love, but with Arlo, you could leave a room, close the door, go to another room, and then watch yourself leave the room and close the door in the app several seconds later. Improvements I’d like to see: real time SMS notifications, and better low light definition. The lamp in one room seems to befuddle the camera in there, to the point that it’s bright enough to see, but the camera is constantly jumping between B/W night vision and a very grainy color/daylight mode. Also noted since set up 4 days ago: Arlo permits live monitoring of all cameras on one screen. I have 4 WYZE cameras and it’s like playing the kettle drums having to switch back and forth among them, waiting for each to load. The app on ipad is moderately annoying, as it does not flip in landscape mode. There IS landscape, but if you need to put down your tablet, the display remains upside down. Also, on the camera selection screen, the app on a tablet is just a larger version of the iPhone app: the list of cameras remains vertical when you turn the tablet sideways for landscape mode.
title: BAIT AND SWITCH. USELESS FOR SECURITY.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ZZ
content: I used one of my blink cameras  to monitor my dog day and light, switched to wyze to separate home security alerts mixed with my dog’s activities. Blink allows to set sensitivity, clip length from 5 to 60 seconds, re-trigger timer from 10 to 60 seconds. Wyze no option always clip length 12 seconds, but re-trigger timer is 5 minutes, which is about 300 seconds, I realized there is a lot less activities recorded for my dog with wyze than blink, then found out that 5 minutes re-trigger timer, I was very disappointed on that,  I won’t buy wyze if I know that. Glad I didn’t use that for home security, that’s going to miss a lot. I guess it is set to limit video cloud storage. There are 2 things wyze is better than blink, wyze price is much cheaper and recorded video with date time stamp. Blink video do not have date time. Phone app:  blink is much easy to use , wyze is much harder to navigate. Night vision: wyze is a lot worse than blink, when light turns off, all dark, barely can see with wyze camera, with blink, I can see much better.
title: Wyze pan has fixed 5 minutes re-trigger timer. Blink XT can set to 10 seconds re-trigger timer

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: TechGeek
content: The camera works ok. I got two of these. Picture quality is good. Easy to setup on iPhone. Unfortunately I only get about 1 of every 10 motion alarms.
title: only get about 1 of every 10 motion alarms

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Pablo
content: I tried to love this thing.  The features are great, pan and tilt (no optical zoom), 2 way audio, motion tracking, all for less than the cost of a good SD card.  Unfortunately it felt like it was put together with string and duck tape.  It did track motion for 1/2 a second until it lost it.  Couldn't track close or far away.  Moving the camera on the app was like trying to get a prize at the drop claw game.  You could really only get it *close* to facing the right way.  It was easier to walk up and turn it with your hand.  You could try and replay video on the app but Holy Moly that was a bad interface.  Finally I removed the SD card and looked at the video on the computer.  I have NEVER seen such a bad video!!  I know it was encoded as 1080 but WOW it looked like your uncle recorded an old 8mm film to VHS and then burned it to a disc in the lowest possible quality.  I knew who was in the video and I barely recognized them.  We tried 3 different wifi Access Points and 4 different SD cards.  I'm not sure who is enjoying this camera but I must have gotten a lemon or most of the reviewers are related to Mr Magoo.
title: Streaming was horrible and video quality on the SDcard was pitiful.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Timo
content: Was looking for a simple & easy-to-use wifi camera, but with this purchase I got the opposite... First of all it was extremely difficult to get it to set up and connect. Every time you turn the camera on, you need to log in. I understand that you need this if you want to record to the cloud, but it has a microSD card slot (which is how I wanted to record) and I cannot find any setting where you can simply use the camera without connecting to their server. What a pain. Then - for the icing on the cake - the video quality is EXTREMELY poor !!! Even when recorded onto the microSD, the image jutters and is very blocky. Super poor quality camera - so I guess we get what we pay for, but this sure was a waste of money for me, and an extremely disappointing experience.
title: Extremely bad in so many ways

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: fireman
content: i have had wyze cam since day one i currently have 10 cameras in operation both old and new versions but i have bought 15 or so since inception so i have only 10 that work the other 5 when they update they just wont work anymore even repairing does not work countless time with tech support but being that there so cheap i keep buying new ones but this last update bricked 3 more and now with this person detection software they are pushing actually slows the camera software loading to a crawl so i keep buying new ones to replace bad software not hardware you guys at wyze have real software problems
title: your software sucks lately

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: tj2k
content: I was glad to see Wyze finally released an RTSP firmware for their cameras, this allows it to work with 3rd party server software like Blue Iris and not be dependant on yet another cloud service. Unfortunately the firmware is poorly supported and refused to install, just failed over and over and over.  A little searching revealed that if the RTSP firmware is installed, you lose all pan/tilt functions anyway, so it was a total bust even if it had worked. I did not evaluate it in its standard cloud camera out of the box firmware, but by all accounts it's excellent if that works for you.
title: RTSP firmware would not install

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S. Schiraga
content: The kids and I are on vacation. They were talking about missing the dog back home. I was so excited to bust out the live Wyze feed, and handed my phone to the kids. Unfortunately, the cam had frozen, so there was no feed. A message displayed that maybe if we cycled the power for the camera, it would be able to connect.  Huh. The viseo quality is good. Just dont expect to connect to the camera if you are out of the house!
title: Crashes muchly

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Hi Tech Dad
content: This is an excellent product at an uncontested price. I have not seen any comparable product that offers this much functionality at anywhere close to the price. Pros: excellent tracking and motion detection, pan, tile, and Zoom, recording to micro SD and to your device, simple set up, clear night vision, ability to use a slider to movie though recorded timeline. Cons: two-way communication? Forget about it! The slightest background noise drowns out the already speaker challenged device. The sound DOES come out clear on the recording when playing back the SD card on another device, but talking through the camera remotely is going to be a challenge. Also the image quality is limited to a few feet. If you have the camera positioned close to what you want to record is excellent. But covering someone at the front door from a far corner of the room will produce an image slightly above a sillouette in terms of clarity of detail. Zoom in and the image blurs. Conclusion: for general use and observations on one's property there is no better device for the price. If you want the ability to have a conversation remotely and capture license plates and birthmarks to turn in to police, look elsewhere.
title: Big Things in A Small Package

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jun Jun
content: Well I got this little PTZ back at the beginning of January since then it has been patrolling the front of my house through the kitchen window. Picture quality is great remember you are only paying 37 dollars for this camera. I have it set up on patrol and it can follow movement inside the determine area creating an alarm for me. The only thing that I don't like is the lack of quality in the two way communication, much lag and noise ( I know that the lag could be because of my network). Also the sound detection is very sensitive so it had to be disable.  The only issue that I have encounter is that lately (as of two weeks) I have been resetting the camera for loss of connection, which again it could be because of my network since I own two more of these camera having the same issue, but for them not to be able to automatically reconnect is kind of a problem, specially if you are not in the house. And no, the turn on and off function on the app does not work for this issue. Also the lack of 5GHz is a problem when you have so many systems in the house using the 2.4GHz (and I'm aware about the difference on range).  Another low is not been able to be set up outside the house, the camera is obviously not made to deal with the weather specially a wet one. For this reason the IR is not a good choice to use behind a windows since it reflex and image quality is bad. Now if you live on a good lit area the need for the IR is minimal, the view at night is still very good. Overall this camera is great, it bring some peace of mind and keeps my lazy ass behind my computer since I can see what is going on outside my house with my phone and not having to go to the door or window.
title: Usefull little PTZ

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Nicole
content: Picture quality is decent, not great. The huge issue i have with this camera is the customer support. The camera has stopped recording "events" (capturing motion) and I have contacted support several times with no response. It's worth mentioning that I pay for a monthly service with the company for a "full motion capture". I went online and countless people have had this same issue. It is unreliable and I wouldn't recommend to anyone. I have already purchased a different camera and using this as a baby monitor. Dont buy this if you care about it recording events/motion.
title: Unreliable recording events

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Gen
content: I bought two of these a few months ago, as well as some motion sensor lights for outside. Both cameras are inside, one faces outside towards the condenser and the other faces either inside my living room or outside facing my truck. I have a fence with a ten foot gate that opens in, and the security light is right between the gate and my truck. I don't really have too many complaints about the camera on the condenser, but the camera on the driveway is just not worth the money. I can't tell you how many times I've pushed open the massive gate, completely expecting to be caught on camera, and yet nothing. Not even at night when the motion sensor blares its bright LEDs. I'd say the camera picks up about 40% of actual large movement (ie, a person, the gate moving, or my truck driving in, not a cat), which is disappointing considering these are supposed to be for security. Also, when they do pick up sound or motion, they record something for 14 seconds and then basically stop monitoring for some amount of time that I haven't figured out yet. So say it catches me opening my gate (I walk it open and latch it)... it records that, but does not record me walking back through the gate to get to my truck, nor my driving through the gate to park, nor my walking back through the gate and shutting it. That's upwards of two minutes that are completely ignored and not recorded. If I'm getting groceries out and take multiple trips, it ignores that as well, and that's at least another five minutes. I get trying to save space on their cloud, but this doesn't really amount to much security. The other issue I have is that they some times just stop. You don't notice it when you pull up the live feed because that's still going, but every once in a while you notice that there is nothing in the events page, when you know there should be something. If you're not home, some times restarting the device in the app makes it start working again. But sometimes it screws everything up and you're left with no cameras. So you have to unplug them when you get home... which could be in a couple of hours... or days. Sometimes restarting your phone helps. But still, sometimes it doesn't. I get that they're $40 cameras, but I spent $120 on a set of 6 from Belkin and never had an issue. The only reason I removed those was because I wanted something a little more attractive and less "security camera" looking while trying to sell my house. The picture quality is good. I would say the sound quality is good but I do have hearing issues and the house is 100 years old with original hardwood floors and minimal furnishings, so I can't distinguish much, but that's probably not the cameras fault.
title: Misses way too much...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JillinWPB
content: I bought several of the cameras when they had the "person" detection.  Now I just use it indoors for watching my pup as he sleeps when I need to run errands and find him myself. The only security and motion I get now on outside cameras is the wind in the bushes and a few ducks and squirrels.  Unfortunately I cannot return this or the three cameras including the longer cords purchased. This is no longer a "security camera" option unless you hear someone outside and know the time to look at the footage that is 24/7.  Price should have dropped as a result of this change along with removing of quite a few reviews.
title: Person detection no longer an option--great for checking in on your pup...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rebecca
content: Prefect for keeping an eye on my baby bird when I'm not home. The motion and sound alerts are great.... Get almost immediate alerts and recording when he starts screaming but not any from the tv I leave on for him.... And the occasional me walking in when I forget to turn them off ...So the adjustable settings are great! I love that I can hear what's going on and even talk back to him if I need too Have had no issues pulling up live feed on the go and the photo recording capabilities when he's doing something cute are great The night vision is perfect at night and because you can switch to it anytime remotely it helps when the lighting in his room isn't great very clear picture on  night vision I got the pan so it could also double as a security can fire the living room or could follow him if he makes it where he's not suppose to and the control/quality are excellent for the price.... To be able to have full control of the camera including powering  it on and off when away is incredible I also have a door contact sensor attached to this cam and that works perfectly as  well giving me notifications everytime door is opened closed or left open Don't have the video when door opens function turned on now but tried it and it does work well We had a power surge recently and the camera after a little time was able to reconnect itself which was also Great
title: PrefectForPetWhenGoneAlertsAndCanTalkBack

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Scott Satellite
content: SET UP This was almost a one-star review. The set-up process is simple but I could not get the cam to connect. I tried for over an hour and followed all the directions to the letter. I set the camera aside to return and decided to try the connection process one last time and BOOM it finally made the connection. Now it works perfectly. So expect some possible frustration up front during the set up process, but it will be worth the effort. USING THE CAMERA All I can say is wow is what an impressive piece of tech this is for $30. A pan and scan remote live stream camera with two-way voice would have been $150 purchase not too long ago. Now with just a few quick clicks I can check in and make sure the dogs are OK when I am at work or on the go. The clarity when it switches to black and white night vision in low light conditions is amazing, it can see better than I can in the dark. The pan and scan works great. One feature the description doesn't make clear is the cam comes with a USB wall-outlet adapter so all you need is any power outlet and you are in business once the set up is completed. Would definitely recommend.
title: Impressive technology for the price... love being able to check on the dogs when I'm on the go!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: A. Aleman
content: I really, really wanted to like this product.  But I can't even open the software unless I surrender all my  privacy to them first.  They require access to all my files, photos, etc before I can finish installing my software. Why? The only reason I can think of is that they want to spam me and all my friends with sales pitches. Or worse, they're just plain spying on me. Sad really. They could have had a sale from me, and most of my friend if it wasn't for that.  Just sad.
title: Why do they need to access all my files, photos, etc? Before I can install software

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: GONZO
content: I have several cameras including NEST and Blink XT2 and Blink Mini.  I bought Wyze out of curiosity.  The camera is feature rich and that is also the problem.  Using all the features creates a busy view of an area, however If you need the room to be scanned and its not high traffic or you need 360 vision, this is a great option at an unbeatable price.  I found having too many of the features on renders the camera almost useless because it becomes confused by all the rules and starts to ignore some of the enable features in order to satisfy another. The on board storage is a great option and cheaper than paying NEST a monthly or yearly fee.  It is a huge plus The app is easy to navigate and does what is needed. Set up was easy and straight forward. I'm not too impressed with the picture quality, the Blink Mini won that in a comparison.  Also the night vision is lacking, it picks up too much reflection from white surfaces especially white surfaces, which cause the picture to wash out.
title: Great features, excellent for the price, still not for everyone

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mongol420
content: I've had these for months now. When I first got them they were great. Since then they kept updating the software and they've just gone downhill. I use to be able to do a two way conversation with them. Now people can't hear anything I'm saying through the speakers, on any of them and I own 4. The person detection doesn't work and it's not even a free option like it used to be when I got the camera.  They ran a beta trial and not once did person detection work. Constantly sending me notifications for blowing leaves. No way I'd pay for an option that doesn't function. These were great a year ago. Now all they are is live cameras I can look through my phone. None of the other options even work.  No 2 way conversations and you cant leave notifications on for movement because if the camera moves then it thinks the room is moving.  Sad the programmers ruined these cameras. I really liked them.
title: The software is terrible

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Dave in Florida
content: I've had one Wyze still cam and one Pan Cam for quite awhile. Both work pretty well. Bought another Pan cam, installed it under the eave in the front of the house, signed up for their monthly paid "complete motion capture" that records to the cloud. Camera would NOT detect motion, nor would it record to the cloud (because, I assume, it wasn't detecting any motion to record). Contacted Wyze support via chat. Spent about two hours following her instructions to manually flash the firmware back to a July 19 version. Wouldn't work, despite trying it three or four times. Meantime, we're emailing back and forth about my progress. She stopped replying to me late in the day, presumably because her shift (in the Phillipines) ended. I had a case number, so contacted Wyze again the next day. Different support agent. Went through the whole story again, tried something else, emailed back and forth with me finally saying "you need to replace this camera, it is of no use to me if it can't detect a thief pulling up in my driveway". Never got a reply. Presumably her shift ended. These cameras are cheap, but, if they don't work, they're a waste of money. Stay away. Oh, of course they're all made in .... yeah, there.
title: Don't buy this camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Reid
content: I thought with all the positive reviews this would be a great nanny camera, unfortunately that's not the case. You get you pay for here. The noise from the camera rotation is loud. So loud that you can hear it across the room, thus drawing attention to the camera. I got it hoping to be fairly out of sight out of mind. So now I don't use that feature because I don't need the nanny looking up at the camera all the time wondering why it's following her around. The microphone sound quality is horrible. I can barely understand a conversation 5 feet from the camera. Lastly and what irritates me the most, I got this because of the addition of the SD card for continuous recording. I've had this camera a month now and twice the camera just happened to disconnect itself from the SD card. When this happens you have you manually eject the card, re insert it and format it. If something were to happen to my child because of the nanny on a day it decides to do this, I wouldn't have the video footage to review! With this happening twice in a month, I get the feeling it's not the last time it'll happen. I regret buying this camera.
title: I regret this purchase! Cheap price and it shows.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Benny Ellis
content: Overall the camera its self is pretty good in terms of video quality. The issue that I really have with it is the motion detection window that you can refine in the app to alert you on your phone when something crosses into that zone. The app only allows you to create a rectangle hot zone area for detecting things. I have the camera installed at my apartment front door which overlooks the community front gate. So it picks up motion for every single car and person that walks into the. community. Now it also catches my front door perfectly. However, the window that I have set near my door picks up every bit of motion by the cars. I wish the window (hot zone) tool was more intuitive so that you could draw with your finger the zones you want to be ignored and the spots you really want to keep an eye on. It watches my door which is great but the constant motion is an issue because I believe the camera to avoid recording too much will detect motion and notify you on your cell. After this motion is detected the camera will go into a cooldown mode and I from what I grasped not record or notify you for 5 min. I could be wrong about the record part but notifications will stop so you don’t get spammed. However, that worries me because if a car drives past and triggers the motion and someone decides to try to rob my place 2 min later will it even catch it due to the cooldown? I’ve activated night vision mode twice to test and its honestly not that great looking in my opinion. Maybe it will preform well in low light environments. Not that the area is overly bright. But I’ll be sticking to standard vision. Getting an SD card is a must if you want to record more than the 20 seconds of video that is offered with the cloud storage Wyze offers. However, I’ve looked all through the app and I don’t see the option to set your camera to record the minute of video it should capture with an SD card. I did find the setting to record only motion rather than record nonstop. But if its not there in the app it should be added. While the Camera pan is nice and you can turn the camera from your phone. I don’t think it has a zoom feature. You can only turn the camera up, down, left or right but no zoom. So if you need to take a photo through the lens you’ll have to zoom in using a 3rd party tool. So in the event you need to take a photo of a license plate that was a distance away you may be out of luck. I also heard from another review that the device may not reboot if you lose internet connection. Currently as of writing this I’m not at home but my camera is down and It hasn’t come back up likely due to internet being out but I won’t know if its back online until I’m home and can reset it myself. Now for the things I do like: I like that you can watch from your camera from your phone via the live stream. It has sounds detection and an intercom feature. Granted I don’t see myself using those features. Quality is pretty good and surprised me although like I said above about the lack of zoom. A small zoom feature would have been nice. Doesn’t need to be Hubble Telescope levels of zoom but a basic zoom in. You can change the detection hot zone sensitivity. However, I wish you could set the setting higher for person detention and lower for motion in my situation. Which the app only lets you set the sensitivity for motion. So I wish you could toggle one detection to be higher than another. For the price point not bad.
title: Nice little cam

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Daniel D. White
content: I so want to give this a 5 star rating but cant even justify the 1 star. The cameras are great small great quality easy to setup and use. now they have an outdoors one and sensors all of which are great. The biggest problem is you cant use any of them. The app that is required to use these cameras and sensors is the biggest steaming pile of S>>> you could ever think of using. First it only plays back a 12 second video even if you have an SD card. OK so they want you to use their pay service. The pay service still does not fix that it will only notify you of events every 5 MIN. If someone walks past your property doing nothing  and 4 MIN later your door is kicked in it wont notify you as its not been 5 MIN.  The APP will lock you phone and just give a black screen. If you try to pan the camera you had better have a half an hour as just the lightest  tap will cause it to do a full 180 so you can record you drapes for a min. I have 2 of these cameras both connected to the same WiFi and they are ALWAYS 3-5 min out of sync of each other. The App when connected to the same network will sync the time for all of 3 seconds and then one will just stop wont record,move, or display anything for 2-4 min then start again at the wrong time with the wrong video. The App will also just hang when doing playback again on the same network. The fact that you can not use ANY other software with these cameras is also a major fail. The best I can say is that if you want to order these cameras is don't use them for anything other then looking at a static image like a painting or poster do not use them for anything important
title: App is total GARBAGE

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Drew
content: One of the few products I've owned that has progressively gotten worse over time.  Initially, I really liked the Wyze cam and ordered a total of three pan cams.  The camera was never anything near perfect, but it was a great alternative for home security.  After the most recent firmware update, the cameras are now terrible.  I get constant alerts of motion despite motion sensitivity being set to the lowest threshold setting...and this is from static items in my room that are being picked up as moving when the camera pans.  Manual control of the camera using the app is really frustrating, the camera "fights" you the entire time.  Let's say you want to pan to the left using the manual control, the camera will keep sensing movement and move to the right.  It's as simple as them programming a disabling timer so that the user isn't overridden while tying to use the camera manually.  I've tried working with the company to give them cues as to what is problematic with their product...they don't care.  The app often times won't connect to cameras and requires numerous attempts despite being connected to 150 mbps Xfinity internet and I have full bars with my iPhone on the verizon network. I switched to Simplysafe and it's a vastly superior product/service.  It costs more, but for something this critical, price shouldn't be the primary concern.
title: Getting worse with firmware updates

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Shay F.
content: So here’s some info below off Wyze support that would have been helpful yesterday prior to ordering. I’ll start by saying we have two $25 Geeni cameras that are 100% reliable although the picture nor sound quality as good as Wyze. The Wyze support is stated as 5-7 day turnaround?! People online saying it’s running closer to two weeks. No bueno. “We have been experiencing an issue with Wyze Cams not displaying or having a display delay on all Alexa devices (Echo, Spot, Fire TV's, etc). We have a temporary fix that will allow users to have a better connection rate. Customers may still experience the longer connection times, but it should succeed after a few seconds.
