We are actively working with AWS on this issue. It has not yet been finalized if the issue is on the Wyze or AWS side. If your Alexa device fails to display your Wyze Cam the first time, please try again and it should succeed within the 2nd or 3rd try. If that is not the case, please contact our support team.” Okay so I’ve tried like dozens of times and it never connects. Alexa says “hmm...camera isn’t responding” but all the other cameras show up even the Wyze cam v2 (not the pan) we got last week which has had connection issue one time. This has been going on since November?! I’m super bummed because overall I love the camera. I’ve attached photo of picture quality in Wyze app and a photo of it not responding on my Echo Show (which I love so much by the way! Except now I’m afraid of zombie deer...tip don’t ask alexa to show you that story) I’m glad I didn’t get the skin yet though because I suspect it’s going back :( Update 3/7/2018 I’m updating my rating to five stars. Wyze did contact me and resolved the issue. As of today I can view my Wyze pan camera on the Echo Show and Fire TV. Love it. Really solid features for this price point.
title: Happy now...Wyze resolved issue -> Known Connection issues with Echo Show :(

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ELH
content: Purchased and installed this cameras based on the ability to trigger alarms by person detection rather than just motion. The person detection works great, I reliably get notifications on my phone when a person is detected with no false alarms. Unfortunately, Wyze has announced they are discontinuing this feature in January. Unfortunately, the motion detection alone would trigger so many alarms as to be useless in my case. I am more than a little aggravated that Wyze advertised a feature (a feature that was critical in my decision to buy this product) and that subsequently this feature is disappearing from the product. When I buy tech products, I spend a great deal of time analyzing the various features of each product in order to make a decision. I have never before had a company decide to simply alter a fundamental feature after the purchase. There are a lot of things that are well done on these cameras - but dropping features after the purchase forces a one star review.
title: Features disappear after you buy

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jim P.
content: I bought two. Wish I'd tried one before purchasing the second one. Pros: It was really quick and easy to set up. Motion Tracking works well. Colors are vibrant when the camera is in color mode, and the night vision capability seems good. Cons: Even though the camera detects motion (which it tracks...so I know it's detecting it) it won't reliably turn on the camera and record it. It will do so if a LARGE area of its monitoring field is in motion (such as my garage door going up), but smaller events (like people walking by the camera) don't reliably turn on the camera, and that's primarily why I bought it, to pick up the movement of people entering my garage. And even when the camera does start recording, it will only do so for 12 seconds. Which isn't long enough to do much good. Additionally, there is no way to adjust the image for contrast or brightness, two very important issue for a security camera that is used in widely varying lighting conditions. So, I intend to start the return process tomorrow.
title: Not very good

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ron
content: Not worth the money, even though it’s inexpensive. Why would a camera that pans face backwards to a wall after resetting position!? Why does it have the cool down period!? Why does it record for only 12 seconds!? Using SD card doesn’t make much difference even with continuous recording setting. Suggestion- allow me to opt out of cloud storage to increase video length and maybe cool down period. Provide software update the lets user define max panning range (not panscan limits). Update 2- two side by side cameras react differently to motion and sound inputs. Miss motion activation altogether at times. (Sometimes I can open front door and go to my room totally unnoticed!)  With app and a strong WiFi connection I cannot turn cameras off. Testing continues... Took stars away Update 1- got the camera working finally . Very cool functions. Almost overcomes setup frustration. May need to buy the replacement... :O Jumped through hoops with username/password connection possible fails only to find Wyze pan cam is defective. New one on way, but it all still sucks... Update to follow , hopefully next one works
title: Not looking good

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: DP Sound
content: Update: Camera broke after 3 months. Absolute worst camera. The wyze v2 I have is still operational and nowhere near as frustrating. This camera is pretty frustrating. Always ends up in some position I didn't set it to, even with all motion settings disabled.  Which is unfortunate as I got it to use some of those. Motion tracking spazzes out so bad that the camera goes crazy and never recovers. Even at low sensitivity. Pan and scan seems to change its mind about where the waypoints are set at random. If you set a motion tagging zone the camera will randomly set itself to some unexplained spot. And to top it off, the speaker for 2 way audio is extremely quiet no matter how loud you scream into your phone. I wish I'd just gotten another regular wyze cam because this thing is ridiculous.
title: Broke in 3 months. Spastic camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Spangle33
content: I had high hopes for this camera. I had done a lot of research.  However I was left so disappointed and frustrated and without Internet for 1.5hrs yesterday after having final connection problems and having to resort to asking for Amazon support.  I contacted WYZE support line twice - first time, I was waiting for 20 mins and no pick up, second time, different day (both weekdays &  within their PT open hrs) the response was "no-one available to take your call" and they hung up!!!  I emailed WYZE twice NO response.  So I contacted Amazon support on chatline -the agent took my cell number incase we got disconnected.  Good plan, or so I thought!  The camera was going through the set up motions successfully but would NOT connect.  (I got all the ready to connect verbals from the camera). Yes, we had done all the plug in and unplug the camera, reboots etc.  Nothing changed, still unable to connect.  I have duel 5g and 2.4 Wifi with Xfinity, I was only logged into 2.4 Wifi as I knew the camera wouldn't work on 5g.  The Amazon agent stated I needed to disable the 5g Wifi and then connect the camera and then Iwhen working I could re-enable the 5g Wifi afterwards.  Sounded like a good, reasonable plan.  He talked me through the process of disabling the 5g.  Entering the Gateway, when I disconnected the 5g, I lost internet AND the Amazon chatline!!  The agent DID NOT call me back!  I had no internet at all.  I did not disconnect the 2.4.  After 1.5hrs of discussions with Xfinity, reboots etc I got the internet back, I still needed reboot on Ipad and another laptop in the house, everything got affected.  It was stressful and I was mega disappointed with Amazon too for not having the sense to call me back, it was obvious what had happened.  Why did he ask for my cell number in case we did get disconnected.  As for WYZE support- well REALLY disappointing, I needed them to guide me through the connection process as having problems.  They would be the experts, right?  So buyers beware there is NO response from WYZE support.  The cameras being returned, just hassle I didn't need and now left with finding another camera.  Thoughts anyone?
title: NO support from WYZE and camera still did not connect after Amazon support.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Someone who cares
content: When it was released this cute little camera and the non moving one were excellent value for money. Flash forward a few years later when I finally get around to writing a review and this is only a good deal if you want to also pay a monthly fee,if you're putting it in an extremely low traffic area, or if you need to stick your camera in a window at night with outside (IR or otherwise) illumination.  I say this as someone who gets free person detection because I've used these for so long. Unfortunately they have introduced a 5-minute "cooling down" timeout on alerts (motion, person, and sound.) It will of course continue to record (ONLY) to your local SD card but no cloud backup.  (If your dog barks at the cat you don't get a motion detected clip at your package (or treat) spy cam for 5minutes in other words.) I very much like the company but the monthly/yearly fee (per camera) definitely reduces the usefulness of this compared to offerings from eufy (love their 2k stationary one with detection on camera) and the like 😿 however once again the big selling point for this camera (without a subscription) if you can tolerate the 5 minute cut off is because the customers asked, the night vision illuminators can be turned off so this is excellent for use as a nighttime camera through a window. But even here there are cheap battery-powered cameras with better optics for mounting outside without having to do hardcore installation...  I will say I quite like the app and the ability to group multiple cameras together to view simultaneously on Android, hence the modern day pair of stars. My original review would have been five stars before they handicapped the device for those of us that buy sd cards and don't want a subscription based device.
title: Was once a high mark for affordable cameras but in the current market not worth considering.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Red
content: Wyze Cam V2: Pros: Good $. Phenomenal Customer Service YouTube set up videos. Cons: Poor Design. Top-Heavy; Topples over when moved. Mediocre Picture Quality Fails to Capture All Motion. Captures and Sends Notifications For Non-Mammals [*Ghosts, Dust Particles, Wierd Lights @ 4 am, etc.]. Camera Slow. [I used to track a mouse and the mouse was always faster than the camera]. 5 Minute Cool Down Period after 12 Second Video. Must be Plugged in at All Times; sometimes unplugging disables Settings. Wyze Cam Pan: Pros: Good $. Clear Picture Quality; Especially Night Vision. Rotation is Good, but Get's Stuck Sometimes; No Matter how often it is Readjusted. Sometimes Fails to Record Motion Events, Despite Receiving Motion Notifications. Sometimes Fails to Record Motion Events and Does Not Send Motion Notifications. Amazing Customer Service, but too much time needed to Troubleshoot. Always needs to be Plugged in.
title: Wyze Will Be Good Once Bugs Are Fixed!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J. C. Davis
content: I bought this and was absolutely thrilled with it for the first 30-days.  The features and functionality were super, and the overall quality of both hardware and image was excellent - and at a price point that was compelling! Unfortunately, it only works for as long as you subscribe; otherwise, it becomes a paperweight.  The moment my trial subscription expired, the camera would no longer connect and was unusable.  This is misleading: the impression given by the "trial" software is that it provides cloud storage and the ability to access recordings and other extended functionality.  Nowhere does it indicate that unless you subscribe, the camera won't work at all. I get having internet access and a web account - and, privacy concerns notwithstanding, I accepted that tradeoff. What I do not accept is the requirement for a never-ending subscription fee for this product to work - and that this fact is not made abundantly clear in the description. It's a nice little camera, but unless you are comfortable having to pay a monthly fee in perpetuity (or as long as the company stays in business), then I recommend you avoid.
title: Only works for as long as you subscribe - not acceptable

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S. Wilson
content: I wanted something cheap and easy to view my kids/dogs when I'm not home. This does the job. It doesn't have some of the fancy features like my more expensive outdoor cameras have (Geolocation activation, multiple schedules...) but it covers what I need. It was super easy to set up and get it running. The app is super easy to use- I've had it for about 4-6 months and have had no "buggy" program issues with it (whereas I've had MANY issues with my expensive Arlo Pro app.) I bought a second one to put in my spare bedroom/cat foster room so I can check in on my foster cat throughout the day. A few cons: Motion detection isn't great on small things, it tends to activate for my cat but not for any of my dogs- even though my dogs are bigger. It sometimes drops in and out of night vision, not a huge issue for me but could be for someone else. It makes a continuous weird clicking noise when it turns on for it's " Event Recording Schedule".  The biggest issue I have with it is the voice feature does not work. When my son is home and not answering his phone  and I can SEE him sitting in front of the TV (:eye roll:), I would like to use the "Voice" feature to speak with him, but it's so glitchy that he can't understand me at all.  Overall pretty minor things; and like I said, I've now purchased a second one.
title: Good for the price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Florida
content: Super disappointed.  Right now I'm waiting for its app to return control of my Samsung S-7 back to me--it has locked that phone TOTALLY.  It did no better on a newer Samsung phone of another family member.  Camera repeatedly displays unable to connect, or similar, despite being next to 2.4 ghz router and logged in as instructed.  And it showed signal strength as good, so that was inconsistent.  Tried it via cellphone network and via the same home network.  Multiple phones.  Its app directed us to force close this and that.  No good results no matter what we tried and I've managed some 15 camera setups through the last 5 years or so, including the Blink, which seems much more reliable, but is more limited in what it boasts. When Wyze Pan Cam  did work it did not track motion well -- kept indicating fixed objects were moving.  The sound was very, very low as some reported.  In both directions.  Not useable for most unless you get very close.  And apparently it will not work with a browser or desktop or Blue Iris or similar third party software unless you change its firmware, at which point it apparently will no longer function as originally intended with its own app, which COULD have been its strong point.  For the low money, I was going to just have it monitor the food / candy pantry from raiding children, or the puppy, but it won't even serve those limited purposes.  Some report it is not really the American success story but is just foreign hardware repackaged.  For the money, it boasts too much and doesn't perform basic function, much less the frills.  Going back.
title: Not ready for market

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Cristian
content: This camera cannot effectively track motion.  It is a very loud camera when it is panning and Dante from customer service basically tells me that this is normal.  It also cannot focus on movement.  It will turn back and forth within in inch frequently like it is trying to focus, but cannot do so.  The camera also shuts down randomly and the only way I know is when I'm going back to try and look at footage.  This means that it was not actually recording footage as it was off the entire time.  I have been working on getting this issue fixed for over a week now and the customer service I am receiving is very lackluster.  I have sent over 4 or 5 videos of my camera not working properly with each response being "it's doing what its supposed to be doing. maybe you should turn off motion detecting".  Why would I buy a motion detecting camera if I didn't, in fact, want it to detect motion?  I'm disappointed in this product. I'm disappointed in Wyze and I will not be switching out all of my cameras to Wyze.  Yi Home Camera offers the same products but without all the noise.
title: Cannot effectively Track Motion

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Elsy D.
content: My father is in a nursing home which allows a camera in a resident's room.  I had previously purchased another brand with which I was familiar, and installed in my father's room.  I connected to a cable company internet modem/router, which 'seemed' to be more reliable than the free WiFi at the nursing home.  That setup required a wired connection to initially set up and then WiFi.  COVID-19 hit, and the nursing home allows no visitors.  Around the same time, the cable company internet connection died, and power cycling did not resolve the issue.  Neither I nor a cable company technician can enter to troubleshoot the problem, and nobody can enter to configure those cameras for the nursing home WiFi.  This Wyze Cam Pan was purchased as a 'pandemic solution', since we were able to configure it wirelessly for the nursing home WiFi without entering the building (we just needed to be outside the building and in range of their WiFi).  We then gave it to a nursing home staff member who placed it my father's room.  It works great, and any motion/sound recordings go to the cloud.  For some reason, it would not initially remember the WiFi settings when unplugged in one location and plugged into another, but that somehow resolved itself. I took off one star in the overall rating for the following reasons: 1) if not placed properly, or not properly secured, panning can result in the camera falling over.  My father is blind and cannot help in this situation, so we have just stopped panning. 2) the previous cameras we used had a web-based interface, whereas this only has a phone app.  I prefer having both viewing solutions. It is very affordable and has allowed the family to monitor my father, and I would purchase again.
title: Helped me out in a pinch

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ruth M Tomandl
content: I live in a condo and can't modify the building exterior, and I didn't want to pay a monthly fee, so a video doorbell or wired outdoor camera isn't a good option for me. I got this camera because it was cheap, and it's doing exactly what I need: I want to see when someone comes to my door, and have recordings to review when they do. I have it pointed out through the window next to my front door. They've added a switch to turn the IR LEDs off, which improves night vision through a window (when I was researching this camera I found pictures where people had put electrical tape over the LEDs, so I was prepared to do that, but now there's a switch to turn the LEDs off so I don't have to! Auto recording and notifications work great so far. The phone app is serviceable; there's no web app or PC app so you have to have a smart phone or tablet to use this camera effectively. I was hoping for a web or PC app so we could check the camera from our computers, but for the price the phone app is perfectly fine. It lets you schedule time-lapses, take manual recordings, set auto-capture for motion or sound detection, and review past notifications. Note that you need a microSD card to be able to do anything other than look through the camera and take manual real-time photos and recordings. All forms of automatic recording (including motion triggered recording) require an SD card.
title: Works great through a window

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jaided Dreamah
content: I’m very impressed by this camera for the price. I bought this to replace an old Dlink camera I had been using for a few years. Setup is pretty easy with no hurdles to jump through. I was impressed the very first night. It’s field of vision was greater than my old camera and the picture was sharp and clear. This camera also has great range and motion. I use this camera to view the outside of my home through glass. At first when night came, lights came on the camera and caused a glare against the window, but there’s a feature to turn the light off and it worked like a charm.  I love the fact that with a micro SD card (sold separately) it will record whatever it sees so you can playback at any time. Motion and sound detection records 12 seconds and gives you a message and you can view these clips in “events”. It’s pretty accurate. I set my camera to only detect a certain portion of the screen because it was detection a tarp flapping in the breeze and the notifications were off the chart. You can do that.. have motion detection only focus on a portion of the screen. This helps,  it I found it to be a bit of a pain. With that feature set, if I moved the camera to see another area, it would reset itself in a few seconds back to the start area you had it set to. I thought my camera was broken until I figured out that it was because of how I set it. It’s really a minor issue. The sound quality or 2 way audio isn’t the best. It’s “ok” and works which is all that really matters, but if you need to have a long conversation you’ll be disappointed. I don’t need or use this feature so it’s not a problem to me. Again though it does work and you can hear and speak. Very minor issue. I love my Wyze camera. It’s jam packed with features and I bought it for under 38.00. I have no real complaints and I’ve since purchased 2 more for other windows.
title: You Can’t Go Wrong For The Price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jen Ng
content: First of all, the motion tracking can't track my cat correctly, and my cat was just walking straight. As advertized, its 360 degrees. The camera turns after a lapse of a few seconds when responding to the control. The noise when turning is loud. The two way speaker is not good sound quality. I tried in the same room and all i could hear was bits and bits of sound. When you record it from the app and speak through it, you can't even hear anything you said being recorded. Night vision is ok, i can see stuff, but sometimes it clicks and turns entirely black, and would be back to normal after a few seconds, but it was annoying and i don't think it should happen. Playback is unloadable. I tried to playback stuff that happened five minutes ago and it would load, but if you tried to playback an hour and plus before current time, it would just go dumb and not load.
title: Not very "high definition" as advertized. motion tracking is weird

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: BlakeH
content: I really like this camera but it seems that its in the early stages of being released. I bought this to primarily monitor our cats at night as I had a feeling that one of them was getting into things they weren't and getting sick because of it. I set it up in a corner that had a good view of the entire downstairs but at night when the camera is on and motion tagging and panning is enabled, the camera gets attracted to the infrared light on the wall and pans close to the wall and this continues until its pointed straight at the wall where it stays all night. I wish I could set a pan zone so that it doesn't pan past a certain point. That being said, when we go on vacation I set it up to keep an eye on both the food and the litter boxes to make sure that the fur babies are being taken care of so that works.
title: Great camera but...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Shelby Highsmith
content: I don't want to subscribe to cloud event storage so I put a microSD card in it for local storage, but the camera keeps losing recognition of the car all the time. First it fills up the memory with continuous recording (event-driven is too unreliable, see below) and stops recording, when it really oughta overwrite old data and start anew automatically. Then it'll say either "SD card not available" or "0 MB/0 MB memory available," and trying to Format Card (again, and again) doesn't work - you have to pull the card out and put it back in to start fresh. Way too high maintenance. The motion detection for event recording is barely useful -- it's either so sensitive that the moving shadow of a tree branch in the wind triggers it constantly, or it doesn't even notice people walking by. You can try setting a tiny detection zone, but that doesn't seem to matter. And the free version of Events only allows 1 event every 12 minutes, so you get a 30 second event of shadows moving and 11:30 of dead time where you won't get any recording. My camera also is stuck in a single home position that I can't reset, so if I try to pan to a different location and leave it there, it automatically recenters after maybe 10 seconds, no matter what I do to the Pan settings. 2 stars because you can at least look out the window in real time. But that's it. Oh, and the smoke alarm notification feature does seem to work, so at least that's a feature.
title: Glitchy, get what you pay for

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jerry
content: The picture quality, app ui, features and nearly everything are great for a camera in this price point. I have a few minor complaints I'll list below. (***This is not the best camera on the market. My review is based on the quality and features of this camera based on its low price.) PROS: + Easy to set up and only take a minute or 2 + Wyze has decent support and is an established brand + Image quality if very good during daylight and pretty good at night. + Motion tracking is pretty good (you may mis motion for this that aren't in the frame very long) + App is nice, easy to use, clean ui and good amount of features + Decent design overall CONS: ** these are things I don't like about the camera and they may not be cons for other pole depending on their expectations. - it's pretty large, it seems they could have made it half the size based on the weight and feel of it. - the tilt angles are subpar, expect blind spots if you're mounting it up high. - They do not include a mount with any of their cameras which I find incredibly annoying. I've reviewed and owned a bunch of cameras and literally every other one has come with a mount. - Do not trust the "format as card" option in the app. I've spent hours recovering unreadable sd cards after trying this feature 3x Tldr; I do recommend this camera and it's great for the price point.
title: Great camera at this price point but not perfect.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Dani Lynn
content: Pan camera randomly turns off and disconnects from WiFi and spins around. It's annoying, but we tolerated it until it totally malfunctioned today. We have several Wyze cameras and only the pan camera is a problem. Today it started making an obnoxious, high pitched squeal (kind of like a car alarm) that wouldn't stop until we unplugged it. Luckily we were home because it terrified our senior dogs. I reset it and the obnoxious sound still went off later in the day. We've only had it a few months, so I'd like it replaced please. Thank you. Updated: 3-11-20: Haven't received a response from customer service and the camera still disconnects within minutes. I attached a video of the horrendous sound it makes.
title: Malfunctioning after a few months

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Collins
content: So I have a couple of the little cubes that I have been impressed with them so I though I would give the pan/tilt a try. The only thing wrong with this cam is that every time it pans it thinks everything is in motion so it records and sends notifications. This is rather irritating and going to pose a problem monitoring the home while away for extended periods of time. I've tried different rooms and settings and still the same results. I gave it at least 2 stars because it has the other good qualities.
title: False motion detection

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J. D. Manley
content: I've had two of these cameras for a few years.  Initially, I was impressed with the low cost and packed features.  Overtime though, I've discovered that they cost more than they're worth.  Here's a quick peek why. The picture quality for a 1080p camera is pretty good.  It doesn't record at 30fps if I recall so you'll end up missing some details so you'll need to consider why you're getting the camera and the use case. The night vision works, but it's not heavily powered.  So you're going to be limited in overall distance.  Indoors the night vision will works well a few meters is all I'd really get though.  So depending on mounting and placement this may be a non-starter for some. Most of the bugs were worked out and restarts of the device now take you back to the last known position of the camera.  Which for the first year or two, that was literally the most frustrating thing in the world.  Placing your camera in the right spot, get everything just the way you want it.  Only to come back the next day and it was facing the wrong direction because of a random restart. Here's the major cause for concern.  If you look at the forums, Wyze cameras seemed to be eating SD Cards.  Don't know about you, but I tend to use good quality SD cards.  Continuous recording, in varying conditions, and for extended periods of time.  You'll want an SD card that can handle that many rewrites (yes - SD cards have a life span measured in total number of complete writes).  The cameras have eaten 2 of these cards already.  Now I don't bother to record anything.  Which defeats their purpose. The motion tracking, and event triggering has been spotty at best, and the application doesn't have any fine grain video controls.  That in my book costs the units almost 2 stars right there.  Having to take the cards out, pull the files, and fast forward gets old really fast. Pros: - Decent picture quality. - Good feature set for little cost - Excellent panning and motor controls for a small unit - Night vision included Cons - Stop eating my SD Cards (they cost as much as you do)! - Video reliability is an issue - Night vision is underpowered - App is terrible If you're looking for a security camera.  This is not it.  You'll want to look at something more refined, and with dedicated storage.  If you're looking for something to monitor indoor activity (3D printing - which is what I use it for, baby room, entry way events, etc.) then it's a great camera and a great value.  But, until they fix the units eating my SD cards and the app.  It won't be doing any video recording...which is kind of the primary purpose right?
title: Not Quite Ready For Primetime

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: MaineFlyersFan
content: Overall I was happy enough with the camera that I went and bought a second one. The good; Very easy to set up and start using Easy to use and navigate app Video quality is good but not great during the daytime. Video quality is a bit on the blurry side with motion. With people standing still it’s better. Night vision video quality is outstanding. Subscription isn’t required but if you chose to sign up, it’s a great value. Wyze has a great selection of products and are always adding more I had an issue with my subscription and Wyze Tech support was a little slow but when I finally got through they were outstanding. The tech even emailed me again later on to check up and make sure everything was working out. I was very impressed. I also felt like I was actually talking to a person that cared and actually wanted to help. The bad I live near a road and the reflection from passing cars (especially large tractor trailers) coming through the window / shadows on the wall will trigger a motion alert. The video quality with any motion in it is a bit blurry.
title: Quality Product

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: handicapped shopper
content: Wow!  I love this.  I bought this, after wanting one for a LONG time.  But most are very expensive, don’t have tge features I want, or have poor reviews.  When I saw the price on this camera, and its fearures, I snapped it up.  It was very easy to set up.  And the images are very clear. The ability to turn and tilt is really nice, but I’m having trouble mastering that part, which is why I took 1 star away.  When I use the app to turn the camera, it doesn’t move.  So, I do it again and the next thing I know, it's turning very fast.  I THINK I’m just too impatient to wait for the signal to get to the camera.  But, I’m new at this, so I think I’ll get it right soon.  And their customer service is terrific.  I've sent several questions, and they respond quickly and patiently. I got this mostly to check in on my dog when I’m not home.  He's not destructive, but he doesn’t like being alone, and I wanted to see what he goes through when I’m gone.  I like being able to talk with him, too.  That's a nice feature! I was so impressed that I bought another one for my home, and two more as Christmas gifts.
title: Very nice camera.  Bought 4

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: F. Lastname
content: This costs twice as much as the regular Wyze cam, so the question is whether there is a signifiant increase in FOV over just using two cameras. A single camera placed in a corner just about covers the entire room, so two cameras used indoors and placed in opposite corners will probably give you more coverage than a single pan cam in that same room. The reason I returned my pan cam is because there was a loud mechanical click when moving the lens up and down, which means it was either cheaply made, broken, or simply didn't have much life expectancy. Lastly, the tracking feature was interesting, but very poorly executed. The camera would jump to any motion without much discernment. Pointing it outside means it would catch any blowing leaf or light change and nervously twitch back and forth all over the scene.
title: Pointless and poorly done

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: oaktree
content: The Wyze Cam Pan won't stream live if the Wyze app cannot contact servers in China.  I run an enterprise-grade firewall at my home, and the Wyze app will not live stream unless my China geoblock is removed.  This is not a temporary communication as Wyze as claimed online.  China servers include 47.112.127.239 and 44.233.123.97.  Security risk.  Not happy I wasted the money.  Buy Ring or Arlo. Update: Wyze posted a response offering to help.  There's nothing they can do to help other than program their security cameras to NOT send data to China.  The offer of help is useless AND disingenuous.
title: Wyze Cam Pan won't live stream if it cannot contact servers in China

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JojoT
content: I can't emphasis how completely disappointed I am with the Wyze Pan cam. To lay a foundation here. I have 5 standard Wyze cams, I have been using them on a daily basis now for about a year. I've had little to no issues, that experience had built a strong faith in Wyze products. This faith is why I bought the Wyze pan cam. I have worked in IT for 20 years now. I'm no stranger to technical difficulties. That said, spending over 2 hours trying to get motion detection to work with the help of Wyze support is unacceptable in my eyes. As a result I returned the camera for a refund. The Wyze support tech I worked with left me hanging with no good solution or response. I'm not sure what happened here. When I looked up the issue I found that many people have had the same issue. I expected a much better experience and was completely let down here. I hope Wyze will read this and figure out what is going on. Shipping out defective devices is not good for business.
title: Wyze, what happened here??

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: pbleier
content: I've got 5 Arlo Pro2 cams. 1 Reolink 1 YesKamo and now this.  This is the worst of the bunch in terms of connections. It's sitting maybe 4 feet from my router - and two wifi repeaters within 50 feet.  I've tried moving it around.  Same problems: "Connecting camera by secure channel"....  Sure it is. Every once in awhile I can get it to connect, but oftentimes it takes 2 or 3 tries. UPDATE:  Wyze just updated the firmware - and the connection time seemed better.  We'll see.
title: Sometimes it Takes Too Long to Connect

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Michael Gonzalez
content: I've had this camera for several days without a memory card. I have it set to record only when motion is detected. It will record a 12 second video and save it to the cloud under "events". But then it shuts down and will not record again until 5 minutes have gone by. So if someone breaks in and is creeping around my living room I only see the first 12 seconds before the camera shuts off. And most likely the thief is gone before the camera starts to record again. They do not mention this in the details. I probably wouldn't have bought it if I had known this. So, now I have to buy a memory card to use with the camera to continuously record when motion is detected. I'll update when I receive my memory card. (Update) Now with the memory card I can set it to record continuously. However I checked it last night and there are pockets of time where nothing is recorded. 3 minutes of nothing. Also while watching the playback on my phone it sometimes shuts down the camera.
title: Free cloud service doesn't do the job.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kelly
content: We've had this camera for about 8 months and have had decent luck with it. It was primarily purchased to watch our living room and front door area since we run an AirBNB. The camera doesn't always detect motion even when it is active. Most days, it doesn't record people leaving our house when the door is in clear view. There have been some cases recently where the camera has panned around to face the wall without explanation and no recordings prior to show if anyone moved it. The camera makes a clicking noise when it turns on. We have heard this click a few times while sitting in the living room while the camera was turned off. It is a decent camera, but we haven't felt safe with it to watch our home while we are away. Sometimes it won't connect to turn on and we are already away from the house. Not fully reliable and there is definitely some room for progress.
title: Not always reliable.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mike Reddy
content: If you want live streaming only, this is a great piece of hardware. If you want to record video to review later (for security or other purposes) pick something else because the software is useless. Been trying to get this to work reliably for 3 days. Doesn't play well with Wifi, disconnects, the app loses the camera and then refuses to upload to cloud without reset. Even if it worked, you can only access the videos through your phone - this is video Wyze, bigger viewing is better. This is nice size, power cable it pretty long actually, its a great live streamer with the motion tracking and pan controls but nothing else really works reliably. You'll need to pay more to do better - this is priced right for stream only, but if thats not what you want look elsewhere. Wyze, if you paid attention to the software I'd buy two more of these instead of returning this.
title: Great live streamer but not for security or recording

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: MISTER&MRSTWOTURBO
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Using this a couple weeks, the video and audio looks great. Love the fact that it follows motion and pan and scan. Only gripe is that it is noisy. Everytime it moves, I can hear it from my bedroom with the bedroom open and it is in the living room. The noise isn't unbearable but when the house is quiet, you can definitely hear it. It almost sounds like a "beep"noise as well when it turns besides the mechanical movement
title: Functions great but a little noisy when turning

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: G. Patten
content: I have four of Wyze cams. Three  Pan Cams. One inside and two outdoors with protective covers. I love them. The only drawback is the night vision. Just not up to other cameras, but for the price you can't really go wrong. I also have a Ring doorbell, two Amazon cloud cams and a Blink. Daytime Video quality is great on all cams. Night vision is great on the cloud cams and the ring, but substandard on the Wyze cams. But again the Cloud Cams are 119.00 and the Wyze Cams are 25-40 dollars. I think the Wyze Cams are great depending on the  application.
title: Wyze Cams are Amazing

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Dan
content: As above. Newest firmware + MicroSD resulted in constant reboots, loud buzzing issues, etc. Spent a number of hours with their helpful tech in an attempt to manually downgrade firmware; without success. SD slot wasn't reading SD card. Received a replacement unit and similar constant reboots (no buzzing now) happened with MicroSD card inserted. Have not tried manually downgrading firmware (again) yet. I believe No MicroSD means no local storage which means can't record footage locally. So as a PSA - buyer beware. Their tech is very helpful, to their credit and replacement unit was sent quickly. That said, shouldn't be this painful to get their camera working. Get their non Pan Cam instead, that works great.
title: Buyer Beware : Newest firmware + MicroSD = Problems

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tpederson11
content: I love the paning aspects if this!!  Makes my life so much easier.  Speaker sucks on this one too (4 stars) but I use WITH my Alexa Devices and the pic quality is AMAZING.  Since it works together so well.... I wanted to keep them even with faulty speaker systems.  Previous cameras of other brands had same issues AND no where NEAR the same quality of picture or Camera Quality. Review on original wyze cameras: (i purchased 1 Panning Camera and 2 of the Stationary Cameras as well). I bought these to replace some other cameras I had that we're not very good quality. The picture quality on these is amazing!!!! The fact that I can have multiple cameras and see different rooms on one screen at the same time, is phenomenal!! This makes having multiple children, and a dog on the second floor of an apartment much more manageable. The other thing that makes these amazing is that they work with my echo devices. I can talk to my kids through my echo in each room, while watching them on the camera if I am outside with the dog.  This puts me at peace of mind immensely.  I can have stationary cameras in rooms or a panning camera in the large open areas. This also makes it so that I do not need to pay astronomical amounts of money for a security system as I have these cameras. I can sign in to check on the baby sitter or even just to make sure the dog isn't barking.  These really do have benefits.  I also love that i can Group them.  I can also turn them on and off. With the touch of a button.  Or by telling Alexa. ****They are only on when needed.  ****
title: Love LOVE LOVE this thing!!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: moocowman
content: Update: New problem.  For the last couple of weeks. The camera will randomly blare a loud buzzing noise out of its speaker, like the horn of an ambulance or firetruck.  It won't stop until you unplug it.  I has been happening with increasing frequency.  I had to give up on this junk. Viewing the useless 12 seconds of motion is the only thing that's reliable.  Connecting to view "livestream" works 80% of the time.  20% of the time, connecting to the cameras fail.  Connecting to view recorded video from the SD card is horribly unreliable. (I have 2 cameras at one location, 3 cameras at another.  I get the same results whether I'm accessing remotely or locally, on the same WiFi as the cameras.) Let's start with the useless 12 seconds of video.  That's 12 seconds EVERY 5 MINUTES.  So, a car approaches.  Recording starts as soon as it sees the headlights beaming on the ground.  By the time the car enters view of camera, 12 seconds is up.  The thief now has 5 minutes to have their way with your property without being recorded.  I've had at least 6 instances of theft and vandalism where I have 0 seconds of footage of the act.  In most cases the person isn't even seen because that precious 12 seconds is squandered away by some stray beam of light or a bug flying past the camera.  Someone once borrowed one of my trucks.  In the video, one second the truck is there.  The next second, poof it vanishes.  It didn't even catch the truck leaving the parking lot. So, I though the solution would be to install SD cards because the cameras will record as much video as you want, up to the capacity of the card (32GB max).  The problem is you can't watch the video because trying to connect to load video from the SD card (they call it "playback") is horribly unreliable.  Even when it's able to quickly connect to view live video, as soon as you click "Playback" to view recorded video, it fails to connect.  If you're lucky enough to get it to connect, it takes forever to load video or doesn't load at all. The software is buggy and poorly designed.  It crashes frequently if you click too many things.  Unfortunately, you tend to click around a lot when you can't tell if the software is working because it's not doing what you've asked it to do.
title: Poor connection, unreliable, glitchy software and now, random loud buzz from the speaker!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Nevada Woodchuck
content: First off I want to make clear that the instructions are horrible, they lack some important information.  Aside from that, the camera is fantastic!  The pan, zoom, and quality of the image are excellent.  I installed the additional micro SD card, plugged the camera in, ran the setup, got it hooked up to my WiFi without any problems.  Downloaded the app for my phone, did what was necessary, and it worked!  Awesome!  What the instructions don't say is that once hooked up to the internet through your router, you have access from anywhere you have a phone signal.  I was at a loss initially because nothing about this was said, but when I read a post about somebody having two cameras set up in another country, It dawned on me... why not try to connect from a mile away.  I opened the app and turned the camera on, and was able to remotely control all the functions and monitor what my 3D printer was doing (I had aimed it at the printer before I left but did not turn it on).  If you are looking for something to remotely monitor whatever it is, this can't be beat, not only for the price, but for the functionality.  I highly recommend this camera.  Almost forgot to mention that the pictures it takes are of a very high quality for something this inexpensive.
title: One awesome little camera.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Nathan Spencer
content: As the headline states: if you want a motion tracking camera, look elsewhere. As far as setup, connection, night vision, and firmware updates, I had zero qualms. But I bought it to track my cat's usage of the litter box to make sure that they weren't relieving themselves elsewhere after I had an issue with one of them deciding the new litter wasn't to her liking. The motion detection seems to work ok, but tracking is nothing like they advertise. Once a target is detected, the adventure begins. When the target moves, the camera follows it by frequently overshooting the target when rotating to keep it in picture. It then overshoots back the opposite direction and eventually completely overshoots the target and you end up staring at a wall. Even if you stand right in front of the camera, it will perform a little mating ritual by dancing back and forth as it hunts for you. Trying to watch the recorded events was a squeamish nightmare. I don't normally get motion sickness, but this was nearly enough to induce such a reaction.
title: If you want a motion tracking camera, look elsewhere

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Lisa
content: I waited 30 minutes just to get the verification code, by the time I got it I had already requested another code.  I switched to another e-mail, 30 minutes later I have yet to receive a code.  How many hours do you have to set up a simple camera?  I finally get the code, and the app won't ever scan the code on the camera for it to recognize it. I try to research it on the internet, and while I'm looking I find out that apparently you can't have a dual band router and set this up.  Seriously? It is going back and someone else can get this worthless camera.  I am disappointed that Amazon continues to let companies give out products for free in exchange for reviews.  It really renders the reviews worthless.
title: Are people getting this product for free?

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S. Erhart
content: I like this camera but there are a few things that I'm on the fence about. It was easy to set up. The picture quality is good. But it's big. It's really tall, and definitely you know it's there. If you want a camera to keep hidden or out of the way, this isn't it. It's easy to tip over, it's loud when it pans around. I had to secure it with double sided tape to keep it upright and in place. You are able to move the camera up and down and side to side within the app which is neat. I did notice it kept moving in circles back and forth constantly though. Without me instructing it to do so. I did finally figure out in settings how to make it not move and stay stationary. I didn't think the use instructions were informative. I had to figure some things out myself. It is an affordable camera though and there are some accessories for it that can be bought separately. Would I but it again, no. I would want a camera that isn't so visible and big, something that isn't as noticeable and loud when it pans around and you move the lens around.It's an ok camera. It does the job, you can see clearly and it has night vision. It does detect motion but if you don't want it constantly moving around on it's own loudly then I would turn that off.
title: Definitely not obscured

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: M. Peterson
content: My problem is that the wifi seems to be weak. The events are short but give a good snapshot to what had happened. If I need to see more than I choose the playback feature. The cameras work well.  I have them looking through the glass windows. The pan feature seems to work well, at times it does not follow the cars smoothly and appears to be confused where the  motion target is. My problem comes mostly from the app. Sometimes it locks up when choosing an event to watch. What I really didn't like is that I got an Echo show  to monitor the cameras, after the security problem WYZE had I cannot get the Echo Show to monitor or recognize the cameras, really frustrating. When it previously did work with Alexa  it would loose the signal and display buffering. Very frustrating.
title: As a camera it works well.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: dB
content: Bought two Pan Cams directly from Wyse. Stable app, good quality build and image. Love the motion area setting, good audio, good motion and sound detect. Panning gives whole room visibility. Night vision works fine to 20 feet. Using it for a dog monitor. Bought three of the Wyse Outdoor cameras. Color image is good. Field of view is a bit too wide, want more face and less yard. Night image loses facial contrast (blooming) if the object is over illuminated by IR from incandescent house lights or object is too close to the camera IR LEDs. The mounting arrangement is insufficient, easy for perp to knock camera off wall with a stick, wind may blow it out of alignment. The motion detect area is not adjustable and this is a Huge problem as we get triggers from areas we do not care about and that fills up our cloud storage with reflected car headlights and  irrelevant activity in the neighbors yards. Battery lasts about two months before re-charge and it is a pain to get on a ladder to get them down for charging, but better than drilling holes all over the house for power cables.  If you put an SD card in the camera, the bad hats or fuzz have instant access to your recordings by stealing the camera.
title: Pan camera is great indoor activity/security choice, Outdoor camera has issues...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: mlm_1905
content: 3 stars for Video quality. To be called a "security camera" and store your videos on their servers (probably not encrypted) without the option to decline cloud storage, is an a contradiction in terms with function. Unfortunately, it seems like most of the cheap "security" cameras work that way. What are they doing with the videos recorded to the cloud? And when delete them, are they really deleted? Overall , I would not buy multiple PAN CAM because if 1 is difficult to operate, what happens the work increase to manage 3, 4, 5, or 10 cameras would be burdensome. I've purchased 3 different brands of camera. Yi, Wyze, and Wansview. Of the three, I'd put Wyze as second for usability and configuration. The pan feature isn't really every a effective because the camera pans too fast. When setting pan speed in the app, I cannot discern the difference between slow and fast. The video quality seems truly 1080p. Very good. Mic quality is very poor. Seems compressed to a very low bit rate and audio constantly cuts out. The timelapse feature seems nice, but try downloading the timelapse video and it can take hours. If the download fails, then the process restarts. Some frequently accessed configurations in the app are buried 3 to 5 levels deep and are difficult to find and to navigate. Deleting videos saved to the SD card is not possible and requires the SD card to be formatted (wiped completely). Deleting video "events" (motion detection), is a 4 step process. If 5 videos exist you want to delete, 5x4=20 clicks. Deleting events is very difficult, time consuming, and not worth the effort of owning the camera.  Seems it's intentionally difficult to delete. How about the option for a 1 or 2 click delete and delete all? There is no way to DELETE ALL EVENTS (10-12 second video recordings stored in Wyze's cloud server whether or not you want them stored in cloud). Even to delete videos for 1 day requires minutes of scrolling to load all videos for that day, then press select, select all, delete, confirm. And if a mistake is made, start over. The camera hardware is nice. But the app make is impractical I soul
title: deleting videos difficult, mic quality poor

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Steven Santos
content: You get what you pay for and this is definitely a device with many problems. First Problem: Motion detection did not work. I received the device about April 28th.  As soon as I got it connected to WiFi, it needed an update that failed.  After the update the motion detection never worked.  I contacted Wyze about 5/6 and I have yet to hear back from their technical support.  I spoke with Amazon.com for some help and they were more than happy to assist but nothing worked.  After scouring the net and forums I found how to get it repaired, WITH NO HELP FROM WYZE, but then the second problem appeared. Second/current Problem: Every 20 minutes exactly the device will reset.  I run a continuous record being saved to an SD card and every 20 minutes. I emailed Wyze on 5/20 and I am still waiting for their response.  Even though they say a 3 business day turn around, it has yet to be answered. I will never purchase any Wyze products and will always advise anyone who asks to steer clear.  Do yourself a favor and spend a couple extra bucks for a Kasa, Ring or another reputable company that will actually have a technical support department that helps.
title: Avoid at all costs

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Sid Ceaser
content: I use this Wyze cam as a security camera for my photography studio.  It has a wide field of vision that covers almost the entirety of my studio.  I have it turned on any time I'm not in the studio and I have alerts set up to ping my phone anytime it detects something. The quality is fantastic and the night vision mode is remarkable.  I have some Christmas lights strung along the top of two walls in my studio, and with those small led christmas lights it makes the night vision look almost like daylight!  It's really good. I recently just subscribed to their monthly service that allows you to record more than the 15 seconds or whatever it is that the free version offers.  For $1.49/mo it keeps recording past the cutoff.  I've walked into my studio numerous times and the video follows me for at least two minutes.  I'll pay $1.49 for that extra recording time.  Though if you don't opt for that, the shorter recording time is still good.  Since I'm using this for my business, I'll pay for the extra time, just in case something happens. I don't use the pan feature on this, so if I had to go back and buy one again, I might just get the little cube, since the wide FOV covers almost the whole studio (It doesn't cover the window area that is directly below the camera - I am on a 3rd floor building, so it's impossible to get in my window) I'd definitely check these Wyze cams out if you haven't yet.  They are great. The only thing I'd like to see that they don't have yet is some kind of auto-detect feature where the camera could shut off if I get within a certain distance of the studio.  That way I could arrive and leave and it would turn on/off automatically.  Currently you have to disable/enable it every time. Great camera.
title: A fantastic home camera with great night vision!  Fantastic price!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Whitney Patterson
content: So I’m an electrician/electrical engineer I install these cameras all the time. I won’t ever recommend one again I pulled into my driveway and the SD card wasn’t recognized when I installed it it was operating properly. After a few days a crime occurs I actually need it and it’s not recognizing the SD card. The company will say is the SD cards fault it’s a Wyze SD card I injected it put in another one it doesn’t recognize it. So I put in a third brand new SD cardThe reason these cameras are so cheap is because they’re that cheap.
title: Malfunctioned when we needed it!!!!!!!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Andrew
content: I bought the Wyze cam to watch my dog when I'm sometimes away, so remote viewing is critical to me. In fact, without it, the camera is completely useless. So, imagine my frustration when that seems to be the one feature that isn't working on my camera. No big deal, sometimes there's software bugs or issues with my network configuration that prevent these kinds of features from working correctly. If this were some PC software or something where I had access to logs, I bet I could have diagnosed and fixed the issue myself-- it's my day job. But, Wyze decides to hide their logs inside of an encrypted zip file, meaning I don't have access to them at all. But support has to, right? Surely, if they have a feature to send the logs to their team, they have to be able to look at them. This isn't the case. Support only uses templated replies and makes no effort to troubleshoot. Instead, all I get is the standard "did you restart the camera? Remove and re-add it from the app". Unless support becomes more useful over night, it kind of looks like I'll need to return this and buy something 3x as expensive.
title: No Remote Viewing, and Support is Useless

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: MJ
content: I love this Camera, love the panning feature, love the picture quality, great value for the price. Why 1 star then? I am getting continuous flickering, Wyze customer service asked me to disable the HD mode and remove the SD card. It actually worked with much less flickering and decent camera. So, why did I choose this Camera if I have to disable HD recording and remove the SD card?????? Great Camera, great customer service, but if you are going to ask me to disable HD recording and remove my SD card then you need to advertise that this camera is NOT HD capable and does not support SD cards even though it has a slot. Not recommended at this time.
title: Great camera, but.....

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: RPM
content: I purchased the Wayze Cam Pan to replace a Belkin camera that is no longer being supported by the manufacturer.  Unboxing and preparing for initial set-up was pretty straightforward, and once I had the app downloaded on my phone, I started the set-up process.  For the most part, it was pretty easy, although it did take about three attempts to get it to fully complete the process (so be patient!).  Once it did, I was able to explore the features of the app and the camera itself with no problems, and found it pretty intuitive in terms of navigation.  The build quality and stability of staying connected to my wifi network and to the app are strong points!  Having owned a different brand previously, and experiencing relatively frequent issues with the connection, this is a big step-up in terms of stability.  This camera is a GREAT value for the price, it performs very consistently, is easy to set-up and use, and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone in the market for a solid home-monitoring solution.
title: Great value and easy to set-up and use!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mikenzie
content: We recently purchased a house and got a ring doorbell as a housewarming gift. We loved the peace of mind it gave us and started looking into getting a camera for inside the house, but quickly gave up the search when we saw that they go for around 200 dollars. I happened to stumble upon this browsing amazon one day. I couldn’t believe how cheap it was and figured it must be a scam or total junk but after seeing the reviews decided to try it. It’s been amazing! I love being able to check on in things while im on break at and Also keep an eye on my pets. One day, I received a notification that motion and noise was sensed and when I check, my dog was up to no good. Thanks to the speaker, I let her know she was busted and she stopped immediately. I’ve never seen a dog look more shocked and confused in my life. The night vision isn’t the beat, but that may be due to all the stupid red and blue lights on electronics letting us know that the 100 appliances required to watch tv now are all off.
title: I thought it was too good to be true, but it’s been amazing!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Amazons Customers
content: AND ANOTHER UPDATE:  After about 6-9 months with these, I can say they're definitely unreliable.  I am constantly going around and resetting some of them when they lose wifi and don't reconnect.  There is no power button.  But unplugging and plugging them in, they come back for a few weeks until they go out again. ANOTHER UPDATE:  I had ordered a couple more of these and every one of them has serious setup/network problems.  "Cannot find specified network."  Have to reboot, reboot, try and try again.  This may be a cheap camera but it should at least work. UPDATE: After a very slight brownout/power drop, all my Wyze cameras lost their internet connection and never reset.  I didn't know this for days.  Because of that, I am reducing it to 1 star and suggest do not buy it if you are using it for security. I tried and tried and tried to get this connected to wifi, fresh out of the box.  Finally, out of frustration, I performed a factory reset even though it was supposedly brand new.  Finally, it connected.  I had a similar experience on the non-panning Wyze camera.  I find the video quality is no better than the pan and scan wifi camera I'm replacing that cost less than twenty bucks, although this Wyze is a smaller package.  RTSP is missing from this device.  Panning is fairly responsive but a bit difficult to be precise.  It worked with TinyCam Pro with some tweaking to "channel" in the app.  Night vision works moderately but isn't as good as my wifi camera which cost half the price.  The motor in this Wyze is really noisy when moving the camera.  I was surprised at how much noise it generates.  You won't be using it incognito as anyone in the room will know if you rotate it remotely.  Sound transmission from the room is not as good as the non-panning Wyze.
title: Problematic - Bad Wifi

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mancuniensis
content: First, the only way to get it to scan the QR code is to screenshot it and enlarge it on a computer monitor. People on the WYZE forums report it taking up to AN HOUR to get their cameras to recognize the QR code on their phone, if at all, and the "blow it up and print it out or use a computer screen" was the most reliable way. This is a ridiculous workaround and does not happen with the SimpliSafe camera setup FYI. So that wasted almost an hour of my time - and then it turns out they don't work on 5G, so I had to set my phone to the 2G network by which time it had timed out again, so I had to start all over. At that point, the simply refuses to recognize the 2G network - even though the camera's blue light is on. Supposedly the camera is connected, but I have no way to access it. I've tried all the suggested solutions of turning it off and turning it on, but it just goes through the same endless loop of error messages in the app. So I'm packing it up if I can even return it in this time of plague, and certainly never going to buy another one. Lack of support is a deal-breaker for me when it comes to tech, and the sheer overwhelming number of other owners on their own forums having similar problems says that these cameras are not bargains at all.
title: Garbage - because they won't connect

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tricia F
content: These cameras are great  So easy to install.  I bought  2.  One for inside and one for out.  Mounted the one outside right under my porch so it catches anyone on the porch and also driving up.  Inside mounted beside my TV. My home is very open it covers  family room kitchen and dining room including front and back door. When you load the app and view the camera you can move the camera around to view a wider range.  I would recommend.  Great picture ,  color is good.  These were better and cheaper than other camera's I have had.  They have been up for about a year and still working perfectly.
title: Easy install

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Wayne DeJulia
content: Rebooted router, called tech support for both Amazon and Wyze, noted lag between wyze app view of camera and the echo show motion. Now it just buffers every 1 minute or so. upload speed is certainly fast enough to support multiple cameras. the app is works fine, the connection to Echo Show is tenuous at best and is very diappointing.  Going to try rebooting echo show. Reduced my review, and sent it back. it finds cars passing my street in the distance, and doesn't see my own car in the driveway when it moves back and forth. endless repositioning and limited ability to set the "eye" down to the lower level to exclude the street makes it worthless. 12 second clip is too small, very disappointed.
title: Camera connected to echo show constantly shows "buffering", cannot be adjusted easily

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JH
content: This camera is a great deal considering that this is a good camera, easy setup and free cloud storage. Bought six of these. After 2 weeks of use here are the cons - the cloud footage is too short to capture meaningfully activity. Biggest flaw however, is the motion detection is disappointly unrealable. Lots of motion captures but misses lots of important captures even when passing directly in front of the camera. Notice this flaw in all the cameras. If this improves I'll adjust my review. I am rooting for this camera to be a five star. Update giving it 5stars. Motion detection vastly proved. Added SD cards and did didn't realize how well they work with the motion capture. To top it off Waze today offered full motion capture and I immediately signed up. They have also gotten rid of that 5 minute delay between capture. Awesome package.
title: Great deal but...update

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: David
content: I know these cameras are cheap, but no where online did it say you have to pay in order to use all of the features! We bought multiple, I'm not paying per camera in order for it to record longer than 12 seconds and to not be forced to wait 5 minutes for it to record again! Yes you can use a memory card, but no where did it state you had to pay for not using a card! Not a happy customer at all, also not alone, have been reading through tons of sites with upset customers. I guess I should have went elsewhere for honest reviews! Also, using a memory card seems to have it's own set of issues, sometimes it records, most of the time it does not!
title: Bait and switch

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Scott Brown
content: I wish I would have never purchased this! I was able to set it up properly the first time, and now it doesn't work at all. I always get an error message when I plug it in and follow the prompts on the app - and tech support's big solution was for me to enter it as a new product (and start all over again). It worked (that one time), but has now failed every single time after that (I've tried at least 25 times now, and get more and more frustrated with this cam. It refuses to connect with my WiFi, and I feel like throwing it through my window!I guess you get what you pay for - and I'm going to try to find something that WORKS like it's supposed to. I'll never buy a Wyze product again, ever.
title: Does NOT work - have been emailing tech support for a week now, with no positive outcome

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: B. Costley
content: Of the three Wizen Cam Pan units I recently purchased, one has the annoying habit of periodically losing track of the installed memory card. It will work for a day or two, then say there is no memory card installed. The other two cameras work with identical memory cards as they should. The memory card in the faulty camera has been swapped out for different cards with the same results. When the problem first happened, I could use the phone app to restart the camera, and the memory card would reappear. Now a restart doesn't have the same result. The memory card is still "missing." As if this isn't aggravating enough, two e-mails to Wizen customer support have yielded nothing other than an automated reply. At this point, I'm wondering if Wizen has any humans for support.
title: 33% Failure Rate

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Marc P.
content: I purchased a “no name” camera in 2013 and paid almost double what the Wyze cam cost.  The picture quality was poor at best, and setup was so difficult I eventually gave up on it - and I’m an IT Professional. I discovered the WyzeCam, and I’m well beyond impressed. As another reviewer commented, it takes longer to open the box and unpack the WyzeCam than it does to set it up. Literally, you can have it working in minutes.  The camera is compact, nice looking, has surprisingly good picture quality, and the two way talk/listen works great. If you’re looking for a camera to monitor your home while you’re away, don’t hesitate.  I feel like I got much more than I paid for. WyzeCam, your iPhone app is quite good. I would like to see you add the ability to view the camera feed from a web site or at least a Windows 10 app. I would also like to see you add the ability to turn all cameras off/on at the same time with a single button. Ideally, you would also have the option to use location services on the iPhone to detect when people are home and turn the cameras off. Would also be nice to have them on for certain times whether I’m home or not, such as at night.  These are just requests, I can say the app (at least for iPhone) works much better than expected and has excellent features; firmware updates occurred without a hitch and the app is very stable. Well done.
title: Great value webcam - Don’t hesitate, just order it!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Sarah
