content: The camera itself is bigger than it seemed. Didn't matter to me but pay attention if it does to you. It's about as tall as my hand. Wouldn't connect to my network the first four times I tried. I tried three times the day I got it, and one a few days later. Then immediately after that fail it magically worked without actually adjusting anything. You can't set a default home position for the camera. Not naturally. When you turn the camera on it either uses whatever it's currently looking at as default or picks a default on its own. You can use controls in the app to pan and zoom to what you want it to record but the camera resets position 15 seconds later. No option to make it stay. A lot of times the camera reset within a few seconds of me using the app controls to just look around. Didn't wait the 15 seconds. Some users reported having success with adding multiple waypoints at the same position but what if you wanted to use those waypoints for what they were meant for? To monitor different spots with the same camera? I set up a "detection zone" inside of the monitored area. Some users said it would make the camera stay on that spot. It didn't for me. If I selected a smaller area within the bigger picture to be monitored, the camera would then reset to its original position, taking the detection area with it. Not sure how to explain that. I guess imagine I selected a rectangle within a larger rectangle. Even after the camera reset itself the rectangle that I selected remained in the same spot. So in my case it meant that the detection zone was a square of floor now instead of the area I wanted monitored. Even still, I got notifications for every motion detected in the whole screen, not just in the detection zone. In fact, I was only ever notified about motion I didn't care about (people walking through the hall) and never about motion I did care about (motion in one area of a room). I had to turn the sensitivity up to max to get what I wanted which just meant I got a lot more if what I didn't also. So very frustrating. "Works with Alexa" needs some clarification. Yes I can ask Alexa to see the camera feed on my echo show but it will only stream for 10 minutes and then stop. Worse, it spends most of that time buffering. Unusable for monitoring purposes which is what I bought it for. Camera pans fast as described. But there are a few issues with camera movement. One is that right now the lens is stuck facing all the way down so I had to tilt the camera up for it to be looking at what I want it to. I can use the app controls to look up but as stated earlier any adjustments I make get reverted a few seconds later. Also, when I tried to use the reset camera position option in the app the default position shifted about an inch each time. So if the original position was center, after a couple resets it was facing at least 45 degrees away from that. "HD" didn't seem very HD to me. In a brightly lit room a face 30 feet from the camera wasn't much more than indistinct shadows on skin. Not much to go on if you needed to identify a suspect. I do feel like I might be missing some important part of how to operate the camera but having read all the included documentation and spent a couple hours scouring their forums and searching the internet I feel like I should have been able to locate better instructions, explanations, or help. It seemed like an item anyone with basic network and device experience could set up. I have more than basic experience, though, and I'm still stuck. All I could find in my searches was that these problems have been commonly reported since at least the fall of last year. Apparently there have been a lot of firmware updates since then. I saw one person on the forums say he updated his firmware a couple days ago and he no longer has issues with the buffering. I've updated the firmware twice in the past two weeks and none of the problems I have are improved at all. There seems to be a ton of potential here for this affordable camera but it just doesn't do what I want it to. It's not even false advertising either because the only thing it said it would do and didn't is monitor within selected detection zones. (You can only have one detection zone as far as I can tell by the way.) The rest of the issues are things you can't really accuse them of. Like yeah I thought I could center the camera without changing it's physical position but that wasn't explicitly guaranteed. Just feels messy. Like I got it through a GoFundMe project. It's not at all what need or expected.
title: Messy

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kimberly
content: It records well and if I have to say 1 thing is the best it's Motion detection when that's on even at 50% it still chimes if the tree is caught moving which is annoying and i do have it on people as well but there is no motion detection on or off for just people . 2. When using out a window the instructions even say turn off night vision , well we live in an apartment complex with outdoor lighting and the picture quality is much better with night vision off and i do run it on full 1080 . I also set the recording to only record captions meaning motion detection or people defections instead of record all the time . I had a 64GB sd card a nice class 10 Samsung evo sitting at home so that worked out it . It can take up to 128GB though . The reason i chose NOT to do record all the time was 2 reasons is in about 4 days or less the card was full and you just need to reformat it if you have nothing important on it . BUT MAINLY was due to when i took out the SD card and put it into my laptop testing as if i was showing the police an indecent well recording all the time is not just like using the phone where you can just roll along the blue bar at the bottom and see images instead it shows up as j pegs all individual  pictures so it took me over 3 hours to find 1 pic of the person i was testing on then i would have to run it like a picture flip book and keep running j peg or pic after pic for the police to see what happened and if it was a 10 minute break in OMG that would take a week to do . S So my rec. when you get it set up are to go down the list but mainly advanced options (recording events only ) camera light status on timestamp watermark show wyze logo and record sound that actually helped as my neighbors have smaller cameras with no sound recording and had a break in and said it was a hate crime and the police said there is no sound to prove well i hooked it up to my laptop and connected my Bluetooth speaker and it they could hear it from the 2nd story on the ground floor . Plus if someone accuses you of something you have it all video and audio. now with all the hate and idiots out there ! All lives matter not just Black ones or Chinese, and what chapped me is when the police did ask me what race the person was i did not give a response . MY ANSWER WHICH I  THINK IS THE BEST ANSWER IS WELL SIR HE HAD A COMPLEXION CLOSER TO OFFICER # 2  .Instead of guessing or saying Black , Mexican and then being seen as a racist which is stupid but that's what today's times have come to . ok the bad Pan Scanning this was happening on its own with it being OFF and when i would leave my home I would come home to a camera facing black out curtains . So i turned it on temp. and set the 4 settings to my front porch a little low to check for packages , a little to the rt and lft. and last right in the middle . then i tested it it worked well but i just need it statutory so i turned it off and since i set those settings it has not moved . Motion tagging i do rec. turning on it puts a green box around heads of people or if they move quickly to show whats in their hands etc. and works well . I also love the fact u can use it as an intercom if you have a small place . The manual record and picture work great and store on you phone's sd card as well as the device so even if you format accidentally on the camera it will still be on you phone and much easier to find. Last even if on live stream where you can just look outside and you turn sound off that does not mean it is not recording that is in a different location . That just turns it on so you can hear everything being recorded also when anyone holds the mic. button down the sound button comes on so you can hear . Like i said earlier it makes a good indoor intercom but outside the sound output is not enough to detour a criminal like shown on Amazon clips . in a completely quiet living room no tv on at about 10 ft away it was difficult to clearly hear what was being said . Well hope this helps and i highly rec. getting this over the base model even though they did come out with a base model in 1080 finally . The cord is longer the camera is much bigger with a better aperture  and overall much better visuals i can see all the way down to our covered parking which is almost 100 yards away
title: Pretty easy setup , Has some quirks , Took us about 1 week to figure it out

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Paul
content: I decided it was time to get some type of security monitoring device.  So I spent an afternoon researching on youtube to find the best camera within a budget of $100.00 delivered.  There are a lot of different devices and systems to sift through but eventually all paths lead to the Wyze Cam Pan at less than half of what I budgeted. I like the app - it does take a little time to get familiar with the settings and controls but the learning curve is short and sweet - one of the neat features is being able to turn the cam on and off from your phone wherever you are.  Within minutes I had set up various alerts and notifications and was getting alerts whenever motion was detected.  I also had my son setup the app on his phone and he too can control the Pan Cam at the same time - for an experiment we turned off the cam before he ran an errand - while out he turned the cam on without us knowing and started speaking to us!  HOW COOL IS THAT?!?!  You can also manage multiple Wyze devices from your phone with just the one app from wherever you are. Pros/Cons -Pros; app works great, 1080P is crystal clear, takes great snaps and video, plenty of alert options, setup is really easy, night vision is awesome, manual control from the app works great.  Cons; the microphone on the cam is a little weak but the speaker works great, there is a short cool down period when motion is detected for the cam to reset, and notifications can have about a 30 second lag but considering the cloud storage is free it's a pretty fair trade-off. I'll be adding at least one more Wyze Cam Pan and two additional Wyze Cams which will cover most of my property in and out including my garage. I highly recommend this cam - built well, setup is a snap, works as it should, very cost efficient.
title: SURPRISE!  You're on Candid Camera!!  Works as it should, very pleased.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: BobbyDigital
content: The night vision blew my mind away but I had problems with the interface where my app sometimes found the camera and other times it did not. The app is way more confusing than it needs to be. Also, the motion 360 movement is actually quite loud.  So loud that you can hear it 12-20 feet away while watching a movie. I'm returning mines just because it's too loud and the app was very annoying. I might just downgrade away from the pan cam.
title: Noise of motor and app sucks.  Night vision is very good.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: TheElderGodFather
content: I'm an avid ip cam user.  I have 8 ring cams and 2 petcubes... Ring is nice, but it can be expensive, Petcube gives very little support - half my devices cannot load the app and it doesn't have web based access... not only that but the cloud sub fee is UNREAL - ring is a little deal when you look at what most pro alarms cost)  Petcube gen 1 had semi-decent plans, but the second gen did away with that and discounting for multiple cameras.  I just can't get over the idea of having to pay individually a high dollar fee and not even getting a month or so of cloud access. I love that Wyze supports local storage, the picture is as good as my petcube, with great night vision... interestingly enough, the room I have it in (our sunroom) has both a pet cube for the dogs and a Ring Stickup cam for security.  On the other two cameras, you can see the IR light from each other.  I don't see any IR light coming out of the Wyze, but the picture is just as good. I was really excited for the pan and scan...  but in practical use, especially compared to Ring's detection options, I find it kind of lacking.  You can set waypoints for the camera to auto check every 10-15 seconds and yes, if it detects motion it will follow things around, however I found it kept detecting motion from non-organic sources - I wanted to catch pets and people, it kept looking up at the ceiling fan...  when it did catch the pets, it would focus on the first one in the room, often following it so closely as to lose site of the other.  also the waypoints get ... well in the way when you're manually operating it - you'll focus on something only to have it suddenly jump to the next point. So I've turned off movement detection and have it fixed at the dog kennel, as I wanted something with a longer cloud ability (without paying money) than the petcube (but keep the pet cube because the motion activated laser toy the dogs and cat love) I'm hoping with future updates it will get smarter about detection etc, for now it's a camera with a freebie multi-day cloud account (Petcam free cloud is like 8 to 12 hours)  - with the added bonus of being able to pan and scan when I remote in.
title: doesn't work as well as I hoped.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rob S.
content: I'm torn writing this review.  For the money, it has some great features you won't find anywhere else even for a lot more.  The motion tracking is the primary feature I'm referring to.  Even my $350 exterior security cameras don't have that capability.  The daytime (non-night vision) picture quality is excellent. Motion tracking works for the most part, although it is pretty easy for the camera to lose the object it's tracking.  The Wyze app isn't bad, but I wish there was better support in other viewing software (Blue Iris, Tinycam, etc).  Yes, it will work in Tinycam, but not all features are supported.  It does not appear to support 2-way audio.  Maybe that will change in an upcoming release of Tinycam, but for now it is not supported. This leads me to my two biggest complaints.  2-way audio does not work for me.  I bought three cameras and all have the same problem....no audio from the camera speaker.  I know the camera audio speakers work because it's loud and clear when the camera tells me it's ready for setup.  I've made sure my devices allow microphone permissions to Wyze app.  I get either no audio at all or audio so quiet I need to literally put the camera up to my ear to hear it.  This happens with my phone (Galaxy s9+) or my tablet.  I've opened a support ticket to Wyze on this issue. The final major issue is the night vision.  It is absolutely worthless.  I am not able to see more than 5 feet away from the camera.  The rest of the room is completely black.  Even my cheap baby monitor type cameras (Foscam) have vastly superior night vision. Given these two major flaws, I'm not really sure what I will do with these cameras since my two main uses rely on either of these features.
title: Very good and Very bad

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: virtualwolf
content: The only reason I bought the camera was so when someone walks in front of it then it starts doing it's 12 seconds of recording. I had it unplugged for a couple months, then when I plugged it back in I noticed it wasn't recording when I walk by. Then I go into the settings and it says - Person Detection is temporarily unavailable on the below device. I had to sign up for a 14 day free trial for "Complete Motion Detection" (What's the difference from "Person Detection", which is free?). Not sure how much motion detection is going to cost me now. "Person Detection" was free so why is this company hosing people after they buy the product. RIDICULOUS!!! If the company was able to produce this product with motion detection for free then it is absolutely rotten and underhanded to then remove this feature.
title: NO PERSON DETECTION!!! WHAT?!?!?

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Distantsoil
content: Almost immediately returned this. The microphone on the product is beyond unusable. When reviewing recordings there's a constant overtone of static and drop outs every few seconds. Research online shows this to be a very regular complaint over the past few years with no resolution in sight. It's apparently a software thing. Night vision is great, field of view is great, as is the motion detection, except... turns out the AI software that detects if it's a human versus your cat...well that contract ended abruptly back in January so now you only get motion detection. Fix the microphone issues and sure, this'll be a worthwhile buy. Otherwise, right now, it's more of a cheap gimmick.
title: Avoid due to poor microphone and missing features

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kip K.
content: This webcam offers an outstanding value proposition.  It’s an extraordinary value for the price.  Every aspect of the product far exceeds my expectations, right down to the packaging and user instructions. This webcam is well constructed with quality materials. It’s solid and substantial. The user interface is intuitive.  Setup is virtually idiot-proof. Sound quality is pretty good, but not great. Video quality is excellent. Motion detection sensitivity is adjustable; it may involve a little trial and error before you find the right threshold for you. The list of features for this webcam is truly impressive for such an affordable price. I purchased an SD card with mine and I recommend you do the same to really get the most out of it. In short, I can’t imagine anyone being disappointed that they bought the Wyze Cam P/T/Z.
title: Outstanding Value

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: RJS
content: Update: Overall I still like all the Wyze camera's. I have two of the regular ones and one of the pan cam's plus I purchased a dozen of the Wyze bulbs. They all work great. The regular Wyze camera's have slightly better picture quality vs the pan cam for some reason. Hard to nitpick too much based on the price. My only major complaint with the Pan Cam is I have it set up in a part of my house and default aim it in a certain direction. If there is a power outage or if the camera does an update/reset when it reboots it always spins around and is aiming at the wall. At first I thought that was just the center point so after a couple of times I moved it in the direction it was aiming... unplugged and plugged it back up and during reboot it spins around and is again aiming at the wall behind it. this happens all the time and I have to go into the app and turn it around. The motion sensing and being able to identify people is great. except while I was out of town I pulled up the cameras and again.. aiming at the wall.. spin it around and we get home a few days later.. aiming at the wall again. I am about to just replace it with a stationary regular Wyze camera because I don't know what else to do. this happens at least once a week or every other week. it gets an update or reboots and spins around backwards.
title: Pretty good for a $30 camera with one minor issue.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: jrdrock
content: Was big fan of this company. May have purchase over 15  the last batch (5) I purchase v2 pans the first two did not function. They turned on and off by themselves. All time of day and night a loud alarm would go off. No notifications or alarm were turned on  I changed password, reset the cameras, reformatted Wyze S,D cards. Turn off the infrared. Reset my router. I spoke email with three separate people over the course of a month. Removed add SD card several more times. Deleted the devices and re install. Reset to factory defaults.  I set up the final 3 out of 5 and same issues, Had my  IT Guy check my router again. Great internet avg 200 down. And 10 up. Came to the conclusion the were defected. They offered to send two new ones but wanted my IP address and MAC address wasn’t giving the that info. Threw all 5 away after dealing with customer service for 4 week by email. No phone. Company and product changed  still have 8 that are a year old set up at the office and been great but things have changed for sure. Spend hours and hours on these cameras.
title: Product and service terrible

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: K. F. Steele
content: I have had a number of wireless security camera systems over the years. Most are just OK and require some serious effort to set up and operate. I wanted some cameras for inside our vacation home and didn't want to upgrade my existing system. Saw the reviews on these and decided to give them a try for the price. Ordered three stationary and one Pan/Zoom. Set up was super easy after getting a good internet connection and the quality of the pictures is more than expected at this price point. Had them up for 2 weeks now and everything is working fine. Night vision is reasonable as long as you're not looking too far away. Motion sensing seems to be OK, with only a few false alarms. Images are generally good, sharp at 1080 and with good color balance with natural light. Pan/Zoom camera works well and can be set up to automatically pan or you can do it manually. They are quick and quiet too. Wyze offers unlimited cloud storage at $1.49/month per camera. Certainly can add up with a lot of cameras, but offers protection should someone break in an steal the cameras along with their SD cards. At least you'll have the motion capture images of the thieves in the cloud. Overall, very pleased with these cameras so far. For the price, it's hard to beat the value. Will be buying more soon. I have had a number of wireless security camera systems over the years. Most are just OK and require some serious effort to set up and operate. I wanted some cameras for inside our vacation home and didn't want to upgrade my existing system. Saw the reviews on these and decided to give them a try for the price. Ordered three stationary and one Pan/Zoom. Set up was super easy after getting a good internet connection and the quality of the pictures is more than expected at this price point. Had them up for 2 weeks now and everything is working fine. Night vision is reasonable as long as you're not looking too far away. Motion sensing seems to be OK, with only a few false alarms. Images are generally good, sharp at 1080 and with good color balance with natural light. Pan/Zoom camera works well and can be set up to automatically pan or you can do it manually. They are quick and quiet too. Wyze offers unlimited cloud storage at $1.49/month per camera. Certainly can add up with a lot of cameras, but offers protection should someone break in an steal the cameras along with their SD cards. At least you'll have the motion capture images of the thieves in the cloud. Overall, very pleased with these cameras so far. For the price, it's hard to beat the value. Will be buying more soon.
title: Great value. Easy, simple security

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: TR
content: Our primary purpose for this purchase was to make sure our elderly mother was safe and sleeping okay.  For that reason, the night vision was one of the most important issues for us.  I read many reviews for countless different products, and this brand was consistently among the best rated.  We decided to take a chance on this.  The price was great.  We have not been disappointed.  It has great clarity with the night vision, allows you to zoom if needed, and the microphone even picks up her snoring. Gives us peace of mind, and certainly makes no noise or causes any disruption to her.  I highly recommend this monitor for young children, elderly family, or even your special animals in your house.
title: Great night vision

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jim Dompier
content: I guess for the money this is a fairly good camera but I’ve had two problems.  (1) The camera has a feature (person detect) which works well. I’ve gotten notice from the company that if I want to continue getting person detect it will cost me $3.99 a month. WHAT?  They are taking away a feature that came with the camera. 2nd problem is I’ve had 3-4 firmware upgrades and until this last one the camera was extremely erratic. Really bad. And of course you can’t get ahold of anyone for support. So, I’ll be researching other inexpensive cameras that has support you can get ahold of and features they won’t be taking away from you. Really pisses me off Jim
title: 2 problems make this camera a no buy from now on.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Liz M
content: I bought this cam so that I could watch my elderly mother, who has had some recent health problems, when I have to go back to work after taking a work leave to care for her. The image is crisp and beautiful, and the camera pans and tilts so that I can follow her movements. I can also set it for motion detection alerts so that, rather than watching all the time - I can just be alerted when she’s on the move in the house. The best part is the 2 way microphone!! So when I see that she’s doing something sketchy, I can just call through the microphone, “Mom, don’t do that! You’re gonna fall!” And she can respond back to me in a 2 way conversation. It’s given me wonderful peace of mind. Best purchase I could have made, and I plan to get more for other areas of the house.
title: OMG - I LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Raj Against The Machine
content: I have no idea why I bought this other than the cnet review. For the price it's pretty good. Now just gotta find a use for it. I basically just have it in my den for now. Not sure if I'll mount it outside or inside, and I may buy another to keep in the crawlspace with night vision. Picture quality is surprisingly good. Once you set up the app it's fairly simple to use. When the camera pans over sense sees the TV screen, it senses the moving picture on the screen and tags it, and sometimes stops for a while and records as an event. Even at the lowest setting it would do this. So I turned off Motion Tracking for now. I could see where this would be both useful and fun, especially if one had pets that are left home during the day. The status light is a bit hard to see, not very prominent. Some may like that, some may not, I haven't decided. In a quiet room you can also hear the motor as it pans. Again not obnoxious, it hasn't disturbed my naps, but some might find that a deal breaker. For $38 I think it's a steal compared to others.
title: So far pretty decent. Motion Tracking is a bit too sensitive.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JB
content: The camera itself is good. It does some good things in regards to security. (I.E. - Motion detection, event recording on motion & sound, alerts & notifications to name a few) Two stars is simply because of the alexa integration. (I BOUGHT FOR THIS REASON ONLY) It only works with the show or spot and it will... It only actually connect about 40%, and when it decides to actually connect, it takes upwards of 10 - 15 seconds and longer. These are security cameras and alot can happen in 15 seconds of time. So if it detects motion, and you say, "Alexa, show me the front door." You don't have 15 seconds or longer. To prove the point further... When the camera detects motion, it only records for 12 seconds. So Wyze expects most of an event to happen in a 12 second time span, but will not connect to alexa in those same 12 seconds to show me the door or driveway. My phone with the wyze app will connect in under five seconds and connects fine through my wifi so it's not a connectivity issue. If you're not wanting to connect to a smart home system, then these are great. If you are, unfortunately, these are not the cameras you want. For a smart home with alexa, etc - I wouldn't recommend. For a non smart home security use - I would recommend.
title: Unreliable with alexa / takes way to long to connect to Alexa.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Sascha G.
content: I love this camera but I am starting to believe that someone is watching me through the camera.  I normally only have it on in the evenings and when I am not at home due to this, but I have noticed that the camera goes to the a different position without me changing it.  I do not know if this something that happen with updates or if someone is moving the camera. The audio is pretty good. If this continues to happen I am going to get rid of the camera get a different one.
title: pretty sure someone is watching

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Paolo
content: The cameras in general are good BUT, if you are hoping to use these when "on the road" and using cellular data then think again! I have 4 of these and previously worked fine up until a few months ago and now they no longer connect on cell data meaning you have to be permanently connected to WiFi in order to view them. Many checks done online and many people having the same issue. Joined the Wyze page forum to discuss with other users and tech guys and still noone cam solve this issue for many frustrated users. In summary, time to buy different brand of cameras and throw the Wyze ones in the trash.
title: Poor Service System

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: regulator
content: I bought this because of the good reviews and price. It serves the need as a basic home camera but unfortunately fails in the integration with a larger smart home ecosystem. I use google home products, and this camera is supposed to integrate via IFTTT. When it decides to work, it's relatively easy to use (although not as intuitive as other products - you'll need a pretty decent understanding of technology to download all the necessary apps and download the functionality). However, most of the time, there are issues with the automated features. Importantly, I don't want/need the camera to be on while I am home. I have it set up so that it automatically turns on when it detects that I leave home, and turns back off when it detects that I return home. The problem is that the automation does not regularly work - in fact, I would say it only sporadically works.  I haven't been able to isolate why this is. My other products (such as Nest thermostat) is able to detect when I am home or away, so I am not sure why the camera can't. I'll keep using the cameras, but it's a pain to remember to manually turn on and off the cameras every time I step out of my home. I hope this is addressed in any future updates. In the meantime, if you are looking for an easy to use, automated camera that plays nicely with Google home, I would try one of the Nest products instead.
title: Lots of issues syncing with Google smart home

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: james wood
content: Incredible for the price! If your not familiar with the app and settings, it can take a little getting used to. But I promise once you get one... u will buy more. Buy SD cards as well so you can save locally and plan on extended power cables or extension cords. Also this will use up WiFi bandwidth but not to the point we have noticed, just be cognizant of that. Overall I am very pleased. I have had this device outside for several weeks with only this silicone (sold separately) wrap on the device. Mine is mounted on a fence post and in direct contact everything: Sun,Rain,Wind,Polin etc. still not one issue. I have wiped the lense with a microfiber one time haha. Be patient with fine tuning the detections settings. Do not add other users until you have the detection notifications dialed in. Or they eventually just disable them. Use the Rules in the app and make timers for different setting to be enabled or disabled. You can set them based on each individual camera>enabled/disabled>AllDay/Set Time>Settings> and beyond. Once again great product so far for the price. Pro tip: go ahead and order appropriate size extension cables and likely some matching electrical tape to seal the connections if outdoor.
title: Outdoor Review/Tips

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Liz
content: My awsome husband bought it as a baby monitor and I had my doubts initially because it's not an ACTUAL baby monitor. That being said, it works better than all of our real baby monitors. In fact we have gotten rid of them and bought multiple Wyze cameras for each room our little ones interact with. I don't like how the cameras motion system makes it randomly move around but you can just take your finger and move the focus back where you want it. It did scare our 3 year old at first because it sounds like a Transformer when it randomly moves but now she's over it and doesn't seem to notice. Great night vision too btw, and I like that I can do 2 way audio plus I can make it so I hear the kids but they don't hear me OR they hear me but I don't have to hear them if they have a loud TV show playing. You can set it to where you hear them and they hear you too. I like that me and my husband can use this on our smart phones individually so if he's napping I don't need his phone just to look at the camera. It really has been a game changer, and I would recommend this to any parent who has to work remote/at home with children.
title: Best Baby Monitor Ever

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kellen
content: It's a nice camera. It's a little misleading. In the video they have the camera plugged in sometimes while it's moving, and other times it's not plugged in but moving on its own. If you check the questions section, IT MUST BE PLUGGED IN AT ALL TIMES TO WORK. No charging available. I would not have bought this if I knew that. How can you mount it on the ceiling with such a short charging cord? Doesn't make sense and it doesn't look good. Also setting it up was painful. Kept saying my wifi password was wrong, it wasn't, and had to enter it 5 different times. And don't get me started on scanning the QR code. Took about 20 minutes for it to register. Most frustrating thing of the day. It's cute and it works to record but if I knew I couldn't use it without it being about to take a charge, I DEFINITELY would not have got it.
title: Read the question section carefully..

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: SKierkegaard
content: I bought this camera to record video of my front yard as we've had a lot of package theft recently. I would suggest you look at other options if this is what you want to do with it. Here are the issues: * Night vision - This works by shining an IR light, this light gets reflected off glass. So if you keep it behind a window, all you'll see at night is the glare of the IR light. This makes it absolutely useless. Inside a room, without glass in the way however, it works. * Software and app - This is the worst part of the product. The app refuses to connect to the camera all the time. Firmware updates never complete correctly. requiring a reboot of the phone/app/camera etc. Livestream is a chore to connect as well many times. It blames my wireless network and I don't buy it, every other device at home works flawlessly. I am attaching a screenshot of the issue at it does not connect to the camera. Motion detection - This will literally ignore people walking up to my front door but pick up a rose fluttering in the wind in my front yard. Messing around with the sensitivity settings did not help. All in all, this is ~40 bucks wasted and I would not recommend it unless you want to use it indoors.
title: Not a great product

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: P. Smith
content: I really wanted to like this camera. The initial setup to connect to my WiFi went well. The video quality was excellent and the ability to pan was awesome. That’s where things started to go not so well. First, i tried to format the Wyze SD card and that consistently failed. Finally, the unit stopped recognizing that it had an SD card altogether. Then I tried to access the camera from my Amazon Show 2nd generation. The setup went fine in the Alexa app, it recognized the camera, but it could never connect to the camera. I followed all the troubleshooting support info to no avail. With all these issues, I had to give up and return the unit. I also saw that folks were having issues with accessing the camera remotely (where you were not on the local WiFi). Apparently, they were having some server infrastructure issues. I’m sure that will be fixed, but i just can’t spend any more time on the device to make all things work when other technologies just work out of the box. This is a young company and eventually I’m sure they will get things to working more reliably. I might try them again in the future to give it more time for things to mature. The camera itself was really nice though.
title: Never could get past full setup

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ridgeland MS
content: I purchased this camera almost a year ago and was quite satisfied with the price and performance.  It can be difficult getting it setup if you don't understand how to ensure your phone and the camera are connected to 24 gigahertz wifi (most things use 5.0 now).  Once working it was fine for almost one year.  I ofter leave the camera plugged in to the power supply but not turned on.  One morning around 5AM I woke to a very loud buzzing sound like an alarm clock.  Upon investigation I learned that the camera was making the sound.  Apparently one of the motors malfunctioned (even though the camera was turned off).  I called technical support and they were not trained on this problem even though I found other reports of this problem on the Wyze website.  Upon request, my call was escalated but the more experienced technician wasn't much help either.  She offered to replace the camera with an "open box" camera as a "courtesy" even though my camera was under warranty.  I gave up and called Amazon and of course their customer service was great.  Sent a replacement within a couple of days at no charge.
title: Great product, great price, customer support may need improvement

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: LensEffects
content: I am a Wyze fan.  I have purchased several products over the years and have been very impressed for the tremendous value they offer.  A couple of thing to keep in mind... 1) Wyze is a young company.  Their operating philosophy is to take off the shelf hardware and use their own proprietary software to achieve better results and features. 2) This Pan Cam (and all their cameras at the time I am writing) are designed & intended for indoor use.  Yes, they can be used outdoors but always keep in mind what the intended use is. I purchased this camera to replace a Yi model that would not connect to my wifi. This camera is indoors, I have two other two other Wyze cams (V2 model) outdoors. The IR lights are great for a room.  They can give you night vision for even a large room.  They will not be suitable for outside.  Outdoors the IR emitters will only illuminate the area in the immediate area.  Indoors , they will provide enough light to view the room. The PanCam has motion tracking... if it sees something moving the camera will stay focused on it and track it. Any motion detected will be recorded to Wyze for 12 seconds.  There is a slot for a SD card if you want to record for longer. Wyze offers Complete Motion Capture.  This is an additional service ($1.49/month) that will record all motion to the cloud service. I have 3 Wyze camera.  I purchased my first more than two years ago.  I am a HUGE fan!
title: I am a HUGE fan!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Maaacey
content: Motion detection and sound detection not working. Motion tracking also not working. All settings have been set to enable them but it's a no go. Push notifications also dont work. Firmware has been updated during the setup process. I really wanted to like this camera. It sounded too good to be true with all these features at the price point for which I bought it. Turns out to be true! Why do we need to deal with tech support on a brand new item. It should just work as advertised.. Update* 05-13-2019 Traded it in for another one. Found that if you upgrade the firmware during setup, when it ask you to.. you are rendering alot of the features useless. Select cancel when it ask you to upgrade! The stock firmware works great. Motion detection / tracking / tagging all work. Cloud recording and local micro sd card recording are working great. Picture quality is good and live playback only has about 2 seconds of latency. Leaving it at three stars until they can fix the issue with the updates.
title: Not performing as advertise!... update!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: M. Y. Lee
content: The product is better than Blink XT2.  It wins XT2 from every place (except it is battery power).  I really want to like it, BUT the big cons are: 1) its video clip time is less than 12 seconds. 2) from detecting the person motion to starting recording has a big gap that catches nothing (I can only see the video without the person's picture). 3) after the motion detecting action completed, the Cam will no long catch video again. 4) Pan action is too slow. Frankly speaking, I am willing to pay 20 to 30% more for this Web Cam, If Wyze can fix those issues and keep the video clip time to 1 minute.  This type of web cam security system may not ready, I am thinking to install CCTV type security cam system.  I wish next version of Wyze Cam to fix those issues.
title: Motion Recording Issues Make the Product Useless

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Deepjet
content: I have Arlos at my primary residence that I picked up here on Amazon and wanted something for my work location apartment, reading the reviews I thought I would try these Wyze Pans. First off they look nice and seem to be made with good materials. Let me start by saying that I have a very strong 2.4/5 in my one BR apartment and a fast fiber optic connection and stream HDTV and game on internet with no issues so network is not the issue. App was loaded on Samsung Note 9 if you are wondering. It took many tries to get Pan to connect and I did the exact same thing every time using the 2.4 network and after the 9th try it finally connected...this took me an hour and there is really only one way to do it.  Once connected it took me another hour to get the push notifications to work. After that was done I installed the 32 Micro SD (Sandisk Extreme Pro) and started to explore the rest of the settings. HD picture / video quality was better than I expected. record and playback worked well. One thing I wanted to do was check the cameras ability to reconnect automatically after a power failure. I could not get this to work....the only thing that would make the camera work again was to delete it from the app and start over. The main reason I got this camera was to monitor my apartment while I am gone so this was am epic failure. I need a system that is reliable and smart enough to "restart" and these failed the test. I did order two cameras...and I had the same issues with both. Went on line and watched all the YouTube videos and went to the Wyze site and after 4 hours of frustration I boxed them back up and will be returning as soon as possible. If you want a toy to play with and something practice your trouble shooting skills with...The Wyze Cam Pan is for you. As for me I'm going to do what my gut originally told me...get something better.
title: YIKES...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ron M.
content: I decided to take a chance on this camera because they were so inexpensive and also because of the thousands of positive reviews... so glad I did! This handy little gizzy does EVERYTHING I wanted and more: - SUPER easy setup. It was probably the easiest Tech Device to get started. - I can clearly see my kids in their rooms (night and day). The video quality even on the lowest resolution is still amazing in my opinion! - The ability to rotate up, down, and all around - I am alerted when either of my kids gets out of bed at night (the main reason I wanted this is because we just got my 3 year old a big boy bed and he gets up constantly in the middle of the night) - Has two way talk - Easily play back recordings or watch recordings from previous hours - Effortlessly save clips and share with friends and family (I purchased this Micro SD card to use with it): https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B073JWXGNT/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o04_s02?ie=UTF8&psc=1 For the price, I cannot believe how amazing this little camera is! It works better than our stupid Ring camera which cost over three times as much! I also love that I can share the cameras with friends and family. I shared it with my mother-in-law so she can see her grandbabies during the Covid-19 quarantine and she loves it! I only have two minor issues with it (which aren't that big a deal to me) is it makes noise when it moves around (my kids sleep with sound machines so you can't even hear it move over the white noise). The second is it would be great if it didn't have to plug into the wall and was battery operated (again, not a huge issue to me). After purchasing my first Wyze Cam I purchased two more immediately!  Now I have three and am very satisfied! Huge thank you to the folks who invented this marvelous little gizmo!
title: PERFECT Indoor Camera!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Brandy
content: I got this camera as i just got a roommate and not only that i wanted to be able to see my puppies when i wasn't there. Let me start out by saying you cannot beat what this camera offers, the rotation so that you can see everything is great! Totally worth it, the detection settings are easy to use and very accurate as well. I feel so much better having this in my house. I love that i can hear everything that's going on, and i like that i am able to talk through it as well. It's nice to talk to the pups while i'm at work. The night vision is good as well, adjusts on it's own, picture is crystal clear. Day time picture is also crystal clear. The only down fall that i see with this is that it's so obvious that it's a camera, however i was able to find a perfect spot for it and it's not as obvious. Cannot beat the price on this and the quality of it is great as well!
title: Best on the market!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jake
content: I'm amazed what you can get for so cheap - the video quality is great and night vision worked well for me. Pan/tilt works, but it's clunky. Motion tracking mostly works, but it's clunky (I'll admit, computer vision is such a small package is awesome). However, those latter 2 features felt so unpolished and while cool to say you have them, I wouldn't consider them ready for actual security monitoring. So the good video quality is the only thing worthwhile, which meant I should have opted for their cheaper non-pan version. A few other things: speaker and mic are not very good which means the 2-way talking isn't actually useful. There are several options for these cheap cameras (they look to be Xiaomi cameras) that probably use a similar/same sensor and on-board processing, some of which are cheaper. So I suppose what makes this one different is the Wyze app (phone apps only) and their "eco-system". This means installing yet another app (FYI, I think you can only view this on your phone and not on a computer) and creating a new account, then streaming your data through their servers. Their servers are also where they provide "free" 14-day cloud storage. App usage is intuitive including camera setup, but personally, I already give enough of my data away to these companies; web activities are one thing, but video streams of my home seems too much. I read a review on this camera about having a stranger randomly speaking through the camera in a different language, so there's seemingly a security risk with these as well. Personally, I will not be using this camera any longer. I had originally thought about using this as a baby monitor, but now see why that's ridiculous - don't use a wifi cam, use a baby monitor. Not only is there a security risk here, but the delay in streaming is sometimes 30 seconds and you'd have to have an app open at all times. Finally, the claim to working with google home - You can get connected to google home, but it's unreliable and frequently disconnects, yet another unpolished, useless feature. If you're just wanting something easy to set up that has good video and some features you can toy with for fun, this is fine. But in general, I wouldn't recommend this camera, especially for any serious security monitoring.
title: An ok camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: R. Dibb
content: I'll start by saying I do like this little camera, but before you purchase, please read on for some info. I have four of these cameras. First, look at the picture. One of the cameras stopped working and I diagnosed why. The power supply (a little cell phone power supply) looks like it shorted out. It burned out the top a bit if you look at the pic. We all have a million of these by now and I just swapped in a new one. Motion Pickup/Recording: Fair job. I've tried various settings. Changing the Detection Zone, changing the sensitivity, turning things on and off, etc. 90% of what it records is moving shadows and things moving outside. Recording: Once it picks up something to record, it will record a 12 second clip. Be aware, that it then seems to pause for 5 minutes before it records another clip. The closest consecutive clips you will get are always paced 5-6 minutes apart. So if you're looking for people moving or alike, you'll miss a lot in that gap. But, I do like this little camera, especially for the price. It moves well, has great video and more. Just be aware of the above info. I'll post more if I think of things.
title: Good for th Price - Read for More Info

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Andy Levesque
content: I had high hopes of replacing my Foscam cameras with a much more accessible and integration-friendly set of Wyze cameras, but I quickly learned that the night vision on these cameras is very poor in comparison. Our living room/kitchen is approximately 35ft x 25ft. Our Foscam R4, in very dark conditions, could see everything without issue. This allowed us to use one camera to monitor the entire area. The Wyze camera hardly illumiates the coffee table 4 feet from the camera. Given the poor conditions, I don't believe having more Wyze cameras would be a solution. I don't understand how these cameras could be useful in dark conditions. Had the camera's night vision been around 15 feet, I would understand, but this is unusable for night time situations. Unfortunately, night time is when cameras are the most needed. Other features on this camera are incredible for the price. The app is intuitive and does a wonderful job of differentiating human movement from any other. We have 2 cats and it has yet to falsely identify after months of use. My favorite feature is the recording to the card and being able to view from the card remotely. All features are accessible and changeable from the app. This is leaps and bounds ahead of Foscam which requires some settings to be changed via a PC. I am bummed that the night vision is so poor. I was very hopeful to replace all of my cameras with Wyze given the incredible features at a great price. It is strange that this camera does so poorly because the fixed Wyze cameras seem to have a further range.
title: Everything is great except the abysmal night vision

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Robbie Delli-Veneri
content: Update: they have since updated software and it seems to be working great I now have purchased two more and could not be happier for the price and the quality you get. If you're looking for a camera to view your house when not home it's ok. But if you're looking to use as security to record your house when not there, don't bother buying this. It will recognize the SD card when you first put it in it will even record but then after a few days will say that there is no card in camera and the only way to reinsert the card is to take it out and put it back in after that everything it recorded before you doing that is now a erased so there's no way to access what it's recorded. I thought maybe it was the SD card I used then I thought well let me let the camera format it properly and its own way but I've been using these for 3 months and every few days it says there is no SD card in camera and I have to restart it reformat the card and start it fresh so yeah it works for 2 days but then all those two days worth of video if you did not look at them within those two days it's gone it's completely erased. So please don't waiste your money. I was gonna buy 4 more but wanted to make sure it wasn't the camera before I did.  Nope it's the camera. Could be the software  or firmware on camera? But so far same problem every three days.
title: Update. They have updated the software and it's working pretty great now!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kelly L.
content: I LOVE this camera!!  I have a 200mbs wifi connection (supposedly, not always) and my current wifi camera system is a little older and tends to draw a great deal from my bandwidth making transmission slower.  I bought several of these cameras to see where I might want to use them in and around my home.  I adore them!  They allow me to set up the area to be scanned (it will go 360 degrees) and doesn't move unless it senses motion or sound.  I immediately get a notification which is great!  I work a distance from my home and I keep my cameras up on my work computer all day.  My first intention was to install this in my dog room so I could watch them throughout the day and communicate with them if they were doing something naughty.  My voice sort of freaks them out as they can't see or smell me so I limit my talking.  The motor on the panning camera is rather noisy and if used solely for security, I think it would need to have the microphone moved so it's not picking up the motor right away and to have the panning capability quieter in the motor. I like these and the stationary cubes  so much I ordered 5 more.
title: Love it!!  My only suggestion is to quiet the panning motor

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rob
content: Things I like: 1. Easy to install and connect to internet. 2. Good picture quality. 3. Lots of settings and features. 4. The manual panning settings work very well. 5. Good build quality 6. Good sensitivity and accurate event alerts. 7. Quick learning curve with app. 8. Stays connected to wifi once the app properly loads. 9. The live stream runs flawlessly once connected. Things I didn't like. 1. There is a 5 minute cool down period after an alert which means the camera will not record or alert again for 5 minute. 2. Having some storage issues with alerts and events. 3. Having some loading issues with the live streaming but once loaded is good. 4. The night vision is not powerful enough past about 20ft + or - 5. Occasionally a light or some other object will erroneously set off an alert when in  the night vision mode. The 5 minute cool down period is a deal breaker and renders this otherwise good camera almost worthless.
title: The 5 minute cool down is a deal breaker

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Dave P
content: I bought this camera to be able to keep an eye on my vacation condo from my main residence. Overall, it’s a good little camera but it does have a couple of issues. Here’s a list of my Pros & Cons. Pros: • Setup was fairly straight forward • Great picture quality (except when there's backlight). Night vision is good too. • The speaker quality is good, but not great. The person needs to be fairly close to the camera for a conversation. • Supports a 32GB MicroSD card for playback (it would be nice if it officially supported larger) • Playback of SD card recordings works well • Reconnects to Wifi after power outage without issues • Motion detection works fine • Notifications to my Android phone work fine • One really nice feature that I like is the Alexa support. If I’m watching TV on my Firestick, and I hear the Wyze notification sound on my cell phone from across the room, I don’t have to get up and it. I’m able to say "show me the condo cam" on the Firestick and the app with the camera image immediately opens up automatically on the 50” TV screen (i.e. I don’t have to manually exit what I’m watching, find the Wyze app, open it up, etc…). • Another bonus is the sound notification (i.e. smoke/CO2 /water sensor alarm). If an alarm ever sounds, the camera issues a notification to the phone. In the cons below, you’ll see that I rate the microphone as being terrible, but it was good enough to alert me to the (loud) noise coming from outside when workers were redoing the balcony cement with jack hammers. So even with the poor mic, I’m pretty sure that it will pick up a loud smoke alarm. Cons: • Right out of the box, the 1st camera I ordered was defective (the microphone did not work at all). Amazon replaced it no problem. • The biggest disappointment with this camera is the terrible microphone. Even with the 2nd camera, the microphone is extremely poor. During a conversation, in order to hear the person they have to be right beside the camera, speak loudly, the phone has to be by your ear, and then it’s still faint. I am not able to look at the image on the phone and have a conversation with the person at the same time. And this is with the phone’s volume turned all the way up. Another example is that the camera is about 5 feet away from a dehumidifier (which is fairly noisy in a quiet empty condo unit). I cannot hear any sound AT ALL from the camera. Yet I have a second camera (a Zmodo brand) 20 feet away at the other end of the room which picks up the sound fine. • Only supports 2.4Ghz network (time to support 5ghz Wyze!) • There is no Windows/PC Interface. Geez guys, how difficult would it be to offer this? When I’m at home, I like to check on the condo when I’m working on my PC and I don’t carry my cell phone around on me. Over time I have purchased 4 different brands of cameras (Lorex, Zmodo, Reolink & now Wyze) and this is the only brand I have come across that doesn’t have a PC dashboard. I was however able to install an Android emulator on my laptop (MEmu) as an ugly work around, but it should not be necessary to have to do this). Overall I would have given this camera 3 stars because of the poor microphone and lack of Windows support. But because of the sound notifications and Alexa support, I’ve bumped it up to 4. Overall a pretty good camera for the money. Update May 17, 2020: I have to downgrade my rating from 4 stars to 3 stars. In the last 2 months the camera has lost detection of the 32gb MicroSD card several times. I.e. one day I'll go in and check and it will say "no SD card detected". After restarting the camera, it's recognized again (for a while). And then at a later date, the same thing happens again. What makes it worse is that I only find this out when I occasionally go to review the video recordings and discover that I can't. A security camera needs to be reliable and this one falls short.
title: Overall, an OK camera (with issues though)

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tash Robinson
content: The camera hardware seems nice and it does take good images, but good luck actually seeing them.  The software is  poor, and will only run on an Android or Iphone device, so if you want to use your PC to view the camera, you're out of luck, not even a web interface, of course viewing the cam on your device drains the batttery like crazy, so its no use setting up a dedicated tablet to view the camera either.  Besides the software limitations, there is the connectivity issue, I have the camera literally right next to the wifi router, and I can mange to get about 0.7 FPS,  less than one new image per second, when the camera is actually connected...  before you assume its a wifi problem, my wifi works well for my other cameras and I can stream 4k netflix all day.  it seems getting a 1080p stream from the camera in the same network should work, even lowing the resolution on the camera doesn't help.  The hardware seems nice, and I'm looking into alternate "hacked" firmware to try to use it,  because as delivered it's basically a useless paperweight.  I definitely would not buy another.
title: Poor software, worse connectivity.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: jpn
content: At first they seem really nice, but after owning for over a year, they are so unreliable and never work when we need them. Often they are off on their own and require manual reset or lose connection and again require manual reset. Very difficult to go back and view a specific time period of a possible occurrence. The motion detection is great at detecting sunsets or trees blowing but will miss a car that parks in the driveway! If you turn up the sensitivity then you’ll get notifications every 2 mins. Turn it down and it misses everything. Frustrating. The night vision sucks. Good luck ever detecting a would be perp on night vision! These are high quality baby monitors, and possibly very low quality security. They are handy and cheap, but with just a hint more effort from Wyze they could possibly be usable. These are not reliable enough or good enough detection quality or night vision to use for security. Good for watching your kids play in the other room, beyond that, lacking.
title: You get what you pay for

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Andrew Ewing
content: I must have gotten a Lemon because it is barely able to pick up sound even set all the way up to 100 sensitivity. I have contacted support and if the issue is resolved I will edit this review. My search in the forums leads me to a firmware update issue. UPDATE: I got a second one and did a comparison. The second one (same firmware and settings) was better but not by a lot. I guess the Cam Pan is not as sensitive to sound as the CamV2. That one is really easy to set off a notification. It picks up by ice maker dumping ice and the phone ringing while set on 50% .  The Cam Pan does not react to this. It requires a sharp loud noise as far as I can tell from testing 2 of them. UPDATE 2. A recent firmware update on 7/28/20 has not fixed this issue. I also tried the IR at night with a V2 and the V2 provides better IR than the pan. Final update. After not hearing back from Wyze on a 'ticket" I submitted, I am returning the item. I am keeping the bulbs , sensors and the two V2 cameras and I plan on buying at least one more v2 but until the above issues are addressed I am staying away from the pan cam.
title: Relatively Poor Sound Detection and IR lighting

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jay
content: Currently I am giving this camera one star because the unit stopped working. It currently has a solid yellow light that will not go out even after following all the online support documentation. I submitted a request to tech support. Lets see how long it takes to resolve the issue. UPDATE 02/08/19 - I decided to return this item to AMAZON for credit. I will be looking for another camera. I liked the price and the functions of the camera..until it stopped working. I attempted to work directly with Wyze support but they only responded by telling me to try all the things that were on their support website. At this point I am looking for a new camera and wouldn't recommend this camera or any Wyze product based on their lack of customer support.
title: Stopped working after 3 weeks

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Justin & Stefan
content: These cameras look cool, and advertise great features. They only work with 2.4Ghz wifi, which is common. I have many 2.4Ghz-only devices in my home which work perfectly with my Google Wifi mesh system. Google Wifi only broadcasts 1 SSID for both 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz, and there's no setting to change that. These cameras would not connect to my Google Wifi, always resulting in the blue/yellow flashing light and the audible "Could not connect to local network" message. I researched and found a workaround of disabling primary wifi, creating a 2.4Ghz hotspot with the same SSID/password, connecting the cameras to that, then disabling hotspot and re-enabling primary Google Wifi; but, the cameras would still not connect to Google Wifi after that I tried that process with a hotspot on multiple Android/iOS devices. I sent a message to Wyze tech support, but still haven't heard back 3 days later. It makes me kinda sad because I like the form factor and advertised features, but after several hours of various connection attempts, I returned them.
title: Wouldn't work with Google Wifi

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Peachy
content: I must first start by saying that, after reading some of the lower star reviews, I actually waited another week before finally ordering My WYZE Cam Pan 1080p. That being said...This product is absolutely amazing!!! Seriously, if you were on the fence about purchasing this product, please read my full review because I sincerely pride myself on giving true unbiased reviews.  knowing that as a Amazon shopper myself, I rely heavily on the reviews of others. Originally I wasn't going to get this awesome product because of some low starred reviews, but I was in a rush to get a camera as I was going to Las Vegas and had someone staying in my home as well as just wanting to feel secure that my home office would not be tampered with. I GAVE THE WYZE CAM PAN 5-STARS FOR THE FOLLOWING REASONS: 1) AMAZON WAS ABLE TO DELIVER QUICKLY 2) THE WYZE WAS INCREDIBLY SIMPLE TO SET UP. 3) THE WYZE DID EXACTLY WHAT I WANTED AND WORKED LIKE A CHARM! 100% 4) THE RIDICULOUSLY GREAT PRICE! Just in case  you need more here is more to save you from the fear I had before finally just trusting and making the purchase.  I'm not putting down anyone's opinion or experience, but I struggled with my discussion un-necessarily because of reading some reviews. This particular WYZE  can rotate, has voice, CONNECT WITH ALEXA : ), Night vision, and more. While away in another state, I was able to totally check in and view the the entire living area that included the front door liv rm, kitchen, and back door, all because of the pan feature which I was able to control from my phone. Honestly this is a no brainier.  Of course it does rely on wi-fi and is not hard wired, but I didn't want wired anyway. All you need is: The WYZE Cam, a phone or tablet, WiFi and about 5-10 mins to set up. I watched a YouTube video and was amazed at how quick and simple it was to actually start using it. Don't fret like I did, do yourself the favor and get it...It's a great product and not just for the price, but also because it works as described. Something rare now a days. Thanks for reading my review : ) ps: Ill upload some video and pics at a later time.
title: Absolutely Amazing!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: cc
content: It's expected based on the advertising from Wyze that this will follow (track) motion when motion is experienced in the front of the camera (lens area). Te device I receive does not track consistently and if you move too quickly it will lose track and then focus on something that you never added to the field (pan scan settings). If you move unnaturally slowly it will track but you sort of but then eventually loses track of the motion and goes back to some position where it will not experience any motion.  When there is no motion the camera focuses on a part of the room where there would be no motion to track and I have reset position on the device several times to no avail. I may have received a bad camera or its abilities were exaggerated. Update: 9/10/20 with some frustration I have learned quite a lot about this camera. I recall originally being impressed with the description presented  by Wyse. Unfortunately not much is true. This camera fails to track anything consistently and easily loses track of movement and turns to a position where it can no longer track anything... like toward a wall. I have set all parameters correctly in settings and limited detection zones and still spins out of range where it can't detect.
title: Does not follow motion

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mrs. C
content: When I first bought this product, it was wonderful; camera worked well and was fully functional for what it did. Then the company offered person detection which was a nice add-on feature BUT after a few months they then announced that they made some changes to the business and would start charging for the upgraded level and person detection by subscription. However, they said, that since they originally said it would always be free to early purchasers, they offered us an option to continue people detection but not have any recording but asked us to pay what we felt it was worth. I didn't find it to be great, so I subscribed without paying (which they offered as an option). Anyway, that said, the person detection is really not very reliable; sometimes it does send me notifications and sometimes it doesn't. I am so happy that I did not pay to subscribe! It is a nice little cam, but not worth what they are asking; too many small glitches in the app and not much support. Support does  answer my emails, true, but I feel like they dance around the problem and don't really fix the problems (my person detection wound up working on one camera but not the others). Can't fully recommend this cam.
title: Works well but not the best functionality

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: julian
content: This product was not ready for market. I bought 2.  First the app is clumsy and not PC usable. The app will not even auto detect your wi-fi network. I've NEVER seen a set-up where I had to manually type in the SSID. Then if camera says "setup complete" the app still says connecting and times out. I found after camera says "setup complete" you close the app using your phone's close apps program. Then when re-opening, camera is connected. Really that needs work. I updated their firmwares and next after that oddness. I find that motion sense is DEAD on both cameras, absolutely no motion following at all, or even recognizing of motion. For kicks, I danced in front of it, and it was just a brick with a blue LED. I contacted support and received a robo e-mail that they will review my "case" and get back to me in 3 days. That turn around is not what I call good support. I also aw these same issue all over the forum, and the "answer"  was to manually re-add the last firmware, but of course the link to that is not avail, and only the firmware older is a clickable link. So we are looking at a product that's main upgraded function "Pan " (its part of the name) doesn't work, a weak app (3.6 on Google Play) a lacking website, and so far no support.
title: Half baked would be an improvement

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Vick
content: Pros -  The cost of this camera is low for the perceived value.  The picture quality is reasonable as long as it is not in motion and if you purchase an optional SD card, you can rewind the recording. Cons - The camera has lots of software issues.  Initially, it was slow to activate the image on my Wyze phone app.  Using Alexa was very inconsistent to the point that I usually had to ask her 3 times before she could connect.  Finally, after a Wyze hardware update, the system really suffered to the point that you could not turn the camera off through the app.  The result was always yielded the response... "Operation Failed".  The Wyze tech support is non-existent.  You put in a ticket and they send an automated message indicating a response time of 3 to 5 business days.  5 days later, you get a response telling you steps that you have already done (reboot, unplug, reset,).  My response to that was to return the camera to Amazon.
title: Lots of Bugs in Software

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: BJHart85
content: For what you pay for Wyze cameras they are great! This camera have given me some issues by chasing movement that didn’t exist and notifying me about it while in bed, forcing my to check it out. This is in part because I have motion tracking on, it picks up on something even though I have the sensitivity really pretty low, then it turns around and sees the light hitting the wall behind and chases that. Eventually it resets its self. Another issue I have with Wyze is the ‘cool down’ period where movement will not getting reported to you, but it does make you aware of something going on before that typically. These cameras are not perfect but well worth what you pay for and they do a great job.
title: Not perfect but amazing value

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Bizzy Bee
