content: I have installed multiple cameras indoor and outdoor with ease, even less than 5 - 7 minutes.  However, after 5 hours of trying to set this camera up without success, I felt felt forced to return it.  As a senior, I want my cameras on my Ipad for a much bigger picture.  Worse than failed downloads of the Wyze app was NO CUSTOMER SERVICE.  I tried to phone them twice, waited a half hour and more, all the while listening to a constant canned message repeat, repeat, repeat.  I didn't get anywhere, either, on their online "support."  I tried to download the app both on my IPAD and on the Internet.  Finally, I tried to download the app on my phone and that had a "dead" download button, as I best recall.  I can't imagine a nice camera matched to a company with no customer service. I suspect I might have been able to keep this camera with a bit of phone customer service.  I dislike writing negative comments, but I would want to know other people's issues before I purchased merchandise.  Even more, I wasted many hours of my day.
title: Very disappointed.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Daniel Ferrell
content: I bought a camera that was $7 less in cost with the same primary features but the previous ones picture quality, installation process, app and esthetic was terrible in comparison. I was ready to yet again be disappointed and trying to put all the cords and plugs back the way it came which is impossible for most of us. This camera exceeded my expectations x 10. App is great and has excellent features to allow total control including scheduled times for specified activities. It took me an hour to become an expert. This is the camera for us who are used to technology keeping up. I also rarely leave a rating. A+
title: Perfect for people who like quality and features

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: GPbo
content: I'm one of those who marinate all the good/bad reviews before deciding to buy something. Needless to say, this takes awhile to process if you are a complete noob to smart home gadgets. Here's why I bought the Wyze Cam Pan. I have quite a lot of Alexa related devices. It was definitely tough to choose between Alexa Cloud Cam and Wyze Cam Pan. People are not fond of the Wyze app, but the same could be said for the Alexa Cloud Cam app. As for the price of 1 Alexa Cloud Cam, I could snatch 1 Wyze Cam Pan (this one), plus 1 Wyze Cam V2, and 1 Sense Starter Kit. Like if you do the math, Wyze wins. It really completes the whole collection and makes my home "smarter". You just can't beat the price for something that Wyze Pan can do without paying for a subscription to get your recordings stay on the cloud for more than 24 hours. Think about it for a sec, getting Alexa Cloud Cam is equal to paying for the basic subscription. You just can't micro-manage everything when you have other stuff that matter more. Your kids? Your work? Your "me time". What if you forget to save the record when someone breaks in? You only have 24 hours with the Alexa Cloud Cam. That's why I went with this guy. With everything in the kit, I automate a few rules to kick it up a notch when it comes to my apartment security. When my front door opened, the Wyze Cam Pan will send me a notification, along with a 12-second recording. When the Cam Pan detects motion/person, it'll send another 12-second recording. Literally, every motion is captured on cam. You can also talk to your phone app to reply through the cam. Have to yell out loud though as their 2-way audio is not so good. If you don't have any microSD, every recording will be sent on the cloud and stay there for 14 days at no additional charge. This right here is a big selling point for me as I mentioned above. No sub for 2 weeks recording on the cloud. Yahooo! The night vision is amazing. It works great in complete darkness, and you can still track the camera and see what's going on, or what the intruder looks like. At this age and time when break ins happen like meals, I think it's a wise decision to have an entry security system at home, even if you don't have kids or pets. I live alone and I work 9-11 hours a day, 6 days a week. So now I have that peace of mind that there won't be any break in any time soon. And when I'm home, I feel safe. Tips: I use the Pan Scan option, but you'd need to set up some waypoints. Do make waypoints overlapped a bit so they don't pan left and right too fast and lose focus. The pan covers about 120-140 degrees. I also set the cam movement to about 30% for the same reason above. By setting up this way, the motion tracking and tagging work much better. It'll detect and follows the person without turning too quickly, so you can see their faces more clearly.
title: Don't think about bad reviews, just buy it!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mr Bean 57
content: Buy directly from WYZE for $8 less.  That being said, and that was my fault.  Probably would have been a wash since I have free shipping with Prime.  Anyway, set up was a no brainer.  up and running in 3 minutes.  BUT that's it, up and running, no info how to use the tasks, alarms, etc.  Basically you are left to figure that out on your own.  WYZE has user groups etc, but they couldn't spring for a real manual?  I'm not kidding here, its a little scrap of paper just to get your camera on your wifi.  THAT'S IT.  IF YOU WANT TO WATCH PLAYBACK, YOU ARE ON YOUR OWN.  SETTING TIMERS, SAME STORY.  BE PREPARED TO SPEND A LOT OF TIME FIGURING OUT THIS CAMERA AND IT'S FUNCTIONS.  GOING TO 2 STARS BECAUSE OF THE LACK OF INFORMATION.
title: Cheaper elsewhere AND LACK OF INFORMATION ON HOW IT WORKS.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Katelyn Davis
content: I had some sneaky suspicions that there was some Secret Lives of Pets stuff going on in my house while I'm at work during the day. So I purchased several WYZE Cameras so place around the house. They're easy to set up, connect, and use with a simply designed yet robust mobile app. During the day we can keep tabs on the inside of the house and at night and while we're on vacation we can move the cameras to monitor our porches and exterior entrances. The best part is that the cameras have both motion detection and an AI tech that can detect people specifically. No more random alerts from a tree branch moving outside the window when it's set to "people detection". This is far more sophisticated than what we can set for alerts with our Ring doorbell. Unfortunately we have been using these cameras for almost a year and the only thing our dog does is sleep, eat, and sleep some more. Very lackluster. UPDATE: The one downside is that in November 2019 WYZE alerted customers that the "person detection" AI was being removed from the cameras' capabilities.
title: Real Life Secret Lives of Pets

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ava M.
content: I have two smaller Wyze cameras and thought i would get this one because it pans. I have my cameras in the windows pointed outside. It works well and is a cheap option to outside cameras. This thing drove me crazy. It follows you. And getting it to stop is hit or miss. So it will pan in the window and then that means it will move and dislodge itself. Or it will accidentally close the blinds...lol. it's all very comical. Then after a few days, it will stop panning. This is how i know it was not me or bad settings, it just decided what it wanted to do no matter where you set the pan. I'll have it pointed in one direction, pan setting off and when i check the camera an hour later, it's pointed up or down or just completely opposite of what i intended. Anyhow, i returned this. I ended up getting the cheaper version which i think works perfectly. Also the notifications came late 2 minutes late. You know how much damage a thief can do in two minutes? No thank you.
title: Hated It

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Chris Richardson
content: I purchased this camera due, in part, to price, features, and reviews.  Unfortunately, I should have probably read more into it. Setup was easy, for both the physical setup and the app, but from there, things got a little more involved.  During setup, a firmware update was recommended, so I did it.  Once everything was set up, the motion detection and notification did not work.  Upon further reading, I found the solution was a manual roll-back to the prior firmware version.  Ultimately it was not too big of a project, but between the time looking for a solution, putting firmware on a micro SD card, and then flashing said firmware, it's not something that should need to be done on a brand new product. Since rolling back the firmware, it has mainly worked as advertised.  I have played with the sensitivity settings, but I do not know how effective the adjustment really is.  I've had it set to below 50 and had it detect light from my upstairs bedroom TV (cam is downstairs), but at the same setting, I've walked right by it and not trigger the motion detecting or notification.  I've had the sensitivity set much higher, with the same results.  This leads me to wonder if there was an intruder, whether or not the pan cam would notify me. I ended up getting a fairly large micro SD card set to continuously record, so at worst, if someone breaks in, I can view through hours of recorded footage if/when the cam fails to notify me.  At the end of the day, I'm not sure whether I would purchase this again.  Some features are great, primarily the motion tracking and the notification ability, but it's so inconsistent it's hard to suggest this product.  Since I did purchase it, and spent the time getting it somewhat working, I'll probably stick with it and hope for some firmware improvements. TLDR: Currently (5/9) I do not think it is worth it for recording an intruder / break-in, but that could change with firmware updates.  If you want a cam to keep an eye on pets, and not for security purposes, then it is most definitely worth it.
title: Somewhat works when using prior firmware version.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: oyobass
content: When I bought this it had XNOR in-camera AI person detection built in. Unfortunately Apple bought the company that developed the technology, and Wyze could no longer use it. They are developing their own in-house person detection which is constantly getting better and better, but not quite up to XNOR standards yet. Another downside is that the connection to the micro SD card is constantly lost, so that the recording function constantly fails. The app reports "SD card is not available." Because of where the camera is mounted, I have to remove the camera from its location to access the SD card slot and remove and reinsert it to get another few days or hours of recording to the micro SD. All the other functions work perfectly: The image quality is great especially considering the price, night vision works well, and the two-way audio is great for confusing the cat all the way from work or saying hi to one of the grand kids.
title: Was a Fantastic 5-Star Value, Now Just Very Good Value

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Phillip Louw
content: I have only had the camera for a few days, so here is just my preliminary observations. Full disclosure: I have a very fast internet connection (750+ up/download speeds), and a Google Wifi mesh (one per floor) which provides blazing wireless speeds. Negative: 1. Voice is very delayed 2. Tracking is noisy and erratic - seems to jump from an actual object/motion to other non-motion 'ghost objects' and back again - not sure why this is 3. Finding it hard to make this work with Google/IFTTT - might be my lack of knowledge, but ideally I want this device to turn itself on/off based on whether someone is home or based on issuing a Google command to start/stop monitoring when I leave or return home 4. When I turn it off and on again (in Wyze app), it sometimes reports an error (unable to connect), asking to try again - this is most concerning to me as I could not depend on this to reset itself in the event of any failure when I am away from home - yes, you can restart it remotely, but have seen reports that sometimes that is only possible if you disconnect/reconnect the power Positive: 1. Great picture, and clear recordings 2.  Fast panning 3. Excellent features for the price I will update this review in another week's time as I become more familiar with the advanced features and test it out while physically away from home (see hom much pet activity is picked up or not...)
title: Good value for the price, if you dont intend to use it for home security

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Minnesota Nice
content: The quality of the camera and sound is excellent. We bought this hoping to use it as a baby monitor, but I'm actually still using another actual baby monitor at the same time. I like: that it sends you alerts, that it works on wifi and can be accessed via an app on your phone, that you can share the video streaming with other accounts, that it's quiet, that you can turn the indicator light off. I dislike: that it only sends you an alert every 5 minutes. So if at minute 1 there is a noise, I will get a noise notification, but then I won't get notified for all the noises in between minutes 1-6. On the one hand, I get it, it's a free service. But this is why it does not work well as a baby monitor. Also, if you were going to use it as a baby monitor, you need to be a light sleeper, as the notification is just a phone notification. If you're prone to sleeping through text alerts, this is not the camera for you. But if you just need a camera to check on your house, your cat, or periodically check in on your kid, then this would work fine.
title: Good quality camera - iffy for a baby monitor

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Avery Freeman
content: I install "real" IP cams in the field, so I thought I'd try some of these since one of my clients has started buying them instead of TVI cams so he can throw them up himself instead of having to hire me.  They *are* a lot more convenient to set up and use, which is cool if you're a normal person.  But I A/B-ed the picture quality with my *worst* IP cameras (e.g. SV3C A-series 4MP) and the cheap  "real" IP cams just blow them out of the water. Keep in mind:  Poor quality security cam footage is worthless because it can't be used to identify people.  1080P is a crap resolution for any sort of digital zoom.  Wyze cams might be OK if you're only using them indoors in small rooms - hence, near field of vision. For my own system, I will only install 4K IP cams or Dahua IVS Starlights these days w/ a VMS system: Milestone xProtect, Ivideon, Blue Iris, Shinobi, Zone Minder, etc. or a real NVR like Dahua or Hikvision (or OEM - there's a gazillion of them that are re-branded that are all just fine compared to Wyze).
title: Was disappointed

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Heather Hayes
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I purchased this camera after reading the reviews. Honestly, I wish I hadn't! The quality is horrible! Nothing like the pictures and videos I have seen. When you view the camera it will go down to 0 KB/s and freeze up! Same thing when you try and talk through it. As you can see in my screen recording the camera is not helpful at all! I can't talk to my dogs through it while I am gone because it freezes. My alerts will go off stating there's a person in my house...when it's just my dogs. There are just way too many problems with this camera! I've deleted and reinstalled the app, reset the camera, emailed Wyze Support, submitted a ticket etc. I was really hoping that this was a good camera! Especially for the price but clearly it was too good to be true!
title: CAMERA IS JUNK

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: NomusaMagic
content: First bought 2 to keep an eye out for my 90yr old dad who insisted on staying in his own home for hospice. We kept one in kitchen that allowed view of entrance hallway from side door and the stove. Had another in dining room that allowed view of side door, hallway outside dad's room and living room. We could see when he got up in morning and fixed breakfast, when he ate lunch and what he fixed for dinner when we were not there. We could TALK to him thru the camera which he found fascinating. One of us was always there when his hospice nurse or others visited. The rest of us rotated and could watch, hear and talk with Dad and those visiting with him .. from our smartphones .. while we were at work. No monthly fees. All that's required is the camera, WIFI and a wall plug. Wish there were a battery operated version but extension cords pretty much fixed this teeny drawback. The recordings are very high definition and so are the live views. I'd have paid tons more for this peace of mind!!
title: Amazing Value For Price! No ongoing, monthly charges

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: John C
content: I bought this so that if motion was detected I would receive a notification on my Iphone when i am away and my teenager is home. Well I have all notifications enabled and this thing barely makes any sound at all. It would also be nice if I were able to be home sleeping and someone entered the view of the camera and the a notification would actually make a noise you could hear to alert you that someone is moving in the house. If you want this to check on your pets its great while you are at work, if you want this for any type of security don't waste your money, it wont notify you with any real alert if you have an Iphone.
title: Useless if you want a notification of motion for Iphone

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S. ATILES
content: I did a lot of research before choosing this camera. My sister & I are caretakers  for our  elderly father . We needed something reliable to be able to check in on him when one of us couldn't be with him.  I read all the wonderful reviews about this camera and watched a youtube video on it's functionality and performance. When it arrived, I was able to set it up in a matter of minutes and was stunned at the amazing picture quality! I love how it's able to pan side to side and up & down. The 2 way sound is a big bonus as well. I purchased the Wyze memory card so I could record & playback. I loved it so much I bought another one for our garage so my son could review his boxing training. Everything about this camera is 5 Stars and the price is exceptional! I only wish it came in black, but  since it doesn't, I was able to easily find (on Amazon) a black silicone/rubber case that fit perfectly. Now it blends in nicely with it's surrounds. I would highly recommend this camera.
title: Awesome Camera Packed with Features!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tom D
content: I bought this knowing that I shouldn't expect much at this price point. But I was won over by all the rave reviews. I'm gonna call it as I see it: this is an unreliable toy, not a real security camera. Pros: Good image quality Easy setup Simple design Lots of features Pan and Tilt at this price point? Amazing! Cons: Flaky hardware Poor motion detection Poor connectivity Poor alerts (probably due to poor connectivity) Details: I installed this in my office at work, for testing purposes. I'm the network admin, so I have control over our wifi and physical network. The camera was easy to setup, but has poor WiFi reception and connectivity. I have several other wifi devices operating in the same area, same office even, and none of them have connection problems. The Wyze Cam Pan drops the WiFi connection frequently. This adversely affects its ability to do its job, which I see as notifying me of motion in the camera's viewing area. Of course, it still records the events, but I don't find out about it until hours or sometimes days later. That's not very useful. Also, while it is having connection problems, I can't remotely view the camera. That's not very useful either. But wait, I can put a microSD card in the camera and have it record all of the time, so I don't miss anything. But that doesn't work all of the time either. When I first put the card in, the device wouldn't recognize the card, but it didn't let me know about that. It went a couple of weeks - not recording - before I went to pull a recording and found out there was nothing there. It took several reboots and reformatting the card before the camera would recognize the card and start recording to it. Even so, it was a pain to get it to start recording to the card. The settings just didn't seem to want to do as they were told. The last nail in the coffin of this camera as a motion detecting security notifier is that there is a several second delay between when the camera detects motion and starts recording the "event". For instance, when the night time cleaning folks clean my office, it triggers an event. But I can't see them because the camera misses them coming in the door of my office and doesn't start recording until they're already standing behind my desk (too close to the camera to see their faces) and the camera stops recording several seconds later rather than continuing to record the whole time the motion is going on. That's a double-fail in my book. So buyer beware: it's fun to play with, but if you actually need to secure anything with this camera, buy a "real" security cam.
title: Less than impressed. This is a toy, not a security camera.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Christopher H
content: I love these cameras. Both the pan and the stationary. I've had several different app cameras and home security camera systems... And for the price with the features and video quality, these are hands down the best bang for the buck. I'm buying more to eventually replace my wired camera system. I just hope the manufacturer continues to improve the software. Pros: cheap, great day & night picture quality. App is very easy to use. Super simple to configure. Lots of features. Great detection notification, even with person identification. The 7 second detection clip sent to you is great Expandable memory. Panning and motion tracking are very useful. As is the ability to manually move the camera nearly 360 around the room. Cons: app only access; no website viewing. Very sensitive motion and sound detection even when turned down (had 12 motion notifications in a few hours because of a fly). The Pan Cam every so often resets the detection zone to default. Not a bad thing because it increases the detection area, but if your area is high traffic you'll get a lot of notifications. The mic/ speaker are only useful in small quiet rooms. Large areas with any background noise makes it impossible to distinguish what's being said. Plus the delay from send and receive, but I didn't buy for 2 way communication. The pan movement can be finicky, and not as precise as you'd like (for the money however it's not a true complaint at all). I wish: I wish the app would allow all the videos to stream at once. You have to click on each camera to see live feed. If you have good internet it's only an inconvenience of an extra click and a few seconds to load, but coming from streaming wired cameras it'd be a nice feature to add. Weatherproofing or some kind of IP rating would be fantastic. Two of my cameras are currently outside, under awnings, in aftermarket housings, and protected, and work flawlessly, but there's that uncertainty of failure at some point. Bottom line: I constantly recommend these cameras. Several of my friends have them set up and love them. Cheapest best,  most feature packed cameras on the market. Worth the $25-35 price all day in my opinion.
title: Best cheap cameras on the market

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J. Walters
content: Well, I bought this on an impulse because it was on sale. I figured that with all of the positive reviews it's got to be a solid product.  I was quite disappointed. Pros: very easy to use and set up. Nice looking piece of machinery.  Lots of recording options. Cons: first off, it never said anything about how to name your wifi network and how having spaces in the name causes issues with setting up the camera.  Of course I then had to rename my network, then on top of that, reconnect all of my devices to my network which was frustrating.  Second: I never would have purchased it had I known it was contingent on paying for a service.  I thought it was just a cam connected to my wifi. Like I said, its a nice piece of machinery but if I'm going to pay for a service as well, I'm going to with something more substantial.
title: Hello bait, meet switch.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: B. Arkin
content: This camera is fantastic for the price! The picture quality is great and the motion detector works very well. It sends a push notifications and shows you a 12 second clip. If you want to see more you can playback the recording time on the camera. Def get a micro usb so you have video storage thats not cloud based. I can record 2-3 days worth of video. When thing i like is the motion tracking. Sometimes i cant be home when maintenance comes and i have camera set up so they see it when they walk in and can see it moving and tacking them. You can control the cam with your phone. Up and down side to side. It has two way communication and the night time video quality is surprisingly good. You can also tell your any echo with a video screen to see what the camera sees. If you are looking for an indoor camera. Youd be kinda insane to not pick this for 37 bucks. You can also set monitor zones so the camera moves to diffrent postions you have selected so it can monitor multiple areas.
title: There is no reason not to buy this cam. 100% worth the price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: H. Choi
content: I chose this one because it is an American company and the cloud service they use is Amazon, not MIPC(I was concerned about security).  Also, I love the free cloud service.  It took me some head scratching to figure out the 5 minute interval between motion detection recording rule (it records 12 secondes footage with 5 minute interval between motion detection.  So if a footage was recorded at 1:00 even it will not upload anything new till after 1:05.)  This works for me because I just needed something to alert me when I'm away from home on trips.  The footage is very clear and had no issue connecting to my WiFi or the app.
title: It's a keeper.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: SEAL2
content: Well to start with it's a very good looking product, think the way Apple products look and are packaged. It's easy to set up, has good instructions even if you might need glasses to read them. I was almost ready to buy a second one when I realized the limitation that nixed it for me, as I chatted with tech support online. When it picks up motion/sound, it does alert your phone, BUT it does so AFTER making the recording , about 12-15 seconds later. You are able to view it but it's not a live view. Also, after it records, there is a "cool down" period before it will record again, so if there is motion/sound during the cool down period it will not record. I think the product could be awesome, but the delay in viewing the video, and the cool down period need to be "fixed" before in my opinion it is. I returned it.
title: Good but..

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Reva
content: Sometimes the sounds breaks up and you can't understand what someone is saying to you through the camera. but it cheap and does the job and it moves. Other than needing a sim I love the Wyze Cam. UPDATE: After having this camera for about 2 weeks, I have 2 pans and regular one, they wont do anything. They just keep telling me they can't connect to my internet and I have great wifi. I have 940/880mbps. Nothing else has an issue except these cameras. It so annoying when I'm trying to watch my puppies from work and I can't because this stupid camera cant get it together. I have rebooted it, restarted it, unplugged it, reboot my wifi, made sure all were up-to-date and STILL NOTHING. I'm pissed. Wasted my time and money with these cameras.
title: OWWWW this camera SUCKS!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Shannon
content: I had filled in a hole near our front window I knew this was a fox hole so wanted to see when this guy was showing up...yep! I recorded him or her! This Wyze was a little hard at first setting up for some reason it didn't take my password to my internet I tried and tried it took 4 to 5 times to get a connection for me yes...I had the correct password...I'm using this up close and picture is pretty clear day and night don't know about distances yet. For $40 its ok. This is not high tech and if you want that then you'll be paying for it. I'm using this for fun to see what wild life is in my front yard and camping out.
title: Furry critters

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Virginia
content: First, you have to purchased the Cam Plus subscription in order for the camera to pick up, record, and notify you if someone comes into the camera view.  However, when you update the firmware, the camera stops recognizing persons and motion.  If the motion setting is on 100% sensitivity, it might pick it up, but that doesn't work with persons.  Supposedly, you have to go through the setup process to get it back to functioning properly, which I have done at least twice before calling the Wyze help line.  I'm on my third update with the exact same result.  When I've contacted the customer service line each time, magically, it starts working again after we go through the same setup process with the customer rep AGAIN!  I'm sick of going through this process every 3-4 weeks.  To make matters worse, customer service is only available M-F during general business hours PACIFIC time.  I'm disgusted and frustrated, so be prepared if you decide to purchase this camera.
title: Stops working after firmware updates

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: G. R.
content: After owning two Wyze cams and learning more about the company, I decided to give this one a try. As soon as it got here I was a bit disappointed because it looked like it was re-packaged since it seems that things were not properly placed in the box and it was a bit bloated. However, I could not find any indication that it was used of refurbished so I carried on with excitement. Getting it to sync with my app and wifi was as easy as the Wyze cams, which means - very easy... however, navigating the options of this one was a bit a mess. Even now, after having the camera for a few weeks, if I want to change the zones that it scans, I cannot find it until I look at all the different settings menus. Yet, something like that would not prevent me from enjoying my new toy, so setup if over and now let it do its thing. It does its thing, but there is a big issue, it lets you know that it is doing its thing. The motor is very noisy, to the point that if you sit in the same room as the camera, it is very annoying and noticeable background noise. At this point, it became useless for me to use in the house or even in the patio, and it found its way to the garage. Do I need a pan cam in the garage? no, not really, but it is the only place the noise will not bother anyone :( I was really hoping to get some more of these for the other locations, but know it seems that the collective noise will be sufficient to discourage any burglar wannabe even before they will come in range of the camera. Another issue is the motion tracking, it is useless in close range and actually, cause the camera to miss what is going on. If the object is close, the camera will frantically try to follow something making the video feed useless. Last recommendation to the app. If I control the camera manually, pause the pan scan and resume it after 10-15 seconds. I found myself fighting for control with the pan scan. Still a very exciting company with very useful products, but this one needs to be as quiet as a security camera...
title: Good camera for a great price but very noisy and software can be better

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Sean Tucker, Sr
content: The camera is a neat device, if you can get it activated. This is the second camera I purchased and it maybe the last. The first camera took me two days, I had to walk away from the device the first day because after numerous, numerous tries, the camera would not scan the QR (I think that's what it is called) from my phone. On the second day, getting ready to contact Amazon so I could return it for a refund, I decided to try again. After three tries it finally scanned. I was so pleased with myself and "knew" I had figured out what I was doing wrong.  Today, the second camera arrived and I was overflowing with confidence that this setup would be a breeze compared to the first (insert wrong answer game buzzer here...EXTREMELY LOUD!!!).  I have a plad tablecloth on one of my tables...plad has grid pattern.  I placed the camera on the table against a specific line on the tablecloth.  I pulled out a ruler and lined it up along the same line as the camera and placed my phone, with the QR, 5 inches from the camera and held it there.  Then 5.5 inches; hold.  Then 6, then 7, back to 6, etc., etc.  The QR only lasts five minutes. I went through two QR codes.  If you decide to purchase this product, I hope your results are successful.  However, a word of caution, be prepared to be very, very, very patient. Finally, I went on the company's website and accessed their help section...(Enter second wrong answer game show buzzer HERE and a laugh track.).
title: Fun, if you can get it to work.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Robert T. Johnson
content: If you are interested in purchasing this camera wait. Wyze is having a major issue with their not functioning via remote access after firmware upgrade. Don't upgrade your Wyzecam firmware and Wyzecame appears to have no answer to the issue. Google and you will see everyone is having the same problem after firmware upgrade. Before the upgrade the camera worked great I could access from anywhere in Chicago.
title: Worked great before firmware upgrade

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: jd2210ct
content: I bought 3 of these so far and all seem to be doing the job for me. The IR night vision is pretty good up to about 10-14 feet, but after that not very good. In total darkness, I can't see the floor in my shop from 15' in the air, until the lights get turned on. The sound is not real good either unless whoever is talking is standing right next to the camera otherwise it's all chopped up and you can't understand it anyway. I like the motion detection which works good so far. Don't like the fact that it skips a full 5 minutes before detecting motion again, but I knew that going in. I think this should be a feature you can set to your own wishes. Overall a great camera for monitoring the coming and going on the property, but not what I would call a true security surveillance camera. It has it's place and it's doing what I thought it could do for me just fine. Love the app and features it brings to my phone. I paid $26.00 shipped the first time I bought these cameras and I see now the price is up to $37-38. That's to bad, as I wanted a few more... Good Luck Y'all....
title: For the money, these are good cameras

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kirby T
content: I now own 6 of these and have them set up as an alarm system!  The app works great, no monitoring service to pay, it alerts my phone and I decide if its a threat to call 911 about or if it is something else.  We use two as baby monitors, it will alert when it detects sound or movement.  Its motion is based on pixel changes, so turning on a light will set it off.  I shared the cameras with my wife, and now she can use her phone as a monitor/controller as well as to arm and disarm.  You can create shortcuts for anything you want.  We have  Away, Home, Bedtime, Baby Down,  Baby Up, Playroom On,  Playroom Off shortcuts, each one turns the phone alerts on/off for any combination of devices.  I only wish I could set the time between event triggers/notifications, the 2 year old likes to lie in bed and play for a little while at nap time, so I get an alert on my phone every 2-3 minutes until she falls asleep.  It would be nice to adjust that to 5 or 10 minutes, or any variable to meet your specific needs.
title: Works Great!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: coffeeandcats
content: It’s been 3 months, time for a review!. I was swayed by the low price but I didn’t expect the camera to be that good. Yeah, it takes forever connecting to the internet sometimes if the connection is lost and has the longest reboot ever, I feel. Or maybe I’m just impatient. Either way, I can get over those minor details. I really just use this to check on my cat when I’m away for many hours during the day. The pictures are crisp and the night vision is excellent. I also love that I can talk to her through the camera. For this price that can’t be beat. I don’t really need the camera for security purposes (like to put outside my living area and such). So for what I use it, it is excellent. I will update this if anything changes.
title: Bought this to check on my cat

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jeff
content: Purchased this pan cam for inside and a v2 fixed for an outdoor housing to overlook a garden bed. Goal with the outdoor cam was to motion sense for any animal activity and trigger our irrigation through IFFFT in the event of deer activity for instance. Pros : they're super cheap, very easy to get online, and picture quality is surprisingly good. App is nice and simple / easy to use as well. Cons (for our application) : outdoors the motion detection triggers for every bug that flies in front of the camera. there were hundreds of triggers within the first few hours and no way to eliminate. so night vision motion detect outside is totally unusable. IFFFT integration is also buggy, often requiring you to kill the service connection and rebuild applets, and does not always work as support suggests. There is no phone support (goes to VM). Email support is slow and poor. They either don't fully read the specifics of inquiry and provide an incomplete or irrelevant answer or don't seem to fully know their product. I bought a motion sense kit to try and work around the issues with the camera motion sensor. Now bugs don't set it off but every flutter of a planting leaf does, with no ability to adjust sensitivity. There is also no way to set detection time windows with the dedicated motion sensor as on the cameras. And contrary to what support suggests, IFFFT integration with the sense motion sensor doesnt seem to be available/working. Overall disappointing for our needs. Could be great for the price especially, but needs refinement and better support. For indoor use only as a simple live view camera, it's a good option.
title: Lots of potential but issues and poor support

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JS Lurkin
content: Sound quality as good as you can expect from such a tiny package. Features and price, amazingly wonderful. Customer service is kinda sorta prompt. But, if the question is too difficult, it could take a couple of days longer. Changed my rating to one star. The company sends you unsolicited offers to your email. As if I needed one more of those. They’re working on an outdoor version. No time schedule. Hopefully soon.
title: Great value. Iffy customer service.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Steven
content: Bought this on a friends recommendation, and for the price i wasn't expecting much. I figured it couldn't hurt as i had no other home recording devices.  Every aspect of this exceeded my expectations. The App works very well, it's easy to use, and it saves video from motion sensing activitvies with no monthly subscriptions or SD Cards. I installed an SD card anyway so all recent video would be saved and i can easily replay any saved video from the App. I used to be a videographer so i'm sensitive to image quality, once again this surpassed my expectations. It records sounds well, and i'm able to speak through the App and it has a built in speaker to broadcast my voice. This has kept my kids and pets in check :) . I put mine inside my house near a window. I typically have it facing outside but the App also let's you rotate the camera easily and nearly 360 degrees. It's rare to find a product that works this well, offers so much for less than $40.
title: Pleasantly Surprised. Met and exceeded all my expectations.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ajay &.
content: We did a lot of research looking for a good, affordable indoor camera to Use as a home security monitoring system and also as a nanny cam. Although we did want to find a battery powered one, those were either too expensive (Arlo) Or did not have great reviews or did not have great reviews (Blink). The Wyze Camera seem to generate a lot of positive reviews, and have won awards in consumer magazines (Pc Consumer magazine 2019). At under $40 per camera, it is also one of the most affordable options out there. We have only use it for about a month, but do find that the picture quality is pretty superb, including night vision. The only downside is potentially the microphone, as our cameras which are mounted on the ceiling do not pick up the sound as well. I suspect this may be the case for any camera that is mounted so high, however if this were better than this would be the ideal wired camera.
title: Excellent indoor camera!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: jas
content: I purchased this camera in April 2020 to use as our baby monitor with our Echo Show. Turns out, it times out after 10 min on the Echo and you have to constantly ask Alexa to show you the bedroom to reopen the app... the camera was much better on the actual app. It didn’t time out on there, but 2 out of 10 times, the camera wouldn’t connect when I would open the app. To fix this, I would have to force close the app and open it again, and then “turn off” the camera... and then turn it back on! Super annoying. Well... after 5 months of use, it finally gave out. The camera wouldn’t connect to the app, no matter how many times I force closed the app or disconnected the camera. I contacted customer support for this issue on 9/1 and they told me they would send me a replacement right away! Awesome! But then two weeks go by and the tracking number they sent me has zero updates. Two weeks later, I call CC again and they say “hmmm that’s very strange. We will go ahead and send ANOTHER replacement”.... it has now been ANOTHER two weeks (I’m writing this on 9/30) and I STILL DO NOT HAVE A REPLACEMENT CAMERA. It has been an entire month. They said that because they’ve already sent out two replacements, they have to wait for one to hopefully arrive “soon”... even though I’ve been waiting literally for the entirety of September lol. Buy at your own risk 🥴
title: Gave out after 5 months. Customer care is 2/5 ☹️

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mike D. Kays
content: Thought these would be great, but they have SO MANY BUGS.  They only work about half the time.  The pan feature doesn't work right,at all.  You tell the camera to pan right one click, and it ends up going all the way to the right or all the way to the left.  And it is down more than it is up and working.  We installed these on a remote cabin so we could keep an eye on things when we were not there, and it kept shutting off, or had bad quality video.  Had to drive back out there from time to time just to get the cameras up and running again.  Ended up buying more expensive cameras, and they are SO MUCH more reliable.  Look at the Q&A on the product website.  There are tons of problems with these.  Unless you like to spend hours and hours of re-booting, resetting to factory default, re-setting up your cameras and constantly tinkering to get them to work, BUY SOMETHING ELSE.  I am tired of trying to make technology work like it is supposed to.  These only have one job, remote access of video, and they are not reliable!
title: Don't waste your money!  Not worth the effort.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Steven Mather
content: Died after 3 weeks and I didn't return that week so screwed. Bought July 1st and couldn't return after July 31st. You get what you pay for. That's why other motion tracking cams are much more expensive. I left seller feedback but don't expect a reply or at least a reply that they will refunded, fix, or replace. I would not recommend this to anyone even though when it worked it did a decent job. Will look for another motion takings cam and bite the bullet on price. Also this was not fully ONDIF compliant and worked sporadically with blue Iris 5
title: You get what you pay for, the old axiom is true.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: James
content: Got my Wyze cam 9/9/19 and everything was a easy setup and gone through the day without an issue. Tilt pan and zoom is great on the phone and video quality is nice. Next day checked on it and was still working.. got to work and wanted to check the camera out and couldn't even connect via remote on my phone and I get this  error 90 and was prompt with "Please try to power cycle the camera" but guess what I'm not home to do that. Came home for some reason it connected to my phone and was good again. Then after fiddling a few minutes later I couldn't connect anymore. Had to delete the device in the Wyze app and re-install the camera again. Giving it just 2 star just because I couldn't connect and view the live stream while at work but alone the video and features were great. Will update tomorrow on the connection of the live. Update 9/14. Its works after emailing and opening a ticket with the Wyze tech team. Faith Kirk did a awesome job getting back to me with suggestions on how to fix the error. Working great viewing the live stream away from home. Ordered another one yesterday same day prime delivery and had no issues setting up the new device. I would recommend! Rating has changed and satisfied!
title: Live Stream - Error 90 - Fix Update! Recomended

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mikey P
content: I'm not just a fan, I'm a critic, and an omni-consumer, who has no complaints at all about this product or it's manufacturer. 2+ years using Wyze, owning all 3 versions/makes/models of Wyze Cam without ever having any issue (except for one time when I thought there was an issue but it was NOT Wyze-related, oops #smh). On *Ease* of Use: Power Supply + Mobile App + WiFi Connection = Good to Go! On Setup: You would have to try to make this difficult and even then it would still be a no brainer. PS Bonus Points if you have the non-Pan Cam and you like magnets or simply appreciate how completely 'under-rated perfect' magnets are for lots of things in general (maybe I took some creative liberty in applying my own neodymium discs where I felt could work, or... see next). On Durability: It stands to reason stuff just isn't made to last nowadays or has been designed obselesant. Well, I also like to "Putz" around with things, and I'm not always the most graceful or delicate either. That said, despite many drops, tumbles, and knocks that should never have happened, all my Wyze Cams seem unaffected, and I was pretty sure I should have shattered this one the last time I drop-kicked it off of the balcony by mistake, oops! It landed in a planter 3 floors below, but it was completely fine, surprisingly, though I strongly discourage testing durability. Wyze Cam App is legit - I mean, it is super user-friendly, has a clean interface, and anything you might not know, is very easy for anyone to figure out without much effort. Of course, the company probably has customer support that is superior to any other brands, from what I hear, of course I wouldn't know from experience because I've never needed it (sorry about that one time I thought something was wrong, but it was just me, and/or another tech gadget, so yeah, I was wrong Wyze!). On VALUE: Try finding better and you'll find you're just wasting your time. I won't go over details with specs, they're listed. And you can pay 3 to 10 times as much for the same features or even fewer features. Simply put, there is no better overall value. Side Note: As someone who regularly attends baby showers (proud Guncle to so many and counting), Wyze Cams across the board are substantially WAY better for baby-monitoring than most run-of-the-mill "baby-brand" cameras, which, you should know typically cost much, much more and usually have less to offer. Wyze is what's up. Not going to brag, hut I pretty much started the entire (unofficial) Wyze Cam Nursery division when I decked-out one of these with baby-themed animal character pizzazz. Just saying, like, I probably, sort of, maybe, *definitely* started that trend. #supercute
title: No. 1; No Brainer

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S. Harris
content: The camera steadily lags when trying to use the app when away from home. It worked great for the first couple of weeks but then little by little it started getting disconnected and lagging during use. I have 1gbps internet so it’s definitely a hardware or software issue with the camera. You definitely get what you pay for. I’d recommend spending the extra hundred and getting one of the better cameras on the market.
title: Product doesn’t last

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Seaotter
content: 6 month update: Wyze continues to update the firmware on a regular basis. Great communication with customers via forum. Still working great! Alexa integration could be better. All you can do from Alexa is view the feed, no controls. Update 5/8/19 Still very reliable. The company Updates their products in as regular basis. The camera and the Wyze company continue to impress! Update 3/16/19 The camera has been extremely reliable since my last update,  with no dropped signals that I have noticed. It faithfully reports when my daughter comes home from work at night. I still find it amazing that such a useful item (and service) costs so little! Update 2/13/19 There have been a lot few dropped signals since the lad software update. The camera has been working well. Great integration with Alexa would be nice, as right now all you can do with Alexa is view what the camera is seeing; there is no control of the camera except with the app. Update 1/26/19 Still working well. Have had trouble formatting the SD card while in the camera, will try to use my laptop instead to see if that works. Have had issues with dropped signals at times, But that may be due in part to a lousy Wi-Fi provider (at one point WYZE did note they were having issues, but quickly fixed it. Don't forget to check out  their forum).  I haven't had any issues with sensitivity or alerts. Even when I couldn't connect to the camera thru the app I was still getting alerts. Original post: This product is amazing! It was easy to set up, and has been operating for a week now without any issues., i gave it just 3 stars for sound and video quality, but that really isn't fair. Its a security camera, it was never intended to be used in a studio. I am often away from home during the week. My kids keep an eye on things when I am gone, but they obviously can't be there all of the time. Now, for just a few bucks, I can check my house from anywhere at any time. And if anyone enters the house, or if the smoke detector goes off, I receive a text immediately, giving me a chance to call emergency services. I can even take a picture or a video on my phone (in addition to the continuous video on the memory, and the free cloud storage from the Wyze company). And I can use the audio functions to chat with my kids when they drop in to feed the fish.
title: Great for peace of mind

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S Wallace
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Well I WAS super excited to replace my arlo cameras, because they weren’t communicating well with my Alexa... until it started making this horrible noise!  My dogs were freaking out, I was freaking out... can’t imagine if it had happened when I was at work and the dogs would be stuck listening to this all day?!?! Had to unplug it to get it to stop. Contacted customer service, sent my activity log and the video, and was basically told that the engineering team is looking in to it and hope to have a fix in a future update?!?  Ummmm how long will that be? And no guarantee it will be correctable!  Think I’ll likely send these back. The tech seemed to insinuate that it was because I’d installed an SD card (a Wyze brand SD card at that!) Disappointed...but thankful this happened before my 30 day return window was over.
title: Randomly makes an obnoxious noise

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Trip
content: Love the price. Having been using mine for over 2 years and its been working great.  I only bought one and will maybe by another if Wyze doesn't start charging for person detection. Pros: reliable doesn't need to be reset and when i pull it up in app i can move camera around and see entire garage. When it picks up person or dog it will follow the person around garage. Con: picture is sometimes jerky when its following a person because its trying to keep it in the center of the frame and it will sometimes come back if it overshot the motion. All together great camera for $37 and I like that it will stay facing the entrances to the garage unless motion is detected and will follow until they leave and will go back to my set location.  Its great!! Saved me from buying 2 Wyze Cams
title: Fantastic

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Cyclops
content: This is the second one of these I received to replace the fist one that refused to recognize the SD card. Support was quick, tried several things but in the end returned both the 32GB card and camera not knowing if it was the camera or card although all things pointed to the camera. Replacement arrive in a day, no kidding. I was not optimistic with it arriving in a soft package and the case being split from rough handling (see the pic). On setup, I had the same glitch and camera not recognizing the card or being able to format it. I formatted it in my PC and tried something a little different than the on line support suggested. I reset the camera and restarted it with the freshly formatted card in it BEFORE the initial setup so the card was installed first, not after the WIFI setup. Success! I carefully powered it down through the app instead of just unplugging it and it seems OK for the last hour or so. I haven't tested it recovering from a power failure yet. As noted in a couple of other reviews, the motion tracking is a little buggy and they really need to support 5Ghz WIFI.
title: A nice toy, but still a toy

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: VB
content: I had Arlo, Arlo Pro, Pro 2, Yi Home can 3, TP-Link Kasa KC120. Recently discovered Wyze brand and bought this Wyze Pan Cam and Wyze Can v2 with Sensor kit. So far, this camera is one of the best by video quality, application features, free Cloud option, micro SD card support. This Pan Cam has different sensor and lens than Wyze Can v2, and produce better video image color temperature (no yellow tint. Wyze can v2 produce more warm color temp indoors, see image one is below). Pan Cam has a bit bigger sensor and better night vision led 6 vs 4 and 940nm vs 850, so it not visible to human eye. The Wyze can v2 4 infrared led is bright and visible to human. You have continued video recording if you use micro SD card. Company produce many useful updates. Motion detection works well. They have smart bulbs, plugs and sensors. Hopefully, they will update software that when Motion detection sensor linked with Pan Cam the Motion tracking will be enabled by itself. At this moment, when video recording enabled to this camera it will record motion, but won't track subject unless Tracking Motion enabled
title: Great Wyze Pan Camera with a lot features. Great for Livingroom

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Stahrr
content: I bought this camera to use a baby monitor. It sucks for that use. 1) it pans 360 left or right, sure, but the up or down angles suck, so unless you mount it sideways (which mounting requires a separate kit, can't just hang it on the wall like most), you have to basically have it relatively close to the level you want to view. I wanted to sit mine on top of an armoire and have it look down into the room so I could see into his bassinet, but it couldn't look down far enough without me propping something under the base, which made it unstable. I also, incorrectly, thought it would operate like bluetooth, and that it would just need to be paired with my phone and then it would connect to my phone directly. Instead, it had to go through your WiFi, so if your internet goes out it's worthless. That also means if your phone isn't connected to your WiFi you can't connect to it at all. So if someone is babysitting my child and I want to check in while I'm out, I can't. I thought there would be some benefit to being able to use it through the internet. I thought at least I'll be about to check from my phone, and I can through the app, but if I want to use my phone for anything else other than leaving the video steam up, it will disconnect from the live feed and you have to manually come back to check it, instead of being able to listen to it like a regular monitor. There's also no way to adjust the volume of the video or the camera. I tried using the 'talk through the camer' feature, and whispered into it for my husband, who was rocking the baby to sleep. I could hear it from the living room, down the hall, through a closed door. I also can't have to turn the volume up all the way on my phone to barely be able to hear my son cry. My son is about 8 feet from the camera. You can't turn the volume sensitivity up or down on the camera at all, so I can't hear him unless he's wailing, in which case I can probably already hear him myself. I would return it, but I stupidly threw away the box and packaging as soon as I opened it, because I was confident I would love it, a it was recommended to me by a fellow parent. It also took me several attempts to connect it to my internet the first time. It is a simple process, but it just wouldn't connect. Also, it doesn't support 5G, so you have to connect it to a 2.4 band. Also, now after a couple weeks I'm getting an error code 90, and says it isn't connected. There's no way to re-sync it besides unplugging it and hoping that fixes it, which it hasn't for me so far. Google 'Wyze error code 90', to read tons of other people frustrated with the same thing, and no real solutions, other than, "eventually it should come back." It has great picture quality, and the night vision is fantastic, and it was priced nicely, and the app is simple to use. If it could be viewed from my phone while I was out and about I'd say it would make a great security camera, but like I said, you can't view the live stream from another WiFi. It will send you a push notification if you want and a short clip of the recording if it detects motion or sound, which is ok as a security feature. I'd still prefer a live stream. Not really sure what this camera would be good for, honestly.
title: Not for use as a baby monitor.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Michael Gergen
content: The camera itself is pretty great for the price. It has pretty good resolution and image quality, and decent motion capacity. The night vision works great too. The camera’s firmware and software to use the camera is... alright. Firstly, the way the firmware handles motion of the camera is lousy. When the camera is tracking motion mode, the camera only move in increments for whatever reason, and when moving in increments sometimes the motion is lost because the camera is so jerky when moving. Also why can’t you change the duration of the waypoints when in pan scan mode? Also why can’t shared users view SD card footage? Shouldn’t I be the one to decide that? I don’t know, the software just seems like it’s lacking features that just make sense. If I have a personal camera, I want to be able to personalize how it behaves. On top of all that the app tries to get you to pay more for longer motion captures. If you have an SD card in the camera, the 12 second limit doesn’t matter. I’m not giving any money to a sub-par app. Overall it does it’s job pretty well and it’s certainly a good value still. I recommend it, but I hope the software gets better.
title: Excellent camera, OK software.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: SmokyMtn
content: Wow, don't let the price cause you to hesitate into thinking this cam might be of lessor quality or functionality than other popular brands! It's sooo much better than the other brand I purchased.  I was so disappointed with a different brand's cam performance, (that was 4x more costly!); their tech support just made excuses and blamed my wifi connectivity, so I decided to give Wyze a try. I will definitely purchase more of these. Download of the Wyze app was quick; has good control options and functions.  Wyze cam pan has quick record response, no lag,  immediate starts recording much quicker and clearer than my ring cam. Live stream and playback are excellent, picking up voice and the tv from 15 feet away.  Included separate push notification alarm settings for CO and smoke detection alarms; event recording storage on your purchased SD card as well as cloud storage, separate detection settings for motion and voice (better than other brand's "zone" detection setting); rotate image and take a still photo of what you are watching; freeze a specific event so it is not accidently recorded over.  The cam picked up voice from 20 feet away and good clear picture quality during daylight. I have not yet tried  full dark/nighttime detection recording to view quality; but with small over the counter kitchen light on, 20 feet from camera, live stream viewing seemed fine. You need to plan to use internet search to find numerous, excellent utube videos for step by step install and trouble shooting help. There is no printed instructions included in the packaging, so I took 1 star off my review for that. I did not have to call or contact Wyze tech support as I was successful in setting up the camera using utube video help.
title: Very satisfied. Camera has great functions/features and pic quality recordings than popular brands.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J. W. Schulert
content: I really wanted to like this camera. The price, picture quality, pan/tilt ability are all great but in the end it just never works. I returned my first Pan thinking it could just be a flaw but he second camera is just as bad. The camera almost always throws a error code 90 telling me to power cycle the device. This happens daily and seems to be down more often than up. Troubleshooting hasn't helped at all as the error code can be related to many things most of which I tried to fix. I also have a normal Wyze camera that, while a problem to connect to through the app, works most of the time. I am giving it 2 starts because when it works it looks great. Update: 10/20/2019 Wyze has really come a long way to improving their app connecting to the camera. Great value and connects 99% of the time now!
title: Great features

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: MikenzCO
content: I started out with the basic Wyze cam and was so impressed by what I received that we picked up several more. Then the cam version cam out and picked up that too. We currently have eight Wyze cams different versions throughout our household. Price, quality, customer support and ease of use is why we have stuck with Wyze products and will for the foreseeable future. The Good – Price, quality, features Customer support Free storage No fees Up to 32 GB local storage Frequent updates Recording quality The Not So Good -  Limited to a maximum micro SD card size 32 GB At dawn and dusk the ‘auto’ setting for light can jump back and forth for a few minutes between IR and day camera modes The cam motor can be a bit on the noisy side if nearby The biggest difference between the original Wyze cam and the Pan version is of course movement. You don’t get a full 360 degrees but close enough. All the settings you would find on more expensive setups you get with this including time lapse. The motion sensing can be on or off. You can set sensitivity and detection areas. Notifications work all the time without fail. When triggered the clip is sent to your phone no matter where you are. The IR video is easy to see. You can set it to pan scan the full range or just a set area. The clarity of the images is good enough that you can make use of the zoom function and still be able to see things well. Unlike other systems there are never any fees after purchase for saving your recordings. I have SD cards in all of ours (not needed just an option). That way I record 24/7 as opposed to shorter video clips when activated. After about five days it will start to overwrite the oldest recordings (not saved). FYI cards should be formatted exfat not ntfs. The system worked great with google to start and now you can even use Alexa devices like the show to view live streamed. I have had great success with Wyze to date twice I encountered hiccups but it all was easily worked out. Thanks in large part to one of the best customer support teams I have ever had the pleasure to work with. Polite, friendly, U.S. based, they know their products and don't just read from a script and best of all they actually listen to what you have to say. Better still if you need to contact them after all is said and done you'll be sent an email asking how your support went? not typical as you then get to choose how to reward the support person w/gift cards, coffee, movie tix. A company that treats its employees well, what goes around comes around and it works! All said we got started with Wyze products to keep track of family. To keep an eye on both kids and our mom who is older and falls at times. These products enable us to check in and make sure everyone and everything is where it should be and okay. Yes it is great to keep tabs on garbage pickup or deliveries but there is so much more. I still worry when we have to leave our mother alone for short periods of time but being able to take a quick look around and know all is okay? The peace of mind, I cannot say enough good on that aspect. There are fun bits too. Like setting up slow motion for something like a big snow? Watching it pile up or melt down? Just one example. Or putting out food for the critters, squirrels, rabbits, and birds then watching them all eat together cafeteria style, something only the Wyze cam caught. While not fun it also came in handy last year. We got hit with a bad very localized hail storm. The cams had been running and caught it all. I was able to take the vid email to our agent as further proof. The Wyze Pan is just a more versatile version of their great original Wyze Cam version. There aren’t many products out there that give you so much value for the dollar IMHO. Plus getting it all backed with fantastic U.S. based customer support. I have recommended these to family and friends alike for all the reasons mentioned.
title: Updated 12/2019 Fantastic product, helps keep tabs on family too

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: G Dreelin
content: This is one of the best security cameras I have tested and very very inexpensive. It gives you great tilt pan ability and the picture quality is 1080p. The person tracking on it work better than some expensive brands. I was a bit skeptical about them at first but after getting one and seeing what it could do I wished I had these years ago for my home security system. They are not exactly waterproof but there are many products on Amazon to make them usable outside. I have gotten feedback from many that have used them outside without any issues for a year now. I have had one outside for a few months and still working strong. For an inexpensive home security camera these are the best and work with many  camera applications like Blue Iris, MotionEye, etc.
title: Just WOW!! Love Wyze Cameras

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JATOAV8OR
content: My first observation was how fast the pan & tilt tracking is. I have tried several wifi cams over the past decade and this by far has the fastest pan & tilt movement.  I also like the audio, it’s a open two way like a phone call vs a press to talk walkie-talkie design. The app has all the features you’d expect including control over night vision and 180° Picture flip. You have Full resolution control, 320p SD and 1080 hd. There’s lots of accessories available including silicone sleeves for outdoor placement. An Alexa skill is available, I’ve tried it with my echo show and show “5” It works perfectly with good audio. The frame rate is extremely smooth, i’d compare it to the Amazon Cloud Cam For picture quality & smoothness. “Disclaimer” I have gigabit fiber optic internet & a nighthawk triband router so even on 2.4g wifi my speeds are 250mbs+ with 10ms latency.  I’m so impressed that I will be replacing all cameras that fail in the future with wyze.
title: FAST & SMOOTH

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Bennett Barouch
content: I have owned several ip cameras over the years. These are the first ones that are super easy to set up, and they perform well, although with some flaws. They can be installed at more or less any angle needed, including upside down (without the image being upside down). Pan speed is good. Images are very clear. Captured video is streamed to the company's site in real time (secured to your account) from which you can view them easily from the app you put on your phone. I would rather I didn't have to depend on that and could directly access the cameras since any company can eventually go out of business, but it works. I get a lot of notifications of movement or sound that do not have any accompanying saved video. I don't know why that is, and if my security threats were at a higher level, that would be a disqualification. I get false alarms pretty often, mostly due to the movement of sunlight in the areas being watched, but they are understandable given the necessary technical limitations of the device type, and no worse than similar products.
title: Far better than most, but still lacking in some regards

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J Wamsley
content: This camera was useful while it lasted, which was only a few months. Now, the camera will not connect to WiFi and is not successfully able to perform a factory reset in order to setup the device as new. Customer service/tech support is non existent and hasn’t responded to my support tickets/requests. My camera has been down for almost two full weeks and no one has responded to my request for support. I guess it’s time to get a Ring stick cam instead. It doesn’t matter how well a camera works, if tech support isn’t prompt, it’s not worth it.
title: Tech Support Awful

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Heyborne
content: I love Wyze products and their service is incredible. I have 2 Wyze indoor cams but I use them outside. They did fine during the winter and nothing is wrong, but I live at the back of a cul-de-sac and I have wanted a pan for a while. I got it installed and I regret not doing it sooner. Motion tracking is great and picks up neighbors, hummingbirds at the feeder, people walking away from the garage, and so on. Being able to pan across the back of the cul-de-sac this way is awesome. It gives a better view than the cam at the other corner of my garage. Photos and video are just as clear as the other Wyze, if not just a tad more clear. I did have to buy a 4rd party mount but it worked perfect. I use an SD card in each of my cams so that I can continuously record. This is helpful for playback and going back several days if need be. I can't recommend Wyze enough and I'm so glad I found them!
title: You don't know you need this!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ColoDad
content: For the approximately $40 I paid, these are the best pan and tilt motion Sensing security cameras out there at that price point In my opinion! I was surprised at the features included and that was the number one selling point for me. Ok now to the meat of the review. First off I am using these for outdoor security camera's (and they work well) even though they are rated for indoor use.
