I did buy third part weather sleeves for them to protect them from the elements. I have had them for about 3 Months now and have had no quality control issues. They are easy to activate and install out of the box as long as you have an electrical outlet nearby, about 5 feet. If not there are work arounds, extension cords, longer Micro USB cables etc. Ok here's My pros and cons for the features I use. Pro: 01: Manual Pan and tilt camera with easy to use App that lets you use touch and a zone button for camera movement. It also lets you pinch to zoom in and out and has the option to live stream/record at HD (1080p), SD (720p) or 360p. 02: Automated pan and tilt with fairly easy to use pan and tilt zone settings. 03: Two way audio. 04: Motion and/or sound event detection with sensitivity control, tagging and push notification. 05: Free 14 day Cloud Storage for recording on event and/or Local SD Card storage (not included) for continuous or on event recording with the option to turn off sound. 06: Manual Video/Pictures and time lapse that can be saved to an album on the SD card and shared. Con: (Remember for me a $40 Camera with these features = 5 star rating even with the cons!) 01: No Windows 10 support. This almost killed the deal for me since I work at a Win 10 Desktop at home and a Win 10 Surface on the road. 02: Cloud storage of events only allows 15 second clips with 5 minutes between events. I've had events go unrecorded because they happened after a squirrel ran across the lawn and the event happened before the 5 minutes was up. No option to purchase longer cloud storage clips with no delay and No NAS or computer recording option. 03: It could be just me but I can't tell the difference between HD and SD camera resolution even when zooming in. 04: The Motion and sound detection is pretty much all or nothing, the sensitivity controls do not work all that well. The motion detects headlights reflecting off the lawn or cars in the driveway at night, Reflections on windows day or night, even moving shadows set it off. Also the motion detection zone placement only allows straight lines like cropping a photo into a rectangular or square area. 04: If you want to share a camera or event you have to have the person your sharing with open an account with Wyse or give them your login credentials?? All in all I would purchase them again though, and probably will for my Fiancé.
title: 5 Star rating based on price for the features included!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: WyghtLyon
content: First a little history: I own several Wi-Fi surveillance cameras that I have connected to my net successfully. I have also connected [via iPhone apps] to said cameras successfully [with alarming regularity]. As in: access app on phone, camera IMMEDIATELY connects, enjoy service. I’m not a newby to this. I wish. It would be so much easier to accept this issue —-> It didn’t connect as easily as most of the other reviews bragged; however, when it connects, this thing is impressive. “When it connects . . . “, “When it connects . . . “, this thing is impressive. Sadly, this thing will consistently not connect to the app. I have to access/kill the app repeatedly to get it to eventually connect. Beyond frustrating. I’m hoping the manufacturer will reach out to me due to this review because the Support section of their website is an unresponsive mess. If I don’t hear from the manufacturer in a few days, it’s going back to Amazon for a refund. So disappointed.
title: Really wanted to believe.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Anan
content: a fan of Wyze cam definitely one of the best Camera on the market but this one is disappointing. the camera build quality is Perfect, the picture quality is amazing. but I had faced some issues with this item during the past moth some before the Firmware update and some after. the motion tagging and motion tracking doesn’t sometimes, the voice won't come out when I speke even tho still can hear everything from Wyze Cam, and sometimes it freezing and after the latest Firmware update (4.10.3.108), I find out that the camera Does not auto-reboot when losing WiFi connection and you have to manually reset it every time this happen to me 3 times and every time I had to delete the device from the app and connect the camera as a new device.
title: Need some improvement (disappointing)

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kfo
content: Great camera with great features. Issue is with continuous recording. It will not do it unless you set a event and motion/sound detection. Then it will only record 12 seconds and then wait 5 minutes before it records again. So it is useless for me to use. A lot can happen in 5 minutes, bad idea. I wanted it to continuous record without setting the motion/sound detection. Support was no help as they just sent me pat answers to my questions and concerns. Another issue is when I put the SSD card in a computer for playback it only show 1 minutes clips. So it is very time comsumming to look at the video.
title: No continuous recording

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: C. Kenyon
content: A few months ago I ordered two Pan Cams, two V2 Cams with sensors, and two four packs of Wyze bulbs. I've been extremely happy with all of it, pretty much the best home automation stuff I've used and at an awesome price, but there was one problem. A few months after I bought and started using it one of the pan cams started randomly dying. Unplugging and plugging it back in would usually get it back online, but the problem was getting worse over time. So I contacted Wyze directly, wondering if it was maybe a bad firmware update or something else that possibly could be fixed. The Wyze representative asked me to do some diagnostic stuff, including one thing I hadn't thought to try, and it turned out that one thing seemed to get the cam back online. I sent an e-mail back to them, telling them what had happened, thanking them, and figuring that was that, but then I got an e-mail back telling me that what I'd tried and worked indicated that the cam had an unrecoverable hardware fault and they would be sending me a new pan cam to replace it. A few back-and-forth e-mails to get my snail-mail address and such, and a few days later I had a new Pan Cam to replace the old one that was, indeed, still acting funky. Good products, easy to use, very good at what they do, and a company that backs their products when things don't work as they should. Couldn't ask for more than that. Highly recommended.
title: Impressive support

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: AndyMan517
content: Right from the get go they connected to the wifi and after just a 30 min it started losing connection and spinning backwards and staying stuck there.  I reseted it back to factory and started the process all over again with the same problem error code 42 and two other ones such as power cycle camera.  First try yo contact Wyze was great and sent me a new camera with same problems. After that emails stopped and no more contact. basically after reading multiple blogs about these cameras everyone is have the same problems and Wyze is washing their hands of everybody.  The regular V2 I have never gave me a problem until just now I sent my son to power cycle that to see if we can get that working now.  I was really excited after owning China brand pan cams like Digoo but sadly no luck with these.  Ps cameras will show 98% wifi connection yet app doesn't connect.
title: Impossible to keep connected

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: E.P.
content: First time buying A security camera -so i only have experience between this model wyze Pan and the other wyze cam model for $25. So i have only owned this for 1week..so far Likes: Very impressed with the packaging! Its like a high end expensive product. The actual WyzePan360 camera itself has a good weight to it-material doesn’t feel cheap. I am Really surprised and impressed with the quality! — video quality is really good —mic works better and clearer than the other Wyze seccamera ( you dont have to hold down the mic icon -their other model you have to hold it down as you speak) but with this one you only tap and untap -havent set up the motion alert yet since i use this mainly to monitor and check on my kids -love that it can give me a view in our living rm all the way to our kitchen since it can rotate 360!! - the tilt/pan control is very responsive!! In fact so responsive that you have to be careful and tap only little by little I LOVE This Wyze model! I havent found anything yet that i dont like about it. Really awesome purchase for less than $38!!
title: GreatQuality All angle 360 view security camera for $38

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J. L
content: Bought this camera because it claims to have xx days of free cloud storage, and the super nice reviews from over 18k users. Here is what I got out of it. 1. Very disappointed to find out that the cloud storage is limited to 12 seconds clips triggered by motion/sound detected. And it has long delay before it makes a second detection. What can a 12 seconds clip show you? You see someone approaching your house, and that's it - you don't know what the guy does. Watch the ad selling their Complete Motion Capture service in wyze app and you will know what I mean - basically useless. 2. Pan/tilt stepping angle is limited - it doesn't go to whatever angle you want. You can't tune the position in small steps. My 10+ year old foscam overperforms. 3. Noisy motion. It must use very cheap motors. Again my 10+ year old foscam does much better. 4. Exposure in night mode is weird. If you have some light on, you will see bright area around the light in the live stream. If you turn the light off, that area is still bright! Absolutely this is not expected, at least not acceptable for my application.
title: Wrong choice if you expect free cloud storage.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Desertsweeper
content: I bought this a year ago and then before I could use it,moved house. Finally unpacked it from its original packing to set it up and the first thing it wants to do is a firmware update. Fair-enough - let it do what it wants to do. Never recovered. Performed the manual firmware procedure advised in their trouble-shooting section. No joy. This thing is a waste of plastic junk now. And if you google this rpoblem you will find I am not alone in this issue - many have suffered the same fate with this. Avoid unless you like pretty white boxes that do nothing
title: Bricked on first use

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: lynnette seybert
content: I first bought one of these when I lived alone in an apartment on a college campus. Since then, I've bought a second one and never looked back. Reasonably priced and so many customizations you can make with how it records activity plus there's updates to the firmware a lot so it's always up to date. I set it up with a two factor safety which makes me feel better. I've seen people's cameras getting hacked and that made me nervous way back when. With the two factor, anytime someone new accesses your account, they need a code which can be sent to your cell phone and without that code they can't get in. Ive been very happy with my wyze cameras and how I can keep an eye on my home when I'm away on vacation or just away from home.
title: Awesome

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: N A K
content: After being fed up with people who let their dogs take dumps in my front yard I decided to invest in a cam. I looked around and was debating on this or a Ring cam. I'm not very handy so I wouldn't have been able to install a Ring cam on my own. The Wyze seemed to have good reviews and wasn't going to break the bank. It was pretty easy to set up and the app is great. I use it in my front window and the sensitivity is good that it picks up motion across the street as well. I can also pan it around to check on my dog while I'm at work. The notifications are great and they come in pretty quick. The only improvement I could suggest is allowing the user to make the speaker a little louder when talking. Not really a big deal but it would be nice for when my dog is barking or I need to tell her to get off my bed. Other than that I love it and I plan on getting one or two more. Edit: June 13, 2020 I really really want to like this cam but lately the ‘view playback’ feature does NOT work. It’s very frustrating when there is an event I want to see but cannot watch it because the cam didn’t record it. I googled it and it seems to be a very common feature and other users have said to restart the cam. Well this is all fine and good but the cam won’t playback anything from before you restarted it. Why is this an issue and WHY does it keep happening?? From what I can tell it’s not something the folks at Wyze are addressing or seem to want to fix. It’s kind of crap, honestly. The cam is supposed to hold two weeks worth of video but it doesn’t.
title: View playback stops working after after a few months. Save your money and buy something else.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: K. Webb
content: I tried other inexpensive security cameras, but none worked well, and none had any of the myriad of features this one has.  It's like the regular Wyze camera, but it can be set to follow and track motion, pan the room, pan just parts of the room, stop and record certain areas before moving on, and more. On addition, just like tje regular Wuze cam, it can be I can set it to alert for noise, or motion, or motion in just part of the viewing field.  I can set the sensitivity of both, set it to alert or not, to have night vision or not, or auto.  It has a microphone, and it saves several days of video to the server and my SD card.  It even does time lapse if you want. Additionally, the app is very advanced, amd works flawlessly, and WYZE is an AMERICAN company, with customer service in the US, so it's easy to communicate with them.  Furthermore, the Wyze forum has areas for suggestions, peer help, upcoming improvements, and customer service, and they really do take the suggestions and problems of their customers seriously.  New ideas and improvements are largely from their customers.  How cool is that? This is a great little startup company, and I hope very much that they continue to improve, and provide excellent products and service at a price regular people can afford.
title: Best camera under $100

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Frank W
content: WYZE is what I call innovative technology and the best thing about it...your not paying some insane price for it. I am a firm believer in NOT paying mortgage prices for technology because it changes so #@*# fast! I've only had this camera for a short amount of time (A few days) and, I am already giving a review on it. I usually like to wait 30 days to get a full product review, but this doesn't need a total 30-day wait because of the price. This camera comes with many excellent features that I think all cameras should have like manually recording, motion detection recording, time-lapse recording, 2-Way Talk/Audio on and off, motion tracking. Now, I have been looking for a security camera that could record manually as well as motion detection. Just having those two recording options was enough for me. The time-lapse recording was a bonus. There are different situations you need to record things: You might be watching the camera(s), and you see something of interest, so you manually record it. Then, you have motion detections which will record ANY movement, and lights turn ON/OFF, trees moving, shadows. This feature works excellent. I have the camera in the kitchen window overlooking my car. I would say my car is about ten feet away from the camera. So, I can pretty much hear the activities or conversation going on around my car. The bonus part about this feature is that I can also chat with my wife while she is in the kitchen and I'm at the computer desk in the bedroom(50 feet away). The features keep getting better as I learn about this little inexpensive camera. The most awesome features are "MOTION TRACKING" and "MOTION TAGGING." I didn't recognize the features by name which is a surprise seeing I watch TED TV and a bunch of other tech channels. Well, I set both the motion tracking and motion tagging and went on about my business thinking no more about it. It wasn't until I went to get in the car that I saw the camera following me as I walked around the car. THAT BLEW MY MIND because I was there watching Ted TV or Youtube when they first discovered this technology, and I said wait they are going to charge insane prices for it. It's a good thing I didn't bet anyone about the cost...LOL! WYZE my hat is off to you and your TEAM. You didn't do what many other companies did with new technology and trust me, and I know what it takes to program a camera/device to track motion. Tracking is a form of AI on a fundamental scale. I am looking forward to seeing future features and products from you. WYZE Team you outdid yourself. Thank you!
title: Not what I expected

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: CMC Ohio
content: We have been using this to monitor the front door and the driveway from our bay window for a few months now. Set up was a breeze. Where it is positioned, we can get the walkway, door, drive and street beautifully and then spin it to catch the yard and "upper" part of the street. It responds nicely and the night vision is quite good. It has never dropped the wireless signal, not once! My issues are that unlike another camera that we had to return for dropping the signal all the time, only one account can sign onto this camera and be able to use the full program. You can "share" it with your spouse or children, but they do not have access to any features besides watching and seeing very short clips of events (motion alerts). Also the white color is a large issue at night as you do have to deal with some reflection issues in the glass. I solved that by building a paper housing for it (black, of course, and yes it looks really bad, LOL!) so that the camera itself does not reflect. Also, it needs positioned in such a way that the infrared lights do not reflect - just a slight angle does that very well. We have had no false alerts which is amazing!  Playback is a little clunky and hard to work with until you get the hang of it (and truthfully even then) and the fact that it will do only one alert in a five minute period seems weird, but you can still go to playback to get the video. I love the fact that you can set an alert zone so when we do have it aimed more at the drive than the sidewalk, we can set it to not pick up the neighbor's activity but if you want to watch something else it will revert back to the original position in 15 seconds if the defined alert zone is set. So there are a few issues that need worked around, but all-in-all it is much better than the large number of cameras we tried in this price range (and it had the lowest price tag - go figure).  I love being able to check on the house or know when packages arrive when we aren't home. When someone we didn't know came unexpectedly the other day, even my husband who was at work knew it and called to see if everything was ok as the camera alerted as the guy walking up the driveway. I could see him through the camera before I got out of the chair. I liked that security. Oh yeah, you can see the pizza guy coming, too - an added bonus to be sure! LOL!!! If the software was a tad better (playback and ability to load two accounts to one camera with full access) and it was in black this would be a five-star camera hands down!!
title: Not a bad little camera!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Momof5
content: We like these cameras.  We have 1 setup at both our outside doors.  Pretty simple to set up and can view away from home anytime.  You recieve alerts to your cell phone if you have movement detected.  We had 1 go out due to lightning but was able to replace quickly.  Note: when you set up a new camera after having one go out, we had to uninstall app and reinstall on our additional phones to pick up new camera.  It would work fine on the 1st phone on install but additional phones or tablets it waWe like these cameras.  We have 1 setup at both our outside doors.  Pretty simple to set up and can view away from home anytime.  You recieve alerts to your cell phone if you have movement detected.  We had 1 go out due to lightning but was able to replace quickly.  Note: when you set up a new camera after having one go out, we had to uninstall app and reinstall on our additional phones to pick up new camera.  It would work fine on the 1st phone on install but additional phones or tablets it was just as simple to uninstall, reinstall app and then just sign back in.s just as simple to uninstall, reinstall app and then just sign back in.
title: Nice reliable camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: eroduc
content: Great WiFi camera. We use it to check in on the pup throughout the day. It was recommended and thought for the price it wouldn’t be much of a loss of it didn’t work well. I can tell you that this camera has features that some more expensive camera do not have. The image quality is really good even if this was bought at a higher price point. The ability to remote control the camera position is great as well as the 2 way communication. If you have a good WiFi connection you will have good results with the Wyze cameras. Another cool feature is that the app allows you to group cameras together which allows you to set up outside and inside cams or different homes if you have a vacation home. Once you set up one camera the rest will be a piece of cake.  As great as it is there are a couple of cons. A couple of the cons include instructions that non tech folks may find a little lacking and there is motor noise when the camera is moving and you’re listening in. Not a deal breaker but I wouldn’t use this version as a baby monitor. They do have other models that are not motorized and give you various mounting options so noise from the motor is not an issue. Those cameras are about 25 bucks and the night vision works extremely well. All in all I gave it the 5 stars because it does everything it advertises. Are there better options? I’m sure there are dozens out there but these guys put out a solid product with web servers that are based in the US, the ability to set zones for motion detection, programming for when to record, and the inclusion of a micro sd card slot for recording.
title: Great Camera especially at this price point.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: kdoodle
content: revised 2 weeks later: Randomly stopped working with an error, attempted to reset the device multiple type and nothing happens. Returning. Original Review: I have the camera in my front window so that I can see both my car and the front walkway up to the door. It often does not detect the people coming up, and when it does it will send me an alert about 2 mins later. Which defeats the purpose of having it watch for people coming to my door. Additionally it constantly is detecting the wind moving the trees and shadows from the trees.
title: Often doesn't detect the people but will alert you to a tree shadow...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: hollee
content: Yes it's 1080p as long as you don't zoom in on anything. I have a 17 foot driveway and if you zoom in on a car on the end of that driveway it becomes a complete blur and you can not read the license plate. I tried it in all kinds of light situations. If your own Mother stands at the end of that driveway you could not identify her. Same goes for the Microphone. You have to be real close and speak loud and clearly if you want to hear anything. But the biggest drawback is that it doesn't have a scratch feature. So if you have a memory card installed and you try to find anything in playback mode you have to bring a Mountain of patience. To get precisely the moment somebody walked by your house is complete Luck. You can of course just watch the playback in real time which means you have to stare at your phone for 24 hours or more (depends on what you're looking for). But if you should find what you looking for and want to zoom in you can't hear or identify the person anyway. If, however, you just want to have a general view of your Porch or Living room then it's good enough.
title: Fun but useless

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Misty
content: I got this to make sure my senior dog wasn't hassling my crated puppy while I was away from home. I am blown away by the picture and sound quality for such a cheap device. (Had to share pics to show the clarity, so please excuse the messy house! I wasn't planning on posting them to the internet when I took them.)  The pan works great. It does make a faint sound when it swivels around. You wouldn't notice if you had any other noise in the room. But at first my puppy did lift his head and look every time I panned the camera. The zoom is also great. (Zoomed pic is in SD instead of HD because my connection isn't the best right now.)  I can hear clearly when someone is talking in the room. On the negative, when someone using the app tries to talk to the room it is difficult to understand. If that is an important feature for you, this isnt' the device you need. If you were trying to sneakily spy on someone, the panning would definitely give you away as the whole unit spins on a base.  There are several added features, like motion tracking and time lapse, but I haven't used any of them so I can't comment. Attached pics are screen shots from my phone. I just realized there is a "Take a Photo" option which I also haven't used.
title: great value!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ARM
content: The Wyze 1080p Cam Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera, Night Vision, 2-Way Mic, quality is much better than expected. The camera operating in scan mode is noisy but being able to scan 360 degrees works great if one needs the option. I reset it to one position after operating for a week in a 4 position scan mode to eliminate the noise. The digital zoom is helpful but does not provide much detail. The Mike receives sounds well and the set up options are easy to learn with excellent control.The Wyse cube camera is less expensive, smaller and provides nearly same functions without rotation is an excellent camera for the cost. I installed a 128GB micro SD in both cameras instead of the recommended 32GB which are recording well but do not know if the full capacity will be used or if the camera overwrites before the sd is full.The cameras were readily available at Home Depot and less expensive than some online retailers, but I chose to get it through my trusted amazon
title: Trust

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jessica reuter
content: $35 and this thing seems like a steal! Mine just came in today. leaving town for awhile and needed something to keep an eye n the place. so far its pretty great. was a little hard to connect to my network but a little patience and persistence paid off. so far my biggest issue is the fact that it must be plugged in constantly to work. (if your electricity goes out so does your cam) they do provide a fairly long cord so thats nice i guess. overall im pretty happy with it. i unplugged it and plugged it back in and it auto connected to the network which is also nice. as of right now, i would definitely recommend, will update if my mind changes after my trip.
title: NO INTERNAL BATTERY

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Gerry Lewis
content: This is a high resolution sophisticated camera driven by well designed and maintained software. The camera is designed for indoor use but there are several reasonably priced enclosures available that are designed specifically for this model that permit it to be used outdoors as I wanted to do. I got the silicone cover and it fits perfectly and protects the camera without interfering with its operation. The camera supports pan and scan movement. I won't repeat all of the specifications that are readily available in the description but I'll say that this is a well thought out design packed with useful features. It's worth mentioning that this camera's movement is fast. Some cameras I've tried before turn slowly so you might miss the action your trying to see. Combined with the Play Store available application, it can serve a wide variety of needs. It is supported by Amazon's Alexa so it's as easy as saying "Alexa, show me the (name) camera"  and the live picture appears on your Fire TV; saying "Alexa stop" returns you to the program you were watching. There are a variety of tracking options including motion,  person, and sound. I found it easiest to experiment with the settings to find the best way to invoke the 12 second video that it records onto an SD card which you supply and insert; I'm using a 64Gb card. There is also a recently available paid but reasonably-priced option to record longer videos. You can share the camera with anyone using the software but be aware that if you use the notification option, it will notify the shared people as well. I hope they make this configurable in an update because in my case, my friend one thousand miles away needn't receive a notification every time someone pulls into my driveway. I hope they make it so each user can receive notification or not. The software application available on the Play Store is great. It is highly configurable so you can tweak the settings to fit your needs. The camera is easy to set up and connect to your WiFi and doesn't seem to have problems staying connected. Also, the base is easy to mount and the cable is connected so that it doesn't interfere with the pan and scan motion. Generally the whole unit is well built and seems like it will last a long time. All things considered - the excellent price, configurability, support, and build quality - I recommend this camera.
title: Great features and quality

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: redpat2061
content: I contacted Wyze support who advised that motion tracking doesn't happen in the camera but in the Wyze cloud. And at the moment motion tracking does not work for pan cams. Their engineers promise they are working on it hard but have no timeframe to have the problem corrected. Without motion tracking the cam doesn't know where it needs to pan. Seems like a fundamental flaw. I have a regular wyze cam v2 in the same room as the pan cam and it tracks motion just fine. So I'll keep that one and return this. Recommendation to Wyze is for the next generation to put the motion tracking on the camera itself so the camera can keep doing what it's supposed to do when offline and when their servers take the week off.
title: Motion detection does not work

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Dennis Fox
content: After shopping around for a camera to monitor our dog in the apartment, we bought this Wyze camera.  It works excellent.  I may even buy another one for a different room.  We use it with an old Android phone and with some new Iphones.  For a little while, I noticed the frame rate on the Android didn't seem right, with about eight seconds of lag.  However, the app developers are actively maintaining the app and I downloaded an update that made it work just as well as the iphone app.  Our dog had a barking "problem" after we moved to a new apartment, because he was so scared.  When we trained him, we needed a way to make sure everything was still ok.  We play some quiet music and leave, then watch the camera and listen to the audio stream.  If we hear the music playing and no dog barking then we know all is well.  Good thing because our neighbors were getting angry.  This camera was a life saver for us.  It has pan/tilt and can be set for 360/720/1080 which is great.  At 360, the lag time is only about a second or so.  At 1080, faces are easy to recognize.  Whoever designed this camera and the cellphone apps is a genius and did a great job!
title: Works as advertised, no messing around.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: E from Cali
content: Like many, I was very skeptical at first. I did my research and was going towards an Ar*o or Ri*g wireless camera set for inside. However, I got discouraged w/ both brands because I read many, many reviews on how over a period of time it gets annoying having to recharge. I read very positive reviews about these little guys and I must say I was impressed but thought it was 'too good to be true.' To begin, the fact that it was not wireless or meant for outdoor use was a huge turn off. But then I thought about the locations where I would install. I took a chance and ordered 2 of the regular wyze cams and 1 of the pan. I couldn't be happier. For less than $120 I got 3 cameras and extra mounting hardware for a secure install. So far, I've had them for over 8 months and I'm satisfied. As you can see from the photos, I drilled a small hole through the inside of the cabinet for the cord to run down and reach the outlet. Because I installed the pan cam at this location (see photos) I have a complete view of my entire living area (I only showed a portion but it rotates all around) including the front door. The angle on my garage with the regular wyze works well too (excuse the mess :). You can't beat the price for it's functionality. Bottom line, it's a good camera to have inside and innexpensive. And even though I read some people's reviews on outside installing I really don't feel like drilling holes through my walls in order to do that. I can't wait for these guys to make an outdoor camera. With that being said I do own a Rin* camera doorbell and floodlight but I paid almost $400 for those two items. If you want to save $ on an inside camera then, this is it. Outdoors- that's another story.
title: Surpassed expectations for an inside camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: rds
content: Bought this Dec 2018, now it has been malfunctioning and I put off troubleshooting malfunctions due to you can't talk to anyone, just send messages, so I put it aside until after the holidays. Wrong, now it's out of warranty. I thought I would be a happy user of Wyze products with another pan cam, six v2's, as many micro-sd's, four bulbs and the sensor starter pack. Now I'm second guessing going with this brand, since when something goes down such as power or wifi, it is a real pain to restart everything. And if you are away, you cannot restart remotely,I have spent extra $$ to get after market mounts and different length cables.
title: pan won't connect anymore and make screeching sounds.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Sean S.
content: It’s decent product, decent quality (minus night vision), why 1 stars because you can not view multiple cameras live at same time. You have to click on each camera and wait till makes a connection (at least  4/5 seconds depending on your WiFi signal) this is somewhat a deal breaker for me. I have been trying to get use to but it keeps disappointing me when I need to see something right away and have to wait 5 seconds for it to load up by that time the person or whatever I am trying so see is out of visible area. Other than this everything works good but I will be looking for alternatives that allow me see all camera live at same time once logged onto the app.
title: Can’t view live with multiple cameras.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: BR
content: Updated 11/19:  Amazon made good on their product and immediately shipped me another that has been working fine.  My favorite feature is just how quick this thing connects when I want to view through it.  It's way better than my Ring and I wish I could put it in a window to do what the Ring does.  I tried it, but there are some interior lights I guess which reflect on the window and all I get is glare.  Nevertheless, I bought it as a nanny-cam and it's been perfect.  There are a myriad of features and making little rules like when to notify you depending on time of day, person, etc, but I only use it to send me a notification if it detects motion during the day while the house is empty to check on the kids if I'm running late.  I've been able to communicate with them through the speaker/mic system and the sound is adequate enough to get the job done.  I have a micro Xd care for it which I recommend.  Bottom line:  I'd buy it again and recommend it for others. Previous Review:  Camera and app work well and are easy to set up and use, but tilt feature broke within first 30 seconds.  I'll update product rating if manufacturer does what their supposed to do and sends a new one.
title: So quick to connect

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: xeero
content: I had a hard time connecting to the camera device from the Wyze app on my Android phone.  Sometimes when pairing over wifi, I disable the VPN app that's usually running on my phone.  I'm not sure if this made the difference, but eventually I was able to connect to the camera. Overall, the camera works great, especially for the price.  It indicates when it detected a person as part of the status of the recorded video "event."  It does get triggered by swaying tree branches, and during sunsets if the sunlight is momentarily blocked by same swaying tree branches. One rather big negative is that it seems to ignore any events (e.g. motion or sound) for a 5 minute period once triggered.  So, if the camera gets activated, it will record for 12 seconds (the default free duration) and then will not pick up any more video until 5 minutes goes by.  This to me can be a big negative as a LOT can happen in 5 minutes!  My Arlo Q will record a new video snippet within a minute timeframe.  I like the Arlo Q better, but that camera sells for around $150 at the time of this writing.  This Wyze camera is a good secondary camera to have around.
title: Good value

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Michael
content: I was drawn in by the price point and the lack of subscription feature but a bit hesitant because of some of the negative reviews. I bought this to check on my cats while I was at work. Wyze app also works with Android emulating devices on a computer so you can check on your computer as well. Here is my unbiased opinion after purchase in September of 2018. THE GOOD: 1) Installation is super easy, video quality is crisp and night vision mode is good enough to see most things clearly. 2) You CAN check on your camera any time with any wifi or mobile data. I read a lot about people who could only see the video on their phone if connected to the same wifi, and that is not the case. 3) The fact that this camera can rotate (and you can control it) is pretty neat, it has almost 360 degree vision. 4) Notifications are pretty nice and convenient. You can also toggle the sensitivity of the camera as to what triggers a notification. You can also have the notification feature on at only certain times, so that you're not bombarded with them when you're already home. 5) The developers really seem to listen to what the people want, and they patch up the software so that they give the people what they want without any added cost. Pretty cool! THE NOT SO GOOD: 1) My biggest gripe is that the camera can be too sensitive. My only example is the light coming through the curtains from my sliding door to the patio. If the the light is shining through a slit, it kinda looks like it's blinking - like the flame on a candle. That sets off the motion sensor and the camera keeps focusing on it, which makes the camera notice it more, leading to a vicious cycle where the camera just fixates on the light without getting much of anything else. If I tone down the sensitivity, it just misses everything so I have to decide on getting what I want along with the occasional fixation on the curtains or no movement detection at all. 2) The talk function is pretty bad. There is a speak function where you can talk into your phone and it plays on the camera, but the quality is pretty awful so it's not worth trying. Likewise, the sound quality received from the camera is not great either. Not a deal breaker for me personally since it's not a feature I was particularly invested in. 3) When the camera turns, it's actually pretty loud. My cats eventually got used to it but it was very startling for them initially. Overall, it does most everything I want and for the price point, it deserves 5 stars.
title: Better than expected

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Nick
content: Everything about this camera and company is spectacular! The picture quality is excellent. All of the features are amazing and well designed. This US-based company should be a model for others. Their products are affordable and extremely well built. The companion app is extremely well designed and functions flawlessly. They routinely update the camera's firmware and the app itself to add features, and correct problems as found. The features are comprehensive including but not limited to: 2-way talking and listening, night vision, remotely control camera (tilt and pan), sound detection (all sounds and will notify you if it hears smoke or CO detectors going off), motion detection (all motion as well as AI driven person detection), motion tracking (the camera will actually pan and tilt itself to follow motion) among, continuous recording as well as event recording and storage when motion or sound is recorded. Highly recommend this camera, and their other products as well!
title: Highly recommended product and company

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Den
content: Upon watching and reading some reviews. I decided to purchase the WYZE Pan cam. I had no difficulty setting it up. I placed it in our den to assess its quality and dependability. It worked as it was advertised. The recording image was OK but, didn’t expect much more from  a camera at that price. The motor sound was a bid annoying but for monitoring my home while I was away that would not really be an issue. But, the reason I returned is was I had no faith in it. I attempted to access the WYZE when I was away from the house several times and I was unsuccessful. I attempted look up a solution to this problem. The answers I received were delete everything and start over etc. The bottom line is I had no faith in its ability to do the job I purchased it for. To fair, I was just not willing to go through what was recommended to correct the problem. I decided to return it and buy a Blink. I own three right now and I am very pleased with them. No glitches!
title: The reason I purchased the WYZE was to monitor the inside of home when away and it didn’t.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Calen Said
content: Update: Wyze customer service reached out and decided to replace the cam with a refurbished one. It arrived promptly and was easy to set up. It’s been working properly so far. Died. After one year and half. I reset the router password and tried to reset the cam but it refuses to scan the QR code. Tried all the trouble shootings and spent hours with their tech support and they were completely useless. They refused to replace the cam because it is now outside the warranty. Do not waste your money on this garbage cam. Buy one from a reputable company.
title: Cam died after update but received replacement

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Hilary
content: 2020 UPDATE: I contacted support and let them know the multiple issues I was having (poor pairing, bad motion tracking, constant noise from one camera's microphone). They asked for a video recording, and heard the noise one of the cameras was making and they promptly sent me a new one. Since then, I've been able to pair the cameras with no issues and they're both working well. My only real complaint with them is that I wish they recorded a few seconds earlier, when motion is first detected, rather than when a person is already all the way inside the door (example: it never records the door opening, only someone walking into an open door and then shutting it - then it won't record motion again for 5 minutes). 2019 original review: I purchased 2 pan/tilt cameras. I installed 1 upstairs and it worked great for 3 days, when it was the only camera. Motion tagging and motion tracking worked without fail, I was getting proper event notifications, etc. However, when I installed the second camera downstairs, everything started to get buggy. Motion tagging and tracking does not work at all on the camera in the basement, and now only works about half the time on the camera upstairs (I did not change any settings upstairs, and the settings downstairs are identical). I’ve updated, restarted, deleted & reinstalled devices, etc. Will not work with 2 cameras no matter what I do. 2 cameras was the entire point of ordering these, so I’ll be returning.
title: Good value

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Huey
content: Only records for 12 seconds when motion or a person is detected and  you can not adjust the recording time. If someone breaks into your house the simply can take the camera with them and won't have to worry about what was recorded on the memory card. The picture quality is also pretty poor. I would not recommend this camera to anyone because it is clearly not a good security camera. Another thing I dislike is the fact that it is and sticks out like a sore thumb. Avoid.
title: Disappointing Camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: The Dude
content: Upon receiving the product, I've unpacked it and followed the enclosed instructions. Downloaded the Wyze app for Android, created an account and added the Wyze Cam Pan. Plugged in the cam and followed the Wyze setup prompt. I was supposed to hear the required audio/voice prompt (Ready to connect" after pressing the "SETUP" button for 3 seconds. I don't hear any audio/voice prompt that would allow me to proceed to the next step of the setup. I tried several times with no success. Double checked my router settings 2.4 Ghz, WPA/WPA2, camera physically setup next to the router, reset router, factory reset the camera and I still can't get pass the add device/ready to connect portion of the setup. Google searched the issue and no suggested solutions worked. This product is a dud upon receipt. Not buying this brand ever again. Item returned.
title: This camera is a dud upon receipt. Waste of time and money.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: mrdaoyang
content: You really can't beat this for the price. Video quality is good enough. Motion detection is good. I'm not a big fan of the motion tracking though. Motion tracking works good if someone is walking across the room. But if someone is standing in one spot while doing something, the camera moves side to side continuously. Basically it detects motion on the left screen and pans left, then now motion is on its right side and it pans right. Seems like it wants to keep the motion centered. It'll just keep turning left and right over and over not being able to keep the motion centered. I've turned it off for now. LOL! I like the 2 way audio. Nice to be able to hear and talk. I had trouble with the first initial setup. Took a few tries until I got it. But once it's set up, it works just fine. I wish there was a way I can view the live feed from multiple cameras instead of one at a time. But a deal breaker. Overall, I like these little cameras and would recommend them. It's nice to have visuals around the house. I don't know how secure these recordings are when the clips are uploaded to cloud, but I'm just gonna have to trust that they're secure.
title: Great for the price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Josh
content: I want to really like this camera. I wanted a simple setup for cat-monitoring and checking in on the apartment while I was gone. It was easy to set up, the online support and communities are good, and Wyze is bringing great hardware to the cable at an unbeatable cost. Two main issues: 1.) Security - there were some recent issues that allowed Alexa-enabled devices to connect to other people's cameras. Basically a worst case scenario. To Wyze's defence, they very quickly responded and fixed the issue within a day. While they didn't try to cover anything up, aren't exactly advertising the flaw. I realize it was an overlooked bug, but it begs the question of the long term success and security of the technology used to route the camera feeds. 2.) Motion recording. I can't get playback to work right at all - I'm using a brand new MicroSD card, and the image in the app just hangs/is frozen when trying to play back footage. The live monitoring and panning works fine, and I see footage on the scrubber/timeline, so I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong. Still need to look into this. Overall, I'll keep it around for messing around, and at ~35 bucks it might be worth trying... but I'm tempted to return it given the concerns.
title: An easy-to-use camera with teething problems.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: A. Mitchell
content: Love this camera! It follows every move. It's visible, but not unattractive, so I don't mind. I bought it to monitor my elderly parent (and the aides who care for him) when I'm not at home. But it has come in useful for so many other things. If you're hoping no one will see it, then you need to know they'll certainty hear it. Each time it scans the room you hear the camera make a whirring sound. I'm not a tech expert by any means, but downloading the app to my phone and inserting a HD card (sold separately) was pretty easy. I'm still trying to understand how to use the app and all its features. I can see real-time super clear and rewind is also easy. But it takes patience to search by date and to establish settings to your liking. It's cool to be away from home and to have the ability to just open on the app and be 'back' in my living room in real time. I read several reviews and while I also have privacy  concerns, I really don't think someone would find my private life all that entertaining lol. I got over that hack-paranoia pretty fast. Because the ease of set up, great picture quality, and price I would recommend this device 100%.
title: Simple, quality, security

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Dallin
content: This camera is amazing! The main selling point for me was that I didn't need a cloud subscription! It can handle up to a 32gig micro SD card that will store a few days worth of videos. We have ours set to record only motion so we have several days of footage on the SD card. You can view everything stored on the SD card from your phone. It's as if you had a cloud subscription but you just access the video on the SD card even when you aren't home! Great camera. Highly recommend.
title: No Cloud Storage? No Problem!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rachel Iversen
content: I bought this because I had a small pipe leak in my basement that was going to take a few weeks until the repair and I was paranoid my basement would flood, so I set this up so I could monitor the leak 24-7. I have been very impressed with the image quality of this camera, I’m able to zoom in and clearly see a 1in pipe sitting 10ft from the camera, and zoom out and see 2/3 of the whole room! I have good views day or night, and it has a strong connection to my WiFi, better than my phone gets in the basement. The motion sensor is sensitive enough to detect changes in shadows on the ground from clouds/light shining in through the windows. I can select the notification noise and it’s a good window of time to review when the motion detector is set off. This is SO worth the price for the peace of mind I get, and i can save the rest for this pipe repair
title: Great quality, low price, peace of mind

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kuhkies
content: I just caught a man trying to crawl into my open window, the window where the cam pan faces. He was standing literally in front of the camera, no notification. I went up to the window and scared him off.  I checked the events and there was NO CAPTURE.  HE WAS WELL WITHIN THE MOTION DETECTION AREA. the camera didn’t even capture me when I ran outside. I was running all over the detection area and this camera is SLEEPING!
title: COMPLETE GARBAGE

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Susan
content: I was hesitant to purchase this after reading the few less than stellar reviews (among many positive). I'm very happy with it! It is easy to use, and the WYZE app (android) is comprehensive. This camera was a breeze to set up, however it needed at least 4 updates taking 10 minutes a piece. The functionality of this little camera is great and it gives you that peace of mind. The video is crisp, night vision is clear, and sound pickup is sensitive. I'm not sure if it is our internet (it's honestly awful), but there is a 15-30 second delay for live steam. The unit itself does make noise, but we've gotten used to it. Our fur babies were curious at first, but they have since ignored it! We will be looking into getting more cameras to monitor outside, as we are happy with this one! We were recommended by a family member who is also very happy with theirs!
title: Thumbs Up

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tim Yoder
content: I had this product for 6 months and it worked great.  I then switched my internet service to AT&T's fiber service and use their router and modem and it won't connect at all.  I created a separate 2.4GHZ network for it and nothing.  The only way it'll work now is if I setup a hotspot from my phone.  For some reason that works but nothing else does.  I spoke with customer service and they weren't much help.  Now it's a paperweight. Update, got it to work finally after hours of messing around with settings. Not sure how but it's back to being a decent camera for the price again. Back to 4 stars.
title: Can't connect to AT&T router - updated!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ibunt
content: i am changing my review after extensive communications with the team at Wyze. I reached out to the company through their facebook page and that person put me in touch with submitting a ticket to the support team. She, the social media manager, Grendolyn Evans, went ABOVE AND BEYOND helping me, kept track of all my support tickets and merged them all, was very professional and apologetic and very organized. I would give 5 stars for her alone. I am now able to view my live feed from work. i was going to take off one star for the frustration on my part, but the fact the support teams and media teams resolved this problem says alot about the company. I'm pretty impressed. Original Review: I bought this for the sole purpose of watching my dog while i'm at work and ..... i can't watch my dog while I'm at work because it won't connect to the live feed in the app. i tries to, again and again but i continue to get connection error code 0 on the app. It has the most recent firmware updates, it's on wifi, not cellular and no deal. Very frustrating. AND, i paid close to $40 here on Amazon and have been on the website for support where is is sold for $29.99. The quality of the video is awsome. i just wish i could see it more! So far, i havent got much help in the support department.
title: cannot connect to live feed when away

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Enrike
content: I was somewhat skeptical about getting a cam that cost $30 or so, but I said to myself, “WTH! Let’s try it!” I do not regret it. I am actually gonna get a second one. I have a Ring cam for the from door and it works ok, not wowed by it but it does the job. This Wyze cam is much better. It is portable, small, lightweight, has night vision, and it rotates. It also has a slut for a memory card so you don’t need to pay for a monthly/yearly fee to access the videos. You can get the videos right from the camera using your phone. I use mine to keep an eye on my dog who has a back injury and has separation anxiety. We wanted to see how she does when alone at home while we are at work. To our surprise, she sleeps a lot; we taught she was barking and crying the entire time we were at work. Lol. The night vision pics, the house was almost pitch black, and the image is great still. I can use this cam to keep an eye on the garage when I leave it open or such. I recommend it.
title: Wow! For about $30 this camera is amazing.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mommydoc
content: We have had regular Wyze cameras in our home and have found them to be amazing quality and reliability.  Especially for the price!  Well, as satisfied as we were with the regular version, we were very delighted with the added capabilities the Pan version of the camera offered.  We can now survey an entire room ...up and down.....left and right, with one camera.  When on our window ledge, the camera permit us to see all of the room by moving the camera AND by rotating the camera, we can see out the window as well.  We can monitor conditions on our front lawn and front steps using this.  Note: looking outside through the window works fine during the day, at night we get window glare back. We have purchased several of these Pan models and keep finding new uses for them.  The picture is clear and night vision is adequate.  By adding Wyze bulbs to the basement or dark areas, we find we can turn on the bulbs using the app and have color clear transmission from the Wyze camera in what otherwise would be night vision. Would highly recommend this product.
title: Pan version added so much capability

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J.J.
content: I bought this to replace the SENS8 camera I had. This thing is AWESOME! Aside from being a third of the price I paid for my last camera, the tilt and pan features are great. Audio quality and clarity are impressive. The versatility is what I love most though. I can set the camera to pay automatically and select what spots it pans. The user has the ability to adjust the sensitivity so you decide how much movement is enough before you should be notified.  I ended up buying a longer cable because I mounted mine outside of my house. This camera has held to freezing temps, without a loss to audio or clarity of picture. ( I bought a cover for my camera and would recommend one if you plan on mounting your camera outside.) All in all, if you want a RELIABLE, flexible camera at a great price, than this is the camera for you.
title: You can't find a better camera, don't bother looking for one.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: BLynch
content: It’s a great camera for its versatility and overall quality. My issue is probably 75%+ of the time it won’t let me live stream and when it does it skips and makes it hard to hear at times. Also, there are times when I move the camera where I want it and it continues to move back by itself so I’m not too sure what causes that. The picture quality is great if your WiFi is superb and you can use the HD. I have the Ring Pro Doorbell and Floodlight and never have issues with connectivity like this one but I put up with it for the price point and ability to move. All in all, it’s not too bad! If you’re willing to fork out the money I would 100% go with the Ring stickup cam or newer models for indoor use as they are much more consistent video quality but at this price point, this is your best option.
title: Not Bad

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rajeev Varma
content: This is my second Wyze product. First one just stopped working after 6 months. It had power cycle issue. I did everything from factory reset to chaning routers at my home. Customer service was horrendous. I've gotten better support at a DMV. The tech person responded every other day (at best), so I decided to give up eventually.  I still had faith and bought another Wyze product. The night vision and visual quality is fantastic hence an extra star but there is no motion detection even when the sensitivity is set at 100 and push notifications turned on. I reinstalled and did factory reset without any results. This will be my last Wyze product Edit: there was a system update and now motion is being detected and all is well. Updated from 2 Star to 4 star.
title: Customer support worse than the DMV

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mr Josh
content: So easy. So cheap. Amazing. Thank you guys for making this so I don’t have to use an expensive poor quality baby monitor camera. I have this right on top of the baby crib and works great. I have an iPhone dedicated to this which just displays the feed 24/7. And yes it won’t cut out... it only cuts out after 10 mins when using an amazon display device (fire tv).  You also have the option of turning off the night vision in case you’re concerned about the infrared in the baby’s eyes. Pop in a 32gb sad and you get local backup too Update: Two things... 1) wyze had security breech. Google and read about it before purchase. 2) I found that my camera would randomly rotate. Would scare me because of the recent security breach and the hackers etc. then found out it’s because of my sd card causing it to crash. So to fix, pop it into your computer via a usb reader and do a full format as fat32 which will fix the problematic sectors causing your camera to freeze, reboot, and do its random spin. If this works for you, vote helpful so others can get this fix too!
title: Read update for How to fix random spinning of camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Robert L Reynolds
content: This is my first 1080p camera so I don't have a lot to compare it to... Setup is easy, and the picture quality is great. Love that I can log in from anywhere to see what's going on. I've already purchased a 2nd one and plan on buying a 3rd soon. Works great to monitor my dog, and would work great as a baby monitor. Comparison shopping with other products, it was a no-brainer to go with this one because of the ease of setup, ease of use, no-cost cloud access, and quality of the product. Totally satisfied with this purchase! All praise aside, I'm hoping to see Wyze update their software so that I can have more control over when I get alerts for movement. Currently, it only allows setting of hours of the day - I want to be able to select the days so it doesn't alert on when I'm around. Speaking through the camera is not always clear, but that's likely something to do with the internet and not really controllable by Wyze.
title: Impressive for the price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tiffany
content: I bought these cameras to set up along the inside of our business. I had somewhat low expectations but these cameras were well ranked among several indepenent review pages so I thought I'd try them out. The motion tagging and tracking are terrible. I was storing videos to the cloud and not on SD and I had a camera pointing DIRECTLY at our back door and not one single person was ever recorded entering the door. I'd get a recorded event of them a few minutes later walking around the floor. This camera has TERRIBLE motion activated recording to say the least. As a business owner this doesn't make me feel safe or secure that I can't rely on the security camera I purchased, someone could walk in grab whatever they wanted within a few moments and leave and the camera would never record a video. It's currently summer time and the inside of our building isn't always climate controlled. We're based in Oklahoma where temperatures right now are 105 degrees and higher. I suspect this is the reason why they all stopped working at the same time because only after 2 months and I found that all 3 cameras have stopped working. If i can't seem to find a way to fix them I will be finding a different product to buy.
title: All 3 cameras stopped working after 2 months

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: WuttheBuk
content: This is a great security, nanny cam, pet watcher, etc ... camera ~ especially for the price! Even the “super low” monthly icloud cost is incredible!  MY MOST FAVORITE FEATURE OF THE CAMERA IS... You can turn off all recording lights  on camera ... Now that is stealth like! ***UNFORTUNATELY*** MY “ONLY” ISSUE IS...  I permanently keep my “panning” (movement of the actual camera itself) of the camera set to OFF. The reason being: WHEN THE ACTUAL CAMERA IS PANNING/MOVING~ it is loud & if u have it in a hidden location it will move what ever is near it or if on ledge it will fall from the movement. You really don’t need it on unless it’s set up in a position that can record all the way around it ...  Not very stealth like... if I was a bad guy breaking in your house I would be drawn to the sound, look up or towards it, immediately remove the device. OTHER THAN THAT ... * YOU CAN’T GO WRONG!!!
title: Great camera! FANTASTIC PRICE! Easy set up! Just one issue...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Erika Sullivan
content: Got this at the end of August to keep an eye on my devilish pug while I'm gone.  Tonight it started acting funny so I restarted it and it all went to hell from there.  Couldn't get it to link up with the app, unplugged it, uninstalled/reinstalled app, restarted my phone...nope.  Reached out for help and apparently there's some sort of issue with it connecting to google bc of their recent firmware update?  No idea when they can fix it so now I have a useless camera.  It's completely deleted from the app and I can't add it back. OTHER THAN THIS ISSUE... Camera will randomly move to different spot regardless of set zone. Audio feature (when it was working) helped deter naughty dogs Picture quality isn't amazing but...it's like $30 so..... Hoping they get this fixed quick.
title: Worked for 2 months...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mike
content: Quality: it's pretty good, definitely good enough to get a good ID on someone. Only instance I see this not working is if they kick the door down and immediately go into a sprint. Hard to catch FAST movement. Here I have low light (light in another room) and pitch black (couldn't see where I was going). Notification: This is the only reason I have it 4 stars. It's main purpose for me is to notify me any time that door moves. That way I can call the police or rush home if I get the notification. The alerts are good but default it was about 50% reliable. Increasing the sensitivity to about 70, it's now at maybe 85%. I wouldn't want my door lock to fail 15% of the time. App: great! Easy to use. Essentially a remote control. Plus good picture quality with about a 2 second delay on data.
title: Great budget camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Silkychoices
content: CONS: the motion should be less noisy. No 5GHz wifi support. Wish it cam with an additional wall mount. does not send email motion events with attached photo. (it will alert on the app however to the prescribe user account's email address). The camera sharing only allows the access of live stream and not of the local memory storage PROS: Good resolution. Audio is soft but acceptable and usable. Easy to setup on Iphone. Very good range of motion.  The motion tracking feature works amazingly well for a low price point product.
title: good value,

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: davichi
content: Good price, simple to set up. Good quality cameras, but they are still in a beta (testing ) stage and should not have been on the market yet... so many bugs. I have 8 wyze.  They all fails one thing or others. Ones more than others. For example, It does not stay in ‘detection area’ i have set up to detect and fail to return to that set location after motion tracking which it should with in 10sec or so. Also  It drifts off to an Obsolete areas all the time from my Area of Interest. Pan cam way points (you can set up to 4 zones) but They also become obsolete since they drift away from my set areas of scan within a day. Notifications are Erratic...sometimes works other times none. Detection for movements for a person fails more than a 50% of the time. Tracking works most of the time but camera gets stuck at that last tracking position and forgets to return to My area if interest or way points. If you set you cameras to schedule times to turn on or off, for privacy issues, forget it ...do not depend it on that. It fails half of the times. I hate to say so many bad things about this product but i have been in contact with Wyze with all the issues mentioned Above and more, and they can not do anything at this point but to have their engineers to come up with solutions for the future. Like I said, they fail from all the things they claimed to be. And it take too long to connect once you select the camera if it does not fail connect ( trust me it is not your wifi problem as they might claimed to be. I already up graded $$ wifi router and wifi extenders ). At this moment 2of the cameras are fail to connect and says they are ‘offline’ where rest of the cameras use the same wifi are connected without any problem. I bought all the wyze cams , pan cams within last 30 days and i have been busy troubleshooting them with Wyze support team. But no success. If they work as they advertise i would give definite 5 star review. I guess you get what you paid for. My recommendation is that if you must have security cameras from Wyze, stay away from pan cams and just get cams and use them without any scheduling. I was so exited about these cameras but now thet are  just a big headache. In process of returning pan cameras. I will stay with wyze cam  till i can find alternatives. Good luck.
title: Excitement to Disappointment

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tex503
content: So this camera was great, for the first three months or so. The night vision was the best feature (still is). But that's about where it ends. It now seems to have a servo motor problem. It rotates by using the controls just fine, but when it boots up it goes to the far range of rotation and just stays there. You have to use the controls to adjust. Now it won't track motion about half the time, either. It also doesn't recognize the SD card. Well, it's actually had problems with that for a while. You have to reboot the device, or eject and reinsert the SD card frequently so it recognizes it. Motion detection is hit and miss at best. The whole "you have this free for x weeks" things are annoying and frankly confusing. If the SD card feature worked fine, I wouldn't need cloud storage. I'm pretty sure I threw the originals box away, so now I can't use the warranty. Bottom line: I wouldn't buy again.
title: Worked fine, for three months

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: G. Orwig
content: This Wyze Cam Pan seems to have a slightly wider field of view than the ones I bought a couple years ago. Color is excellent, even in low light and night vision (black and white) covers the whole room. Image quality is great in color and very good in night vision. My only complaint is motion detection. The company is currently  "in-between" with person detection having deactivated it at the present due to a license issue, and regular motion detection is unpredictable. We have a light in the room that turns on in early evening and off later on. It triggers motion detection when it goes on or off, but different areas of the room seem to trigger randomly so you can't set a zone. If you turn down motion sensitivity then the camera does not detect a person moving around. The choice is not to put a light on a timer if you want to use motion detection or just put up with a couple notices every day.
title: Excellent value

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Bob Weller
content: Edited review: I was ready to chuck it during cleanup but instead plugged it in and updated and was surprised to find they finally fixed the problems that I brought up in my review the biggest problems being the camera would not shut off when commanded and would usually fail to start when commanded.
