I have changed rating from 3 to 5 (3 was being real generous) since it really works properly now. Real flaky controls to turn it on and off and setting a schedule are my biggest complaint when you shut it off via the app it does not appear to completely shut down. Same with setting a schedule. When it is supposed to be off it still responds to noise and movement and if you have it send to push notifications it will confirm it is still operating. It's to bad I like the way it looks and when it's running works reasonably well for it's price point, hopefully they can fix these issues. (decided to keep it anyway) The picture quality and sound are decent. Zooming will degrade picture quality but is good enough to make out larger details, this is not unexpected though since it is just an interpolated zoom from a very small sensor vs. an optical zoom which would cost much more money. The night vision has limited range and field of view for small rooms would be fine but very large rooms you would miss out, there again I knew ahead of time it did not that great of range. I sort of fixed the issue of it continuously running by blocking it's signal in my router setting it to a time schedule that appears to disable it. The better way to make sure it is not running is to pull the plug or put it on a wifi or regular timer outlet. I do understand it needs the connection open to recieve commands. But when you shut it off it should give some indication of that like a red light etc. If and when they ever fix the issues will update my rating. On a side note all the servers this device talks to are owned by Amazon.
title: Wanted to like it more.. And now I do!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Robert Crawford
content: I will start with the good. These Wyse cams were cheap enough that I was able to gauge if I liked the idea of security cams. I did, now I will buy something useful. Now comes the bad. The software. It is an app only. There is no way to get it on a PC. As such, there is no way to store the video offsite, well other than pulling out the memory card. The app is very clumsy to use. This isn't helped by the near thirty-second delay between any two events. Watch a car drive by using the Mk.1 eyeball, then in about thirty seconds the app shows that car driving by. So, send a command to the camera, wait about thirty seconds for the command to get to the camera. Then wait another thirty seconds for the resulting image to show on the app.  This would be great fun if I wanted to play "moon-man" however, on earth, it is very annoying. There are great if you want to see if you like the idea of a cam. However,  they are nowhere close to being a suitable long term camera solution.
title: Buy cheap, Buy twice.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Dino J
content: This product is advertised as “works with Alexa”!  Well, that’s true and not true! As of this writing, the camera can only be controlled by echo’s with a screen. And tablets don’t count. The reason you should care is because if you use this at home, you cannot turn the recording on or off with Alexa.  You can’t do anything with Alexa! All I want, is to come home and say, “Alexa, I’m home” and have the camera stop recording, and stop sending me notifications that a person is in the house...  I know, it’s me...  but you can’t add any commands to any routine without an $200 echo show.  It would be cheaper to get a different camera. They say they are working in the feature to turn the canon or off without a screen.  But no idea when that might happen. If it does, I will change my review, but for now I’m not happy with the product.  And it definitely does not work with Alexa as advertised!
title: Misleading Claims

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Finster
content: I bought this camera so that I could see it on my Alexa Show It mentions several times on this page "Works with Alexa" - that was my selling point I could not get Alexa to connect to the camera I researched solutions, and could not get it to work I sent this to Wyze Tech Support: "I cannot connect my Wyze Cam Pan to my Alexa Show The firmware is upgraded to 4.10.2.31 Both devices are on my 2.4ghz internet I used the same login for both the Amazon Alexa app and the Wyze app I can view the live feed from the Wyze app I have the Wyze skill enabled When I ask the Alexa Show to show my "driveway" (the name of the cam), it shows the Wyze splash screen and then says the camera is not responding I've reset the camera, disabled/enabled the skill, renamed the camera, started over, etc. several times" The reply I received: "Unfortunately, this is a known issue between Wyze and Alexa products. We are currently working with Amazon to find out the best way to get this issue fixed." They need to remove "Works with Alexa" until they get this fixed I bought three Alexa cams, and spent 6x what I would on three Wyze cams but they work with Alexa The Wyze cam is such a nice little cam, that I kept it, and put it in a spot where I just want to record/view occasionally
title: Great camera - that does *NOT* work with Alexa

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: mec
content: It worked great go the first 6 months. Asides from the annoying constant whirring noise it made when it scans the room. Then it started producing a really jarring loud buzz sound. At first I didn’t know where the buzz came from. After a few more intermittent buzzing over the next month I realize it came from the wyze camera.  I restarted it hoping it would be reset. Same thing started happening and now doesn’t turn on. What do I do now?
title: Made loud buzzing then died

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Boatwaco
content: We bought 5; they worked great until an iOS app update and camera firmware updates about 2-3 months ago. Now the cameras will not connect to view in the app. If they connect, they drop within 20-30 seconds. I now have 5 useless cameras that I need to find replacements for. You get what you pay for... these are inexpensive for a reason.
title: No longer connects to iOS app. Need to find replacements

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Nate
content: I've been fighting with all 3 of these I purchased for past several months. Been on support, tried everything they asked, but still continue to have issues with playback. Most of the time it's either "No SD card detected" or "No video available" etc....This is really aggravating when we have a babysitter coming to the house and just recently had an incident with our baby choking, I wasn't able to play back the video as there wasn't any. I about literally threw the piece of junk across the room. Bottom line, if you want a RELIABLE security camera, then look elsewhere!
title: Don't depend on them for playback.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Angela M
content: Let’s cut to the chase.. This is a very, very basic camera. This camera doesn’t work at night. It works well enough for wide shots but don’t try to zoom in. Zooming shows a blurry view of whatever you wanted to see. Motion sensor works well, but it misses some things when it works. It doesn’t always catch my cats playing on the ground. I bought it mainly to watch my cats. Don’t pay for Wyze Plus, I made the mistake and won’t pay again. Invest in a micro card and record on that. The Wyze plus recorded twice all day. My husband was home and walking in front of the camera all day. The cats were playing all day. It didn’t catch it. This is a cheap camera both in price and functionality. If you don’t want security, this will do it.
title: Very basic camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Benjamin Jeffrey
content: Absolutely love wyzecam products. This is our 6th camera but first pan version and while our main intention was for security we actually use it more as a baby monitor. If we are doing dishes or laundry and the kids ages 1-4 are playing in the living room this thing is perfect. We can tell the kids not to climb on furniture through the speaker, see at night or during the day, if a kiddo is hiding the face recognition will highlight their head in green if they peak out which is awesome if we cant see them immediately, I love this thing. The only gripe I have about the camera is the motion sensor feature that moves the camera automatically is jumpy. Even on slow it moves too quickly and too much. If a kid stands from a sitting position or even flails their arms around the camera jumps all over the place until the kids stop moving, even if they haven't physically moved from their spot. We just shut that feature off and moved the camera high enough to see the entire room and no more issues. I still wish the software would allow me to save clips to my cell of video by choosing a time stamp or something instead of needing to take out the SD card or record it during playback from my phone. If it had that feature this would be perfect
title: Minor quirk but no camera can compare for price and quality

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: David Daughtrey
content: This camera astounds me.  I have a Logitech Circle Camera. Cost 199.00 and not the features of this Wyze Pan camera.  This camera varies in price from 38 dollars to 59 dollars.  It's a steal at 59 dollars.  The camera pans 360 degrees !  Looks up and down by using your finger on the screen.  They sale a waterproof silicone cover that fits over the camera and then it can be put outside.  Even in  the middle of the yard.  This camera syncs to wifi quickly, every time I add another camera.  NO issues.  I do not understand how they can sell for this price. With the ability to pan 360 degrees and look up and down, activate activate zones, notifications of course.  Only camera I will ever buy again.  Again I have a 199 dolar Logitech circle camera, 299 dollar ring camera, however the ring camera doorbell is a special device that can't really be compared to the Wyze camera, and a Arlo Go, which cost 459.00.  The Arlo Go is a cellular camera, not a wifi so it is different of course.  But the Wyze cameras picture is just as good as the Arlo Go.  Of course the wonderful ability of the Wyze camera to pan 360 degrees is what really makes it special. And the price is insanely low.  I have two Wyze cameras outside, not under cover, 100 percent exposed to the rain and they work fine.  I have two Wyze cameras in my house.  Give one a try and see if youre not astounded.
title: Best and cheapest camera I have.  Pans and looks up and down.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: L. Rose
content: UPDATE 11/06/2019: Well I am back not for my 2nd but a 3rd Wyze Cam Pan.  Great cameras! The second one I purchased, I also bought the black silicone case and mounting bracket ( + longer cable) and have it mounted outside over my driveway.  It has stood up to fierce wind & rain storms- several of them since March of this year (2019).  A family member mounted it for me & drilled a hole through the stucco and we plugged it in to the garage opener mechanism that has an outlet on it. I bought an electric hybrid car last year & installed a charger in the driveway and learned that catalytic converter theft is an epidemic in my area! My car is not a Prius  but still a concern.  I am able to program the cam to alert me to movement in an area that I specify by drawing a little box so if I back my car into the driveway, no reason why anyone should be walking around the sides or back of my car.  If they do, I can yell at them through the camera! Haha! I haven't actually had to do this yet but think it would be pretty entertaining to scare the crap out of someone with bad intentions. Purchasing a third camera for a friend who has a crazy neighbor that keeps trespassing onto her property and doing destructive things in her garden. That's City Living! (Initial review) I will update after I've actually used this camera for a few weeks but it just got delivered about 20 minutes ago and I've set it up already and can view from my iphone.  I'm using it in my studio as a live view doggy cam. Clear picture and very happy. I just have set on a shelf but plan to look at mounting accessories.
title: This Camera Does Everything - Even Outdoors! It's Affordable!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: LS
content: Well, I bought a Wyze camera because it didn’t have a continuous subscription fee like Ring but the reduction in price is really evident in quality. It does not support a 64G micro SD even thought when we first got it, it would work. An update they did made it no longer work. I contacted customer service and though they were responsive, they told me the product officially only supports a 32G micro SD. So the weird thing is that the playback feature would *sometimes* work with the 64G card, depending on its mood, time of the month, alignment of the stars, etc. I finally got a 32G micro SD last week, plugged it in, and the playback feature seemed to be working. So I rest easy right? Last night, we got home late and Amazon notified me that a package had been delivered. We look everywhere and can’t find it. Decide to pull up the good ol’ handy “security” camera and guess what? The playback feature was not recording. Like, none of it, at all, for the past week. Now, I don’t know if I’m doing something wrong but if I am, this UX is awful because it’s not self-explanatory on how things are supposed to record. (Though I’m fairly certain I’m using everything correctly because it WAS working when I first plugged in the new card.) So the first time our package gets stolen, the camera which is pointed right at it is not recording even though it was on and had the correct micro SD card in it. Thanks a lot, Wyze.
title: Cheap camera in both price and quality

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Daniel
content: This thing is so inexpensive, and provides so much bang for your buck.  The only negative I can see right now is in night-mode, the motion tracking is often fooled by the IR illumination that it thinks it's sensing motion when it's just things being washed out from a sudden flood of IR lighting. The motion tracking itself leaves a little bit to be desired in low lighting... my camera often spins 180 and faces the wall while trying to follow something as it walks by. The pan feature also needs some altering, I if I have it positioned on top of some cabinets, it tilts up (to be level) then goes all over the place, usually musing any action that's near the floor.
title: This thing is so inexpensive, and provides so much ...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Big-Z
content: I am very impressed with the easy setup and great quality picture. Within five minutes of receiving the camera, I had it up and running with no problem so I can observe my 3-d printer in action so I  can intervene if a problem develops. It is well worth the cost, in fact a great deal. Picture quality is excellent. I am not affiliated with the company in any way, and I paid full price for the item. This is a real and honest review that I was not paid or asked to write.
title: Well worth the $$

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Patrick Garon
content: yes, the item records video, BUT you are unable to have it record straight to a PC, you also CAN NOT VIEW the video on a PC, it can only be viewed live on a mobile Android of IOS device. So the price now makes sense for it being a PTZ camera. You are able to use an SD card installed to complete "what they call " Constant recording" but it does not work as they state, the item when set on constant recording is supposed to record and overwrite the oldest part of the video when you run out of space. When i set it up, with the setting of constant recording, it seemed to only record when it wanted to, and before anyone says anything NO it was not set to only capture motion...etc, it was set to constant, So this is not reliable for someone that was looking for a 24/7 recording device, that you want to be able to use your computer to store and or view the recordings/live feed. It does not work like a typical IP camera, its locked down with their firmware, So unless you are good with editing/creating your own firmware to have it work to your liking, I recommend spending a little bit more to ensure you have full functionality and access to the device.
title: not really what I was expecting...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Bernard C
content: I've been using Wyze Cam v2 for quite a while now. It has been working very well, and constant software updates make it better and better. The Wyze Cam Pan differs by being able to move the camera angle. The only complain I have is that it has very limited vertical range. I wanted to mount the camera on the ceiling, but I cannot see anything on the floor for probably a 5-6 feet radius because the lens cannot move down enough. I am pleasantly surprised though it can "chase" anything that is moving. As in once the camera recognize you walking, it'll automatically move the lens to keep you in the center of the picture. I like this product.
title: 360º horizontal, but limited vertical movement

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: theDyker
content: I have 6 or 7 of the Wyze cams in my house.  I bought them all from Wyze directly.  I thought I'd try the pan and decided I wanted it in 2 days so I bought it from Amazon. Why I'm rating poorly: 1.  Annoyingly Loud.  Every time it moves.  It draws attention.  zip, zip, zzz zz z zip. 2.  It can't decide to just smoothly follow movement.  Walk in front of it from left to right and it tries to zero in on your movement as if you're standing still, goes left, goes right... as you're walking left.  Then makes a big shift left... tries again... all very loudly. I'm a big fan of Wyze and I actually got on their support but since I bought it from Amazon, and I'm out of the 30 days return from Amazon, I think I'm stuck with it.  I sent a note to their support and they were pretty responsive but they wanted a video if it, when I told them I got it from Amazon I decided for $30 bucks it wasn't worth all the effort to exchange.  It still takes video, and part of my cam swarm, but I've relegated it to the Garage.  And everyone that walks into the garage notices it because zip, zzz, zzz zip....
title: Loud and jittery

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tim C.
content: You can't seem to beat Wyze for low-cost fully functional home automation thinggies. This camera is no different. For about 30 bucks you get a full color, remotely operated, 306 degree view camera that will detect motion, record locally,  and make you a great little peanut butter and jelly sandwich... well, OK, I'm kidding about the sandwich, but the camera is really great. You plug it into the wall for power... it uses a USB-C power supply, configure it to use your home Wi-Fi and you can access the camera from an app on your phone. The app lets you pivot the unit 360 degrees and also allow you to point the lens up and down... all driven by small electric motors!  It is full color, high resolution, and has night vision.  The only down side is that this is strictly an indoor unit. We have ours set up so that it can look inside the house and out the front window. I love it!
title: For 30 bucks I love this camera!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: phoneguy
content: Lots of good features, easy to use app, good quality audio, motion following works well, fast panning.  The problem is everything goes through their cloud, and connecting to live view is hit or miss.  When the servers are busy, it can be impossible to see the video.  It frequently says to power cycle the hardware.  If you turn it off, you may not be able to turn it on remotely. Having a micro-sd card slot is nice, but 32gigs  is way too small, not enough storage for an extended absence.  This thing is advertised as being compatible with Google Assistant, that has never worked, and not sure it ever will. We can only hope Wyze is able to keep providing adequate web services for the lifetime of these devices, otherwise they become doorstops.
title: Too good to be true

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rheingold
content: I have 7 regular Wyze cams. They all work great. But the Wyze Pan Cam is not the same - not even close. It is confusing to set up to pan scan, doesn't stay where you want it to, response to pan is very slow, and the Pan Scan waypoints are a major pain to set up if you can ever achieve set up. Very poor online instructions and the app is of no help. I wish I had not purchased the Pan Cam. It's not-ready-for prime-time. Until it is vastly improved save your money and stress levels. I hope this is not an example of where Wyze is heading - releasing new products while failing to correct major issues with existing products. I am disappointed in Wyze.
title: Flustrating, poor controls, unreliable

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Evans
content: These are simply "something else."  Razor sharp pictures, in camera storage, iPhone storage, pretty close to immediate email notification of movement  or video detection,  (email alerts with playback) motion tracking, pan and tilt, night vision, simply installation....  probably missed some features but it's spectacular for the price. Two "more minor" negatives... - The Pan and tilt motor is very loud in the recording when it moves - There is a noticeably blurring if the subject is moving both day and night.  (more noticeable (more pronounced) at night) There was something else I'll post if I think of it,  but I just ordered 2 more of the stationary ones today for two other areas where I won't need pan and tilt.  I really like them...
title: After buying one of these, I purchased 6 more some for friends

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ivadell
content: We bought based on a CNET review that was probably comped. Does it work; yes It works reliably and quickly. Shortly after having it, within a couple weeks, I was taking down my Xmas tree(we had it set up inside on the windowsill of our living room) and as I moved in front of the camera it started making a racket I turned to see the camera moving up and down in a weird way. Someone had hacked into it and was scanning our living room and watching us. Shortly after I got an email saying the systems had been compromised and our info and security was breeched. I DO NOT recommend this for your interior. I don’t recommend it at all. This system IS NOT secure. If you’re in the market for a security camera I don’t think k this will make you feel safer, to the contrary you will feel less safe and possibly violated.
title: Not secure do not buy ours was hacked

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: TX Sasquatch
content: I just FINALLY finished the setup. Very frustrating trying to figure out the QR code reading. Instructions vague coupled with my 65 year old non-tech brain.....recipe for DISASTER. After numerous attempts to take a QR picture of the QR on the box (Wrong) using my iPhone....then went to a Wyze YouTube help video, I figured out the actual WYZE camera must be used to view the QR code that pops up on the phone setup screen. Not the box.!! (Mistake one) Made many attempts to let the WYZE cam see the phone screen QR....never worked, after several tries. Went online to a WYZE help forum...got an instant resolution-!! On your phone screen, at the QR display...slide the QR slightly higher using your finger.. and this exposes the bottom edge of the QR symbo. WORKED first try!!! I was ready to box up and return it..!!!
title: Having trouble with setup? And QR code reading? Here's the FIX.!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ryan Balowski
content: We use this camera as a baby monitor and it’s the beeees kneeees. We are officially hooked on wyze products.. Pros: Easy setup, first try sync and app setup Excellent WiFi distance in my 3 floor home Motion detection uses pixel movement instead of traditional method so it’s extremely precise in notifying. Sound detection notifies every time App is full of features to fine tune the camera use Have rebooted my network multiple times cause I’m an IT guy and do things, and it never once had an issue reconnecting Motion tracking is very accurate Picture quality is crystal clear and night vision is beautiful I have no cons for this system, absolutely 0 and I’ve tried them all.. blink, amcrest, nest etc.. all junk compared to wyze Just bought wyze smart plugs and I can’t wait to automate my house with these affordable products working happily in one simple beautiful functioning app! Buying anything else is just unWyze :)
title: Look no further, wyze is the present and the future

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rasputin
content: For $36 dollars and a $9 dollar 32 GB SD card, this is a great camera with good software.  The Pan Scan feature which enables the camera to just scan assigned quadrants is a great feature.  The motion tracking works and even follows people walking through an area.  However when used outside it is sometimes  too sensitive and sets off notifications too often and/or misses some people going through an area.  Fortunately you can turn "motion tracking" off or only use it indoors.  The range of the night vision is effective up to 35 feet, but with normal outdoor lighting I'm able to still see over 150 feet. Overall, this is a great camera and software package that integrates with the Echo Show.  I'm going to purchase another one.
title: Low cost entry into video camera's with Echo Show integration.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Wooly Mammoth
content: So as many others have probably mentioned, this is not going to be a heavy duty never fail security option. It's for watching your pets or kids, and that's about it. It does that well. It has glitchy performance from time to time and disconnects from your wifi often. But it usually connects again after 10-20 secs. The camera can pan around almost a full 360* and go up and down as well with ease. So if you put it in the corner of the room in an area where it can see a lot, it's amazing. We can watch our entire family room, a bit into the dinning room, and the bottom of the stairs to be able to watch our dog when we're not at home. Make sure nothing bad happens where we would need to rush home. The motion detection and face recognition are decent but not great. And the microphone is glitchy and doesn't work that well. When you talk into your phone, it comes out of the speaker on a delay and is all garbled up and staccato like. It sort of works, but not great. Overall it does what I bought it for, and that is just to watch our place while we're gone, and watch our dog to make sure nothing happens. It works well for that! Good product in that regard.
title: Pretty good pet camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Barry L
content: SHORT VERSION: Wyze is a up and coming company, already on it's way to giving all those other "smart" companies a serious run for their money.  Wyze started out with it's little box shaped camera, now in it's second version, and includes their incredible valued "Pan."  They are INCREDIBLY easy to set up -- the most you need to know is your router /modem's network password. LONG EXTENDED INFO VERSION: Their product line has exploded in the last year to include "Motion" (the size less than a diameter of a quarter) and "Sensors, also small" - smart bulbs, and smart switches, and a recent announcement to expand their camera line to include outdoor cameras.  Part of their recent growth plan has been extending their products  into Home Depot stores.  You can now see their cameras there, where before you ordered direct or online like Amazon. Their "pan" camera, along with their Wyze 2 (non-panning) camera have excellent image quality, and many software, function features which include a recent facial recognition update.  There are so many software functions to mention.  Their cameras /software SD card slot, include instant notifications, video playback, continuous recording, motion recordings, The company doesn't short you by stopping updates and making you purchase new cameras.  They are ACTIVELY updating upgrading their current product.  Support is responsive, and the growing Wyze community has great ideas that everyone shares. I'm sure I sound like a promo or an employee.  I'm NOT.  I am, however, a consumer excited to see this level of quality and function within a small packed product that you'd not expect.  FINALLY...  big company security monitoring class, and features in a price EVERYONE can afford.  Their dedication to keep their products affordable while competitive can't be matched.  Those "other" smart device companies should be worried!
title: PACKED features for fraction of cost

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Angelita H.
content: I bought this after buying the wyze camera v2 because I liked the idea of being able to turn the camera remotely...my husband had an out of state job and my teen thought he'd take advantage of dad being gone to sneak out. Little did he know, Mom isn't as niave as he thought...I have the v2 in the kitchen facing the door and it's worked perfectly. This one is on my TV stand and I am able to see both doors with it.  As long as I have a light on at night anyway. The night vision is crap, doesn't work at ALL. I have moved it several times and no matter where I put it, the night vision does NOT work. I do Iove that I can peek in on the other kids when I run out on errands and even talk to them if need be. I have no complaints other than the night vision.
title: Okay, not great

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: SM.
content: This camera is such good value! I bought this camera to keep an eye on my dog while I'm at work. It was easy to set up and download the app. I put a memory card in it and it records constantly. When the card gets full it just goes over the oldest video. I can take pictures, review video and easily send them through text message. It also has 2 way sound although its a little muffled. The picture quality is great, but if you zoom in it does get blurry. The motion tracking can get a little jerky because she moves around so much, but overall a very good buy for the price. Perfect for what I needed.
title: Great value

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S. C. Sutton
content: I want to love this product..  I really do, but it is VERY noisy.  It scares my dog, and annoys me.  So far I have not been able to figure out how to train it to follow movement of my dog, which I why I purchased it.  It doesn't follow humans entering my home either.  Not sure how useful its going to be.  Will keep trying but so far.. it is not working as expected.  I am definitely open to suggestions.  I purchased one for my brother (gift) and he is having similar issues.  at this point, I recommend nest cam over Wizen..  but will change my review/opinion if I ever get this one to work.
title: Jury still out on this..  so far not good..

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kyle McAnally
content: Received the item, easily set it up and played around with the functions before turning it off via the app. Went to turn on this morning and the camera would not turn back on via the app.  Went to setup the camera again but it wouldn't read the QR code for wifi access. After trying in vain for an hour to get it working again I've given up and started a return.  Don't see how you can trust this thing as a security camera when Its software is so weak that it stops working after less than 10 hours.  I recommend you find another brand, this camera just isn't robust enough. A little background, I'm a millennial with a technical background with extensive network administration experience in a professional setting.
title: Stopped connecting to WIFI after less than 10 hours

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Steve
content: I was skeptical that a camera this inexpensive could match up to similar cameras from the big names, but I was wrong.  There are plenty of technical reviews on this camera, so I’m not going to do another, but wanted to say your making a mistake if you don’t give this product a try. After purchasing this and trying It I instantly became curious how a company could make a quality product like this so affordable, and still offer free cloud storage— you just don’t find this combination at this price point anywhere else, so I decide to do some research on Wyze. I found a very inspirational story about some young kids mostly who put everything on the line with the goal to make friends, not customers.  Well, the product is really good, and the story just make you want to help them succeed— I’m a fan, and I would encourage you to try it too. Your really have nothing to lose, try it, if your not convinced send it back. I have two in my home now and they have been working well and provide us with a added sense of security when we are away. I would love to see some sort of wireless siren that could be added to the system making it more of a security system, but maybe that will come down the road.
title: If you are looking for inexpensive home surveillance, read my review.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Genee J.
content: I had bought an expensive surveillance camera a while back with the same features as this one. It was  9.99 to save, record and get notifications. I tolerated it. There are some glitches in this app, on occasion. Nothing too serious. I did have trouble with it and/or the camera when I used a "used" micro SD, but once I replaced it with a new one, it was fine. I love the detection settings, detection zone, motor controls, adjusting the sensitivity to sound and motion are a snap, night vision is pretty good for this inexpensive camera and you can turn off the night vision IR lights if you need to place it in a window. The speaker/mic are great! It has an "off" option so you're not using it when not needed. It is a little noisy as it pans and moves. When I decided to subscribe to the service after the free trial it was only 1.99 per camera!!!! That service is much easier to navigate and view than my previous. Once in awhile it freezes and I have to close the app to view the next saved clip but that could have been my wifi. I actually bought this to keep an eye on a new puppy as well as use the speaker. Love it!!
title: Great camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Lorance W.
content: The distance the camera can capture is very short without getting all blurry so for a security cam it's completely useless during the day or even at night. When I bought this cam it also was supposed to give free video clip storage for 14 days before the video gets deleted but that is not the case, apparently now we have to pay a subscription model to get all their previous free features which is fine if they updated this onto their listing prior to doing this sneaky business move. I could look past all of that if the camera actually was good quality, all the good reviews for it made me hopeful only to be severely disappointed. If you are right in front of the camera a couple inches apart then it works but if you are trying to get it to clearly see either objects or pets or even children / people 2-3 ft away then it will show you a blurred image. I made sure to properly clean the camera thinking that could of been the cause but nope it was doing this since I first got the product. I have 1gb/s download speed and 50mb/s upload speed and I even installed an SD card into the device and the video capture quality is just horrible. Setting it up was quick and easy but the app crashes a lot on my samsung s10 so if I was relying on just the live feed I'd be in trouble especially since the rules I set up do not work at all. I set it up so that every morning at a specific time it should of captured a video and sent to the cloud but it doesn't do it at all. I deleted and re-added the rule multiple times to no avail. Not sure if I got a defected product or if this is just the quality one can expect from wyze.
title: Get wyze if you want blurred capture

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: DKO
content: I ordered two of these for a specific application and one of them would not function properly. It would not hook up at all, even after going through all of the recommended troubleshooting. The second one is working fine. It does seem to pick up motion well, but the camera movement is jumpy as described in other reviews. The jumpiness makes reviewing the footage a little difficult. The pictures quality seems to be good, but the audio is not so great on the one camera that I am using. This may be normal or the audio on the working camera may be defective. I will know more when I receive the replacement camera for the one that did not work. I recommend purchasing and using a memory card. Without the card, the motion triggers the recording to kick on, but it only records for 12 seconds. That may not be long enough to get a look at a face or details. Edit: I have been using three of these for a specific application and they are working great.
title: One Worked

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jen H. W.
content: We wanted cameras that could keep an eye on my dad, who has dementia, when he’s in another room. These cameras provide peace of mind that he hasn’t fallen or gotten confused. Pros: - Price - Reliable app - We like that several of us can check the cameras from anywhere, simultaneously or not, at any given time. Wyze cams are a good option when you have a “team” of caregivers. Anyone who is invited can have access. You do NOT have to be on the same wifi. Or even in the same town! - Picture quality is good, night vision is good, sound is good. Cons: - Haven’t been very impressed with motion sensor alerts - I don’t honestly trust that they’ll let me know what’s up. I just keep an eye / ear on the camera images. - Not super discreet. Whole camera moves with pan. - The set-up voice and noises are super loud/jarring. Prob not a problem for most folks, but really not great when you’re trying to set these up quietly and peacefully. My dad is very confused by extra noises and “voices from nowhere.” So that was tricky. All in all, very helpful for our family caring for a loved one with dementia. If you are in the same storm, but a different boat - Blessings to you and your loved ones. Hope this review is helpful.
title: Very helpful caring for parent with dementia

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Blake Johnson
content: This is a highly functional camera for the price. I like that I can pan the camera to face backwards when not it use. I would 100% recommend over the stationary webcam and will be buying another in the future. The daytime mode works great even in the dark. I'm not sure why other reviewers are saying it feels cheap, I think it feels like it was built of quality materials. The bad is if you have the mic turned on, the motor sound from rotating the camera (side to side or up and down) overpowers everything with an unpleasant whirring noise. It is incredibly loud over the air, however if you listen to the camera in person it isn't making much noise. I think this is poor mic placement or poor sound isolation that they should work on as a revision to this camera. If you are away from home in an area with poor wifi bandwidth (good connection but a low bandwidth) the camera will often fail to load and will be very laggy. I do not like hat I can't switch apps back and forth without re-loading the camera. I like to multitask with the Alexa app to turn lights on and off and talk to the animals via drop-in instead of the camera, but every time I want to change something I have to re-load the camera. All-in-all I highly recommend.
title: Exceptional Pet Cam

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Minions Web
content: As far as cams go, image quality beats arlo pro2 in a heartbeat. Of course this is a power tethered cam with those limitations compared to a battery powered tetherless model. I have not tried the new arlo 4k cams, so I cannot give a comparison there. Audio quality is good, interface for the phone works well. Biggest fail IMO is no email notification (with still capture) heck no embedded email notification period) tho it seems possible using a round about process using alexa skill and ifttt - however, there are no ifttt ingredient for still capture regardless of there being a declaration of the ability in the service description. 2nd fail is mSD on board storage - no way to automatically off load video to remote storage. The cams have a USB port but it is for power daisy chain, it does not pass data, so not remote connection to a storage device and no existing solution for automatic remote storage. It has its positive attributes, but the above leaves me rating it 4 stars not 5.
title: Works fine, needs more functionality

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: R. Sherrell
content: First off, I love my Wyze cams!  I bought these because I wanted to have a way of checking in when I'm not home on my dog and to see what's going on if my home alarm system is set off.  I used to pay for Ring monitoring but figured I could do it myself (plus my dog kept setting the motion detectors off on my Ring system).  I use my Wyze cams with IFTTT so that the cams turn on when I leave the house range and turn off when I get home.  The video quality is great, manual panning is functional, and the audio (sound and talk functionality) is so helpful.  I haven't bothered to put memory cards in the cams yet but need to start using this functionality.  I did have IFTTT set up to send alerts when the cam sensed motion but it kept going off when sunlight was causing shadow movements from outside so I had to turn that off - I'd like to see some improvements in that particular feature.
title: Great Cam with a couple of small Issues

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: patrick geer
content: I love love love this  camera ! After buying one "baby monitor" that was horrible i came across the wyze cam pan and saw so many great reviews i had to give it a try and im so glad I did.I must admit i was very skeptical about it being so great for only $37 . Im so glad I bought it in the end ! I actually just purchased a 2nd camera for downstairs ! It does everything it says it does ! The picture is crisp HD even the night vision is great ! I am using as a baby montior because all the actual "baby monitors " suck .So happy with my purchase ! Seriously  buy this camera you will not regret  it !
title: This camera is AWESOME!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JOSH&ALY
content: So, I have 3 of their indoor cams for the kids rooms. The picture quality is great as is the amount of stuff if can fit in the screen. The pan cam is also pretty awesome but is a little noisy. I have no issues with the cam but the app is simply awful. Half the time none of my devices are even on it. I keep closing it and opening it until finally they kick back on. Definitely not a convenient thing to have happen with a security cam when you need to check something right away. Love the cams, app is failure.
title: Cam is good, app is dreadful

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: C Fowler
content: I like all the features available.  The pan can be useful.  Picture quality is very good.  I also like the ability to turn it ON/OFF remotely, although, since it's plugged in, it's something that may not get used often.  The fact that it has to be plugged in, limits my use to inside the home.  I have an older home and the places where I need a security camera, it would require too much work and expense to get electric to that area.  The night vision on this camera could be better.  I am using it in my garage and I can barely see anything at night time via the camera.  It has a lot of features and for the price, it's an excellent buy.  Haven't had it long enough to evaluate long term use, but if night vision isn't a must for you, I'd recommend this camera. UPDATE: 3/20/2020 I contacted Wyze and made a complaint about their IR night vision.  They were responsive and asked a few questions and wanted some information.  After I responded to their requests, within 2 days, I got a message from them apologizing for not having satisfied my needs and are sending a replacement camera at no charge. Now here's a company that truly respects it's customers and will go the distance to make sure you are satisfied with their product.  It is a refreshing experience to find a company that takes customer service seriously.  I would definitely do future business with Wyze.
title: Great features and good picture quality.  Very easy to set up and share with family members.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J Christopher
content: This is a GREAT camera- until you set it to motion tracking.  I got a second one from the company- thinking the first one had a defect.  However - it appears the camera isn't ready for 'prime-time' when you use it in Motion Tracking mode.  That said - the company was SUPER RESPONSIVE.  And as long as you don't try to use the camera with motion tracking...it's fine - but they make a less expensive non-pan version if you are going that route.  When motion tracking - the camera is - ummmm- SPASTIC would be a good word!  Lol.  And if on a wooden surface, generates a lot of noise (all do) when panning.  But again, motion tracking is more like panic mode as the camera constantly makes adjustments - spinning itself left-right-left-right - until all motion in the room ceases.  So that's why such a low overall rating.
title: Fails at 'motion tracking'

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Phoebe H
content: I place this cam indoor in my front living room to watch the comings and goings in front of my house.  I had two attempted thefts on the catalytic converter in my old car that parked on the street in the previous year.  This cam also has a clear sight of whoever comes through my front gate.  Its day-time picture quality is excellent.  Its motion detection is also pretty decent.  However, since my street is pretty busy, I think that this cam tends to capture fast moving cars over slow moving pedestrians. I'd like to see two improvements  - (1)  there is a bright street light in front of my house.  The light from that street light would bounce off the lens of this cam and reflect on the window glass.  The result is a huge glare in the middle of the image. I have tried to position this web cam differently to get rid of the glare to no avail. I wonder whether there is a software fix for that.  (2) because I set it up to watch the street, the motion detection is skewed towards moving cars with headlights than other unlighted objects/individuals.  It'd be nice to allow users to adjust that.
title: A low cost excellent web cam

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Locksmith
content: Installation of the camera is an example of good design. The Wyze app will capture the required Wi-Fi credentials and transmits them to the camera via QR-code. And then, what was the first thing the camera did? A firmware update. This is how devices are supposed to work. I found the image quality to be reasonable, albeit it quickly loses detail in longer distances. The sound quality is somewhat below average. While hearing conversations near the camera in real time, many times the sound is choppy and unintelligible. It seems to work better when hearing the conversations after they are recorded to the local SD card. The camera supports a maximum of 32 GiB SD card for continuous local storage of streaming video. In HD resolution, that amounts to roughly 4 days of video. Capture to the local SD card and to the cloud storage occur independently: the local SD card captures the streaming video or event capture (selectable), and the cloud storage stores captured event clips for 14 days. The manufacturer claims that the device uses end-to-end encryption while sending the streams for storage, and possibly while viewing the streams through the app (the camera utilizes the manufacturer's servers to be able to stream the videos out of the consumer LAN). Using HTTPS, the end-to-end encryption is met. However, it is unclear to me whether the videos are encrypted at rest (i.e., when stored in the AWS cloud) and who possesses the encryption key. Since this is a pan camera, once can move the camera in gradual angles in several directions. Using the Wyze app, one simply needs to swipe over the streaming image to move the camera to desired directions. Excellent. The included USB cable is long, but I did have to purchase longer cables for properly positioning the camera high in the wall and over a fireplace. For the price of this camera and included 14-day storage, it is unbeatable.
title: Superb.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tara
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I got these cams for a critical reason.  My mom is in poor health and my aunt who lives with her has alzheimers.  All these cams do is buffer even at the lowest resolution of 360p.  1)  Internet speed is fine (over 100 download and about 11 upload).  2)  Got updated modem.  3)  Router is fine and firmware is updated.  4)  My internet company does not throttle.  5) I disconnected other wifi things to see if that would help.  6)  My router and modem are literally sitting directly below my echo show.  Many people have made complaints including myself and I guess Wyze does not care as they know but have not bothered to fix the issue.  Attached is a video--a little over a minute long on the lowest 360P resolution.  Highest resolution is impossible and it usually just kicks me out.  Same issue on phone.
title: Does not work

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: TM6
content: I recommended this camera to friends based solely on its price and mine arrived the same day. I immediately set the thing up thinking I should probably get schooled on its use just in case they ask me about it. Cons – No Windows interface… yet.  It won’t look through glass at night due to the reflections but no camera will that I know of. Pros - Viewable on cell phone, you can add a 32gb micro SD in a slot underneath in case the internet goes down. Selectable 1080 or 720 resolution, free two weeks of incident storage on the Cloud-Encrypted storage and rolling overwrite, no-cost and its forever. If my Fire TV is on, I can say Alexa, show me Doggie Cam*, and the picture will switch over to the cam and play any noises its hearing. It has motion detection with a push feature. I “stole” a package off my porch and it immediately alerted my cell phone where I retrieved a video clip. Any Amazon device with a screen should allow full function although I haven’t got it working on my Fire tablet yet. A green square highlights the detected motion. The time stamp is from the internet and it doesn’t need to be set like other security cameras I have. The camera has automatic panning so it can be set to automatically rotate 359 degrees.  Set it in the middle of a table and you can see a whole room.  It has a snapshot and video album so you can save and export files. Yes, it has night vision; off, on, and auto.  Easy set up. You download the App onto your phone or ipad. It gives you a 3D matrix for the camera to scan so it knows you’re related.  Then you tell it the network password and you’re good to go. It has a standard ¼-20 camera mount if you’re securing it to a wall or mount.  Camera access can be grouped so you could put one in a remote building and have multiple users be able to check on it.  Camera can be switched on and off remotely via the interface. I spent the evening playing with it and set up push notifications to my cell phone. I am very impressed and would give it five stars if it had a Windows interface.
title: I am amazed at what I received for the money I paid.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Max Too
content: The camera works great. It has an intuitive user interface and good quality. The reason I chose the Wize Cam Pan is because they give you 14-day storage of events in the cloud for free. If they didn't offer that then it's just a me-too Web cam. I also like the ability to store the video in an SD card. I just don't like having to pay monthly fees to watch events.... One note of caution -  after setting it up it prompted me to upgrade the firmware. It started the firmware upgrade and it failed. My camera was now dead in the water. Their website says to try flashing the SD card and other complicated things. I returned it and got another, but I declined the firmware upgrade and everything works great.
title: Works great! Just don't upgrade the firmware.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Drew Smith
content: Have owned a similar camera for nearly 2 years now and just purchased my 3rd addition. It has helped out tremendously, especially during this COVID-19 crisis. Being able to be at work and still interact with my wife and kiddos. Helping them with school work and the talk back feature has been a life saver. For any parent with kids at home, you will truly appreciate the value these devices bring. Easy installation, easy set-up. Just download the app, connect to WiFi and scan camera. May take a min or so to scan the code bar, but after that, it's pretty straight forward. Awesome video playback, great resolution, both night time as well as daytime. I'm pleased with this product. Thanks
title: Worth the money

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Bielzebub
content: This thing is pretty excellent with some great features for a $40 camera! It's super easy to setup, use, and the app makes it easy too! The motion detection is the only thing I have any issue with. Well, it's not really the motion detection because it spots motion with excellent accuracy. The only portion of the motion detection that I don't care for is when it's set to track motion. This in theory is great, accept that the camera overshoots the target then readjusts, overshoots the target, then readjusts, and continues this cycle making it extremely difficult to keep track of what's actually going on. My dog was laying on the couch and then got up to turn around, when he moved the camera started moving all over the place trying to get him in the frame, but it just kept jerking back and forth after it missed him the first time trying to focus on him. At first I thought it maybe was because I was on 360p video so I switched to HD. Didn't seem to make any difference. It's still jumpy as heck but I can just see the video better between the jumps. Otherwise this thing is great. I love how it can articulate not only panning right to left but also up and down. Even without a mechanical zoom the digital zoom is pretty decent. I wish it had some z-wave or zigbee compatibility, but I can't really complain for $40!
title: Can't really complain for $40!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Liz Rip
content: I have this camera set up in my living room. It's great!!! When my kids are home with the roommates, they're always in the living room while the roommates are in the basement. I can use this to check in on the kids without bothering the roomies. I make sure they do their chores, are not on the video games, haven't left lights on all over the house. When I need to pop in and let them know "Hey, you left your bedroom light on again," it's kind of nice to just pop on the 2 way real fast to let them know, instead of dialing the house phone and waiting for them to get to it to answer. The 2 way is loud, they hear me from everywhere one our main floor. Downfall? The Pan!! I love it, don't get me wrong. But I wish we could customize the time frame that it turns. Every 10 seconds is great, and I understand why it would do it that way. But whenever we're sitting in the living room trying to relax we have to turn the Pan off. It's not very loud but just loud enough that when we're 4ft away from the camera we hear every 10 second pivot. Often times what happens is when we are done in the living room, we forget to turn the Pan back on. I'm very happy with this product and will continue to keep an eye on other products that Wyze may come out with.
title: Fantastic!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rachelle
content: I just received this camera. I set it up in less then 5 minutes, directions were easy as clear. There is a few second delay from video to phonebut it's exactly what I needed. My week schedule changes and I needed to keep an eye on the house and kids even though I'm lucky and have a whole neighborhood that watches out for eachother! The controls are easy to use, the camera actually has an on/off setting which is huge! I have not tried the voice part yet but I love messing with my kids so that surprise will come later lol! So far this is an amazing camera, I recommend it! You can share the controls with someone so my husband and I both have access to everything. I do not pay any subscription fees and only use it to login live and check on things!
title: Has an off setting, great camera!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: The Turtle
content: it worked for just over a month then stopped working! 7 days passed the return deadline! i signed up for continuous recording at $1.49/month, and yet it still cut off part of the motion that was still active. i bought an sd card from wyze, seemed to be working well, but now that pan cam is dead, there is no way to access the video on my computer or any other device i own. that just doesn't seem to be a valuable proposition... i power cycled the camera. i power cycled my android phone. i power cycled my wifi router. nothing intuitive to get phone and cam connected again... their online support responded quickly to me and told me how to reset and re-setup...not something you'd find in the setup guide and faqs. if not for their support, i'd have thrown it away....but now i'll keep it and hope it keeps working :)
title: working well, but not easy to problem solve

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jeriel Minguillan
content: The mandatory app for it is easy to use and share with other people. The feed is very responsive but does require a constant wi-fi connection to operate. The zoom is a digital zoom and when zoomed in the picture looks a bit grainy. Considering the price for this thing, you get a movable camera with HD, possible recording and snapshots with micro-sd cards, this is a great bargain. Not a good hidden camera. There's a small blue LED that gives away its position and it's about the size of a soda can so people will see it.
title: Great bang for the buck.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JaredL
content: I have this in my living room and have little complaints so far. A great camera for the price and features I wouldn't have thought would come with a $40 camera. Such as night vision, motion detection/following, you can record past events with an SD card, and the pan/tilt feature works great. It is a wide angle camera so it can capture an entire room, which IMO is good for recording past events, but it would be nice to turn it off and have a little better picture when needed. So far the biggest issue I have had is connection. Most of the time it works great, but it does tend to disconnect and require you to restart the app. Also the playback seems like it would be more seemless, but it can take it a while to buffer before it shows the actual time your'e requesting. Overall though it is well worth the money and I will definitely buy another as I try to replace my security system with a DIY system.
title: Amazing for the Price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: iPwn Repair
content: Wyze cameras are amazing! They have many of the same great features of other name brand cameras such as 1080p HD video, pan and tilt, night vision, mic and speaker, built in micro SD slot for Local media backup, no monthly cost for cloud service. The app is very easy to use and user-friendly! It has many great features such as scheduling your cameras to turn on and off at a certain time, integrates with IFTTT, works with Alexa and other smart AI systems, as a feature that will listen for fire alarm or carbon monoxide alarm I will notify you in app, if enabled, if there is an alert! Not to mention that you can also integrate their wyze sense hardware that basically allows you to Secure your home as it has contact sensors and motion sensors the kit is only $20! And coming soon wyze bulb ($40 4 bulb pack) that will allow your camera and allows you, via the app, to control your smart home lighting! Now anyone can afford that Jetsons home that you dreamed of as a kid at a cost fit for any budget!
title: Feature packed/budget friendly!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Voyager
content: I was really excited about this camera at first. Two months after I got it, the camera stopped panning, it just says "end of motion" no matter how the camera is oriented. Either the motor is bad or the end switches. I can turn it gently by hand it it moves fine, so I know it's not mechanically blocked. Even worse, the camera stops recognizing the SD card once it's been plugged in for about a day. I've written to Wyze multiple times to try to get a replacement, but they just answer with an automated message with trouble shooting steps a few days later. I write back again and again and receive no response. I'm very disappointed.
title: Motor stopped working after just two months, stopped recognizing SD cards, no customer support

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Zachary
content: Really great camera- especially given the price. Use this to watch our pets while we are away. Enjoy the fact that you can use a MicroSD for continuous recording. Much better than paying for cloud storage that thinks continuous recording is recording every 10 seconds (like Zmodo). With this, you have a one time cost and your done. I would say this camera is for more casual uses like pet watching while away as it does have some WiFi connectivity issues at times, as well as night vision issues unless you have a small dim lamp on somewhere in the room. All in all, it has extreme value as compared to some other cameras with a higher price tag. Definitely recommend.
title: Highly Recommend for Casual Use/Pet Watching

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Dani
content: I bought 2. At first it worked. The problems I encounter 1. I get no warning to my phone when motion or sound I have to open it up to check and that's a pain. 2. I set the camera to ONE location it keeps reverting back to facing THE WALL. This is useless. So I have to manually open up my app to look 3. When I set location and want to watch LIVE streaming... It will revert back to the wall I called customer service no answer I went to there site for support no support available I read there how to's and it doesn't work I need a 3 Rd camera...but I recommend you don't buy this!!!
title: Their #800 phone number and support does not work

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: goofy
content: I like these cameras - they record HD and you can pan the camera (almost all the way around), so you are not stuck with a fixed view. I now have 5 of these looking at different areas inside and outside our house and  they all work well. With the option to pan, if someone jostles a camera, I can 'adjust' it remotely back to the original view, which I like, as I am currently over 2,000 miles from the cameras. Also, when traveling, I like to be able to keep an eye on our cat. Having the ability to pan both sideways and up-and down allows me to find him, rather than hoping that he is in the place the camera is pointed at. I have signed up for their service to get 'full motion capture', which is extremely cheap.
title: Great camera and you can pan it.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Told You So
content: Well after having three of these cams setup several months I know them well. I know if an intruder shows up in a car youll lose whatever they choose to take from you due to recordings being way too short. Cars simply appear and disapear, never once showing who got out? Wth WYZE? I know if a person walks really close by cameras location one time but not again it never catches them at all. I know I can pull up in my drive directly in front of the camera and wait about 6 seconds then exit my car it will never show me. Just a car setting in one place not even in motion or pulling up into my driveway nor a person entering or exiting?  I have an SD card in them all too btw. These cameras just suck and are a real joke! If I'm 30+ feet away or everytime a car passes by my home that it records. Not what I wanted a security camera to do.
title: Recording Time.. Sucks!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: David S
content: I found that my apartment maintenance people were coming in without notice, so I needed a way to see what they were doing.  I wanted something pan/tilt, so I could track them around if I needed.  This camera was well reviewed, had a great price, and had a good feature set, so I pulled the trigger.  At first, it was too sensitive to reflecting light outside, but I was able to tweak the positioning to help that.  Then, months of reliable ownership.  Then, every so often, it would reboot, positioning wouldn’t go back to where it was, either.  Then, the person detection changed.  It was flat out bad at first, but got better with tweaking.  Am I glad I made the purchase still? Definitely. I think this system is still better than anything at its price point.
title: It’s GREAT, but it has had a few bumps

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tommy T
content: This is my 2nd tilt/pan/zoom and I love the picture quality, ease of setup and use, and the cloud recording cost of $2 per month is great. My first one was an indoor for monitoring my little dogs. No problem picking up my 7 lb  chihuahua. Now I got one mounted outside with a neoprene cover and I am impressed with the wifi reception. It's on a concrete wall at my eaves and line of sight is diagonal thru a total of 3 block walls to the Xfinity router. It runs 2 to 3 out of 3 signal bars. I love Wyze because they are USA and are so nicely priced. The innovation we are getting from them at these prices is awesome. I already pre-ordered their outdoor fixed camera setup which comes with a wireless hub. So, we'll see how that one works come October.
title: Incredible functionality at a fantastic price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kevin
content: I recently got another brand of well known dog camera to keep an eye on my two dogs during the day while no one is home. Despite its high price tag, I was shocked to find the app required an additional subscription fee to access all monitoring features. I decided to return it and order the Wyze cam. For a significantly lower price, the Wyze picture quality is better, it tracks motion and pans to give a view of the whole room rather than being stationary, and it does not require additional fees. The only feature it does not have that the dog specific camera did is the ability to dispense treats which I found to be gimmicky anyway. This means it takes up a lot less space. Very satisfied and will probably add more cameras in the future.
title: Excellent dog camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Karlene C Lewis
content: Works great and looks nice. picture quality on the highest setting, HD, is very very good and and SD is good too, any lower quality looks a bit grainy IMO. Pros: 1) Great/nice picture quality depending on which picture mode you choose, HD/SD 2) has more features and better built quality than you would expect for the price 3) very well packaged and protected 4) easy to use app(tested the google app only) I wish it had local controls for operating the camera though Cons: 1) SD card placement is not the best especially thicc fingers 2) supplied USB cable is only about 6ft 3) works with only 2.4ghz and you should set your 2.4 WIFI to N mode as opposed to auto for consistent connection it kind of hangs when WIFI mode is on auto
title: Better than expected

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ninbroken52
content: This thing is amazing! Out of the box it took about 5 minutes to setup, including inserting the MircoSD card. The camera has several different video qualities including 320, SD, and HD. The normal lighting mode and night vision are both great quality. The two-way audio is neat. Panning through the app is amazing. There are a bunch of settings for the camera that are easy enough to adjust including flipping the video 180 degrees, sound sensitivity, motion sensitivity, motion alerts, sound alerts, fire alarm sound alert, carbon monoxide alarm sound alert, motion tracking, and so much more. These menus are not cluttered at all. All very clear to navigate through. The share button is so simple to use if you need more people to access the camera. Another awesome feature is TASKS. You can set the camera to turn off and off automatically at certain times and send alerts at certain times. We’re using a 56GB microSD class 10 card in ours. It does recognize it, just be sure to format the card through the app and you’re all set. You can view the live feed, playback feed, and record from both! Already caught my cat checking out the camera and my dogs doing a few things I’d rather they didn’t... LOL! This is a great device and I highly recommend it. Totally buying another one.
title: This thing is amazing!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rachel
content: I love this camera except for two things. When I have it on motion tracking and have it set to record any motion, when it starts recording,  the camera is constantly rotating right to left. It won’t sit still. So the whole recorded video the camera is moving left to right. Once I turned that off, it would record fine without moving. The second thing is the delay in hearing and talking through the camera is super delayed to where I can’t always hear the responses because my voice is still going on my end when they are talking and it won’t allow you to hear both. It’s quite frustrating. I am a single mother of 4 and it’s a great way for me to communicate with my children at home. I do love how the sound is crisp and clear when I’m just listening in. I also love how clear the picture is. Night vision is amazing!
title: Overall pretty good

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Gene
content: So I have mixed feelings. I have family that bought this and it worked great. I thought I would jump into the wyze craze. I bought my first cam and it seemed to work great. However I couldn't speak through the device when I monitored it on my phone like you should. I then returned it and received another quickly. I had same issue so I thought maybe it was on my end however family couldnt use it correctly either on their devices. I did contact support and they had me jump through hoops till I finally gave up on getting a properly working device. I did keep the second one because I can still record just could chat through device so i kept as a basic security cam.
title: Hope you have better luck then I.
