product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Wluttrell
content: For the price, I don't think you can beat this camera and its features. Its roughly the size of a soda can, but rectangular. The setup is super easy when using wifi and an iPhone. I had 2 up and running within 10 minutes including a firmware update. This is my first security-type camera, so take that into consideration. The picture quality is as-expected from the description. Its detailed enough to see what's going on, and I find the motion tracking & detection to be great. The sound detection is SENSITIVE - I received so many notifications the first day I had to adjust the sensitivity. This is a nice feature, but I feel it needs to be adjusted, I have sound sensitivity set at 3/100 and feel that its finally not detecting things like my heat turning on. Still, the adjustment is great to have. The range of motion is great, and controlling through the phone app is super easy. Everything works as-expected, and its easy to see event videos and download them. 2-way audio works, honestly all the advertised features work and are easy to find. Quite happy with these cameras, despite a couple minor issues.
title: Easy setup, great feature-set, smartphone app is useful

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Friend Redding
content: The camera works great. I had to call the company to get help setting up the on and off function. You have to set-up a separate rule for each function i.e. one rule to turn on and another rule to turn off. You would think the on/off piece in the application would do that; however, it does not work. Customer support is awesome. The night vision is ok not great. The motion detection is pretty sensitive the detect human-only does not work yet. Do love the tracking boxes kind of reminds me of an aircraft heads up display. I wish there was a way to set this up so it would turn off and on with my Simplisafe alarm system. I went with this unit because the Simplisafe cameras just could not connect to my network and the company could not figure out. Once they have an outdoor unit I will buy several more. Look forward to app updates.
title: WORKS GREAT APP COULD USE SOME WORK

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Martinjm
content: I decided to buy this as I was going to be out of town for many months.  Wow, this camera saved me.  There ended up being water damage in my condo and I was able to see it with this cam and see when the property manager came on site and able to have a conversation with them while they were standing in the room providing info on the damage.  Next, when the repair folks came in I was able to see their work.  For the price, this camera is an excellent value and I would buy another one without hesitation.  Further, they email updates the company provides on products and their transparency is refreshing.  Finally, the monthly price for their additional service is super cheap and well worth it, even better, it isn't necessary to realize the full value of the cam.
title: Awesome little cam

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Nick D Pajic
content: I won't lie, I did doubt the quality when I saw the low price but after seeing it for myself I am dearly impressed. Setup Setup was incredibly easy and it took me maybe a minute at most. All I had to do was connect to the network (my home network), hold down on the button at the base of the camera for three seconds, scan the QR code on my phone and then bang, I was able to start viewing. Material Quality The material has great quality but there's always room for improvement. It seems to be made out of a plastic that could break, crack or fracture easily if hit with enough force or dropped from a high enough altitude. Camera Quality and Livestream Quality As with the material quality, there is always room for improvement, especially when it comes to camera quality and livestream quality. I will post a video in the future showing the incredible quality but for now I only have the review. I did doubt the quality af first, as the price is incredibly low for such a great camera. I tested the camera in both light and dark conditions and the quality is incredible. In SD mode, the quality is incredible but when you move the camera around you do see hoe choppy it becomes. I have yet to try 360p but I'm assuming that it's not that great as it is, 360p. In HD mode I was truly astounded. It looks at if it is a high quality movie camera. You have to see it for yourself but in both light and dark levels, it captures every single minute detail and when moving the camera around it  is only slightly choppy and not as choppy as when used in SD mode. Pros Excellent price Easy to assemble Incredible quality Durable Blends in well with the surroundings Cons Power cable is a bit short and it may be difficult to place the camera in hard to reach places Summary Overall an incredible camera and it is definetly worth buying.
title: Incredible Camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: tsintse
content: We have a pretty standard camera NVR system setup that's aging and we wanted to replace it with something that had a more modern app and alerting system.  We've been looking at some options like the Arlo or Butterfly but saw the Wyze system and decided to give it a try based on the incredible price and reviews. Camera arrived same day (nice Amazon!) and comes well packaged.  Took it out and set it up easily, connecting to the app was painless and we were able to watch streams and receive event alerts without issue.  The app is clean and easy to understand, setting up event alerting was easy enough that my non tech Mom wouldn't have a problem.  Picture is crystal clear and the ability to pan and setup motion tracking was appreciated in a camera of this price. The camera isn't setup for outdoor use but there are a number of packages and accessories you can get for less than 20 bucks that make it suitable for outdoor mounting (which was our intention.) The reason we'll probably not go with the Wyze camera is strictly from a physical security standpoint.  First, there is no internal battery so if an intruder was to disable power to the unit we would no longer have a functioning camera.  Some of our camera's are high enough where this isn't an issue but our most critical camera, the front door, is easily reachable.  Second, there is no way to secure the power cable to the camera.  Our older NVR camera's are PoE but the cable comes out from the back of the mount, if you install it correctly there is no way to gain access to the cables to disable the camera.  Even if I was to permanently attach the micro usb cable to the Wyze camera any intruder could simply cut the cable rendering the entire system useless, it's easy to do. This is an excellent camera and system for the right situation...however the lack of battery and ease of access to the power connection makes it unsuitable for any scenario where someone can reach or has access to the unit.
title: Amazing camera and app with some critical shortcomings

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: David Nguyen
content: My First experience home monitor system, bought Sept 18 2018. Had it for over a year. Pros keep track of my kids access anywhere Cons i had to keep reformatting it every-time it would run out of memory, i had to physically take out the sd card and reformat using my pc desktop, huge hassle. This system would record whenever it wanted, so i missed alot of video i wanted because it decided to refuse to record, unreliable. Would not reformat sd card in camera, you must remove it, every single time. All in All: Ok system but really unreliable recording and hassle to maintain. the Pros are now in all home monitoring systems. There are lots of bugs and system errors that need to be fixed. Thinking about it, maybe i got a defective model but im using 3 in my home and they acting retarded.
title: Over 1 year of use. Alot of Maintenance and Hassle

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jon D.
content: I really want to like this camera- I've been needing a replacement nanny ca, and this was suggested to me for both that and general home security.  The picture quality is great and super crisp, and the night vision works perfectly fine, but what really kills me is the service and connectivity.  It isn't an IP cam, first off- you have to use the app to view the feed unless you want to go through a convoluted firmware update with a micro SD card.  Even using the app, on my phone, I have to select the camera six or seven times frequently before it connects.  It seems like every week the service is down for several hours to a whole day, as well, so it's not reliable either.  I highly recommend any other camera brand (other than MIPC, I'd stay away from those also).
title: Terrible Service and Uptime

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: CHASE NELSON
content: This is my second Wyze cam. Overall 3/5 due to an issue. I would recommend IF they fix the SD card issue. Background, I own D-Link, Arlo, and Wyze cameras. Overall the Wyze cameras are my favorite. Pros: Good motion detection (adjustable sensitivity), good image quality, app works well. Overall 5/5 for the camera use. Cons: 1/5 stars Wyze SD card Format causes the card to be unrecognizable.  I bought an SD card and it was working right out of the package. After the SD card filled up maybe 1Gb of space. I used the Wyze app "format SD card" option. It formatted successfully and upon the completion of the SD Card format the SD card no longer was recognized by the Wyze Pan camera. I am running the most recent firmware. I reset and rebooted the camera, pulled the power, removed and reinserted the SD card. None of these steps can get the camera to recognize the SD card. I have read in forums that say I will need to format the card using the SanDisk app from the manufacturer. I will update this post after I do this. Disappointed that an in app option can cause the SD card to stop functioning.
title: Wyze App SD Card Format causes SD card to become unrecognized.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: M. W.
content: This is a great little camera. I purchased this camera to try in one of my blind spots at my property that my wired system does not catch. The app is SO easy to use and very responsive. The motion detection is almost too good, I have to keep the sensitivity down pretty low because it picks up motion nearly 100 ft away. The night vision is exceptional and I love the ability to pan around. I can see nearly half of my property from one camera. The features are incredible and the customization is endless. I dare say this may be better than my wired system, only except for the fact the pictures are a bit clearer on my wired cameras. I love that the app is free and you don't have to purchase a monthly storage plan. I have everything saved to a micro SD card. I fully intend on purchasing more of these cameras and highly recommend them.
title: So impressive!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jeff&Laura
content: We bought these to have them face the two outside doors in our home and to alert us to movement when we are out of town. The sound detection works okay.. But that was the only notification we got at first, despite having purposefully moved in front of the camera several times. The motion detection picks up maybe 1 out of every 10 motion alerts. I know it KNOWS there is motion, because motion tagging (places a box where it sees motion in the video) and motion tracking (pans to follow motion) all work perfectly fine, although we don't need the functionality at all. I really just want it to send me notifications every time it detects something. My phone has all notifications turned on, and we read through the guide made by the company to fix the settings for a higher sensitivity detection and still it barely picks things up. It's a shame, because we bought these to replace our Amazon Cloud cam which picks up every single movement and records until there is no more movement, which is nice. Now, we have two cameras facing the front porch, the Amazon cloud cam which will basically be there just to get alerts to movements and whatnot, and then Wyze camera for panning and recording longer videos when necessary (because the Amazon Cloud cam can't do this, which is such a waste). Ah well. The boxes were basically destroyed trying to open everything, so we will keep the other camera for the back door, despite it being choosy when to send notifications. Too good to be true, I suppose.
title: Not good as a security alert camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Amy H.
content: We really wanted to love this camera. On paper, it sounds perfect for an inexpensive nursery cam. I gave 2 stars because the picture and response were great. However, we quickly discovered that it only records for 12 second intervals and won't record anything for the following 5 mins even when there's motion in the room. A LOT can happen in 5 minutes with a toddler. This was an issue for us. It would alert my phone when she rolled over but not when she got out of bed right after, or if she left the room. The bigger issue for me though was this morning when I turned the camera off because we wouldn't be home... I walked into my daughter's bedroom for something and heard the motion sensor click on. I double checked the app, the camera was indeed turned off and I did not receive a motion alert. So why was the camera clicking on when I walked in the room??? This concerns me for the quality of the security encryption. I don't want creepers watching my daughter or potentially talking to her through the cam when we're not right there. And I especially don't want anyone else to be able to turn it on when I have turned it off. I obviously can't verify that this was the reason I was hearing the sensor click on, but it was enough to make me uneasy. So back it goes and will be buying a better quality camera from a trusted brand.
title: I really wanted to love it

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Lukas Polok
content: Great camera overall. I like how the iOS app works. I use it to watch my cat while I’m not at home. The motion detection is sometimes slow, the recorded video starts with the cat in the middle of the room and I never know where she’d been hiding. You can record to cloud or to SD card, both works seamlessly well. The only issue is sound. The sound does not sync with picture and it is oh so quiet and has a lot of static. It is pretty much as if it was not there, which is a shame because this makes really nice videos.
title: Poor sound otherwise great.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Josh Eck
content: I was looking forward to getting this camera setup as I saw great reviews and I wanted an indoor camera to complement our outdoor Ring camera.  Trying to keep all my smart gadgets under one AI assistant is tough when we live in a world where Google, Alexa, Siri, and Bixby all compete, but this was a good start. Typically we used an old tablet and the Alfred app on our phones to keep tabs indoors, but a free app and an old tablet with a 2mp camera just doesn't cut it.  So I saw the deal for this camera at $30, great reviews, and I was like, how bad could it be? Well, it's not bad.  But it's not great either.  The camera itself is cheap, but it has to be for this price point.  The video quality is pretty good and the night vision isn't bad at all.  Two way audio is great. But holy moly, does this thing act possessed!  It has the automatic tracking when it senses a subject in the frame but it freaks out.  You can move into the frame, and the camera pivots to watch you.  But even if you stand perfectly still, it'll keep changing positions over and over as if it can't really grab you thinking there's movement all around you (maybe there's a ghost in my house?).  It's loud too when it pivots so when we're in the kitchen, it's just going haywire trying to focus on something and whirring away.  I get if there's multiple people in the room and it can't seem to figure out who to focus on, but when it's one person, and they don't move all around, why does the camera keep pivoting all over, and sometimes it eventually stops with the camera pointed in the opposite direction. Other than that, it's a decent option for an indoor camera.  I think I'll splurge and buy an indoor Ring camera and put this one somewhere else. By the way you can shut off the tracking and make it a stationary camera, but that kind of defeats the purpose of going with this model.
title: Is it because it's only $30?

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Team Brule
content: This camera is a super deal compared to what you get with the competition. For the record, videos are stored for 2 weeks in the cloud and videos are 12-seconds long. If that does not work for you, shop elsewhere. However, you can also add a memory card for enhanced local storage. There is a critical flaw in the camera that you need to be aware of - power outages. If you live in an area where power outages are common, do not buy this camera. If and when a power outage occurs, you are required to completely unplug the camera and plug it back in manually. I have never seen this on a device before - ever - and can only imagine it is an issue with the firmware. I can easily replicate this and have sent it to their engineering team. They responded with a simple 'thanks we'll look into it' and that was months ago. No fix yet. At the end of the day, this is a device for a place where you occupy daily. It is not an off-site device.
title: Super Deal Compared to Competition

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: suman
content: For the price its fine to buy... unable to switch off from the app. Not useful for continuous viewing, have to refresh every certain minute which is the reason i have to use more my other cam to have continuous uninterrupted view... hope the manufacture would adress these problem!!!
title: Not bad but  could be better

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: nora ryan
content: These work great. They do what you need such a device to do between the app and the device. Solid quality - appears to be able to last for a reasonable amount of time. Really quite surprised and pleased with construction of the unit to-date, its functionality, the quality of the functionality. The sound quality is as described elsewhere. Definitely would want a unit like this one but with better sound quality when available and if not at too much of a price delta. There has to be irony that a device has such solid AI and at the same time lacks quality, conversational (long conversation) audio due to delay/lag, but the price is quite reasonable given what it can do out of the box. Very simple, no hitch installation. It all just worked as indicated in the directions. Can readily switch it between networks, app provides me visibility required easily and flexibly, memory works as advertised. Decent economy and non-economy modes. Unless it breaks in the next 2 years, it's a great product .
title: Very surprised and pleased at good quality. Definitely fits intended uses. Appropriate advertising.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: rick giordano
content: Had this thing for 1 month now. It is monitoring my living room. Things I like: - Easy to set up - Clear image Things i disliked: - If I turn it off it has issues reconnecting when i turn it back on - I have to turn it off whenever i'm in the room for any period of time or it scans every 2-3 seconds - It only alerts me some of the time Deal breaker: - It scans so much the noise is irritating and makes me feel like i'm being watched by someone else - Put a flip down piece of cardboard on to stop it without having to turn it off and silenced noise alert but it still scans repeatedly even with no motion and the settings as such that it can cover everything without having to scan. End result is i'm giving it to my son and just purchased the non-scanning one for the living room. I don't care that it's recording, just don't want to be reminded of it every 3 seconds and with my set up it can cover everything without having to move.
title: Annoying

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: steelew
content: I really like this camera. It showed up quickly, it worked right away. The only thing I missed in the box was some sort of mount but at $37, I can just go buy one. I will say the motor is a little on the loud side. Not screeching or anything but louder than I expected, still not a big deal. You won't be sneaking up on anybody with this camera unless its in a loud environment. I put this camera in the crawl space under my house so I can keep tabs on leaks or anything like that. The night vision LEDs are ok but they don't illuminate the scene very far away. 30 feet is being generous. I got about 10 or 15 feet max. The Camera has very fast motion when moving it, which I like. I will buy more of these when its time to buy more cameras.
title: Very cool camera for very little money

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Aaron Dutenhoefer
content: Setup was super fast and easy and the level of design put into the software was apparent.  So many of these home automation products treat the software or the mobile app as an afterthought - this was clearly paid attention to by Wyze and tested extensively.  The app is fast and responsive, and installing the camera is falling-off-a-log simple.  You just open the app and provide your wifi credentials.  The app generates a QR code which you show to the new camera, and it picks up from that QR code everything it needs.  A quick firmware update later and in under 2 minutes you're up and running.  Have yet to try integrating with my alexa spot or accessing the video from the web, but I'm not expecting any trouble.  I bought one and liked it so much I bought another a few days later.  Motion tracking, triggered recording, and two-way audio is also straightforward out of the box.  (I use one to scold my macaw when she disturbs my wife's home office by screaming excessively)  If you want a simple, easy-to-use camera for monitoring pets/home/whatever, get a wyze.  Plan on adding the amazon suggested mounting brackets for it. ('Fastsnail' - 2-pack for 8 bucks)  It will work standing on its base but it's a little top heavy.  The coverage will also be better if you securely mount it.  If you secure it to a ceiling there's a software setting to flip the image so it's right side up.
title: Unexpectedly good for the price & refreshingly well-designed software.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: eykei
content: This camera has the features of a $150 ip camera for a fifth of the price. Easy to set up, and easily controlled/monitored via app. I have it set up so it sends me a notification when it detects movement or sound. I click on the notification and it opens a 10 sec clip of the event. I turn it off when I’m at home. I can also monitor it anytime I want, and pan and zoom (digital zoom, not optical zoom) using the app controls. Picture quality is great, night vision works even in pitch dark. Sound quality isn’t too bad either. As a security measure, this could be defeated by a determined criminal by cutting the power or disabling WiFi. And if the camera were to pan either by you or it’s tracking function, the sound of the servo motor would alert anyone nearby. But I’m not complaining, for the price, you get incredible utility.
title: easiest 5 stars I’ve ever given

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ella
content: Dont let the low price of this indoor camera fool you! It has amazing picture quality. It also has night vision and zoom. You have the option to watch in high resolution or low resolutuon. This is helpful when my network is over loaded with users! Set up is very minimal. You will need your Wi-Fi password and a smartphone to download the Wyzw app.  I really love the ability to use a memory card and review live or recorded footage. It allows you to adjust sensitivity for motion and sound. You can set it up to pan. The playback feature will allow you to quickly pick the day and scroll theough the times. You can set up multiple cameras. Its a great way to keep an eye on pets or kiddos. I even use when i have misplaced something. I highly recomend.
title: I enjoy Wyze over my more expensive cameras.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Joe N
content: I have to downgrade this review from 5 to 3 stars due to a security breech at Wyze.  It was announced on 26 December 2019.  Not nice to have a security device reveal user account data.  FWIW, Wyze owned up to the breach and locked down the server that was beached, but that was AFTER it exposed Wyze nicknames, user emails, profile photos, WiFi router names, Alexa integration tokens, and other information for 2.4 million users.  They recommend you change your password and implement two-factor authentication.  If you integrated your camera with Alexa, you will need to reauthenticate and create a new token. +++++ Pretty good camera for the price.  Mechanical pan, tilt works well.  Black & white video when no light, color white lights on.  Alerts received within app for motion, sound or when person identified.  Alert includes 12- second video. Wide field of view.  We put on top of cabinet with view of front door, kitchen, hall.  Requires internet connection.
title: Good camera for the price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JmT13
content: I purchased this camera to check on our puppy throughout the day until our sitter got home. There is very minimal lag when manually scanning the room with the camera. The sitter said she could hear us talking to the dog and that our voices were very clear. (Dog was in AZ, we were in AR). I watched YouTube videos before I purchased and everything works as it is supposed to. The camera itself takes all of 20 second to setup, and the app is very user friendly. I had no issues with setup for the camera or the app. I do recommend getting a small tripod for it to use the full view rang of the camera. Night vision is fantastic and alerts come in as expected. I will absolutely purchase another if we ever need and I will always recommend this product to anyone in the market for such an item. I also recommend those wondering if they should purchase this camera to watch the YouTube videos by Wyze. It walks you through everything and works exactly as expected.
title: Awesome product, fantastic price.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: edsal
content: I read about this camera for days. It appeared to be an amazing deal. What I got was an annoying dud. I did the firmware update as part of the setup. I set a detection zone - which was nearly impossible becuase the camera just spins endlessly and without detecting motion.  Then the camera just kept spinning and making noise - completely useless. I will be returning to Amazon.
title: You get what you pay for.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Soup Cook
content: The first thing you have to do is sign up.  You cannot use the camera until you sign up. They want your email address, and you have to enter a confirmation code to prove it's your address.  It's completely pointless because there is really nothing to do on the website except buy more stuff (that doesn't work).  AFAIK there is only 1 way to video the video and that's with their app. I hit the resend button at least 20 times, and about 15 minutes later, only 8 showed up, too late to use because it said: "code expired. Please sign up again..." Tech support was a complete waste of time.  She offered me a link to setup instructions, as if that would make the emails show up.  I expected her to confirm my email and send me a code; but I guess that would have been to easy. To get past the email nonsense I tried to use the web.  However, later in the process, you have to scan a QR code in person, in front of the camera. So I had to go back to the mobile app and make another trip to the camera.  It wouldn't  connect. So, I had to unmount it  to get to the reset button and reenter a very long password. My cell connected to the network, my laptop connected to the network but the camera would not--and each time I had to click the reset button, reenter the password and scan the QR code. So I set up a new network just for the camera and after several more tries, it connected. Then it asked me to enter a name for the camera, but the onscreen keyboard wouldn't pop up.  Hit back space it warned that I would have to start set up all over.  So I had to pick a preset.  Then it got stuck on loading, so I had to shut it down.  I start it back up and see "CRITICAL FIRMWARE UPGRADE". So, finally a picture--after 30 to 50 seconds of loading video.  It's a good quality picture.  There is way too much lag time to use the pan feature accurately.  Refuses to go to HD.  When I rotate the screen, it loads the video again. I may or may not try to get it to work with Alexa. All in all, not worth $35 and certainly not worth 3 hours.
title: over 3 hour set up, tech support: worthless

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JR
content: This camera has the best video quality of any I’ve experienced.  I have a Nest doorbell and a Ring (1st gen) doorbell.  This camera’s video is sharp. Can zoom in quite a bit. Love that I can pan via my phone to move up or down.  I have it on my porch that is screened in.  It doesn’t get direct rain but it’s possible that spray could get on it.  So far it’s been in place about a month and no issues. While it’s not designated as outdoor- For the price it’s worth trying on my porch.  It’s not been extremely cold but has been in the 30’s (F) and no issues.  Easy to set up, although I did have to keep redoing the app to get it to work.  Not sure why it failed at least 6 times but I kept deinstalling the app and reinstalling.  Since then it’s worked perfectly fine.
title: Clear video - can’t beat the price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: CJ
content: Just got it today, and here's my caveat: my previous "security cams" were just my laptop webcam or old cell phone cameras hooked up to an online server. So my standards are low to say the least. But those just weren't cutting it when we go out of town and I want to keep an eye on my house and my pets, so I figured, $40? Can't be worse, at least. I'm actually pretty impressed so far. It was super easy to set up, the app is very easy to use. I love that it has the 360 degree pan, it has tilt, zoom, night vision, and things I never even thought about like pan scan to look for motion and motion tracking to follow any motion. It does require a micro SD card to do motion alerts, so I'm going to go get one tomorrow and I'm hoping it will work just as well as everything else so far. But I will update accordingly. Overall I'm really happy with my purchase right now.
title: So far so good

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kathryn Tomasko
content: I got 3 of them and had less than 2 months and now none work.  I purchased them because I wanted something to put outside and seen the weatherproof housing.  If I knew the housing wouldn't work I never would have got.  It might be a good cam indoors but not outdoors.  I contacted Elijah at Wyze via email, and he just sent me a list of reasons why they can't send me new cams and asked me if I had them outside and I never heard anything else after I answered his question.  I didn't ask them for new cams, I just wanted to know why mine stopped and how I might get them back up and running.  I loved this cam at first and got so many of my friends to buy and now I feel terrible.
title: Don't buy if your using outside!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JJB
content: Wanted a cam to watch our cat while on vacation.  Bought a Dlink camera initially and what a piece of junk that was!  I was skeptical about a webcam under $100 after the Dlink experience, but decided to try the WYZE.  The first attempt to connect to my 2.4/5.0GHz dual band network didn't connect.  Unplugged it and tried setup again and connected perfectly.  The first image on my phone blew my mind.  It was as good as any digital camera and the motion was almost perfect.  Moved it to another room and the reconnect went without any trouble.  The phone app is amazing.  Panning is very respectable by using a finger swipe on the image.  Zoom is simply a thumb/index finger spread.  I am simply blown away by the overall quality of the camera and the app.  Wish I had purchased this camera first instead of suffering with the Dlink crap.  My hat's off to the WYZE team.  Well done!
title: This product is superb!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Peter
content: I own security cameras from four manufacturers, some much more expensive. This one is a gem. The picture quality is the best, the app is intuitive and the free cloud storage is generous at this price range. So far, no problems. I was able to set it up without a direct cable to the router which was important for my intended use. EDIT: The app is asking me occasionally for a password. Of course, this happens when I travel and I do not have the password but really need the camera. This is a major annoyance. One start less. Too bad that Wyze is not making outdoor cameras. I will buy one in a heartbeat. EDIT 8/2000: I own now four of these and of the smaller (not rotating) type. They are OK for internal use but point outside, the dynamic range is awful. Blown highlights and smeared shadows. Compared to LogiCricle, for example, it looks much worse.
title: a gem

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: M. Scott
content: I've had this camera for a few weeks now and I feel that the camera and the app that controls it is still in beta. There are lots of quirky things that still need to be ironed out. For example, this camera is supposed to track moving objects, but if you walk quickly, it will easily lose sight of you. Additionally, there are many times when I am right in plain sight of the camera and the camera will not notice or follow me. Design/motor unit: Additionally, when the camera turns, the motor is loud which will easily alert unsuspecting people to its whereabouts. Thus people can easily knock the camera over or just turn it around, rendering it useless. It would be better if it could be wall/ceiling mounted where people can't tamper with it so easily. However, given the design, there is no way of doing this. Motion/sound sensing: This is probably the weakest part of the camera. The app allows you to adjust the sensitivity of the motion and sound detection from 0-100. If I set it to a sensitivity of 100, it will detect tree branches moving outside my window, but for some reason it will still on occasion miss me if I slowly move in front of it. I have tried to set the sensitivity from low to high but there doesn't seem to be a sweet spot where it will detect the things that you want, but not the things you don't. There are many occasions when my dog will casually walk in front of it and it will not detect it at all despite being set to a sensitivity of 95+. Sound detection is perhaps equally poorly executed. There are times when I set the sensitivity to 100 and it will not hear my conversation from 10 feet away. To be fair, I was speaking in a lowered voice, but I was definitely not whispering. There is also almost no background noise in my home so there is really no excuse for this camera to miss my voice. Finally, there is no geofencing capabilities at the moment so you will have to go into the app and manually turn off the motion and sound alerts for every single camera, every time you come home and remember to turn them back on every time you leave home. This is very annoying and something they should definitely fix. Despite all these flaws, I still think this camera deserves 4 stars because as they say, price is a weapon and this thing is cheap as hell.
title: Camera in beta, but you can't beat that price!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: c. egleberry
content: I replaced the 1st one i got bc you could barely hear out of it! Im using this one in a different place so the sound isnt as important so idk if thats better or not. But the motion detection, to me, sucks! I stood in front of this on my back porch waving my arms watching it on my phone app for 5 minutes before it notified me. It never catches my husband mowing. BUT it will catch my tree shadows all day long on a windy or breezy day! It never catches my dogs that go in and out 10x per day by themselves and run the yard either. I have sound detection off, motion up to 50, only because all the shadows of my trees blowing around during the day!
title: Looks nice

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Bruce McNair
content: I tried another (more expensive) pan/tilt webcam but had to return it when it stopped working after two days.  I wish I bought the Wyze Cam Pan first!  Video quality is great, setup was very easy, and the user interface is much better, both in terms of control and camera status information.  I find the pan/tilt latency on this camera is much better. One nice feature this camera has that I didn’t see mentioned is the camera mount has a standard 1/4-20 camera tripod thread.  This makes it quite convenient to put the camera on a standard mount or tripod to position it exactly where I want it. I will be using this to remotely monitor a 3D printer and I was pleased to find time-lapse images can be recorded to an SD card. Overall, this is a great camera with a high quality build and extra features.
title: Nice camera, easy setup, extra features

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Alex
content: I was looking for 2 things in a security camera: - No subscription fee - Stored locally, not the cloud I thought this camera would be awesome but unfortunately Wyze wants you to pay them a monthly fee to record events that happen which are longer than 12 seconds.  There's no option to view the camera on a computer unless you install an iPhone emulator which is super annoying.  I do like the local SD card storage option a lot and the picture and hardware quality is decent but not outstanding for the 50 dollar range.  I had a little bit of trouble setting it up with my wifi and wish they would support 5Ghz but it's a tolerable camera overall. Wyze, please stop trying to capitalize off of people by crippling the software features unless users pay a monthly fee.  We're trying to protect our personal property this is not a game and this level of exploitation is disgusting.
title: Tricked into thinking there’s not a monthly fee

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Amanda
content: Got the size pan cam for my back porch. The motion detection is awesome. Picture quality is awesome. Great camera in all. I have it three stars because the audio really sucks and again it runs your battery down very fast. If you are looking for a great quality camera that gives you great pics this is the one. If you want great audio, this is not the one. Audio does not really matter to me I just need to see what is going on when I am not at home. Unlike my other two wize cams this one did not come with anything to stick it to.
title: Audio still bad everything else great

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Sher P.
content: In spite of the negativity surrounding the delivery and packaging of this product (was opened and had no supporting documents), thanks to Amazon tech support, I finally got this camera up and running.  That's the reason for the 3 star overall rating.  Operationally, so far so good though.  I'll be able to test it fully once I get an sd card, a motion night light so that the night vision is fully operable in color (watched a YouTube video about this), not just black and white, and I can see the playback of course. There is a pan mounting kit that I want to buy too. I totally didn't appreciate the opening of the product, which was taped back up with that cloudy looking tape, not even clear tape.  Plus, I knew it was opened because the original seal was broken, and the product barely fit back inside the box.  That was probably the reason the instructional manual was not in the box as well, because the product could barely fit, so I'm sure the manual wouldn't be able to squeeze into the box too.
title: Seems like a good product

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: customer x
content: Overall quality is not bad. Pros: Great price for overall package. Motion triggered recording works great, together with motion tracking, the camera move around to track moving objects. Tilt and pan function works well, able to look around the room freely 360 degree. Responsive for action triggered recording, although a bit delay in sending the notification to phone (maybe 10-15sec). Free cloud storage for 12 second clips. Optional local storage for continuous recording with SD card placement, great option here! Even when wifi is down, it still record to local sd card , and you can access to it later when wifi up again. Night vision not bad quality considering the price. Cons: 1) I really want to like this camera. One of the most cons is the camera seems to be unable to trigger by sound. I yell, play music, clap my hands right around the camera and no sound is detected. Compared this to Wyze 2 camera which detect sound very good (set to 100% sensitive, able to detect slight object dropping to desk/floor, sneezing, talking). This camera, set sensitivity to 100% and no response! Could it be a defective camera only? Not sure. I like this to be my main camera indoor to able to look around 360 degree, able to detect sounds (so if someone break open door or windows, or any one making sounds when no one should be indoor, then I can be notified). This makes it such a disappointment for me. 2) Sometimes missing actions and not recorded, although not very frequently but sometimes happens. I walk right past it and nothing recording or notification made.
title: Unable to detect sound to trigger recording

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Andie
content: It is unbelievable how well this camera functions! It does exactly what it says it does. Here is the only drawback... IF a stranger is entering your home on the first floor and you are on the second or third floor, you will not get a notification for 12 seconds -- the length of the video that is taken. THUS it is not a perfect safety solution. OTHERWISE, it is great! The picture and sound are clear. The sensitivity of the camera is mind-blowing -- it takes pictures of cars going by the front of the house and  bugs that fly in front of the camera--and sends notifications. Can be annoying --- but fine for me. Id rather too many than not enough.  It says you can decrease the sensitivity, and I lowered but it is still sending the same video notifications. One thing to remember -- your own privacy is compromised. You have to remember it records conversations and sends notifications -- so if more than one family member is receiving notifications think about what youre saying ....
title: EXCELLENT VALUE

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: MOJTABA S. SHOBEIRI
content: I have purchased 6 WYZE cams and 2 WYZE Pan cams since January 2019. BAD NEWS: One of Cam Pans quit after 11 months. I contacted WYZE and they replace it. The camera could not see the memory card I inserted from the beginning. I emailed WYZE two weeks ago, no answer...I followed up since the camera quit 4 days ago...no answer again!  I checked my other cam pan the other day and that is not reading the memory card any more either!!! soon this one will die too. GOOD NEWS: I highly recommend the original cube looking WYZE Cams since all six are working great and I have never had any issues with them.
title: Replacement WYZE Cam Pan quit after few weeks!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: AmazonShopper
content: I REALLY love this camera. For the price it’s amazing. Picture quality is good, sound is great. We use it for my kids’ room. Checking on them while they play as well at night when they’re sleeping. Only 2 issues. 1.  First one isn’t such a big deal to us. When using the microphone to talk to the room the camera is in, the video delays a bit. So I don’t always hear the response. The 2nd one that’s a little more bothersome is that you can’t cast the video to your tv. You can connect it to Alexa and stream to your fire stick or fireTV. only problem with that is it only streams for 10 mins then turns off. It would be nice to be able to have it stream constantly through the night or during the day while the kids are in the room. Other than that it’s a great cam for the price!
title: Great cam for the price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: D. J. Minten
content: I did not follow the advice of other reviews to not update the firmware and it made the camera useless. Pros: * Fantastic picture quality * Amazing features and settings for such a cheap device (Tracking and Notification Settings) * Motion tracking / Pan Scan (Kind of like a video game) * Great Night Vision Cons: * Slow / Buggy Motion Tracking will often leave the camera pointed backwards * Slow response to inputs from the app when trying to pan / scan * Firmware update made the device unusable After updating the firmware I found the camera live view and settings were so slow they were completely unusable. I tried multiple access points and routers to see if it was a wifi issue, this was not the case. I reset the device and tried the app on different phones with no luck. Before the firmware update the camera is pretty neat and usefull.
title: FIRMWARE - A FIRM DO NOT!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Charlie Mangiapane
content: This product has been a waste of ti.e. the app and the server for the app constantly goes down. It is always telling me to recycle the power on the camera and its just not reliable. Ive had it not even 2 months now and it worked perfect for about 2 or 3 weeks and since then jts been nothing but problems and for security it can not trusted.
title: Unreliable, constant issues

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Curtis Mittong
content: I really like this, and it does mostly what I want it to, but it doesn't seem to matter if you put the motion detection sensitivity really high or super low, it picks up EVERYTHING.  It actually picked up a leaf falling off a tree at about 300' away on the lowest setting.  So my recorded events number in the hundreds per day, every time a bird flies by, a cat crosses the street, or a speck of dust happens to float by.  My other concern is that it seems to have a fixed time for recording motion events.  It doesn't matter how long the motion continues, when it senses motion it records for X seconds.  Sure would have been nice the other night if it had continued recording as someone broke into my car.  Maybe I could have caught her face on camera.  Overall, a fun gadget.  Not serious security stuff, but fun.  I got it mostly to keep tabs on the dog while I'm at work and it does that brilliantly.
title: Really nice picture and control, but motion sensing...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jenisha
content: My son recommended this to me, for safety reasons. I love how I can look in on my home, when I'm away. I can arm and disarm alerts from anywhere. I bought the whole setup, including door censers, motion censers, outlet plugs, and 2 stationary cameras. I did have to buy a longer cord for the panning camera, because I mounted it on the ceiling. The night vision works exceptionally well. I was surprised when I pulled up the cameras (on my phone) in the middle of the night, it was pitch black in the house, and I could see perfectly. The door censer mounted easily, and didn't have to be perfectly positioned, mine is off set by about 1/2 in. and still works great. The motion censer covers a much larger area than expected. When my furnace kicks on it moves my curtains slightly, and I get an alert on my phone. Just a heads up, when you have the motion detection on, it will follow you around the house, which is a little unsettling, but you can turn it off. I feel this was one of the best purchases I've ever made. Piece of mind is priceless, but I didn't have to break the bank to buy the whole set up. I intend to buy the door lock, at some point, then my security system will be complete.
title: Absolutely would buy it again.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Wesley Danger
content: I saw these on reddit first and decided to try one. I was so impressed that I quickly bought another. These cameras have the same functionality as many "name brand" cameras that cost literally 4 or 5 times as much. Some of my favorite features of this camera are: - nearly 360 degree pan - IR night vision - record via SD card - motion detection - sound detection - 2 way sound Among many other features. I mainly use these cameras to check in on my dog while I'm at work. Now, all that being said, the main drawback to these is that they aren't and can't be connected to a security company for monitoring. So they aren't a true replacement for say NEST monitored cameras. But, for what you're paying, these are a full featured product that I'd recommend to anyone for some peace of mind.
title: Why pay $200 when Wyze exists?

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: icrews reviews
content: Great picture quality and features. Easy to setup and use. The notification features are perfect when I'm away so I am quickly aware of what's going on when something is going on. I have 2 of these cameras and set this one up in my living room to watch the dogs.  It's perfect to see what they're up to when im gone all day and the sound quality is great too. The free 7 seconds of recording is useful and I get a snippet of what happens. You can sign up for more recording time for a fee but I don't need it for this camera. This is a great camera for everyday indoor use or outdoor. I'd definitely recommend this and will be ordering more for the rest of the house.
title: Easy setup and use. Great picture quality.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Craig D
content: I bought my first one, and liked it so much I bought a second one, and then a third. Am extremely happy with all of them, and will buy more when I can afford to do so. I am looking forward to the new wireless thermostat they are intoducing soon, and plan on purchasing one for my own Christmas present. I always wanted a wireless thermostat, and now Wyze is making affordable products. No issues with any of the cameras so far!!
title: Great Cameras!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ozark Vegan
content: I recently purchased this Wyze camera to place outside.  Then came hurricane Florence. I was able to monitor my place after we were evacuated. We were in the eye of the storm and when power and internet were restored, the little Wyze cam dutifully popped back up, upside down from the winds, but it was able to pan and I could see the status of my property. After I returned, I found it also took on water and still worked. I am amazed by this product for this price.
title: Survived the Eye of a Hurricane

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ron
content: I needed indoor coverage and did not want to waste my Arlo outdoor cameras. Sadly the night vision stopped working days after setup whereas my Wyze v2 camera in another location performed flawlessly. So I ended up returning back to Amazon and for me the pan and tilt was not even needed for the coverage area I thought. The night vision is an ongoing issue and Wyze claims you don’t have enough background light for night vision to work right , ok then why does the v2 camera work flawlessly in the same location? This camera is junk.
title: Returned and purchased Wyze cam v2

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: CatsMeowMomma
content: I thought  I won mine, in a drawing - until I noticed it in my que for Reviews, at Amazon.  I got a dud, that visibly and audibly died upon trying to get it setup.  They had a good "reputation" best I heard.  This requires to be plugged in, so you do need it to be placed near an outlet.  For mine -  It burned out - heated up - never got past the initiation of it.  Several tries at getting it set up with the software on a tablet, and it heated up, audible "PFFT" - POP sound, and dead. No longer responsive.  This was months ago, so hopefully, others complained - and Wyze got it fixed.  No idea  - I might try to get a replacement - but I may have waited too long.  Hope you have better luck.
title: I got a dud

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J. Collins
content: This was easy to set up and for the price it is hard to beat. Picture quality is plenty good enough for inside the home distances like 10-20 feet. Further than that the facial features will blur out, but this is true of other 1080p cameras also. If you need to see details at more than 15 feet away get a better higher resolution camera like 5MP or 4K. These occasionally fail to connect to the router when I try to check in, but usually connect on the 2nd or 3rd try. Motion detection works well and follows the source of movement when set to do so in the settings. Outside of that, these work well for my purposes.
title: Works pretty well

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Charles Coates
content: If you just need a camera to stick inside a window these work great. They're not really designed/rated for outdoor use, and they don't do well with window screens, but for inside use or for setup in a non-screened window they work great. The Wyze app isn't amazing, and there's a small fee of $1 and some change per camera if you want "full motion" detection. Otherwise it records 11 second clips with several minutes cooldown between detections. But Wyze provides 1-week rolling storage, so compared to pretty much every other brand these are great if you have pretty straightforward needs (like catching people stealing your packages).
title: Great value, not designed for outdoor use.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Noturbizness
content: Been using these cams for over a month just trying them out before going crazy and installing them outside my house and cabin.  They have work perfect only issue that I see but it's minor inconvenience is that they do not have a brightness setting.  If you using it inside the house and pointing to a window the area of the window will be washed out due to brightness.  Night vision is good as stated in the packaging, panning is also acceptable to very good.  The only issue I had was on setup.  When setup the network on a smartphone it provides QR symbol that must be pointed directly at the camera.  This QR symbol will setup the network on the camera, my issue was that I could not get the cam to recognize QR.  I had to use my tablet, this afforded a larger QR symbol and the cam pick it up immediately.  Other than that hiccup everything else has worked fine.
title: Ver affordable Cam

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jim C.
content: Not going to pretend to be an expert. Just wanted a surveillance camera to cover my back lot and Auto. I'm glad I chose WYZE cam. I just did a quick search on AMAZON and came across Wyze cam. Long story short I'm a big fan of the whole company. Seen a few videos on YouTube and liked what I saw / story about the company. I live right outside of a city park. I thought well the camera won't keep anybody from doing anything wrong. But at least I would know what took place. A number of times people would look around and see the camera and could you see there disappointment.. I keep it in my window looking out. Very good quality. Not saying you can zoom in 100 feet away and see what color of eyes they have.. But for the price was a steal ! Good to see them adding more devices not just cams. And last week seen then in a big box hardware store. Actually made me smile seeing them in there. So yes I do recommend them !
title: My second one and more to follow !

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Chicago Book Addict
content: I'm VERY Impressed by this camera for the price. We got it so we can keep our tabs on our pet birds during the day. it was incredibly easy to set up, connects easily with our phones over wifi and works without issue. The only times we've had issues with it being online were because of our internet, not the camera itself. It also lets you know of any software updates and allows you to update them right from our phone. When using the camera the big pro for me was that this camera pans and tilts so I can move the camera around to find the birds. it also has settings so we can watch even at night when light is low. The only issue I have is at time the resolution still feels quite grainy and I have to squint to see the birds depending on their positioning, but given the affordable price point this is ok.
title: Pleasantly surprised

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Snowcat60
content: WOW! These small cameras really deliver! I am amazed at the picture quality for such a small and inexpensive camera. I use these to keep an eye on my crazy cats. The tilt, zoom and pan are fantastic and let me see everything that’s going on. I love the alerts, letting me know who’s misbehaving or in an area they don’t belong. Plus I can yell at the offenders if need be which is such a nice feature. The looks I get are priceless! Set up couldn’t be easier, and they fit just about anywhere you have an outlet. They are well built and have taken a beating in my house and keep working flawlessly. I do have one outside and so far so good, we’ll see how it does in the winter. I will definitely be buying more of these in the future to keep all areas covered in this crazy cat house.
title: Truly Amazing Quality

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: sloop454
content: I bought this camera to install in my home while we were gone on vacation for two weeks.  I had it aimed at the front door, but with the pan motion I could see all the way around.  It has motion detection, and I could control the view directly from my phone.  The camera is super easy to set up and easily controlled from the wyze app.  I am slowly converting my entire security system to Wyze.  NO I DO NOT WORK FOR WYZE and I have not received any free products.  These are just great cameras at a very reasonable price.  I am waiting for the release of the doorbell and smart thermostats. Although I already have 6 cameras inside and outside I will also be adding 4 more cameras to cover the sides and back of the house. I love these cams and will not buy anything else.
title: ANOTHER GREAT CAMERA FROM WYZE

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: William Waterson
content: These cameras 100% rely on the Wyze servers and there's no way around it unless you use 3rd party firmware. I wish I did more research. You need the Wyze servers constantly for authentication and configuration.  This will be a problem for anyone that wants to use these cameras securely offline on a local LAN.  Want adjust the sensitivity ? You'll need the internet for that. Want to play back footage locally inside the app even though you didn't record to the cloud? You'll need the internet for that. Want to use the pan controls locally? You'll need the internet for that. Want to use the app  locally in general? You'll need the internet for that.  Also, if something happens to the company these cameras will be worthless. You can use the beta rtsp firmware that wyze provides and the camera will stream locally, but you will not be able to use the app, configure it in anyway or use the pan controls. The second most annoying thing is retrieving the footage. This can only be done by 1) taking out the SDcard 2) Playing the recorded footage inside the app and pressing record, therefore you are essentially recording already recorded footage in real time. This is the most ridiculous method ever. Picture quality was good, motion tracking was nice, but I rather use a "scary Chinese" camera that can be cut off from the internet and won't lose any functionality.
title: These cameras 100% rely on the Wyze servers and the internet

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ernest suter
content: Awesome camera for the price. I bought 2 based on reviews to test it out. After being happily surprised with the quality, I have since bought 14 more. Pros: excellent quality for the price. Very good picture quality. Great motion detection and it will turn to follow the movement. Cons: using it as a night vision camera outside it over compensates for light a little too much. The night vision is often blurred from trying to get light in and looks a little like having headlights coming at you on a dark road. Day quality is 10 out of 10, night I would give it about a 2 or 3 out of 10 outside. The interior cameras are about 8 out of 10 in the dark.
title: Excellent camera for the price, highly recommended.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: P
content: I bought two of these cameras. One of them stopped working and decided to just look on the floor! That’s the angle camera automatically decides to stick to! I had this in my baby’s room and initially it worked well for 3 weeks! After that whenever I checked to see my baby, it would just look on the floor and if I try to reset the view to look at the baby, it forcefully looks back on the floor! Very disappointed! The other camera seems to be working so far but it has been just couple of days and I have already lost trust in the product! The picture and audio quality however is good- no complaints there but durability is an issue!!
title: Frustrating!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: E
content: First, I love the Wyze cams, I truly do.  Inexpensive, easy set up, easy to use with the app.  Great in a location where you are present.  Unfortunately, all of that is useless if you are trying to monitor a remote location.  I'm 800 miles away from the location I am trying to monitor, and two of the three cameras drop offline on a regular basis.  Sometimes they will come back on their own after days or weeks of being offline, but normally I have to cycle the power to get them back--and my inexpensive camera is absolutely worthless unless I spend the money and time to make the trip.  This is NOT an uncommon problem with the Wyze cams, and yet it still has not been addressed.
title: Great camera...if it didn't drop offline on a regular basis

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kimberlea
content: EDIT: New update and this thing is a dream! I bought an entire set for my parents as well. Love this camera and love this company. I would highly recommend this camera. It works extremely well, has an easy to use app, doesn't require insane monthly fees, and comes with a great team behind it. The only reason I knocked off a star is because I'm literally driving myself insane having to unplug it, unplug my router, replug it in, and replug my router constantly. Every other day it disconnects from the wifi and can't be found. That makes it extremely important that I always remember to turn it on while I'm home so I can troubleshoot if need. It sucks that I can just turn it on and off whenever, since half the time it gives me an error. When it does work, it works so well! I really do love it and recommend it, but would love to see it connect to 5G and save me all of this hassle.
title: Incredible little camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: MTB Guy
content: Much cheaper than the Ring and it works! It's not a perfect product, but for the price it's good. The Pan is big, but with the ability to remotely rotate and tilt I love it. Great for living rooms or even monitoring the yard. A few things I didn't like. The built in speaker could be louder. Seems like I really have to yell at my phone trying to talk to the other person on the cam. Also there was times when I couldn't connect to the cam from my phone. It would just hang up or never connect. There is a few bugs such as the SD card cannot be formatted using the app and you will need a computer to format. App can be improved to work more smoothly. Some times laggy. Sometimes viewing back the recorded footage is a headache. No way to smoothly fast forward or rewind. Tends to freeze or skip at times. Now on to the good stuff. The cam support a SD card that can store all the videos for future play back. Wyze also offers free saving to the cloud for I believe 14days unlike other companies who charge a fee for that service. It will never replace an actual security camera but great for monitoring the house.
title: I need to order more!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Impulse Buyer
content: I’ve included pics of it. My hallway is 50ft long. The zoom is good for about 10ft, after that you have to be 1080p HD mode which uses about 1mb of data and the picture (daytime) is only slightly more clear. I do not believe you be able to make out a face. So if it’s for a standard size 12x12- 15x15 room then yes, get it. If it’s for a hallway over 15ft, don’t. A camera that’ll zoom further than that will cost upwards of $175.
title: Depends on what you want from it.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Nic Btw
content: I've wasted enough time on this junk, so this review has to be short because I AM DONE. Camera auto rotated until wire twisted itself free of the circuit board.  Motion detection extremely flawed, flase alarms.  IR night vision glares off of everything, making it useless.  Micro USB power hub is in a great spot for moisture to drip into.  LOSES CONNECTION CONSISTENTLY.  DO NOT MOUNT YOUR CAMERAS OUT OF REACH, YOU WILL HAVE TO RECONNECT THEM OVER AND OVER.  My home network is extremely strong, this is a Wyze Labs issue. I wish I could return all 6 of the cameras, mounts and housings I've purchased.  What a massive mistake.
title: GARBAGE! Rotated until wires broke?!?! UNBELIEVABLE

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Lily
content: I now own 4 cameras - 1 pan, 3 stationary and I am about to purchase another pan. The value you get for the price is outstanding. Anyone who sees me viewing the Wyze app or has been in my home can see that I am a super fan and I take every moment to rave about the quality of the videos and features. Motion-tracking, live feed, zoom, tilt, photo capture and recording with free 14-day rolling storage, 2-way communication, HD/SD/360p,  night vision, slot for sd card, recording, notifications, sound recognition for smoke alarms and CO monitors, compact, super easy setup, magnetic (optional), works with Alexa and IFFFT app, WiFi enabled meaning no direct wired connection to your modem needed My primary use is to monitor pet activity. I also chat with people at home. The premise of this camera was designed to keep connected with family members while out on the road, all while keeping costs low. I am completely baffled by anyone that states Wyze cams are not a good security camera. No where does Wyze use the words security or protection. It is reviewers that have redefined this camera and Wyze does not have control over what words are used in reviews. I welcome all to check these facts on wyzecam.com. I would also encourage anyone who requires specific functionality to chat with a support rep prior to making a purchase, being unhappy and leaving a bad review. For those who think they should have all the same bells and whistles that they claim are built in with expensive cameras, save us all the grief of reading your low star ratings and take your purchase elsewhere.
title: PURCHASING MY 5TH WYZE CAM -  Major Features Listed

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: L to the Barker
content: The camera is OK. What really bothers me is how weak it is when using it with Google Assistant. If you ask it "hey Google show me (x) on (x) TV the feed freezes instantly or doesn't load. There's lots of online forums with hundreds of posts complaining about the same. Add to that the app doesn't have a Chromecast button built in. It's awful! Look how many apps have a Chromecast button built in! Not Wyze? I won't be investing in any more Wyze cams until they have better Google compatibility. Cameras manufacturered by Google-owned companies are a lot more expensive but they're a breeze connecting to all of my Google TVs and Chromecasts. I can see them whenever I want with voice commands and they always work. Wyze doesn't.
title: It's Google Assistant compatibility is awful.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: AZRN
content: Great product at an amazing price for its features. A little tricky setting up the camera at first, but then easy as pie after that. The night vision is superior! You will be able to see into a pitch black room and see everything you could want to. Being able to check on my mom while at work was one of the main reasons I bought this system and it delivered. I was unable to really check the 2-way audio feature, as the cameras were situated right next to a TV, which drowned out hearing the person in the room. Could hear the TV just fine, though! If the TV were off, I think you could talk to and be heard by the person in the room if they weren't too hard of hearing. It has lots of features and is useful for indoor security. (You can set up the camera(s) on a window sill to see outside your house if you want to.) I was able to check on my house while away from home, both locally and internationally. As long as you have WiFi access, you can tap into the cameras with the app. It is secure from hacking, if your WiFi is secure.
title: Vwey helpful with elderly parent check-ins

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Maximoto
content: This camera has great PTZ feature, 1080p vedio live stream quality, night vision, local and/or cloud storage and two-way audio. Even has motion and sound detection! Cons: The cloud recording is limit to 12 secs  each recording Two-way audio works but hard to have a real conversation with audio delay and not clear on the app. Pros: Just about everything else works really great and the cost is a amazing. I paired this with Amazon smart plug and Alexa to watch my living room when I'm away. It uses goefencing to turn on when I leaving the house and off when I'm in the house so I get privacy, and at night when I to bed using Alexa Routines. I just bought another one for my backyard so now I can see everything going on 24/7 and the PTZ feature come very handy. Please make a solar panel to support this so then the I can have more of these around the house without having to run electricity outlet.
title: Why pay hundred of dollars for a camera that can't PTZ?

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: G. Jones
