content: This is my second Wyze cam.  I got the standard (fixed) cam to try it out.  The setup, use and value are superb.  Wyze cams work exactly as advertised and are an incredible value.  As I find things that I want to monitor - my first impulse is Wyze.  My only complaint is that the IOS app allows viewing only 1 cam at a time.  The login process to see the cam is quick, but having a multi-view would move this product from incredible value to unbelievable value (and would change this to a 5 star). I have my pan/tilt/zoom mounted upside down on the bottom of an upper cabinet.  The setup easily allows for the reversed view to be corrected.  The pan and tilt are intuitive and useful.  The zoom - not so much, but the clarity of the 1080p image makes up for it.
title: Incredible value

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: AJ
content: Bought 3 camers 6m ago, two are working still. Camera update bricked one. The cameras somehow change position on there own after time. The app locks up and crashes. The preview for recorded footage in the app could be more acurate. A car was harassing my wife while she walked our dogs recording her then flashing explicit material of himself on his phone at her. The app crashed so many times I gave up trying to get the images of the vehicle off the app. I record in hd and peoples faces are unrecognizable on the sidewalk from my camera 15' away. During a wyze camera update my camera sd card died. Thats all the bad. I have used other camers systems and this one seems to be right on par with them. I do still prefer Wyze due to all its features and for that price its worth the kinks.
title: You get what you pay for.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: dsciarappo
content: After having this camera for 2 days now I found that its so easy to operate and maintain. This camera has awesome controls and easy to adjust. The best part was taking it out of the box and setting it up. Honestly from the moment I began connecting the power cable downloading the app and connecting to my WIFI and inserting the 32gb SDC card it took no longer than 5 minutes. The directions are straight forward and easy to understand. Seriously folks for the $ you cannot go wrong! The PTZ works great and I haven’t found one flaw so far. If I had to find an issue I would say the sound coming from panning is a bit loud but unless you know it’s coming you wouldn’t know where it’s coming from. Feel confident w/this purchase you will not be disappointed. This is a great buy for the money. So far the IOS app works flawlessly. I can’t say enough good things about this camera. The power cord is long however I choose the 25 ft power cord option for $10 only because where I want to place my camera I have no available outlet.
title: Great product for a great price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: RonRN
content: Good picture quality and good night vision.  I'm giving it an overall 4-stars primarily because of the jumpiness of the pan picture and the additional fee for the motion detection.  You get two weeks free, but after that you have to pay!
title: Disappointed

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: RockUncleBratt
content: This camera worked great for the first month I was using it.  I purchased the additional motion detector and 2 devices that alert me in real time when the items they are attached to are opened and closed. After a month or so this camera stater acting up and was rebooting every minute and that only stopped when I removed the memory card.  I have no idea why it does not work as it did when I first bought it. I found no explanation for this problem and saw that there are many other users with the same issue. Leads me to believe it's a flaw in the software and am in Hope's that the wyze folks will be able to resolve this problem. When they do I'll gladly update this review. Until then I think it best to seek out another device.
title: Great camera with a need for software fix.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Arturo
content: I have 2 Wyze v2 cameras in my home had them for a while now and i love them. So I decided to buy a Wyze cam pan to add another camera for my drive way. After programming it and installing it and hiding all the wires i notice that right in front of the lens there is a scratch or piece of plastic or something on the inside so now im stuck with a blurry image.  But since I already went through the pain of running wire and drilling my wall for the mount i dont want to go through removing everything and sending it back.  Guess this was my last Wyze product
title: Disappointed

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Frostwoman
content: Day One - setup in LESS than two minutes and I had a live picture on my iPhone. I will update later but setup was a ****breeze compared to other cameras that I have had the displeasure of buying and trying - one neat thing is that Privacy is BUILT IN.  You physically have to enter someone else’s email address in order to allow them access - other devices had PIN numbers or passwords, those can be guessed if you are anything like me.  This is something that I have not seen before - very nice. The picture is SUPER sharp and I am extremely impressed with the sharpness of the picture.  Zoom is good, still playing with the camera and will be testing IR early tomorrow and will update stars when I have tested and feel confident in my rating. I say awesome camera for now. I have ordered two of these, but waiting for the second camera to come in.  I am just simply impressed with the set up and it really IS that simple.
title: Set up is a SNAP!!!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J. Gefaell
content: To start, I very much dislike that this product, and others like it do not allow storage to non proprietary remote systems, 'the cloud'. The quality of video, the software and pan and scan with event detection are so wonderful! They don't even charge for the storage offered, however it's beyond inadequate. That is the reason for the 4 star rating. I'd like to give 3 stars because of this, but I feel that's unfair due to all the other outstanding aspects of this product. If only they'd allow configuration to store to arbitrary TCP/IP connected services. Like my own private NAS located in one of my safes, for instance. Or my private virtual cloud servers located far away, or even things like apple, google and other 'drives'. Well, so there you have it. for <$40 you can keep tabs on what's going on at home, while you're not there. Two way audio, 1080P video (with selectable levels of compression), pan/tilt/ and event detection, night vision with IR illumination... FANTASTIC! Let me store my data effectively, please!
title: The quality and functionality, for the price, are astounding!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rafa
content: This camera has been ok until now that they want money for the person detection feature , making this camera obsolete. There should be an option to have the camera saving the events to the sd card instead on the cloud since the camera is already paid. This is the reason why I bought the camera in the first place to detect a person not to detect a dog or a tree moving in the middle of the night
title: Person detection only if you pay for

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: B. Hesse
content: This camera really is revolutionary. My coworker recommended it to me and I LOVE it. First of all, I can’t believe it’s less than $100, let alone less than $40. That’s just downright amazing. I’ve been wanting a home security system for years but they’re always so expensive. A camera from Nest, for example, doesn’t have pan/tilt but costs well over $100. The app is also pretty amazing. I’m an iOS developer and I think their iOS app is truly top notch. All in all, this camera gets 10/5 stars from me!
title: Truly incredible camera! Buying a few more for sure.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Brian H.
content: The first Wyze cam pan I ordered would not power on out of the box. I had it replaced and now I keep getting an error code 90 on the replacement cam. It's about 20 feet from my Meraki AP and signal strength is 36dB. Rebooting it temporarily fixes the issue but the camera goes offline again. I replaced an old Dropcam HD and was hoping to save money on the expensive monthly recording fees charged by Google Nest but I think I'm going to end up going back to Nest. The video quality is great for the price but it seems to get what you pay for in terms of overall hardware quality.
title: Quality control issues

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Molly
content: So first off, I buy off of Amazon almost every single day, and I rarely post a review, because that would take my whole day, every day hahah but... Oh... my.... gosh...., I bought this like 6 months ago, along with the smaller, non-swivel one, and I just haven't had the ambition to set it up. We redid my son's room. So I did. Finally. And let me tell you, I am beyond PISSED at myself that I didn't set this up sooner!!!!! That's legit all I have to say. It's amazing. I'm buying one for every single one of my rooms (besides my bathrooms because that'd be weird). I'm at a friends house at the moment, and I can see my sons room from here. I'm on WiFi at his house and about 7 miles away, and I can see my song watching his movie. (He's 2 by the way and home with Daddy/my husband) so it's soooo reassuring I can see my baby happy.
title: Amazing. Just amazing.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: bluesman
content: This camera is worthless if you are wanting to monitor your house from a distance.  The only thing you can depend on with this camera is getting error code 90. Which means it is not connected to the Internet and therefore useless.  A voice from the camera keeps repeating the phrase ready to connect but it never does. Imagine if you were using it to monitor  A sick person who couldn't get out of bed. They would have to lay there and listen to this stupid phrase over and over. It would be torture. The only way to  shut it up is to physically unplug it from the wall.  I have had this camera for 14 hours and it has failed twice. Error code 90 check Internet connection. The Internet network  in the house is fine.  After deleting the device from the app and reinstalling from square one I was able to get it to reconnect to the Internet. Four hours later… Error code 90  and the annoying voice starts repeating ready to connect.  But of course it can't reconnect  and the voice will not shut up until you physically unplug it from the wall or hit it with a hammer.  There is no 800 number for customer service. All web-based. I don't see how this company can brag about their customer service. There is none.
title: Be ready for error code 90. Unable to connect to Internet. Unplug from wall and throw in trash.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Pip Lowback
content: I purchased this camera to keep an eye on my cat while I am away.  I had already purchased the original Wyze cam that doesnt pan and have absolutely loved it since I started using it.  This camera however goes above and beyond with the bells and whistles and without a doubt the most simple installation process ever.  I had this camera working out of box within 5 mins.  Its easy to reset and restart if the wifi goes out or the power goes out.  Camera picture quality is beyond expectations and has all the features of motion capture and detection and all that great stuff for the nerds like me.  The price is cheap but dont let that fool you, these cameras are built solid and built for functionality.  I truly love these cameras and suggest them to anyone looking for a security system that they can control themselves with relative ease.  Software updates are always rolling out too which keeps the software up to date with great features.  Buy this camera!  I promise it will not disappoint.
title: Even better than the original Wyze Cam

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S. P. Banker
content: This camera does everything it advertises very well. It's extremely well made and small enough to install in very confined areas. It was pretty easy to set up and I have gone out of town and been able to monitor my home very quickly and easily. The two way sound feature is cool too. I can say hi to my pets while I'm at work. I am buying another camera so I can set one up at my summer home to monitor the yard when I'm gone.
title: A quality camera at a very affordable price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Wyckoff
content: I read a lot of negative reviews for this product, and while some of them talked about true issues, most of them just overlooked the fact that you can buy three of these cameras for about a hundred bucks, something that is truly amazing. Picture quality is excellent, it has night vision, two weeks of free internet storage of highlight clips, the ability to listen and speak, and a host of other really great features. They install very easily. If you are concerned with having to reset if the power goes out, bye and I tech smart outlet for 9 bucks on Amazon and plug it into that. On the slightly negative side, it is not always easy to turn these off, and sometimes you cannot disable the motion-tracking, which can be annoying when you're walking by and the camera is making noisy adjustments every 5 seconds. Build quality is good (heavy and solid). If you want to dip your toe into the waters of home cameras, this is a great place to start.
title: Can't Beat For Price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S. Bassler
content: I’ve had an Arlo Q for about 2 years that we use to monitor our dogs when we are not home. Recently that camera has had its night vision stop working which is a huge part of why I got that to begin with. After reading all of the positive reviews on the WYZE cameras, I figured I would try out the on cam. Wow, I am thoroughly impressed!! Not only does it give a similar video feed and night vision, but you get the added benefits of the panning, and tilting features! This camera is by far the best value out there for monitoring what is going on in your home while away. The Arlo cost me 4x what this cost. A must have!!
title: Right up there with the Arlo Q!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rita
content: I love this product and the company which makes it. Wyze cameras offer so many features that help you use the camera to it's fullest capability. I have 3 cameras constantly recording exits/entrances to my house so I have full security of my home and they're been working perfectly. This camera is the most basic form the company sells but it does its job very well. The cameras offer an app that allows you to view the cameras and their recording at any time, making our job a whole lot easier! If you have any issues with the product or it wears over time (which mine hasn't), you can contact their support and they fix the issue very quickly and easily. 10/10 for the product!
title: Worth it?

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: alberto valdecir muller
content: Well, This might be good enough for other applications, however It does not help much as a baby monitor. I had issues with the sound, as I had to mute and unmute to make the sound work. Also, the sound is only active If the app is open and you are staring at it. If you open another app in your cellphone and the Wyze all stays in the background, the sound will not work and you will miss you baby crying. Until Wyze upgrades the product and app for a better function as baby monitor, It would be advertised as suitable for it. I am now returning the product and will buy a traditional baby monitor.
title: Does not work well as a baby monitor.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Wen Mald
content: This is so useful, budget friendly, easy to use, well made; so many functions, picture quality is extremely good, night vision it's super good, you can talk through it, customize as much as you want, the app is really easy to use, they don't charge ridiculous fees like other companies.. I could go all day saying good things about this, but I'll just tell you that I spend a lot of time researching about all the different security cameras out there, and this is the absolute winner. Sure your camera could get hacked, but that's a risk every single things connected to the internet has, it's a really small chance, and for this price and quality, I mean.. One thing I'm not so happy about, is that if you have a lot of movement in your house (pets), the movement detection stops working and you don't get clips of every movement, mine is only working with sound detection now.. Also, recently the fire alarm form my building was ringing and the camera didn't detect it, so that worries me. But nothing is perfect, this comes pretty close tho.. Overall, pretty happy with my purchase, I'll definitely buy more
title: Best camera ever!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mildred
content: I bought this camera so I can watch my dog while I’m out I did the whole set up very easy my only problem is I get no notifications and it’s all set for all types of notifications it just will not notify me at all of a person or movement nothing I had another camera but it stopped working for me so I bought this one because of the good reviews I would’ve given a 5 star because the picture quality is great but can’t get the notifications to work so it’s 4 stars from me
title: Could’ve been a five star

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Sumit Shah
content: Overall, I really like this camera, and I would definitely recommend it to people.  The camera has clear picture quality, great app connection, and good remote control response.  The only drawback, and the reason for my 4-star rating, is the motion detection software is extremely sensitive.  If you turn on motion detection, then the camera CONSTANTLY zoom from one place to another detecting motion.  For example, if I'm standing in one place, it will move to me, but then keep zooming left and right as it detects my hand movements.  It doesn't recognize that the motion is all in one area so just keep still focusing on that one area.  Instead it constantly moves left and right.  I've even lowered the motion sensitivity settings all the way down, but it made no difference.  And the constant back and forth zooming is annoying because of the sound it makes while zooming.  I have 2 cameras and both do this, so I've just turned the motion detection feature off, which is a bummer because that is an important feature for me.
title: Great security camera; poor motion detection software

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: James R.
content: If you're looking for an easy to use, easy to install camera for your home, you can't beat what Wyze has to offer - especially at $30. You get quick and easy setup, full control through an easy to use app, USB powered versatility, and multiple installation options all in box. I won't go over all the features, you can do that on your own at the Wyzecam website. What I will say is that these cameras are not about the marketing hype or "charge a premium to make our product seem superior" like other brands. Somehow Wyze Labs put together a slick little remote panning camera with two-way audio, motion detection, waypoints, and 24-hour configurable app notifications for just $30! It's not perfect - the two-way sound is a little tinny and the "motion detection" is based on pixel changes, but again - you can't get better for $30. It's so good that this is my 4th Wyzecam I've installed in the house (two V2's and 2 Pans). I bought the first 3 direct from Wyze, but the Amazon price comes out to the same but with the added benefit of Amazon Prime shipping (compared to regular shipping from Wyze direct).
title: Really great little camera for a really great price!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: one New Yorker
content: Motion tracking: the camera is constantly tracking/recording 'nothing' as motion. Possibly the reflection of the IR lights on the wall. no matter where you set sensitivity Sound event recording: haphazard. Will record sometimes, other times not - no matter where you set sensitivity Pan-scan: every two days or so, I have to reset all the scan points, because the cam changes everything up but itself. SD storage: it "loses" the card often. Then l have to get a ladder take down the cam and reset the SD card, then go reposition the cam. Remote viewing: has to reconnect every time change viewing window, 30% of the time it won't connect and you have to shut down the app and restart Remote control: 50% of the time it won't work or it will work but your view won't keep up so you're overshooting and correcting. Do not expect to be able to follow something that's moving Streaming: app only, no way to use the video stream with any viewer Audio: spotty. don't expect to listen to conversations if they're not within 3 feet of cam Everything else, that most other cams do, it does ok. It cannot be relied upon as a security camera or child care camera, it's too unreliable. Good for pets or as a toy. Looks different than most others, if you care about that. I have two of these. Both same problems. A third one just all out died, company sent me a new one. They're used mainly for my little child to look at the cats.
title: It's a toy, not a security camera or child monitor

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Lester McGowan
content: Good picture but not what I would expect for 1080 HD. No real zoom- just pinch to zoom. It “zooms” but you lose resolution. Motion tracking is well done. Follows the right things at the right time. App interface and setup is pretty straightforward like any IoT device these days. If you have an Amazon Fire device, you can ask Alexa to show you the live cam on the TV once the ‘skill’ is properly enabled. Will probably buy more. I’m interested in the stationary camera for another spot as well. ProTip: spend $10 and get the biggest microSD card it will take.
title: Best bang for your camera buck.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Miriam Shafivddin
content: We have these at all out stores and our home. We have 10+ Samsung & scandisk micro sd cards. It will either work to record for a short period of time (hours) or say no card installed. I have computer skills here people so cards are formatted correctly. THE ONLY CARDS THAT WORK properly are wyze cards! Thats just bad business. Only reason I still buy these stupid cameras is because the cameras work great and the app is nice. Having to buy there sd cards is not a deal breaker but thats just wrong to tell people all brands of sd cards work when in fact THEY DO NOT. If you want to see my product review search the internet for Lady Seanna Wyze Pan Cam
title: We own 10 of these cameras and ONLY wyze sd cards work!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: DigDawg
content: I bought two cameras about 2 years ago to build my own security system when replacing a national subscription-based system, and these cameras work great and come with nicely featured software. My only complaint is that one of the cameras started has begun failing with terrible image quality no matter what I do with the configuration or reboots. The other camera, however, is still working perfectly.
title: Bought Two - Image Quality Is Very Good And Software/Features Excel - One Is Failing Now

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Lynn
content: I’ve bought three of these in a week, they are pretty decent cameras, I feel like the quality is similar to my Ring cameras. The set up process is not as easy as it should be, after now setting up 3 of the exact cameras I learned that you should ignore what the camera tells you during set up AFTER you’ve scanned your phone for the code. - Every single time I got an error message, the first time I went through their tech support and eventually the camera fixed itself. **Just let the camera sit for a couple minutes after you scan the code on your phone. The last error message I received was- ‘cannot find specified network name. I let it sit and SURPRISE-it fixed itself. Patience grasshopper. Clearly the setup didn’t detour me from buying more of this camera. Easy app. User friendly. Well priced.
title: Third times the charm! I own three now.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ty Nguyen
content: It basically does everything it is supposed to but the swivel action is so noisy it is very annoying.  It sounds like a robot doing "the robot"....constantly.  I use it as a pet monitor and turn on the motion tracker so it can follow my dog when he moves around; I would say this works 90% of the time.  Does not work well when he runs.  The camera isn't able to catch up with the motion. The mic is pretty good and I can hear everything that is necessary and unfortunately, the swivel noise too which would not be too bad but with the motion tracking it constantly swivels back and forth when my dog is just laying there and chewing on a toy and moving his head.  Instead of the camera staying still since my dog is already in the frame, it would swivel back and forth and back and forth.  I just then mute the sound, but then that defeats the purpose of having the mic/sound feature.  Seems like you have to decide to either put up with the noise or go with no sound.  I am going to try it for a few more days then decide if I want to return it.  There are just so many other choices out there.
title: Does the job, but Noisy

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ChicagoFlyBy
content: Where is Wyze quality control when packaging products?  Cam Pan arrived w black stains. I did not test the functionality of the cam. It failed at box opening for plastic production quality. This Cam Pan arrived factory sealed and pack with a black dusted stained tint within the plastic housing. I initially thought it was dust that’d simply wipe off. Nope. It’s baked right inside the plastic from the mold injection machine that created it.  How does this literal black & white flaw get shipped to consumers?  It unfortunately taints everything I originally thought Wyze. Quality control is everything.  Returned.
title: Not so Wyze failure is simple as black & white.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Edward F. Newbold
content: Like most others who purchased these cameras, I found the camera photo quality to be fine, but the software running them is absolutely TERRIBLE.  Plus, like most others, these cameras destroyed brand new high quality memory cards.  The range from my router to a camera is extremely limited.  twenty-five feet is optimal.  Anything over that, and the control of the camera goes to about zero.  The recording to their cloud is horrible.  I had seven motion-activated clips supposedly recorded to the cloud, but on two were actually viewable; the other five have not "finished uploading".  Plus, there's no way to delete these phantom videos!  I will NOT buy anymore of these cameras!
title: Great picture - terrible software

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J. Fancher
content: I bought one of these specifically to put in my living room for the purpose of training my dog to stay off the couch. I had an Amazon Cloud Cam in there originally that went on the fritz and due to the price, decided to try a Wyze Pan instead. The video quality is great, and the microphone on the unit works just fine so that I can hear things on the camera app. However, you cannot speak through the app to the camera. It just doesn't produce sound. The app will toggle talk mode properly, but nothing comes out of the camera speaker. Unfortunately, that's a pretty sour deal for me given the purpose of the purchase. I can sit and watch my mutt on my couch and cannot tell her to get down due to the 2-way audio not working. I've searched online and see that this is a very common issue with the Wyze camera's due to firmware updates. Wyze would be "wise" to fix the issue if they're going to continue to boast 2-way audio as a feature on their camera's. I would buy a bunch if it worked, but unfortunately I would advise against them for anyone who asked.
title: Great 'camera', 2-Way Audio is useless

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kath
content: I would have given 5 stars but I have to reset it almost daily. Could me my wifi connection but also the sd card I got (which is the one they recommended) was very hard to get working, I had to format it on my PC first then today I noticed the camera is not recognizing it at all so I will have to start from scratch. The image is awesome and the motion detection and night vision are great too. Helps me to keep an eye on my kittens when I am at work as I am trying to train them to stay off the cabinets....I get to see they walk all round them and look at the camera when I tell them to get down....totally ignoring me. I would say if you need a good camera to watch your home this one is wonderful.
title: works great

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Missy
content: Bought 2 will be buying more! I’ve recommended them to at least 4 people who bought them immediately! The video quality is amazing, they captured everything sound movement sends alerts. So many ways to customize them. You can change the sensitivity. I have one set up in my front window and it captures everything in my courtyard front door through the window 😮! The app is awesome works with Alexa all I have to do is say “Alexa show me the front door” and I get a live feed from my front door !
title: Most amazing camera can’t believe it’s $36 😳

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kyle
content: I bought this once last year and it wouldn’t connect to my 2.4g Spectrum. I attempted to contact customer service 3 days in a row and never got through to anyone so I returned it. A friend at work said that they updated everything so I decided to buy again last week. The camera now connects to my internet this time, but, the quality isn’t great for what I need it for. The description says HD and clear footage up to 30 feet which sounds fine until I put it on the exterior of my house watching my driveway and garage which is about 50-75 feet away. The camera doesn’t pick up human bodies walking, but does pick up vehicles. At night, it picks up the light from cars driving by but not during the day which is strange as well. This camera seems to be a great budget camera but you do get what you pay for.
title: You get what you pay for.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: DCE
content: For the price, this is an excellent home Cam. PROS ... Picture quality is surprisingly good.  (Don't except 4K clarity or it to be as good as the camera on a late model phone) Software is is also good and has a easy user interface. Sound and Voice quality is good. Pan Scan options. Excellent live display viewing speed when using my cellular data(T-mobile). Hardware Decoding option.  (Makes the quality on my S9+ even better). CONS.... In a quiet room, pan scanning makes noticeable noise. The motor could be quieter. It's takes maybe a minute or two after lights are turn on, for night vision to auto disable. Sometimes connecting to the cam can be a pain, but 95% of the time it connects with no issues. Too much false auto detection, which makes it pan around too much. Even if you set sensitivity to the lowest. I would highly recommend this as a cheaper alternate to the much more expensive cams, or as a first home cam.
title: CAN'T BEAT THIS FOR THE PRICE!!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tiggens
content: I was excited for an easy camera solution to monitor my house, garage, front door, etc.  I have a friend that swears by this camera.  So I bought 1 to try it out before I pick up the 10-15 other Wyze devices that I'd be interested in.  Tried to set it up in my office, until I order the rest, I figured I'd use this one to monitor my 3d printer.  After trying to get it to connect to my network for 10-15 minutes (just said that setup failed on the app) and trying the suggestions (restart the modem and router) I gave up and moved within 3 ft of my router and modem.  Yay....It works.  Connected and played with it for a few minutes then tried to move it back to my office.  Whoops, it doesn't reconnect when it looses power (well thats not going to work for me).  But, I still wouldn't mind something to monitor my 3d printer.  So I try and set it up in my office again (after deleting the device in the app and trying a fresh install).  No luck.  And the crazy part is the router is only about 15 ft away.  One wall in between, no microwaves or anything that should cause interference issues.  Going to try and send it back.  Look elsewhere for your camera solutions!!!
title: Camera looks good, like all the features.  No better than a paperweight when it won't connect

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Marco C.
content: I bumped into the Wyze products when they were brand new and not as known as they are today. Camera is great for your home, garage, yard, etc... Installed this as an outdoor camera with a waterproof bracket from a seller on Amazon and I've never had any issues with heat, cold, rain and snow... Great features available and for the pricing of them, there's no better deal than these Wyze cameras and has alot of Addons and more coming.
title: Great cameras for the price of the product. Wyze brand is great choice and low cost.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: LOUIE
content: After using this camera, I cant complain. Have the camera mounted on the corner and using it as motion detection. Motion detection is perfect only records a couple of seconds, then It will stop recording for 5mins and it will start recording again if motion is detected. Last month bought an SD micro memory card 128gb (Samsung) and so far keeps recording continuously. max it records is 15days on HD Quality and then starts deleting the old footage. Don't know if it will get above 128gb of memory.
title: excellent camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Gregory A.
content: Does not work well with echo show 8... Constantly says, waiting for wyze... The camera seems to work good using my galaxy s9  but not as advertised with echo show even though I have 100 meg internet... It continuously transmits sound to echo show 8 even when it's buffering or waiting for wyze... I do not want to turn off the sound on my viewing devices, I just want the microphone to be able to be shut off... If it can't be fixed I'm sending the camera back... The cloud storage is only 2 days instead of 14 and has caused me to lose some valuable video I thought was saved. All that's left is the first 12 seconds... When you hit playback it says video does not exist...
title: DOES NOT WORK AS ADVERTISED

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: MJP725
content: The unit I got (not sure if it is just me) has terrible motion tracking.  I need to set it to 100 to get any notifications at all even with people walking right in front of it.  Hopefully this is just a firmware thing.  My Wyzecam v2 has been flawless and picks up motion in the default setting perfectly (around 50). Please fix the motion tracking sensitivity.
title: Almost perfect with one exception...

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Richard Meyers
content: Discovered the Wyze cameras by accident, and their writeups seemed to be solid, do bought 2 to play with. I was surprised at their capabilities, but documentation was totally devoid of setup instructions. The app to control the cameras only gets you through connection to the app, nothing else. No explanations on feature sets, functionality, or connection to smart home networks. Their website is VERY Poor. So an IT professional like me, this was eventually solved, but a regular user would be confused and frustrated. The cameras technically were better than cams that are over 250.00 for Pan Tilt Zoom. The app allows for setup of Motion Detect, Motion Follow, but explanation on how is seriously missing.
title: Technically excellent, but poor documentation

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Angel
content: Quería una cámara de seguridad que no estuviera conectada a ningún "cloud" de ningún proveedor y al final dí con esta cámara. Primero decir que la compré en amazon.com en lugar de amazon.es porque aquí cuesta unos 30€, que con portes y aranceles sube a poco más de 40€, y no los 115€ que te cobran en amazon.es. Al haberla comprado en amazon EEUU, obviamente el cargador es el norteamericano, así que toca usar un adaptador a nuestro schuko. Afortunadamente, el cable USB proporcionado es bastante largo, blanco y planito, con lo que en mi caso he podido aprovechar una regleta que tenía con salidas USB detrás de mi sofá. La cámara funciona bastante bien, la calidad de vídeo es impresionante y la posibilidad de mover 360º la visión y unos 90º la altitud, es de agradecer. Se controla exclusivamente a través de una app móvil que podría funcionar mejor (a veces se niega a conectar a la cámara y te ves obligado a cerrar la app y volverla a abrir) pero que es bastante completa, ya que puedes programar eventos, ver las capturas o vídeos que se efectúen cuando detecte movimiento y hojear el histórico de vídeos y capturas por días. Las notificaciones push al móvil no funcionan tan bien como cabría esperar. Se supone que hay un modo que en cuanto detecta movimiento, captura un vídeo de 12s y te notifica al móvil, lo cual es ideal, pero aunque detecte el movimiento y grabe el vídeo, a veces te notifica minutos después o incluso ni te notifica, y te das cuenta cuando entras a la app y ves que el apartado "Events" tiene una marquita roja (queriendo decir que hay nuevos elementos). También he tenido que desactivar el "motion tracking" y "motion tagging" porque se volvía loca girando de un lado a otro... supongo que debo buscar algo de información en internet, pero como estando estática ya abarca lo que quiero que abarque, por ahora los desactivo. Mas cosas chulas. En IFTTT tenemos muchas recetas para automatizar cosas de la cámara, como que se active sola cuando nos vamos de casa, que se desactive cuando llego a casa, ue se pare el "motion tracking" cuando salga la roomba a aspirar el piso, usar un asistente de voz para activarla (por defecto, parece que funciona con alexa), y en general lo que se nos ocurra hacer gracias a IFTTT. La gente de Home-Assistant.io han conseguido vincular esta cámara, y puedes ver el live feed en tu home asistant y crear reglas y automatizaciones con ella. En general, buena cámara. Si te preocupa la privacidad, es una buena opción a tener en cuenta, ya que le puedes poner una SD, no conecta con servidores de terceros, y pese a que funcione con Alexa o Google voice, al poder ser controlada via IFTTT o Home-Assistant, es posible crear automatizaciones sin necesidad de meter a los "cocos" en tu casa. Y probablemente via webhook se pueda controlar con Mycroft, el asistente de voz open source. EDITADO TRAS 1 MES DE USO Me sigue pareciendo estupenda por su precio (veo que en amazon.es la han rebajado de 115 a 70€, que si bien es una considerable rebaja del precio,  aun es casi el doble de lo que os costaría si la compraseis vía amazon.com) No modifico la puntuación, de la cámara, pero tengo malas noticias para aquellos que nos gusta automatizar nuestro hogar fuera del alcance de los grandes "cocos" como Amazon o Google: cuando me interesé por esta cámara era precisamente por su relación calidad-precio y porque había gente en la comunidad de home-assistant que había conseguido hacer que funcionara vía RTSP (Real Time Streaming Protocol) gracias a un firmware "beta" que había sacado Wyze, precisamente para aquellos que no quieren saber nada de terceros que se metan en su casa. Pues bien, parece que el desarrollo de ese firmware beta es demasiado "costoso" de mantener y aunque lo puedas descargar e instalar, ya no recibirá más actualizaciones. El firmware beta no funciona del todo mal, pese a que la imagen sufra cierto lag. Pero obviamente hace incompatible las actualizaciones de firmware oficial de los dispositivos, el extensor USB, etc... además, he notado que con este firmware beta, ya no me notifica de cuando detecta movimiento o personas (solo me notifica de cuando detecta sonidos). Con lo que si no van a corregir bugs, malo. Si buscas una cam compatible con RTSP, esta NO es tu cámara.
title: Muy buena por ese precio, aunque mejorable.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Joseph A. Vazquez
content: The price is great, you cant beat the features and when It worked it worked well.  The problem with mine is that it constantly did not work. It would always power off. I think part of it was due to a loose cable connecting the USB power cord to the device. That occurred on day 0.  It also didnt help that if it scanned the room  it would unplug itself. It served the purpose for me though of seeing I I would enjoy or like a camera. I would spend better money on a reliable system like Arlo or Nest
title: You get what you pay for

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Manie Mar
content: Overall performance is great for the price. The IR is very dark and no adjustment can help it. We purchased a second pan/tilt had to return it bc it wouldn't scan to wifi code. I had the Blink and definitely preferred the Wyze. I wish they were fully waterproof and fully wireless. Update:  we got a second Wyze Pan and Tilt after returning the one that would not scan the code, something was wrong with it.  Well, the two Wyze cameras are really good for the price I only wish they would have one for Outdoors though they have covers to do so I am skeptical about it not being fully waterproof.  This by far is a great purchase.
title: All good

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Lr61d7
content: I purchased this camera for use in a toddlers room. Once I recieved the camera I quickly hooked it up and was pleased with how easy it was to connect to the app on my phone. Great picture a little sluggish on pan and tilt controls, but, for 35 dollars what can you expect. Anyways, up to this point I was very pleased with the camera. My next step was to connect to my Echo device, again, connection went very smooth and Alexa found and added the cam with no problem. NOW came the issue. I asked Alex to show me the room it was placed in. Alexa said, OK, then about 10 seconds later she said the camera was not responding. I then cycled the power and verified that the camera was working in the app... no problem. Then repeated the alexa command with same response. I then uninstalled and reinstalled everything. Same issue. Went through this about 5 times. Same issue. So I then take to the internet to see if there is a known issue with a fix, I see this issue started a year ago, so, kept looking for a fix, no luck. Frustrated I finally broke down and called support, she proceeded to tell me that this was a known issue and wanted some information for the engineers, this pissed me off. I asked how is it this has been an issue for a year now with no fix. She then lied to me saying it's a "new"issue. I them explained to her that I have done my research and can clearly see this has been going in since January of 2019. Told her no thanks I do not want to deal with a company that will not fix an issue that is a year old... returning cam and finding another option.
title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JenR
content: Disappointed.  I own 3 of these.  Night vision poor can see a few feet in front of camera.  Biggest issue is longevity.  All randomly lose the Wi-Fi and takes sometimes hours to hook back up, Sometimes randomly quit recording to sd card requiring reset.  Biggest issue is one camera stopped recording the full 12 seconds about a month ago.  Tried resetting, removing camera re adding camera.  Contacted customer service who told me to do everything I had done before.  It then starting recording the full time about half the time so I gave up.  The same camera now has lost its Wi-Fi connection and will not reconnect no matter what I do and what customer service recommended.  After chat finished Wyze sent an email asking for update to which they have not responded.  Since one is now completely useless I’m not hopeful the other two will last much longer.  So be warned they are good while they last but don’t be surprised if they don’t last as long as hoped.  Mine were purchased July 2019. EDIT: new email stating they want to replace faulty camera. But then emailed again after I emailed them the copy of receipt and camera tag that they charged their minds and no replacement since I was 14 days out of 1 yr warranty when problems started
title: Don’t expect longevity

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Stakeout
content: same review I gave my other Wyze Cams  ..whattsup.. I cannot get the micro-SD card to record to either the Wyze Cam or the two Wyze Cam Pans I bought thru Amazon.. why do I have to go thru a tap dance and jump thru hoops to try to connect the micro-SD card to record on all 3 cams.. 'otherwyze' great picture quality.. there has got to be an easier way to do the Set-Up for recording to the micro-SD card so that IT WORKS.. I saw some of the Q&A about the setup for the micro-SD card.. mind-boggling in this tech age that one has to go thru that .. a nitemare.. if it wasn't for that problem you would get 5 stars for all 3 Wyze Cams.... STILL all 3 will NOT record to the micro-SD card.. disappointed :(
title: unable to setup to record on micro-SD card

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: PNeiva
content: At first I loved the camera. Extremely affordable and good image quality. Audio was never great, but not a major point for my needs. After a few weeks using with no issues, I came home to find my dog very distraught and agitated. The camera, which I had turned off prior leaving the house, was on and moving it’s motion detection. I heard a strangers voice coming from it. Basically someone hacked into the camera and have been annoying the dog while we were out of the house. Not a trustable software. I have not used again since.
title: Easy target for hackers

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S
content: I have gone through reviews, guides, and every setting possible and the camera won't record actual events like the mailman or landscapers but will catch a leaf blowing across the street. Again, I've tried every setting and positioned the camera in several different locations with no success. It's beyond frustrating and this camera only provides the illusion of safety. Getting an SD card will help to review what's happened (without one it only records "events" it deems worthy-- like leaves not people on your property). So if you get the camera it is essential that you buy an SD card, but know that if the notifications from the software are useless it will be hard to know when/where to look for events. Yes, it's an inexpensive camera and you get what you pay for, but it can't even manage the basics. Buy something else. You'll be safer for it.
title: So useless

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Joe Cooke
content: I have a few Wyze non-pan cameras and added the Pan into the mixture to keep an eye on things outside.  The camera works pretty darn good, very happy with it. I have the camera facing outside and sitting on a window sill - the night vision does have some issues going through the window as its built-in lighting reflects off the window/screen.  This isn't a flaw of the product itself - I somewhat expected this to happen, just something for folks to note.  If you want this to work properly as designed make sure you either house the camera outside and/or make sure there is nothing reflective right in front of it so the night vision can light up the outside properly.
title: Good Camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: EVF
content: These little guys are amazing.  I bought them to keep an eye on my new kitten while I'm at work.  For $35 I was not expecting much, basically some grainy video that was just good enough to watch my cat while connected to the same WiFi network.  I was really surprised at everything about these little drop cams. Video: Video quality is awesome - you have a choice between 1080p HD, regular "SD" which I assume is 480p, and 360p for bad connections.  I have had no issues streaming live video over my cell connection at work at full 1080p.  They also have excellent night vision.  My kitty likes to hide under the bed, so naturally I put one of these down there so I could watch him.  Crystal clear even in the middle of the night. Audio: The camera has two-way audio and it generally works great.  I can hear what's going on on the camera side with no problems.  Sometimes, especially over a cell connection from work, the audio from me to the camera isn't the greatest quality ever, but my fiancé tells me that it still comes through loud and mostly clear.  I'll take that for the price. PTZ: The PTZ features are also great.  Again, I can move the camera from miles away, over a cell connection, with no problem.  It's not jittery and the movement and connection are rock solid.  It also has a nifty little motion tracking feature that will follow any motion detected in the frame.  It doesn't always work perfectly and sometimes gets confused by reflections in the mirror, but it generally works and follows my cat as he moves around the camera's surveillance area.  It will also highlight any moving objects in the frame with a green box, and can be set to sweep the area automatically. Recording: Video and still recording are both awesome.  It has a slot for a MicroSD card if you want to store video locally on the cam, but it's not necessary unless you want the camera to auto-record.  I don't want my cameras recording without me telling them to, so that's not me.  I haven't felt the need to install an SD card because the Wyze app connects to the photo album on your phone, and will store stills and vids there.  Very cool.  And the video recordings are excellent in terms of both audio and video. Price: These little guys are only $35.  Enough said.  At that price point you'd expect a product that is significantly lower in quality, but Wyze really delivered a quality product for that price.  I would have paid double what I did for these and they still would have been a great value. Presentation: The cams are beautifully packaged in a very Apple-esque way.  White boxes and everything fits together just right. App: The app is very intuitive and easy to use.  You can hold the phone in portrait and use a D-pad on your screen to PTZ the cam, or turn the phone landscape and just swipe up/down to tilt and left/right to pan.  Whichever orientation you choose, you pinch to zoom.  All of these movements are smooth and effortless.  Setup is a breeze too.  You create your account, pick which model of WyzeCam you have, enter your WiFi details, push the setup button on the camera, and the app generates a QR code for the camera to scan.  Just hold your phone in front of the camera and it sets itself up.  Probably the easiest device I have set up in my start home, and I have Nest products everywhere (which are also incredibly user friendly and easy to setup). Overall this is a great product.  My only "con" isn't really a con, more of a wish list item: I'd love it if I could access my cams over a web interface.  Wyze's website suggests that something like that might be in the works, but so far the cams can only be accessed from he Wyze app. For the price, you can't beat these things.
title: Fantastic little dropcam for $35.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Brie
content: This camera was purchased for an extra layer of security at home; however, it does not do its job. Why would I want a camera that records for 12 seconds once motion is detected(not continuously while there is still motion) and has a ~5 minutes rest time EACH time is records? Not sure why this is even a feature! Even with an SD card, it can record a longer time BUT an SD card can easily be stolen then there’s goes any evidence! Shame for WYZE designing such crap, they even admit it shouldn’t be used for security. Well what in the world is a security camera for then? Do not get this camera, it’s essentially a dummy deterrent and that’s it.
title: Eek! Huge gaps in recording, beware!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kindle Customer
content: I have just purchased and received two Wyzecam2, and a single Wyzecam Pan. As they are brand new here, I can't provide opinions on night vision, durability, etc....yet. But as far as initially commissioning, updating the firmware, connection to my Google phone, initial appearances and video...I am impressed. Have one temporarily set in a window... running on a Powercore 20000 portable power bank... curious to see how long it lasts... just for temporary placements with out an outlet immediately available. So far, every thing is brilliant! Shall endeavor to check back in in a few weeks, after some more usage and trials.... Enjoy
title: Simplicity and intuitive, very fast implementation

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Punkydunkin
content: We got the camera to keep watch over the front of the house mostly.  Even though we don't mount it outside, the quality of the video through the windows are relatively good.  Because of using them through our windows, we don't use night vision.  However, we have tried it out in the house and the night vision did work well.  Our only problem has been sound activation because we have birds that make noise so we are alerted quite often even on the lowest setting.  We like that it can be plugged into a USB charger and moved to almost anywhere in our house.  We also like that having an SD card means that even though the alert videos are only 10-20 seconds long, we can do a full playback using our phones or computers.  For the price, it does a great job :)
title: Conveniently mobile

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Michael H.
content: After thoroughly researching cameras I decided to give this one a try, but made sure that I could use the camera via the web and my laptop.  From all appearances reading online, I could.  When I began the setup process, the guide that came in the box said to go to the Google Play Store and download the "Wyze" app.  I did so, onto my tablet (which is running Android version 4.4.1).  When I opened the app it would not let me into the app until I entered my "mobile number".  I did so and got a warning indicating that there was a problem, so I called Customer Service.  I talked to a very helpful gentleman there who clarified for me that I had the incorrect "Wyze" app since mine was purple colored and he said I should have an aqua colored one.  It turns out that I was not presented the aqua one on the Google Play Store because I have an Android version lower than 5.0 (and I cannot upgrade) and that the purple one is for teachers.  He told me that I had to have Android greater than 5.0 and that the camera cannot be setup via a laptop, even though mine does have bluetooth to connect directly to the camera, as would a smart phone. The back of the camera box has a nice write-up about how Wyze was formed and their goals to "build products that are easy to use".  It goes on to say that "Millions of our customers can testify that our products just work.  Our business model depends on our obsession to exceed your expectations."  Well, for me, the camera does not work and Wyze has fallen short of my expectations. I went back to the 1000+ answered questions on this product and found one that I had read about incompatibility with a Galaxy S4, but because I do not own that smart phone, I failed to drop down the 1 comment about the review.  Had I done that, I would have found Wyze's admission that the app requires Android 5.0+.  So, my bad for missing that, but it seems to me that it is Wyze's bad for not publishing the Android 5.0+ requirement right up front with their product description. Here is the product description where it ought to be stated: "Wyze Cam Pan is only compatible with the 2. 4GHz WiFi network (does not support 5GHz Wi-Fi) and Apple (iOS) and Android mobile devices." Here is the review posted 8 months ago that Wyze did not use to change their product description: Description says it's only compatible with Apple and Android. The Wyze App is needed for setup. The Wyze App IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH ANDROID GALAXY S4. Also the camera (setup app) apparently cannot be installed on laptop w/ Windows 10 Cat H. Wyze MANUFACTURER, 8 months ago: Hi there, the Wyze app is compatible with Android 5.0+ and iOS 9.0+ devices.
title: WARNING: ANDROID 5.0+ REQUIRED AND DEVICE CANNOT BE SETUP WITH A LAPTOP

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: RAC
content: I like how this security camera works but my complains for now is that when a motion is detected it takes too long to notify you. There will be nothing to see anymore by the time you received a notification and looking at the cameras live view. Motion video capture should record 6 seconds before the time it senses motion and it would be nice if the length of recording can be controlled to how long you want it to record. It would be great if they fix this with a firmware update and this will be a 5 star product. Update: 9/23/2019 This is just an update for the Wyze Cam Pan that I have been using it facing out thru my window before purchasing the Ring Doorbell 1, all I could say is that the Wyze did a better job in my overall experience and it has a free 14-day rolling cloud storage and the option to use sd card while the Ring has a monthly fee.
title: A good security cam

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: joseph staltare
content: When I first hooked up the camera it worked most of the time. It would go offline often but I chalked that up to my internet. For the price I figured I got what I paid for.  I purchased this in March in August I had to upgrade my router which gave me a new password and that's where all the trouble began. It will not connect to my internet even though I am connecting it to the 2G. I can't understand how they are not compatible with 5G when that is what is available now. I have tried to contact them and get no where. I have given up and will buy a better camera with a company that has an actual phone number to contact them on. I am now trying to cancel my service fee with them and can't figure out why my account has no where to cancel. I emailed them today let's see how long this takes to resolve.
title: Doesn't work

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Morton Inc.
content: This camera worked great and had some great features. After 6 months the SD card stopped working. I could not access it. The camera worked if the SD card was not installed but once I inserted the SD card, the camera kept rebooting. I call and wrote wyze. They came back and had me try a few things but nothing worked. I kept saying that I would send it back if they could send me a replacement but nothing ever came of that. So long story short, I was sent to review a different camera which is not as cheap as the wyse pan cam but it worked great. I did drop it and the company sent me a new one right away. I ended up liking this new camera better so I replace all my Wyze camera with the new type I received So now I have a camera that works but cam locally record anything and three other Wyze cameras that are sitting in my closet cause I'm afraid they will stop working like the other one did and it's too late to get my money back.
title: Stopped Working

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: SU
content: Hi , I got wyze cam pan , it is a good looking piece of electronics. I ordered 3 pan cams, Also ordered bulbs - 4 and sensor pack and bridge with motion sensor and 2 plugs . . 1. it is a bad experience . out of 3 pan cam only one is working and it is not even 6 months . the other one can not stay connected and has to be restarted multiple times. they have good support . they send me replacement but the replacement has issue with connecting . if you using it for fun that all right but for security purpose It is not reliable . the cam wont connect to internet most of the time and has to be restarted . so out of 3 only ne is working now . 2. bulbs are ok 3. pulgs 1/2 is only working . 4. contact sensor and bridge is not working and I returned it . if you are looking for security it is not the cam as it is not reliable . The continuous recording mode is not working with local storage and need to be formatted all the time . Don't waste your money and try some reliable camera who will capture it in case u need to see.
title: do not work , unreliable , do not waste money on it. 6 months review

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S.A
content: The option of a free and paid version is great. I love the pan feature and would choose this any day over Ring. I am able to watch both my door during the day and turn it to check on my cat whenever I need to. The night feature works well, the app is awesome, great for those with family/roommates since you can share camera access to multiple accounts. I will definitely continue to choose Wyze from now on.
title: Better than Ring!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: David Shorter
content: Avoid at all costs. The cameras always disconnect; the image quality is worse than competitor; the company took away features originally on the cameras (person detection), then brought them back for a charge; cameras are fickle: you can set up a detection area and get the video of a blank wall cuz the camera for no reason thought it should film the wall six inches away; and the notifications never work. I never get notified that someone is on the camera. So what's the point of having a mic? So I can tell them to get off my porch seven hours after they were there when I see the video? Just horrible all around.
title: What a mess

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Allie Blea
content: I bought this when it had a coupon so it was a little bit cheaper, but I'd even pay full price for it. This camera is great! We have it on our fireplace mantle so we can pan to see into the kitchen, dining room, front door and the beginning of the hallway to the bedroom. It's great for when we go out of town, we can check it at any time. The picture quality is pretty good and night vision is as well. We found a starter kit at Home Depot that had another camera with window sensors, smart light bulbs and a motion sensor to expand our collection. I think they're great and the app is easy to use.
title: Great camera for your buck!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Brittany McClain
content: I honestly don't know why there are some people complaining about these cameras. If you buy a security camera for $35 you shouldn't have high expectations. It's not going to be the absolute greatest thing in the world but it will serve its purpose. I love it! I didn't want anything fancy. Just something I could use to keep an eye on my house, especially when I'm not home. So far it has been great. I have 2 of these pan cameras and plan on purchasing many more to put throughout the house. I love that you can turn the camera to look at certain areas. A function that you do not have with a lot of other high priced cameras. The only MINOR thing that is sometimes a pain is the app. If there is a firmware update, it will load like its supposed to but then say error or something of the sort and you have to do it all over again. Sometimes I've had to do it 3 or more times before it actually updates the cameras. But like I said, it's a minor issue that I don't mind too much since it's only a $35 camera. Great quality for a low price!!
title: Low Price With Great Quality!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Flying Along
content: I ordered this unit and the standard Wyze Cam to try out.  I could not get either unit to connect to our 2.4 wifi network.  I have never had any trouble connecting any wifi device to our network.  I went through all of their FAQs on the website as well as the self help Youtube videos.  I spent multiple days and emails talking with Wyze tech support but I got so tired of getting one response (with advice of something I already tried), then wait until the next day to get a response.  After the slow and drawn out response from Wyze, I decided to just return the cams and go with a brand I know.  I have read great reviews about the Wyze cameras and had high hopes for them.
title: Can not even get it to connect to the 2.4 network

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Private
content: Pro: At least people are aware that a camera is present. Cons: 1. The day after I installed the camera in my spare bedroom window, someone jumped over my balcony railing and popped the lock on the window and left before an image was captured. 2. Too many images are useless because WiFi drops so often. 3. At least twice a day images are too corrupt to view. 4. If my complex wasn’t crawling with creeps I would send it back. 5. The app on my smart drains my battery in a matter of minutes. 6. It’s sold by a third party so getting a refund might be a hassle.
title: Over 30 second delay before an image is captured

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Happyshopgal
content: I have tired many different cameras including name brands like Samsung and Blinks, and this is by far the BEST in terms of functionality, user-friendliness and performance. I do not want to install cameras outdoor but wanted to find a camera that works well thru the glass/window indoor.  Unlike other cameras which their motion detecting function goes to none/zero when placed in front of a window looking out, Wyze somehow is able to detect/pick up almost ALL motions looking thru a window.  Absolutely amazing and at this affordable price! So don't look further and get this camera.  You will thank yourself (and Wyze).
title: Simply the BEST camera in the market!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: DJ
content: I couldn't be more impressed w/ this product.  This little guy, for $36,  gives you a HD image, motion sensing, the capability to follow the motion, cloud recording for clips for 14 days for AND local recording if you buy an SD card, night vision, and an app that works as well as their competitors, if not better, for....$36.  (plus the cost of the SD card for local recording if you so desire.)  I bought three, plugged them in and had them online in less than 15 minutes.  I've moved them numerous times to various locations to get the best coverage, and they just work. Three years ago I invested in a similar product, without the ability to pan or scan, but with a battery, for $200+/unit.  And to access the feed beyond a week, it is $100/yr.  There are numerous similar products on the market today that are even more restrictive, requiring a fee to even see live streams. Other companies seem to be moving more towards a more restrictive "subscription" market to protect their bottom lines, while charging consumers $150-$500 for the privilege of owning their equipment in order to use their service. Looking for the best bang for the buck?  Look no further IMHO...WYZE is it!  I'm preparing to buy more for use outside our home, after doing research on the viability of such a venture...and to be honest, the juice is worth the squeeze.  Do your homework...good luck.
title: Best bang for the buck for wifi security cameras!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kelsey
content: If I could give this review zero stars I would. I REALLY wanted to love this product, but after 3 hours of back and forth with customer service and the problem not getting resolved, I’m returning it. It initially connected to the WiFi then lost connection every 10 seconds.  The app would freeze but the camera would follow my dogs moving. After going back and forth with ‘customer support’ they told me to download a third party app (with an avg 1.6 stars and 10 ratings) to diagnose my camera and WiFi?
title: Not even worth $30

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: minmaui2002
content: Wizen has tapped into something really, really important, an inexpensive way to make a product that works well without robbing customers.  This absolutely proves that it can be done.  My wishlist is for Wyze to allow customers access to cameras from a laptop/desktop.  I would also like to see Wyze branch out further to bring customers other security related products at a great price.  Wyze is priced very fairly and their products work well, except for accessing on Echo Show.  I have new cameras and the latest updates and still cannot get it to work, I gave up, but I have a phone and iPad so that's not too much of a big issue.
title: It works as stated at a far less cost than many others out there

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Hopper
content: I have used 2 of these cameras now for about 6 months and I couldn't be happier.  These cameras are easy to set up and operate.  I have only used them for indoor use with the intent to monitor what's happening outside by viewing through windows which causes issues at night as the night mode causes glare on the window it's looking out of at close range.  The fix for me was to not use night mode and set up external motion lights.  I added memory which is a must for playback unless you want to pay Wyze for this feature.  The pic/video quality is fantastic and I really like the feature that alerts me if my smoke detectors are going off.  The app is very easy to use. I highly recommend. Update.  Great indoor camera but not for outdoor use.  I moved one of my cameras outdoors and I've had nothing but problems with it.  The issue is not a result of wifi connectivity but rather, I believe, cold temps (near freezing). So, I still highly recommend but not for outdoor use in cold climates.
title: Great camera for indoor use

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Leticia
