content: The night vision isn’t as clear as can be, the motion is captured a few seconds after the motion starts, the speaker and microphone didn’t seem to work well at the start by being to quite but they seem fine now, the installation took a bit but only because I was trying to set it up with an iPad rather than iPhone, but once established it works with both, it was more expensive on amazon but now the app upped the price so now this is the cheaper alternative, and I never had any problem with the rotating part of it but I feel that it would be better to use the other stationary version for if being used for monitoring while away or in the night you won’t be continually turning it so it’d be better in my opinion to have one stationary camera in each room rather than this version. Overall pretty good but less practical than the stationary version.
title: Pretty good

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jonathan Bennett
content: We have had the camera for 2 months and are very happy with it. Pros - Extremely easy to use - (PICTURE of user interface attached) - Good quality - Night vision - this was especially helpful when we first got our puppy. When he had to use the bathroom, he would sit in his cage and pant. We are unable to see our dog with our naked eye, but the night vision could see him clearly. (PICTURE of night vision attached) - Sound and motion tracking work well. - Great range of motion - Price Cons - Uncertain about security of stream. We have not had any reason to think other people have access to the stream. However, some people have expressed security issues. With a camera in this price range, I don't think you can expect any better. At least it has a large user base, which hopefully translates to Wyze's ability to put money towards keeping streams secure. - Have had to reset twice due to wifi connection issues. After rebooting camera, it worked again.
title: Great puppy camera!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Shareen
content: Followed all instructions, connected to 2.4hz and the detection zone will not stay where I set it. I dropped the sound sensitivity to 1 and it still kicks on and moves because of the noise from the camera rotating.  I have stood outside directly in front of the camera and it does not detect but it will detect a wasp when it flies directly in front. I have the latest update and utilize the ‘person’ detection and when it does work it’s great. But it’s hit or miss. Picture quality is great but either the app or the actual hardware is not working properly.
title: It’s ok. May end up returning.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: brooklyn patrocky
content: I absolutely love this camera. I heard about this from a coworker and after seeing her app and the video quality and control she had from her phone, I knew I had to have one for my pet! First of all, I am in NC and got my product delivered to me in less than 24 hours and shipping was free with prime. Second, this product was packed perfectly in a small box and was delivered damage free. Third, the set up for this product was beyond easy. I was worried at first because there are only a few steps and most 1 star reviews were for set up, but I have to say, it was so simple. You download the app and create a log in. Then, you plug in the camera and wait 15 seconds for the light to start blinking. Once it's done, you hold the set up button (which is clearly marked in the instructions) for about 3 seconds until the device says to you that it is ready for set up. You go back to the app and click "i heard device ready for set up" and a barcode will pop up on your screen. You hold it up in front of the camera until the camera says "barcode captured" out loud. Once it does your device will be set up to the same wifi network as your phone and it's all done! It took less than 5 minutes. It was so easy and I was instantly able to see my pet. You can control the image by zooming in and moving the camera can be done two ways. You can either use the circle pad shown in the picture, or, you can just move your finger directly on the image. You can also turn the camera on or off through your app, and only those with the verification code can access it. I love this camera because you can have more than one connected in the same app and you can have more than one user phone connected to the camera. I can also talk through the camera and hear what's happening on the other end. This was well worth what I paid and I will be buying more for other rooms!
title: Worth Every Penny!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rusty
content: Just bought it, I updated the firmware before completing the connection to the camera.  First try failed, second worked just fine.  The Pan Cam works great, and for all the more it costs it's great. As of 5-11-2019 and 4.10.3.60 firmware I can CONFIRM you MUST HAVE a LIVE internet connection to both connect to AND view a live stream from the camera.  This is not an IP camera per se, in that just being on the same network is not enough, the camera apparently must authenticate to the WYZE servers via the internet. This is a pretty big bummer for me as I was intending to use this at work to monitor machinery that can't have personnel nearby when in operation, and we have no internet service there. Looks like I'll just have to make up some more Raspberry Pi cameras.  :(  I'm pretty bummed, because the pan and tilt are awesome.
title: Has it's limitations.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: The Alpaca Vet
content: As a Camera that you check with your phone this is amazing, cheap, lots of functionality (panning, tilting), etc. Here is the thing, I bought this because I wanted the alexa functionality of being about to check it out on my TV. I wish this was user error but I've gone through the help  and performed all the steps. Enabled and disabled it on the alexa app, discovered it on my alexa app,  updated the firmwares, etc etc. I wanted to love this camera but I bought it for 1 advertised feature only and it doesn't perform that.
title: Doesn't work with Alexa

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Doug Ellis
content: So many of my friends have been buying security gadgets for $100 and up over the past couple years.  I never bothered for that kind of price, but for less than $40!  Heck yes! This is the larger of two Wyze cameras and I simply love them both - but this one way more.  The ability to pan and zoom makes it much more versatile.. and fun! A couple wishes.. - I wish there was a black model to make it less conspicuous - I wish it was more weatherproof Otherwise its features are amazing.  I've probably inspired a dozen friends to buy them too.  Once I show it to someone they have to have one.  It's way cool!
title: This is a game changer for the price!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Lala
content: Not the greatest cameras but you get what you pay for.  The pan is very jumpy when it detects movement.  Then the camera records a very brief segment and does not reset to follow whoever is moving. So if someone breaks in, You will only have a 10 second clip and it won't reset and record more.  Useless really.  I don't recommend this camera unless you want something cheep.
title: Not the greatest camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mr&Mrs
content: Our order was handled timely and we are very pleased with our purchases. First, we ordered the Wyze Cam Pan, just to test the unit.  Then, we ordered 2 more, as well as the storage cards and the Aotnex holder. As disabled seniors on a fixed income, we greatly appreciate the cost factor.  We hope your business model continues to be the mainstay of your focus.  The unit is almost everything we needed it to be.  And, the software is easy to use. We love our Wyze cameras. And, we will be recommending these units to everyone we know. THANK YOU, WYZE !!
title: THANK YOU, WYZE !!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: E Cope
content: I loved the wyze cam so much I decided to purchase the pan/tilt camera to have more room coverage. I like how I can set different way points and go from there. I don’t advice to set the motion tracking unless you’re away from home most of the day. Motor is a bit loud but can barely notice it when the TV is on. Video and audio quality is as good as the static cameras. I can’t ask for a quality camera and cost effectiveness. 29 Jul. UPDATE: My pan/tilt cam stopped working. It started out 3 weeks ago that it would shut off if it get moved a bit. And finally 3 days ago I just can’t get it to turn on. Not sure if the motor burnt out, a loose wiring or something. Now I’m disappointed! Not sure if I want to buy another one to replace it or the seller would replace it even after 60 days from date of purchase.
title: Wyze cam pan/tilt.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: John Sehring III
content: The camera is very sleek and looks great. It was very easy to setup. Just download the app, put in your WiFi name and password, it gives you a QR code to show the camera, and the camera does the rest.  For the price, this is definitely the best choice for indoor surveillance. The app is pretty self explanatory and easy to use. You can put a micro sd card in and record local, or you can record events to the cloud. You can setup alerts by sound or motion. I use the motion alert for the front door of my house. It sends an alert anytime someone comes onto my porch. The alert takes about 10 - 20  seconds to arrive on my Phone from the time the person actually came into view. The only thing that I don't like is that you can only access it from an app on your Apple or Android device. At this time there does not seem to be a way to view from your computer.  But who knows, they may soon.
title: Best & easiest to setup internet security camera I have ever used

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: B.H.C.
content: Bought this thinking it would work after seeing great reviews but it wasn't the case.  It wouldn't upgrade & it stopped working prior to requiring upgrade.  Kept disconnecting from internet & I was away from home couldn't unplug it as the error code required to do. Very disappointed. Also sound quality was disappointing too.
title: nice picture quality But that's all....

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Shaun J.
content: Update: Been seven days and this camera is doing its job. Clear pic, sound and motion. Getting two more soon for bedroom and window to see front yard. Disappointed that it won't work with Alexa as it says. Received it today and set it up. Setup was very easy and fast. Clear picture, pans nicely and viewing from work on my phone with no problem. I like everything about it except that you cannot control the cam volume. Voice to cam very low and so is the video recording sound. Would give 5 stars if it weren't the sound issue. (Fixed! Problem was on my end) But, am buying another for my room. Got to keep an eye on my doggie and cat.
title: Love this!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Areej
content: I have returned the both cameras the first one  malfunctioned as soon as i updated the firmware and the other doesn't do what it says it does when i leave the house i cant connect to it or see anything  doesnt move with detection always disconnects and needs time to connect doesnt send notifications if theirs movements basicaly  it doesnt do anything of what it claims it does and the customer service didnt really show any interesting in helping they sent me a replacement but i dont want to waste anymore so i sent them all back !! And after all this amazon only wants to refund me one camera !
title: Dont buy it !! Trust me !

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Brian L
content: I have purchased nine of them to use indoors for nanny cameras and are worth it. I recommend this over the Wyze basic one for a crib cam as the IR lights do not shine out into the crib. You just have to find a good third party mount on the crib and are good to go. As I was reading questions and reviews, there have been people asking about how to stream video from these cameras to the TV. I have found it and it is tinyCam Pro. You can download tinyCam Pro from the App Store on the fire tv. You have to search for the tutorial on the wyze support page and when you find it and follow the instructions, you will be set. The app is $3 and thats it.
title: Great camera to stream video to TV with tinyCam Pro fire tv app

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Albert A++
content: First, let me tell you that I’m a Security Electronics Technician with over 35 years experience and have installed and serviced many many cameras and cctv systems. I really only ordered this camera to try out as I already had 2 other brand indoor pan tilt cameras in my house. I will be getting rid of the other cameras and using more of these WYZE cameras.  They are great and extremely easy to set up and the app is both easy and very well laid out. In addition to these cameras, I will be installing the WYZE lock and using a few WYZE light bulbs. This company’s products are so well made and easy to set up, I think anyone can do it.
title: Awesome Camera, Awesome Company

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: reddraco
content: This is the first camera I have bought. I am not sure what to expect. I had bought this to give my wife and I a way to check on the kids when we are at work. It is great since it can rotate both up and down and side to side. It takes a micro USB chip not sure on what size it can go up to. The camera hooks up using an USB cable that comes with it. It is noticeable since it is on the bigger side. There is a bit of lag which is expected probably by a second or two. You will not be able to see a face from across a room but like I said its not so much a security cam but just a way to check in things.
title: Great camera for price..

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: KJ Fox
content: I have owned over a dozen cameras like this over the years.  This one is definitely the worst one I’ve ever had, by far.  It is noisy, it doesn’t do what it is supposed to most of the time, and the app cannot connect about 97% of the time, so it is basically useless.  I have had it a few months, so it is too late to return it, so I’ll keep it, but I never use it anymore.  I kept hoping maybe it was just me, and I’d figure it out, but it is the camera/app.  Bad quality.  And more expensive than any other camera I’ve had, as well.
title: Not impressed

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: ACK
content: The picture quality is great. The mobility of the device is awesome and easy to manipulate in the App. We are using ours mainly of the purpose of keeping an eye on our Dog when we are away from home -- replacing our Furbo, which is over priced, has a static camera, and treats gimmick that's virtual useless. Minus one star because I wasn't able at first start to figure out how to set up the motion and audio sensor alerts. I am confident I'll be able to figure it out with a little research, but ideally the App would walk you through those steps or make that process more intuitive. -- I'll update the review once I have figured this out. I have not yet attempted to hook it up to Alexa, but I will work on getting that setup on our Echo Spot and then update the review accordingly.
title: Quality Picture, Great Value, Awesome Mobility, and Good Device Application

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: RL
content: Got 2 of these. Install via Android app was pretty seamless. One small complaint: for the 1st cam, I was prompted if I wanted to upgrade the firmware to the latest version (of course). When installing the 2nd cam, I did not get the prompt. Since I'm gadget savvy, I went into the app's setting and found the firmware upgrade option under "Device information". But other than that, all's great. Easy to play around with the features. Managed to set up detection notification and scheduling notification easily. I may have a need to get a few more. No doubt I will keep getting these!
title: That was easy shmeezy!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Peter Ian Staker
content: Constantly has buffering issues or connectivity problems when I'm trying to view the stream via their app. Have done reboots, have placed next to router--signal is strong for all devices--have upgraded firmware, lowered video quality, etc. Nothing helps. It only streams like 10% of the time. Unusable. And I have similar issues with all camera, I bought 5 of them. I regret it. Bad quality.
title: Useless

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tudor
content: It has lots of advertised "extras" but it performs very poorly at the very basic functions. 1. No sound: you cannot hear what happens in the place it's mounted, you just get distorted noise at a very low volume. After checking the wyze community forum, it looks like this is a well known firmware issue, which wyze fails to solve for over one year. 2. No customer support. Just check the above mentioned forum. 3. No easy way to feed/stream other then their application that has only a phone version. For any decent other brand I've used, you could just http the cam ip in a browser.. For wyze you have to do a bootable sd-card with a non-standard firmware version (which still doesn't solve the sould issue btw) and enable RTSP, then open the feed into vlc or other external player. Still no way to simply open the stream in a web. browser. Conclusion: I wasted lots of time to fix features that any decent cam has readily available and still not happy with the result.
title: Disappointing quality camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Roy N.
content: I have used wifi cameras by Ring, Blink, D-Link, Foscam and others. Sometimes the connect easily and sometimes it takes some elbow grease to get working right. Fortunately, I'm technically savvy and have enough networking knowledge to overcome almost anything. However, this camera is useless garbage. I have panning and non-panning versions of the Wyze cameras and I can't connect to either one from my phone after successfully setting them up. I bought the non-pan camera too long ago to return but I will definitely be returning the panning camera. It's a shame because the picture quality looked good when I set the cameras up. And there are a lot of controls, but if you can't connect what use is any of it?
title: Junk - You get what you pay for

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: LG
content: We had to return this camera, the instructions are somewhat simple unless you run into issues. After failing to connect the camera and running through suggestions we attempted to reach customer service via phone. No one ever answered our calls. After a week of trying to call we decided to return it. We had absolutely no customer service help from this company and will pass on buying any of their products in the future.
title: No customer service

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ja-Storm
content: I have been using wyze cam pan since 9/2018. So after a whole year of used and many updates I have to say that the cams are not getting smarter. After several updates motion tracking got worse and Event Recording Schedule &  Detection Zone Setting keep changing on their own causing the cams to missed events. I have been in contact with the guys at Wyze about some of the cameras that became defective and stop working completely after some updates. After months of back and forth communications through emails, I realize that it's possible that the team over at wyze don't seem to stand behind their products. Seeing that i am an early backer of many of their products i kinda hope things would get better by now.
title: Used to be my favorite Cameras

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: berthan
content: This is certainly a great product from Price/Value perspective, as I am an existing Nest Cam user looking for a better option. The picture quality is great, it sounds ok but I can't tell if it is durable since I owned it only about 1 month Compare to Nest (previously aka DropCam), Nest provide continuous recording in the cloud whereas Wyze only store 10-12 sec clip notification in the cloud (albeit it is free). However, I noted that the notification is not "fool-proof" as if there are 2 movements with a short span (about 5 minutes apart), i got the first movement notification and was uploaded into the cloud but the 2nd movement (a different person) did not trigger the notification. Therefore, you can't reliably count on this as a security camera as you might miss something important. Although you can check the recording in the SD card that is available, but this can be erased/removed (for a case of theft or break-in) and the Wyze app does not provide an efficient option to quickly review the recording. I really hope that Wyze could review and improve this!
title: Good Price Point but No a Reliable Home Camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Marc
content: Really can’t beat these cameras for the price. I’ve had the v1, v2 and now this one and I’m super happy with the purchase so far. Setup was easy, stream and camera quality is consistent and clear, auto record function works okay (wish it would record a little longer) and it’s nice to have some free cloud storage. Only thing I don’t love is that the motion detection can be a little annoying and loud so I turn it off unless I’m away. Besides that, another awesome and affordable product from wyze. I mainly use these as a puppy cam For two way video/audio but would work just as well for security purposes.
title: Great value!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Eae
content: Already had regular wyze cameras and was very impressed. Decided I would integrate the pan cam and slowly disperse my old cameras to my children for their homes. Very discouraged with the pan camera. It makes a beeping sound every time it moves as it follows movement throughout the room. Also, I have it on the slowest setting and it will still move so rapidly that it blurs the picture. If I had someone break into my home, I dont believe I would get a good shot just because with average to slow movement, it is a blurry picture. My first purchase of this pan cam will probably be my last unless updates address these issues. Very sad as the regular camera was such a great product, I expected the same quality pics for this product.
title: Noisy and blurry pics

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Fred Richards
content: Easy to set up. Great picture, clear good quality. Rotates nicely. Real time viewing or play back. Not waterproof I have one on my Covered front & Back porch. That works perfectly. I have bought A Lot of Expensive Cams over the Years and my WYZE Pan Cam are by far the best. Works great on my old cell phone. I can view anywhere in the world. if movement like my Cat, Dog or a person it instantly sends a 12 sec. video clip to my phone, tablet & computer anything that you installed the App on gets the clip. You can set the Zone & sensitivity that something has to pass thru So you can Eliminate picking up Dog & cat And a person would have to crawl to keep from detection and sending a event clip to you phone. You can also set the cams to follow the movement The cam will hold hours of video on disk and if someone is able to power off the cam you have backup video on you phone.
title: Worth the money

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Victor Marino
content: I've been looking for a good indoor camera that is reasonably priced.  A friend suggested Wyze - he set one up at his mom's house and was pleased with it.  Since the price was so low I though it worth a try and purchased one.  I was so pleased with its ease of setup and reliability that I purchased 3 more for my home and one for my parents.  The cameras are an absolute fantastic value and there are no monthly fees! It's clear that the team that put this product together really placed a tremendous amount of thought and time into the design and execution of both the hardware and software.  Pan and tilt, motion and sound detection, motion tracking and tagging, infrared night vision, talkback capability, adjustable output resolution - as I said, a lot of though went into the design.  They also have a fantastic customer support team - I had a question and suggestion regarding an app update and they got back to me within 24 hours and even followed up to see if their response was satisfactory.  I've now been using 4 cameras in 2 locations since November of 2018 and remain completely satisfied. My last point is regarding motion and sound detection alerts - not only do they work well, but unlike the other cameras that I've looked into there is no monthly fee and the encrypted alerts are stored on their server for 2 weeks (we can delete them sooner and they can also be download to our phones).  I simply love these cameras and highly recommend them! Tip... if you even need to help your parents with their TV remote, then get one of these and place it in the room where their TV is - you will have an instant virtual presence and can help them without being in the blind!
title: What a deal... Fantastic Value!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Brittany
content: This camera easily connects with any alexa product. I have it connected to my phone(wyze app), to my alexa app, and to my alexa device. Night vision is very clear and automatic you can zoom in and out and move camera around as you please. There are so many options for it that I don't choose to use yet, such as motion detection... you can get notifications straight to your phone no matter where you are, grocery store, even another state. You can see the camera if you aren't home. Its amazing. Well worth the buy!!! I highly recommend for the use of watching your child or even home protection.
title: *Worth the buy*

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Shauna Marcelis
content: This could possibly be a great camera if the audio worked! I bought it to interact with my dogs when I'm not home. Received the first camera and returned it because I thought the audio was broke...replacement shows up and guess what, its doing the exact same thing. Even screaming at the top of my lungs, no one can hear me, so if the audio part is important to you like it was to me, buy something else from someone else!!! AUDIO is nonexistent in this camera!!! Definitely disappointed and would not recommend!!
title: Audio sucks big time

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Matt M
content: This was a very simple setup up. Granted I am not using any advanced features, I just use the live view to check in on a new pet. I am blown away by the features at this price point. The ptz works great. The app seems to be decent so far. The low light quality was good enough.  The build quality is about what I would expect at this price point. It works great but I don't think it could take may hits or falls if mounted in a high traffic area. I would like a web browser option. Update: I have started using the SD card recording. This product continues to impress. The setup for using the SD card as a continuous recording backup was very simple. The playback of those recordings was very intuitive. I plan on buying a second camera at this point. Make sure your networking equipment and internet service are capable of the upload speeds necessary for viewing these kinds of streams otherwise you will not be satisfied with the quality.
title: Extremely Simple Setup and Use

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Ryne
content: This is more of a 3.5 star because the problem i'm having is a fairly serious one (in my opinion). First and foremost, I can't believe how great this is for the price. Motion tracking, pan, picture quality, etc.  If I would've paid $60 I'd still feel like I got a great deal.  I use one camera to watch my room where my husky is, as I have AirBnB renters in other rooms and dog walkers that come occasionally. The problem, though, is that the camera will shut off at random times for like 20 minutes at least 3-4 times a week, then when it comes back on, it is in the far right position essentially just facing a wall.  This is is a problem because you never know that it shuts off until you go to check the live stream and see the camera facing the wrong direction.  So it could shut off as soon as you leave the house, then you don't realize it until you get back or maybe a few hours after you leave when you check the app. Thankfully, my use is pretty simple, but I can see this problem being a significant issue for people with multiple cameras who are often gone.
title: Stops recording regularly, but still a good deal for the price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: SHELLY
content: Product had a working detection zone last week, all week.  All of a sudden today the device doesn't support this feature.  This is total crap.  I don't appreciate software updates that come in and secretly destroy MY HARDWARE.  I suspect your software subscription does support this feature?  You'll never get another dime from me and I'll make sure to let everyone know how your ripping people off.
title: Rip off.  They destroy your equipment after you purchase it.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Kathleen P.
content: I have been researching cameras now for the past 2 months and I almost went with a hard-wired system like I have used in the past, which would have cost around $1,500. Then, I didn't serious research on the Arlo camera, which looks amazing what would have cost almost $2,000 for a full install... Then I started seriously thinking about the Wyze camera system. ultimately, I figured I had nothing to lose because the entire system would cross under $500. Little did I know that the setup would be incredibly easy, the quality would be amazing, and the features of the pan camera were beyond all expectations! I installed 15 cameras in our home in Florida that we only visit every other month for about a week. We need to keep an eye on things like vine grow, battery tenders on vehicles, insect infestations, rodents, wind damage, rain damage, and the list goes on. We have neighbors that are great but we don't want to impose. Installing the Wyze camera system was the best project I've done all year. We can have a two-way conversation with a delivery person at the front door, speak to the pool guy if he has any questions directly through the camera on the pool, watch our vehicles, and control the cameras 360° as well as up and down panning and zoom that actually works. In fact, I just tested the zoom in feature on the battery tender and I can clearly see the green or red light on the vehicle. When I arrived to you this week both our golf cart and our Lincoln MKZ were dead and they were on battery tenders. If I had the cameras, I would have seen that the battery tenders were not working and saved myself two days of hassle running around trying to get those two things in order. I ended up ordering five cameras to take back home, I have already pre-ordered the Wyze doorbells, and I've pre-ordered the Wyze v3 and we'll be ordering some light bulbs for when I get home so I can throw out our stupid wink system that decided to start charging service fees so we unplugged it. If I could, I would give the Wyze cameras a 6 out of 5 stars! Dr. Robert Polselli The Realty Trust, LLC
title: Wyze - One of the best purchases of 2020!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: EttanASF
content: For the price, it’s fantastic. It does have problems though, sometimes when  it’s really sunny out, it will find itself rebooting every couple of minutes. It has trouble transitioning from light to IR. In the transition times of dawn and dusk it can’t decide which it should use so it flip flops between the modes continuously for a good half hour, each time with a very loud CLICK. Picture quality is decent far away, but is abominable when you zoom in. No way to exclude certain things from triggering motion detection.  Moving shadows outside like from the trees waving in the wind will trigger alerts. Microphone pickup isn’t sensitive enough. I’m keeping it though.
title: Good for price but not high end. Has issues.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Iyona
content: I wanted to love this product but I am just all around HIGHLY disappointed. I research and read reviews before I purchase and I can honestly say, the reviews people have written are far from the truth. Maybe it’s just my luck, but to go through 3 cameras when I only bought 1 (that would be 2 replacements)and only having it 2 weeks is unheard of. My camera stopped working the second day. I got a replacement 3 days later and it wouldn’t even connect or turn on because of a update on the camera. They told me I needed to buy a SD card in order to basically troubleshoot it. I told them I would rather have a replacement since this isn’t my issue. So they send yet another replacement. They then tell me they can’t expedite it. Okay fine but there should be no reason it’s taking 12 business days to get to me when it says 4-7 business days in the website. So they give you non working products, they can’t give you anything but a broken replacements that takes light years to get to you. Needless to say, stay clear from Wyze and purchase something else!
title: Worst product and customer service.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Laura L Ellsworth
content: I bought 4 of these for my offices to see if cleaning people were going through things they shouldn't. I discovered that they do not detect very well and tested the theory by not turning them off before going into the office myself. They missed my detection several times (and yes I had the detection zone and everything set up correct). When I contacted the company to return I was sent several emails about how to fix it which did not work and I finally gave up because of the amount of time I was spending was not worth it. The company should have refunded my money and stood behind the product.
title: Do not purchase

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: 93minpin
content: I have this cam in the front of home monitoring the front entrance. The cam takes really nice video and the pan function works great. One thing I noticed is that the motion detection sometimes will not detect and notify me of motion. I had a postal delivery that walked right up to the cam area , but cam did not record or notify me of motion. Other times, just the movement of tree branches will set off cam. Weird! I wish the cam is more consistent in detecting motion. But all in all, you can’t go wrong with the price and the great video it takes. I would buy again.
title: Pan cam motion or no motion

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Cristen
content: I waited 3 months to leave my review because I wanted to test the cameras first. These aren’t the best cameras but they somewhat get the job done. My detection level is set to 100, the camera catches the tree limbs moving, insects crawling on my outside window but it doesn’t always detect humans. Weird huh? Most of the times when I leave my house, the camera that is at my front door doesn’t detect me leaving it coming in. I have one facing my parking lot, it detects the cars passing by my house but sometimes doesn’t detect me leaving in my car. If someone moves fast, it doesn’t detect them. the issue I’m having now with the cameras, the video pic will show someone but when I click on the video to play the clip, it shows nothing. Like really? It record 12 seconds clips and store in their storage for 14 days. It’s an ok camera but I’m about to throw them out and get real ones.  These aren’t reliable. It misses too much action.
title: Aren’t reliable

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: GMan
content: The camera delivers on everything it says it can do. 360 degree rotation is awesome. Tilts up and down too. If I'm going to be picky, the only thing I would change is the fact that cloud recording only records 12 seconds after motion is detected. I wish there was an option to pay a little bit per month and have recording for the duration of motion. But that's being picky. And the product says explicitly that it records 12 seconds so they're not hiding anything.
title: Good cam especially considering the price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: scott davis
content: UPDATE: After a week in disconnected, now won't reconnect. I am a College level computer student, so if I am having trouble I am sure many other people will too. Very disappointing as it had functioned well for a few days...… OLD REVIEW: I am very happy with this camera. I shopped around for months before making a decision and I was not disappointed. Everything works as advertised and the camera is very easy to control remotely. Plus, it still records if WiFi goes down if you have the optional SD card. This is the best camera I have seen for the price. It isn't a "hidden" camera, but it isn't very obvious either. I had tried using my old cell phone as a security cam, but it seemed to always have connection issues. This camera is always available and responsive. Great buy!
title: Easy to set up, easy to use app...at first :-( Definately do not buy!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: brettofthewild
content: I have an Android phone, and my wife has an iPhone. At first, when we purchased this camera, around September 2018, the iPhone app worked fantastic, but the Android apps, well, was complete garbage. The Android app would not show a stream for more than a few seconds, and, anytime I try to pan the camera was a chance of the apps shutting down. The app has updated in the last month or so, and I can say now that the Android app has been quite stable. The audio seems to work decently when the connection is good on both sides, both the phone and the camera. I own two of these cameras, and I think that they have done a pretty good job with this system. For the price, I think that this is a great deal.
title: Cameras works great after app update

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: JuanferVe
content: This camera is awesome for the price. However there are a few things that could be improved to make it perfect. The motion detection feature when activated the camera starts moving like crazy even if the moving subjects are within the frame, this generates lots of noise and the image is always moving, perhaps you could consider certain tolerance before the camera moves. Regarding the picture quality in HD it is perfect but takes lots of storage. The SD is not really good. How about including some sort of MD or 720p. It would be an interesting configuration that may offer good video quality and require less space in the MicroSD.
title: Very good camera that could be even better

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Fred
content: TLDR: When the Pan cam works, it works great. However, if you have problems with it, you're in trouble. The first Pan cam I bought bricked after a few weeks of use and all troubleshooting related to the issue failed (Google "Can't get past the solid yellow light wyze forum" to see an example of this). I then spent a few weeks having a customer service agent tell to re-attempt every step of their troubleshooting guide over email before they agreed that the problem was a defective unit. When the replacement camera arrived, it had it's own issues with the camera showing everything in a strange tint (Google "purple tint wyze forum" to see an example of this). At this point, I'm not sure if it's even worth it to go through their support system again if it will take weeks of frustrating emails to get a solution or replacement. If you get it and it works, you're in luck - it does everything as advertised. However, if you get a defective unit or two, you're in for a frustrating time.
title: Quality control issues

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Samantha V
content: I liked this product, I actually have three BUT there are somethings I think it needs. First of all it is sooooo slow. When you go to "View Playback", it takes forever to load each time you move on the timeline. If I need to find something fast that happened, its impossible. I also think it needs a "15 second" forward and backward button. When you try to navigate using your finger, it is so hard to get to a specific time. MY BIGGEST COMPLAINT would be that when you move the pointer to a certain time, lets say I'm at 3:30pm and need to see what happened at 2:24pm, when I carefully move my finger backward, I think I should see the feed as I move. (This is so difficult to explain) But in other words, say a picture fell off the wall, when I move my finger I should be able to say "there's the picture... the picture is still hanging... still there... OK NOW ITS NOT THERE!" all while moving my finger. Instead, I move my finger and the screen is still til I lift my finger, then it loads, then shows me recording at that time. It just makes everything so much more difficult then it has to be. Unless you watch it live, and even then it buffers constantly, this product is just so hard to be useful, aka why we got it.
title: Could Use An Upgrade and Better Features..

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Nyte
content: The picture quality is amazing, especially in daylight.  The camera highlights areas where there is motion.  You can zoom in for incredible detail.  The field of view covers a whole large room. It allows setting daily on and off times, which is nice. It could be improved by allowing different times for weekends or adding the feature of the info on when your phone leaves 'home'.  I am afraid I'll be capturing a lot of videos of myself wandering around half awake on Saturday mornings. The sound is a bit loud and crackly (maybe because it is loud) but I haven't attempted to adjust that yet. This will work well to warn me if my dog has a medical issue while I am away. Also fun to see what she is up to all day.
title: Picture quality amazing, sensitive enough to keep tabs on pets

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Tessa
content: I love this camera! Works great as a little addition to our home, we use it as a puppy cam. Both my husband and I can tune in to see what the dogs are up to in the room they primarily hangout in, and it’s directed to see 3 entrance points. The thing I don’t like is how loud it is. If you have it set to pan automatically with motion, you can hear it turning from across the room. I could see this being an issue if wanting to be used discreetly... It’s so loud that we ended up turning off the auto-pan feature simply out of annoyance. Otherwise love it for the price and video quality. You do need a video memory card to store video.
title: Audibly loud but otherwise love it

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jimi W
content: Wyze cameras have an issue with micro SD cards being corrupted by the camera. This problem is documented extensively in a Wyzecam forum. My micro sd card quit working and cannot be reformatted. Wyze is apparently not able to figure out what is going on. This impacts the ability to review video. They should quit selling these until they fix the problem. I loved the camera before this issue surfaced.
title: Defect not yet corrected.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Terry
content: I have three of these, all identical. Do not waste the money on these. After two months of use, one of the cameras decided to stop connecting. So I tried deleting it from the app and starting fresh. I do not recommend doing this. For the life of me, I cannot get the camera to connect to my app. I’ve tried using different WiFi networks, I’ve tried different sequences of powering down and pressing the reset button. The most progress I get is it saying “QR code Sca-“ and then it cuts itself off and never connects to my app. I tried everything I’ve read in google and nothing works. Honestly, I would either like a new one, some tech support or to get my money back.
title: Connectivity setup is terrible

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: gian elgi
content: Camera fails to connect to local network or cannot find network name;  tried all recommended solutions found on wyze support forum (update firmware and/or install older version,  update app and/or try older versions, phone and camera on same 2.4 G network, reset/recheck router settings, etc., etc.) Nothing worked to get camera to connect.  Didn't try to set-up camera until now and should have tested/returned to Amazon before return option expired. Update:  Got it working.  Go figure.  Got a Netgear wifi booster which created an "extended" second network, and tried one last time to connect the camera.  Viola, it connected and works as expected.  Firmware upgraded in process and all seems good.  Wish it hadn't been so troublesome to begin with. I'm guessing I could have probably made a connection by deleting then recreating my 2.4 network; not something I was willing to do insomuch that my network was fine.  Oh well, lesson learned.  The camera still won't connect to my main 2.4 network but will to the Extended second network.  The distance between camera to router or booster was not a factor.  Final rating:  2 stars.  Yes, it works now but not without the wifi booster.
title: Troublesome and Worthless.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Dan Horwith
content: So I’m very conflicted with this product/review. It’s my first time purchasing any type of surveillance camera and I figured I couldn’t go wrong with this product given the price/rating. Here is my review: After unpacking the camera and following installation setup I got stuck at the step which required the camera to scan the QR code. This process is very frustrating. It takes up to 30 minutes to scan the code and Wyze does not offer any legitimate support for troubleshooting. I looked through all the forums and found that most everybody was experiencing the same problem and nobody had any viable solutions. Eventually, I did get the code scanned and the camera now works phenomenally with perfect picture.
title: This is not a 5star product.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Rosie
content: After a week I grew inpatient with the technical issues Front gate is the cam pan with good lighting at night.The parking is using the cube camera which is a different product of Wyze in a very low lit area. Dont like that the speakers on the bottom. Mine I can hardly hear at all, almost non existant if i want to tali to whoever is next to to cam and sometimes it sounds so chopped. I bought the cube 2 weeks before buying this one by the same brand and I would recomend the cube over this one. I also have an issue with the fact that i set my detection zone yet it still sends me notifications outside the zone. I had to tape a white paper on my windo to block off outside of the detection zone so i dont get noticed ever time a car drives down the street. The front of the property is well lit and the cam works great with well lit.
title: Needs improvement

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Aloy
content: I was reviewing smart security cam and saw this highly recommended one on Amazon. It truly did impress me! It is small light and easy to install. I installed them on the inside of the window looking out. As long as you turn off the night vision and has a porch light, it worked great in the night with no reflections from the glass. So far, it alerted me every time there is a motion. The SD card continuous recording is very helpful. More importantly, they offer free two days could storage, which much more expensive brands do not even offer. If you are thinking to get security cams, you have to consider this.  Although these are indoors only, but as I mentioned, they work just fine looking out my windows.
title: Amazing! I am so impressed!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: S. Rys
content: No question this is an exceptional value IF IT WORKED.  My huge, consistent complaints.  Echo Show continues to respond with "the camera is not responding" when the video shows up just fine in the wyze app.  Also, the camera stops responding in the wyze app A LOT.  I had to add a smart plug to the camera to power it off remotely at least once a day if not more.  Customer care?  Forget it.  10 days after my email submission of the problem, they responded by saying, sorry it took so long, answer these questions... All the answers to their questions were in my INITIAL email submission.  It was like they never read it.  This is going back to Amazon.  Love the picture quality, the app is smartly developed, but the camera has a real problem with either staying connected to WIFI or to responding to the app and/or Echo Show.  Echo Show is a huge problem area for this camera.  Consistently, i get "hmm, camera is not responding".  It was the sole reason i bought the camera in the first place.
title: So many things right, but alas, so many things wrong

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: craigery
content: Incredible security camera!  You control panning and zoom with your app.  Alexa show will let you see pics, but not control the app.  Pics are very clear, even when zooming. The only negative I can see is the company says the camera lenses are not designed for outdoor use (they are also not waterproof), and the lens will degrade in sunshine.  I purchased an outdoor housing, and the camera is so relatively inexpensive that I can just replace it if outdoors doesn't work out. Can be used to monitor kids (you can even talk two ways to them), for security, to remotely monitor business establishments, etc. etc.  Cloud storage of alert clips is FREE for two weeks! It does look like a security cam -- it would be great if someone could offer some camo for it so that it could be a bit more hidden.
title: Very, very impressed -- incredible security camera for just $38!!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: J. Baez
content: Bought two of these cameras. They were working great until recently. One of the cameras just stopped working. I reset it to no avail. Power cycled nothing. Reset and tried to add it again nothing. During setup Led light stays solid and doesn’t flash not allowing to go any further. Sent an email to tech support. Waiting on response. 11/4/19 Still no email or response from customer support. Can’t return the item because I’m outside of the return window. 11/16/19 No response from company. Customer service non existent. My second camera still works. I know now if that one becomes defective then i'm on to a new and different product.
title: Led light stays solid yellow

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: @ustinCameron
content: Used to recommend these but now I spend more time clicking refresh than actually watching them. It's become a #$% joke. No idea if they actually record the entire time since the app's connectivity is so dismal. Half way works if you switch your phone to Cell to view the cameras, but if you're on the same wifi network it's 100% unusable even with 400d/100u speeds and only 20 feet away. PATHETIC.
title: All 3 constantly fail to connect

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: D. Davis
content: Update 7/11/20 Fixed the unsecured wireless issue finally.  I was already switching to a competitor and like their cameras much better.  For a $5-10 you can get a camera that reliably works with your Google/Nest hub, has a desktop client, and much better picture.  And reliably works period.  It's a constant "is it going to work this time?" with these cameras.  They have been relegated to the lowest convenience functions and even then continue to disappoint.  The were a good value when they first came out, but certainly not anymore. Original: I live in an area where I don't need wifi security.  That was fine with this camera until recently.  The app has been updated and no longer allows open networks "because we take your security seriously".  Security while on my wifi is my problem, not theirs.  They need to worry about the trip out to the cloud and back, not my wifi network.  As such, these cameras are becoming useless quickly.  Direct quote from email with support "security requirements have and may continue to change in the near future.".  Basically, it might work when you buy it, but they might decide that you have insufficient security and will render your camera useless based on a whim. Asked about refund since they are actively causing my cameras to not work and they said they would refund only if they were bought in the last 30 days.  Well I wasted several weeks trying to reach their phone support (never once did anyone pick up).  Liked the product when it was working, but the support is horrible. Might have to look at some of the hacking options with these cameras to make something useful of them again.
title: Not keeping up, much better options in same price range

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Hoang V.
content: I'm bummed that I have to give such a low rating because the camera quality truly is great for the price point. But no matter how many times I troubleshoot and reset the device and app, I still get a yellow light and connection error. Emails to customer service were no help. They've stopped replying after I told them none of the website's troubleshooting tips helped. So if I want the camera to work for a day, I'd have to hard reset the device and restart set up on the app. And even then, it'll only work for about two days then quit.
title: Great picture quality, terrible software

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: 22.5 degrees
content: The more I use this camera the less I care for it. The connection is extremely laggy and it is located only about 20 ft away from the router. Has a strong signal, with a direct line of site to the router. but is extremely slow to react to movements caught by the motion detection.  Also, when I manually move the camera through the Android app it is extremely laggy. Both the camera and the app are on the latest firmware, and update as well. We have several reolink cameras and they all work exceptionally. When it does work the picture is nice, however it's not worth the trade off. I also find that the speaker is a little bit too soft for two-way conversation. Another downfall to this particular camera is that you can only access it through an application on your phone, there is no computer software version to access it. I like the design, and the fact that it does record constantly, so I can go back and check pretty much at any point. However I guess you still get what you pay for.
title: Good when it works....

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Gary Murphy
content: What Wyze doesn't tell you that if you use them remotely is to install on a wifi controlled outlet. If your power goes out like it does they will not reset by themselves. I have a few and they all need to be reset. I'm 2000 miles away so that is impossible. Wyze must have changed something in the firmware update. Never use to have an issue. They are sensitive. My lights are all controlled with timers to give the look of being occupied.  Everytime a light goes on or off you'll get a notification. Lots of them.  Wyze uses a pixel to pixie flame comparison. Even on the lowest sensitivity they are sensitive. That might change after today. Wyze announced that they are pushing out a new firmware update for FREE that will now detect persons. Too bad I won't be able to update. My cameras don't work until they are reset.
title: Not bad but far from great

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Larrie
content: Arrived quickly and easy to set up. Picture quality is pretty good with a little distortion at the edge due to the 120 degree wide angle lens.  It responds to motion and has a number of alerts which you can easily enable/disable. Cloud storage works but the clips are short. I've ordered an sd card for local storage and will see if that allows longer videos. I had hoped that I could control the video length and capture video for as long as motion occurred. The only setup difficulty occurred when trying to enter the QR code. Distance between phone screen and  camera is critical. I add more after a little experimentation. Motion tracking and two way audio both worked well with little lag. A great security camera at a great price.
title: Works very well, easy to set up, but captured video is much too short.

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mary NSC
content: This is the third one I have tried wanting it to work with my Alexa One just QUIT completely wont even come on today I get another one have tried everything I am reading on the internet can not get it to Scan the Code then when it does then it wont connect to internet says retype pass word  it did not even come with stand I am done with these as they say you get what you pay for!! Never again!!
title: JUNK

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: viviana roman
content: Okay first of this camera doesn't let me view back feeds or anything always says none are available even though it's in 24/7. Its a great camera but thats one if my issues with this specific cam. Second a few nights ago I was going threw the videos from my other wyze can the small one and it displayed on the screwn , another device is accessing recording.  I was a bit confused , at first I thought it was my husband watching it too but his phone was charging. And finally I've tried contacting costumers service but idk if they actually have one or not.
title: Do more research on other cams

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Trailblazer15
content: I have 3 of these now and I love them. You can't beat these for the price. The app works really well, the picture quality is really good. I also love that these will alert you if it hears a smoke detector or carbon monoxide alarm going off. I had one of these that were bad on arrival because it had a green tint, but I exchanged it and it's perfect now. Just a heads up if anyone gets a green tint, that's not normal, exchange it and you'll love it. I only noticed the green tint in lower lighting conditions. Over all these cameras are awesome and I highly recommend them.
title: Excellent Wi-Fi camera for the price

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Gemini
content: Pros: Picture quality is much better than I expected for the price. Setup was incredibly easy. Cons: The is effectively useless as a security camera. It loses connection often. The only way to reconnect it is to unplug it, wait a while, and plug it back in. The iOs app offers a remote-restart option, but it never works. If you're 1000 miles away, as I often am, having to wait until I get back home to reset it makes this useless. I had earlier purchased another wifi camera (for less money), which has fewer features (it doesn't pan), but it reconnects flawlessly on its own whenever it loses connection (either power outage or wifi outage). I would like to like this device more, but I cannot recommend it. If future firmware updates resolve the connection issues, I'll be happy to amend my review. UPDATE: A year later and I seem finally to have it working consistently. A problem with another device gave me a clue about what was causing my problems. No thanks to Wyze, I've discovered that the problem seems to have been the cord all along, not the device itself. I needed a longish cord to position the cam where I wanted it. I have now replaced the long USB cable that I was using with a short USB cable plugged into an old-fashioned electric extension cord. It's been working for two weeks continuously with no problems. Maybe Wyze could make note of this simple fix and offer it to other frustrated users.
title: If it worked dependably, it would be great

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: MTL
content: Be aware of this China made cameras. I have bought a few of these and regret I bought them. I scheduled them for on/off time However, they turn on by themselves during non-scheduled time. This happened quite often.  It's either cams are the buggy or someone are controlling them? I don't know but I wouldn't want to use these camera inside the house if I were you. I don't recommend this Wyze cam. I recommend spending a little more money for something from a more reputable and trusted brand.
title: Camera turns on itself after it was turned off. Scary... someone spying from China made cams?

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Grant
content: I bought this to see if it would work in a project I am designing and the important part was motion detection recording offline and the bonus was notification on my phone when that motion occurred. I got both in this camera. I had an issue that was related to firmware and the tech support from Wyze was stellar! They stuck with me until it was resolved. It works great day and night and the motion tracking is pretty darned cool as well though I don't need it. I actually bought it to hack into a custom item... yes, I have already voided the warranty. But having been into the guts of this thing while modding it, I can tell you they did a good job on the design. Highly recommend it if you want a motion tracking indoor camera. The app is a bit fiddly but what do you expect for under $50?
title: Great bang for the buck

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Patti Hartman
content: I have 2 cam pans and 2 Wyze indoor stationary square cameras. The cam pans have been problematic from go. The first one I set up had a mind of its own.. it would turn on amd off every few minutes,, even when I turned it off myself! I contacted Wyze and they sent me a replacement. The replacement did the same thing for the first several days, but has now stopped. Neither one of the cam pans I purchased  detect sound or motion. I rarely get any videos. The square cameras pick up everything. On the rare occasion the cam pan does pick up an event, the download fails every time so I can't review what it captures. I had the 2 different cameras in the same room as a test to prove this theory. The panoramic view on the stationary square camera is sufficient for my needs. I regret wasting my money on the cam pans. They are a HUGE FLOP!!
title: DO NOT BUY THE CAM PAN!!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Mugsy
content: So far, after about 1 week, I am very impressed with this camera.  I mainly got it because my cat likes to be out on our screened in porch during the summer & I can keep track of what he is doing & make sure no one is coming to our back door.  This sits up a little and thru the screening detects leaves blowing on a tree in the yard next door, our drop blind blowing if it is windy, plus the cat.  App loaded easily, it tells me when there is motion or person detected and I can either play it back to check it, or go to livestream.  Absolutely no regrets on this purchase!
title: Wyze Cam Pan Camera 1080p Camera

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Pianophile
content: Be forewarned. This camera only works on  Android and Apple smartphones and tablets, nothing Windows related. Moreover, there is no app to use it on a desktop, although none of this information is in the advertising.  In addition, you must be physically present to set it up. We wanted to set up this camera for my mother-in-law in another state. I shipped the camera to a friend, who was going to set it up. However, it could only be set up on HIS phone (one physically present at the time of set up), and needs to stay on HIS phone even if you are going to share it with another phone. Moreover, the shared phone can't watch the streaming, nor can it pan or tilt the camera!  Thus, this camera may work very well for Android/Apple customers with smartphones who are setting up the phone for themselves in their own homes. Otherwise, forget it. Very disappointed.
title: Not compatible with desktops or remote setup

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Anthony P.
content: I picked up this Wyze Cam Pan to try out in my home. I had a bit of issue in completing the setup process. The setup wouldn’t complete on the first try but did on the second try. I had to shut off the cam and tried again. The picture quality is good and I like having the ability to pan the camera around with the WyZe app. The motion detection is so so. The camera didn’t always record/capture movement during testing. The auto pan feature is also a bit slow in my opinion. However, even with its shortcomings it fits my needs and was sold at a fair price point.
title: Decent cam for the price, not perfect

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: LeMonte
content: We were leaving for a family vacation in the middle of a major kitchen renovation.  I wanted to put a couple of cameras in  so I could monitor the progress.  I also wanted to put a camera on our second floor to monitor the stairs (contractors should not need to go to my second floor).  These cameras were perfect.  I was able to see the daily progress, zoom in and found several things that needed to be changed and monitor my second floor. Only thing I wish was better was support for a 64GB MicroSD card.  I had a few extra 64 cards that I thought I would use - but found that the cameras did not support them - so had to place an order for 32GB cards. Great bang for the buck!
title: Great bang for the buck!

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Lauren
content: Great quality camera, way better than my Motorola baby monitor. The only issue is that after using it daily for 6 months the cam pan stopped being able to identify our WiFi network even with the router right beside it. We loved it so much and are still figuring out if we should buy another one or try a different brand. Really amazing quality for the price. We had both the pan and the smaller V2 camera and used them for our nursery. My only complaint about the V2 is that the infrared lights are quite noticeable in a dark room and our baby kept staring up at them. 4 creepy lights staring at her. So I covered the lights up with electrical tape which takes away the night vision but I just use both cameras (at different angles) and they both pick up the infrared light from the cam pan. The cam pan doesn’t have the creepy red lights which is nice. Just a blue light which I think can turn off from the app but I just covered it with tape and it’s fine. Would have given 5 stars if not for the connection issue. We recommend this camera to our friends all the time.
title: Great quality, connection issues after 6 months

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: VICTOR Orozco
content: I've read reviews that said set up was easy and some that said it was difficult. Well, I followed instructions but had some issues with the unit reading the QR code. Went to online support site and asked my question. Wyze provided an answer that wasn't about my issue then asked "Did this solve your issue" or something to that effect. But instead of giving a yes or no option so I can explore another solution, it only gave me the option to answer 'yes'. That's pretty useless since I can't go any further than that. After MANY multiple attempts , it decided it had enough of tormenting me and read the damn QR code. Finally got the unit working. The camera, panning, speaker, etc seem to work well. But the lousy set up aggravated me and it killed my excitement on day one. Not in love with Wyze at this point but hopefully day to day operation will be much better than set up.
title: very frustrating set up for Wyze Cam Pan

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Jennifer Brocato
content: How much technology can you expect for $38???  With this camera, I got everything I wanted.  I'm still amazed at how good this little thing works.  I use it as a 'dog camera' while I'm at work for my foster dog that I initially don't know so well.  The camera rotates so I can see her wherever she may be, and on the one occasion when I tuned in to see her trying to open a can of dog food by herself, I was able to talk to her through the camera and she dropped the can.  This is a great, inexpensive, fully functioning camera that eases my mind and is well worth the money.  Love it!!!
title: Unbelievably good

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: Uhgg
content: Ok, you get what you pay for and quite a bit more with these. The picture quality and night vision are pretty good. The motion tracking is well soso when you are near a road and using it in sight of said road. Cars moving at 25mph are just blurs. Fair consideration given the motion tracking is good at the price point. They really need to make a model that is a bit more outdoor friendly. You can with one of the 3rd party kits use them successfully under an overhang or something that partially protects it. The kits do NOT make them weatherproof. The sound pickup is pretty darn good. I can hear people talking 20-30ft away fairly well.
title: Very worth 30 bucks

product: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
author: marisa rios
content: Ive had my product for 7 months and it is still going strong. I like the motion tagging and motion tracking options - meaning that as soon as the camera spots movement it begins following that movement around. The night vision is in black and white, which I would prefer was in color, but for the price I couldnt complain. The picture quality is also a bit grainy at night, but honestly, for me, it works fine. I like that the camera can be accessed using a mobile app. The app is super easy to use and it can send me alerts of movement if I set it to that. All in all, for the price this camera is a great value. I recommend it to anyone who is looking for a good starter camera.
title: good solid product
